text:
Opening Date: August 26, 2019
Closing Date: August 30, 2019
LC Organization Unit: Office of the Chief Information Officer
LC Organization Unit - Specific Office: Data Center Management Division / Network Mgmt Section
Grade: GS-14
Series: 2210
Availability: U.S. Citizens Only
Duration: 180 Days
The Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) is offering a temporary employment opportunity at the GS-14 level to serve on a full-time, 6 month/180 day appointment in a Senior Network Engineer capacity to perform activities related to administering Local Area Network management (LAN) / Wide Area Network (WAN) performance standards, development and maintenance.
Duties include, but are not limited to the following:
Providing oversight of technology upgrades and functionality of existing LAN/WAN systems.
Coordination of monitoring, troubleshooting and resolving network system failures.
Serving as a technical specialist for complex LAN/WAN or other telecommunication systems involving the integration of multiple services over a moderately dispersed environment.
Review of network data such as volume, peak loads, and circuit capabilities.
Collaborating and interacting with employees at all grade levels across all service units.
Qualifications
Interested candidates should prepare a resume indicating the number of weekly hours worked for each job. The selecting official will review the resumes of the candidates to determine how prior experience and duties outline application of the following the knowledge, skills, and abilities:
Ability to provide subject matter expertise, advice and consultancy for networks and telecommunications technologies.
Knowledge of networking devices (Routers, Switches, Firewalls, ICE, VPN gateways, fabric interconnects), Enterprise WAN technology, Telephony, Voice Over IP, Network Datacenters, Proxy and Firewalls, and IP routing protocols Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) and Border Gateway Protocol (BGP).
Ability to capture and provide network design, engineering and administrative support of both physical and virtual networking devices.
Interested Candidates should submit the required document above to Judith Conklin, Deputy CIO via email juco@loc.gov by the closing date. Applicant information will be reviewed and the top qualified candidate(s) will be interviewed. The selection will be measured by how well the candidate’s resume meets the knowledge, skills, and abilities requirements.
Desired start date: September 30, 2019
Work Schedule: Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week.
title: IT Specialist (Sr. Network Engineer)

name: Research & Development Specialist in Fast prototyping and network engineer
summary:
Research & Development Specialist in Fast prototyping and network engineer
Interdisciplinary Centre ...
text:
Research & Development Specialist in Fast prototyping and network engineer
Interdisciplinary Centre for Security, Reliability and Trust (SnT), University of Luxembourg
Research & Development Specialist in Fast prototyping and network engineer
(Valid from 04/02/2022 to 08/04/2022)
Language: English (UK)
Country: Luxembourg
Organisation Interdisciplinary Centre of Security, Reliability and Trust
data:
Job Number: UOL04762
Contract Fixed Term Contract
Type:
Duration 24 Month
Schedule Full Time
Type:
Work Hours 40.0 Hours per Week
About the SnT…
The University of Luxembourg seeks to hire a technician at its Interdisciplinary Centre for Security, Reliability and Trust (SnT) for the Space research
activities. SnT is a recently formed centre carrying out interdisciplinary research in secure, reliable and trustworthy ICT (Information and
Communication Technologies) systems and services, often in collaboration with industrial, governmental or international partners. SnT is active in
several international research projects funded by the EU H2020 programme, the European Space Agency and the spaceresources.lu initiative from the
Ministry of Economy. The Centre is currently expanding its research activities in relation to the Space research and is seeking highly motivated
technician who wish to support research and Laboratories in close cooperation with our Research teams and the partners related to Space and the
Interdisciplinary Space Master. For further information, you may check: www.securityandtrust.lu
We’re looking for people driven by excellence, excited about innovation, and looking to make a difference. If this sounds like you, you’ve come to the
right place!
Your Role…
The successful candidate will support all the laboratories of university’s Interdisciplinary Space Master and the research activities related to LunaLab,
Zero-G Lab, CubeSat Lab, Concurrent Design Facility and 5G-SatCom Lab.
The position holder will be required to perform the following tasks:
* Help on the setup and maintenance of the Labs
* Installation and configuration of computers and networks
* Use and maintenance of the 3D printer
* Purchase of equipment and material for the Labs
* Setup and maintenance of new equipment (e.g. robots, Software-defined radios, etc)
* Implement basic programs and algorithms
* Support code development
* Organize the video recordings of lectures
* Participating in project deliverables
* Ensure scientific quality management
* Contribute to scientific publications
* Research existing technologies and contribute to technology, benchmarks, selection and methodologies to apply to new and ongoing research projects
* Conceptually design IT solutions within research projects (e.g. develop/code programs and/or systems, create new methods, etc.) mainly focused in
network architecture and fast prototyping
Your Profile…
Qualification: The candidate should possess a Master degree or equivalent in Electronic Engineering, Computer Science or Applied Mathematics.
Experience: The ideal candidate should have some knowledge and experience in the following topics:
* Linux and Windows administration user level
* CAD design, for 3D printing
* IT networks setup and management (e.g. Cisco, Mikrotik)
The following topics will be considered as an asset
* Plan, produce, and assemble new or changed mechanical parts for products
* Devise, fabricate, and assemble new or modified mechanical components for products
* Programming experience (e.g., C, C++, python programming and debugging. Familiarity with ROS, LabView0
Language Skills: Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English are required.
Here’s what awaits you at SnT…
* Exciting infrastructures and unique labs. At SnT’s two campuses, our researchers can take a walk on the moon at the LunaLab, build a nanosatellite,
or help make autonomous vehicles even better
* The right place for IMPACT. SnT researchers engage in demand-driven projects. Through our Partnership Programme, we work on projects with more than
45 industry partners
* Be part of a multicultural family. At SnT we have more than 60 nationalities. Throughout the year, we organise team-building events, networking
activities and more
Find out more about us!
In Short…
* Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract 24 Month (extendable to 5 years)
* Work Hours: Full Time 40.0 Hours per Week
* Starting date: as soon as possible (upon agreement)
* Location: Kirchberg
* Job Reference: UOL04762
How to apply…
Applications should include:
* Curriculum Vitae (including your email address, work experience, publications)
* Cover letter indicating relevant experience and your motivation
* Contact information for 2 referees
All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
We ensure a full consideration for applications received by 15/03/2022 – then the posting will remain online until filled.
Please apply ONLINE formally through the HR system. Applications by Email will not be considered.
The University of Luxembourg embraces inclusion and diversity as key values. We are fully committed to removing any discriminatory barrier related to
gender, and not only, in recruitment and career progression of our staff.
About the University of Luxembourg…
University of Luxembourg is an international research university with a distinctly multilingual and interdisciplinary character. The University was
founded in 2003 and counts more than 6,700 students and more than 2,000 employees from around the world. The University’s faculties and interdisciplinary
centres focus on research in the areas of Computer Science and ICT Security, Materials Science, European and International Law, Finance and Financial
Innovation, Education, Contemporary and Digital History. In addition, the University focuses on cross-disciplinary research in the areas of Data
Modelling and Simulation as well as Health and System Biomedicine. Times Higher Education ranks the University of Luxembourg #3 worldwide for its
“international outlook,” #20 in the Young University Ranking 2021 and among the top 250 universities worldwide.
Further information
For further information, please contact us at Miguel.olivaresmendez@uni.lu
Apply here https://emea3.recruitmentplatform.com/syndicated/private/syd_apply.cfm?ID=PSAFK026203F3VBQB7V7VV4I3&nPostingTargetId=103742&nPostingId=71896

summary:
Work group:
Area of research:
IT – Computing
Starting date:
01.11.2019
Job description:
As German Re...
text:
Work group:
Area of research:
IT – Computing
Starting date:
01.11.2019
Job description:
As German Research Center for Environmental Health, Helmholtz Zentrum München pursues the goal of developing personalized medical approaches for the prevention and therapy of major common diseases such as diabetes mellitus, allergies and lung diseases. To achieve this, it investigates the interaction of genetics, environmental factors and lifestyle.
The Information and Communication Technology department hosts a dynamic computing environment (CPU, GPU, and Cloud Computing) and participates in Europe-wide hybrid cloud infrastructure development projects, among others. The department is responsible for the mass storage systems for our highly dynamic and innovative research groups.
At the center we provide the IT infrastructure for artificial intelligence, deep learning and big data analytics and are looking for an
IT Network Engineer (f/m/d)
2019/0359
You will be responsible for
administration, installation, configuration, monitoring of network components (router, switches and overarching technologies like SDN)monitoring of services and network infrastructure (LAN and WAN)support for, benchmarking and optimizing of federated data transfer services over WANdevelopment of standards for network setups and architectures for the center and otherscompilation and maintenance of technical documentation
Your profile
bachelor or master (or comparable) degree in informatics, mathematics, or a related subject from a university with internationally accepted quality standards or equivalent working experience in a related jobprofound knowledge in operating complex network infrastructures (WAN, LAN, VPN, VLAN, SDN), as well as practical experience in the field of routing and switchingexperience with standard IT services and processes (e.g. ITIL)structured and systematic working style, excellent analytical skills, high willingness for continued education, ability to work in a team, service orientationproficient knowledge of English
Ideally knowledge in further relevant areas such as
experience with firewall technology such as Cisco ASA and CheckpointCCNA or CCNP certified or equivalent trainingknowledge of Python and Linuxknowledge of German
We offer you
a challenging and varied field of work and the freedom to develop new ideas the opportunity to get things movingextensive and goal-orientated professional development measuresa good work/life balance for which we offer assistance in the shape of:
flexible working hoursin-house health managementa nursery directly at the campus"Elder Care" concept as well as other consultation and support options
Munich, with its numerous lakes and its vicinity to the Alps, is considered to be one of the cities with the best quality of life worldwide. With its first-class universities and research institutes it offers an intellectually stimulating environment.
Having been awarded the "Total E-Quality" seal we endorse a system of equal opportunities. Applications from women are especially welcome. Severely disabled candidates are given preference if they are of equal merit concerning the position in question.
Remuneration and social benefits are based on the collective agreement for the public sector (TV EntgO Bund). There is also the possibility of an IT specialist bonus.
The position is open-ended and is generally possible in part-time or can be filled close to full-time.
Curious? If you have further questions, simply contact Sandra Mayer on 089 3187-4171, who will be happy to be of assistance.
We are looking forward to receiving your comprehensive online application.
Favorite
title: IT Network Engineer (f/m/d)

name: Tier 1 Network Engineer
summary:
What you’ll be doing...
We’ve got more than the industry’s best technology—we’ve got the industry’s...
tasks: Providing technical support to customers that have problems with their network.,Maintaining 35000 devices in 1300 customer networks.,Documenting every interaction using one of many tool sets provided.,Advocating for the customer by escalating unresolved issues to the next level of support.,Monitoring ticket queue and following up to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution to user requests/incidents within agreed SLAs.,Bachelor's degree or relevant experience.,Fluency in English (written and verbal).,Experience with networking (e.g., routing, switching, and wireless technologies).,A degree in IT.,Cisco certification (e.g., CCNA or JNCIA).,Experience in service provider or a service desk environment.,Understanding of ITIL methodology.
text:
What you’ll be doing...
We’ve got more than the industry’s best technology—we’ve got the industry’s best service, as well. When a customer has a problem, you’ll be the one to help them out (even if it means getting a little creative), and if you can’t fix it, you’ll find someone who can. You’ll be the face of our company to our customers, ensuring that every interaction is a best-in-class experience.
Providing technical support to customers that have problems with their network.
Maintaining 35000 devices in 1300 customer networks.
Documenting every interaction using one of many tool sets provided.
Advocating for the customer by escalating unresolved issues to the next level of support.
Monitoring ticket queue and following up to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution to user requests/incidents within agreed SLAs.
Maintaining user, customer, and departmental confidentiality at all times.
What we’re looking for...
You exemplify values of integrity, accountability, respect, and excellence in your work. You’re organized, detail oriented, team centric, and have a keen sense of urgency in resolving problems, while maintaining a focus on the customer at all times.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor's degree or relevant experience.
Fluency in English (written and verbal).
Experience with networking (e.g., routing, switching, and wireless technologies).
Willingness to work in 24x7 environments (including weekends, nights and holidays as necessary).
Even better if you have:
A degree in IT.
Cisco certification (e.g., CCNA or JNCIA).
Experience in service provider or a service desk environment.
Understanding of ITIL methodology.
Computer knowledge. Ideally, with ticketing software.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

name: Jr Network Engineer
summary:
Job Snapshot
Job Description
Jr. Network Engineer
The Global Certification Team seeks a junior netw...
text:
Job Snapshot
Job Description
Jr. Network Engineer
The Global Certification Team seeks a junior network engineer to support government-related Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation activities.
Your role is to own the infrastructure: R/S, data center products, and a lot of compute and storage projects, NetApp devices, and virtual servers. You will learn what we have in our portfolio and how to maintain those products. You will work with rest of the team and assist them in getting products ready for government certification.
The ideal candidate will have a general working knowledge of computer, network and system fundamentals, including an understanding of routing and data center concepts. The candidate demonstrates the ability to research and articulate recommended solutions and technology; design, develop and document technical solutions; document procedures and change management documentation; The candidate has experience with managing multiple priorities simultaneously.
Requirements:
1) Core network concepts
- Experience working with Cisco products. (CCNA level of knowledge)
- Working knowledge of IP routing protocols and switching technologies
- Basic Understanding of LAN/WAN, STP, OSPF, VRRP, IPv4, SSHv2, PKI, IPSec
- Capable of building test networks, including the configuration, and the installation and setup of routers and switches
- Capable of documenting networking environments using tools like MS Visio
- Basic understanding of network administration to include AAA, SNMP, syslog
2) Core System Administration and Data Center concepts
- Some experience with data center technologies (Cisco UCS, NetApp storage, Nexus switches)
- Experience with basic network administration and virtual environments (eg, ESXi, HyperV)
- Experience with Microsoft Windows Server Systems, Microsoft Active Directory and SSO
3) Soft skills
- Excellent team Interpersonal skills
- Excellent verbal and written Communications skills
- Ability to build and maintain relationships
- Ability to work in a team environment
- Detail oriented and able to think independently
- Exhibit a high level of initiative and self-confidence
- Demonstrate excellent time management skills.
- Ability to learn independently
Desired:
-CCNA
-VMware virtualization
About Aerotek:
We know that a company's success starts with its employees. We also know that an individual's success starts with the right career opportunity. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions. Learn more at Aerotek.com.
The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email accommodation@aerotek .com for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

summary: Network Engineer I - Communications will be to support Cisco Call Manager and associated technologie...
text:
Network Engineer I - Communications will be to support Cisco Call Manager and associated technologies such as Unity, Contact Center and Presence. This will require working directly with the current technical personnel to maintain the key elements of the IT infrastructure.
Responsibilities:
Implement local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data networks
Develop and execute test plans to check infrastructure and system performance
Perform network modeling and analysis
Define blueprint designs for business technology initiatives
Enforce policies for standardizing systems
Configure, install, monitor and maintain network hardware including servers, routers, firewalls and switches.
Maintain the existing Cisco Voice products and implement future upgrades
Qualifications:
Previous experience in networking, IT, or other related fields
Familiarity with architectural specifications
Familiarity with researching communication networks
Strong troubleshooting and critical thinking skills
Strong attention to detail

Includes managing stake holder expectations and ensuring the project completes on time and on budget.,Excellent verbal and written communication skills.,Must be willing to be "on-call" for after-hours support as needed.
text:
OVERALL SUMMARY
This position requires the expertise level in various disciplines within IT Networking. The candidate will provide support in all aspects of Network infrastructure consisting of LAN/WAN, HW & SW, routers, switches, firewalls, management systems, and monitoring systems. This individual will provide diagnoses, resolution, and documentation in all aspects of supporting, implementing and managing an enterprise network environment. Resolve hardware and software network problems in a timely and accurate manner. Make recommendations to enhance operations and availability.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensures that the performance and availability of the network infrastructure is maintained to the highest standards in order that maximum productivity is achieved.
Design, Configuration, Implementation, and Support of all network components.
Provide troubleshooting and diagnostic services.
Manage Load Balancers, Routers, Switches, and Firewalls
Participation in Day-to-Day Operations of Hosting and Corporate environments
Analysis of complex network problems and coordination of resolutions
Conduct and assists in product evaluations and research, including beta testing and analysis of network tools, hardware and software.
On-Call for after-hours and weekend support.
Maintain complete detail technical documentation of the network environment.
REQUIREMENTS
Minimum 5 years experience
Expertise Level knowledge of LAN and WAN based technologies and protocols, including BGP, OSPF, Layer 2/3 Switching & Routing and proficient in TCP/IP
Expertise Level Layer 1 through 7 troubleshooting ability
Minimum 5 years Hands-on experience in the installation, operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of multi-user, multi-protocol networks
Large enterprise experience with a significantly distributed infrastructure is important (i.e. branch offices etc.)
Minimum 5 years Hands-on experience using Cisco Routers and Switches
Minimum 5 years Hands-on experience With Firewall Technologies
3+ years with Palo Alto Firewalls
Familiarity with network management tools such as Cisco Prime, CSM, Riverbed Profiler, Cacti, Cisco ISE & Panorama
Experience with F5 LTM, GTM & IRULEs
Expertise Level knowledge of Infrastructure Security and Policy
Bachelor's degree in Information Systems related field or Equivalent work experience.
Experience working in a fast paced and dynamic Internet environment.
Expertise Level knowledge in developing and implementing sound operational procedures
Demonstrated ability to completely manage a project from thought to completion. Includes managing stake holder expectations and ensuring the project completes on time and on budget.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be willing to be "on-call" for after-hours support as needed.
Cloud Technologies experience a plus

Description
Planning &Organizing
Ensures the organization is able to work effectively by anticipatin...
tasks: Ensures the organization is able to work effectively by anticipating issues and mitigating potential risks as it pertains to networking related hardware and software in the organization.,Plans and supports network and computing infrastructure in tandem with internal team and outsourced partners. Makes recommendations to Director of IT Operations regarding best practices, refreshes, etc.,Monitors existing network for threats and prioritizes accordingly from within and outside the organization to ensure risks are anticipated and mitigated.,Works with internal staff and vendor partners to generate and update Network Diagrams, Hardware Inventories, etc.,Uses relevant technical change management methodologies to ensure changes are captured, rollbacks are planned, and impacts are understood.,In tandem with relevant constituents, conducts root cause analyses and makes specific plans and recommendations to mitigate future issues.,Quickly analyzes and resolves hardware and software issues in an enterprise environment ensuring minimal system downtime.,Supports ongoing maintenance, repairs, and updates to various applications running on relevant technology systems.
text:
Description
Planning &Organizing
Ensures the organization is able to work effectively by anticipating issues and mitigating potential risks as it pertains to networking related hardware and software in the organization.
Plans and supports network and computing infrastructure in tandem with internal team and outsourced partners. Makes recommendations to Director of IT Operations regarding best practices, refreshes, etc.
Monitors existing network for threats and prioritizes accordingly from within and outside the organization to ensure risks are anticipated and mitigated.
Documentation
Works with internal staff and vendor partners to generate and update Network Diagrams, Hardware Inventories, etc.
Uses relevant technical change management methodologies to ensure changes are captured, rollbacks are planned, and impacts are understood.
Analysis
In tandem with relevant constituents, conducts root cause analyses and makes specific plans and recommendations to mitigate future issues.
Quickly analyzes and resolves hardware and software issues in an enterprise environment ensuring minimal system downtime.
Supports ongoing maintenance, repairs, and updates to various applications running on relevant technology systems.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, information systems, or similar majors.
Certifications include: CCIE, CCNP, JNCIE-ENT, WCNA

Overview
Come join a dynamic care team at LifeLong Medical Care! We are looking for a Network Engineer who oversees the installation, configuration and maintenance of networked information systems. This is a full time, benefit eligible role reporting to the Chief Information Officer and based out of Berkeley. Work hours vary depending on network requirements. Applicants must be flexible in their availability to work some evenings.
LifeLong Medical Care is a large, multi-site, Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) with a rich history of providing innovative healthcare and social services to a wonderfully diverse patient community. Our patient-centered health home is a dynamic place to work, practice, and grow. We have 16 primary care health centers and deliver integrated services including psychosocial, referrals, chronic disease management, dental, health education, home visits, and much, much more.
We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits including: medical, dental, vision (including dependent and domestic partner coverage), generous leave benefits including nine paid holidays, Flexible Spending Accounts, 403(b) retirement savings plan.
Responsibilities
Install, configure, and maintain local and wide area network services, equipment and devices.
Install all new hardware, systems, and software for networks.
Documents network problems and resolution for future reference.
Monitors system performance and implements performance tuning.
Plans and supports wired and wireless network and computing infrastructure.
Perform troubleshooting analysis of servers, workstations and associated systems.
Oversee software and network security.
Qualifications
Requires a thorough knowledge of data and voice networking.
Strong analytical abilities and professional office experience needed.
Required: Windows, Cisco switches, routers, and firewalls, Meraki cloud-managed access points. Helpful: some Linux
Networking: LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, UDP, VoIP, QoS, EIGRP, BGP, OSPF, VPN, MPLS, Windows AD.
Strong organization skills and ability to prioritize tasks.
Ability to lift 40 lbs.
Able to work under pressure in a positive, friendly and professional manner.
Ability to work independently and as a team player with staff and volunteers.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar.
At least five years of experience with direct responsibilities for WAN, LAN, and firewall configurations required.
Cisco Professional certification preferred
IT experience in healthcare environment preferred.

text:
SCD Information Technology is currently seeking a Telecommunications Network Engineer. The Network Engineer will perform services to enable all aspects of the network to include maintenance, sustainment of existing networks, and identification/correction of complex internetwork issues.
What the right person will enjoy:
Family Oriented company
Work Flexibility
Longevity and uncapped career growth
The opportunity to work on a mix of products
401k Plan
Tuition Reimbursement
100% Paid Benefits for you and your Family that Quality
Required Clearance: TS/SCI with Polygraph
Key Responsibilities:
1. Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;
2. Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.
3. Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;
4. Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement the approved course of action.
5. Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.
6. May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.
7. May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating the current operational status of networks.
8. Perform data of voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance
9. Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls,
10. Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters
11. May be responsible for the configuration, deployment, and management of our customer's next-generation firewall solution.
REQUIREMENTS
Four (4) years of experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity are required. Associate's degree in engineering technology from an accredited college is required. Two (2) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted for an Associate's degree. Certifications: An IAT level II baseline certification as defined by DoD 8570.01-M is required. CCNA, or equivalent, certification or higher required. Both certifications are HIGHLY DESIRED for this position. *
1. Must be able to lift 50lbs.
2. Must be able to drive a company vehicle.
3. Must be available to work an 8-hour shift between the hours of 6am-6pm, as determined by management, unless otherwise assigned an alternative shift.
Experience with installation and configuration of any levels of network devices, such as firewalls, switches, routers, cabling, Cisco, Brocade, or Juniper devices is a plus.

Experience:
Network Engineering: 4 years (Required)
Firewalls: 4 years (Required)
Network Servers: 4 years (Required)

Driver's License (Required)

text:
Position Description
Welcome to the next step in joining Fortune one! Is this the right role for you? If these bullet points describe you, apply and let’s connect:
You have a strong interest in learning about and working with Network Security technologies including next generation firewalls, IDP/IPS, VPN and secure authentication platforms.
You're interested in working with a team of international security experts in an integrated physical and digital retail system that spans the globe.
You're eager to learn about security frameworks and fundamentals while expanding your technical-security skillset
You like the challenges of delivering robust high-available solutions at large scale. How do you secure 11,695 stores globally, protect eCommerce sites, and still have time to enjoy life outside of work?
Primary responsibilities:
Learn to troubleshoot and maintain security applications and equipment that support a global network.
Assist senior security engineers with implementing the strategic design and architecture of a complex, high-scale enterprise security programs that protect all levels of the OSI model.
Integrate new systems and applications with existing environments. Assist with the decommission or migration of existing environments. Assist with vulnerability mitigation.
Troubleshoot operational issue escalations
Receive guidance and mentorship from team members in a distributed international setting.
Minimum Qualifications
College degree
Familiarity with fundamental networking concepts.
The ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic operations environment.
Independent problem solver; self-directed, self-starting.
Experience in at least one of the following is a plus: Shell Scripting, Perl, Java, PHP, Python
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Company Summary
The Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the world’s largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.
Position Summary
Do you have what it takes to be a part of Fortune 1? If you get excited when you think about being part of a global team inventing and protecting the next generation integrated physical and digital retail buying experience, then we want to hear from you! In this role you will be part of a team of network security professionals working in unison to engineer high-available solutions to secure 11,695 stores, under 59 name brands in 28 countries and e-commerce websites in 11 countries.
title: Cyber Security - NETWORK ENGINEER 1

text:
- Job description
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.
People in our Client Delivery & Operations career track drive delivery and capability excellence through the design, development and/or delivery of a solution, service, capability or offering. They grow into delivery-focused roles, and can progress within their current role, laterally or upward.
Business Process Specialization professionals apply expertise in a specific business process delivery capability (or capabilities) to ensure services are delivered in a manner consistent with our Standard Delivery Solutions and Service Level Agreements and drive continuous improvement.
The Network Operations Senior Analyst accountable for execution of specific areas of responsibility/deliverables with minimal supervision. Serve as a functional expert for a program or a defined set of programs. Ensure configurations meet customer expectations as well as industry and product standards. Responsible for accurate back office system data record management. Support customer activations and be responsible for configuration adjustments as required for management acceptance testing.
Job Description
Network Services develops skills that involve planning, deployment, support and management of data, voice and video network infrastructure for Enterprise IT Operations or service providers upon which business applications are built.g, deployment, support and management of data, voice and video network infrastructure for Enterprise IT Operations or service providers upon which business applications are built.
A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:
Analyzes and solves problems that are lower complexity and may be routine in nature, requiring varied responses depending on the situation.
Interacts with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors. Likely has some interactions with non-management levels at the client and/or within Accenture.
Receives minimal instruction on daily work tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments.
Decisions impact own work and may impact the work of others.
Individual contributor and/or oversees a small work effort and/or team.
Under moderate supervision, the Network Engineer is responsible for operational support of Data Voice Security related infrastructure devices. Will also assist with Customer Request Management relating to infrastructure devices such as Firewalls, VPNs, Routers, Switches, PacketShapers, and Load Balancers.

tasks: Administration and daily maintenance, back-up, storage and support of a 15 server Microsoft Windows 2012 network, Microsoft Exchange 2010, firewalls, network switches and routers, VLAN, VPN and network perimeter security.,Manage network access security, administer anti-virus software, security patches and service packs.,Monitor network services, troubleshoot connections, including identification of root causes, and install, configure and upgrade systems and software packages.
text:
The National Society Daughters of the American Revolution, a non-profit women's membership organization located near the Ellipse, has a full-time opportunity for a Network Engineer to join the Information Systems team and contribute to the goals of the organization through the design, development and maintenance of server technologies.
Job Responsibilities:
Administration and daily maintenance, back-up, storage and support of a 15 server Microsoft Windows 2012 network, Microsoft Exchange 2010, firewalls, network switches and routers, VLAN, VPN and network perimeter security.
Manage network access security, administer anti-virus software, security patches and service packs.
Monitor network services, troubleshoot connections, including identification of root causes, and install, configure and upgrade systems and software packages.
Work closely with outside vendors to maintain and repair systems and equipment in a timely manner.
Required Qualifications and Experience:
A minimum of two years previous network hardware and software troubleshooting experience, particularly with Microsoft Windows Server, Active Directory and GPO's, and a strong foundation of TCP/IP networking and server virtualization.
Microsoft Certified Systems Associate (MCSA) Certification is required.
Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE), and/or Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certifications highly desirable.
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, or an equivalent of four years' experience working in network management.
Outstanding ability to troubleshoot network hardware and software.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Advanced skills in MS Hyper-V and MS Exchange.
This is a dynamic opportunity to gain a wide variety of experience and exposure to working on servers and network switches. This position works at the NSDAR headquarters in Washington, D.C. Relocation assistance is not provided. First preference will be given to local/regional candidates.
For more information about the mission and activities of the DAR please visit our website, www.dar.org.org.
Please send resumes and cover letters, including salary requirements to:
Attn: Human Resources
NSDAR
1776 D Street NW
Washington, D.C. 20006-5303
E-mail: resumes@dar.org
Fax: (202) 737-5702
Professional
Minimum Education Required
4-year degree

Company Overview
World Wide Technology (WWT) is a global technology integrator and supply chain solutions provider. Through our culture of innovation, we inspire, build, and deliver business results, from idea to outcome.
Based in St. Louis, WWT works closely with industry leaders such as Cisco, HPE, Dell EMC, NetApp, VMware and F5, focusing on three market segments: Fortune 500 companies, service providers and the public sector. WWT employs more than 4,000 people and operates in more than 2 million square feet of state-of-the-art warehousing, distribution and integration space strategically located throughout the world. WWT is proud to announce that it has been named on the FORTUNE "100 Best Places to Work For®" list for the fifth consecutive year and was awarded #5 on Glassdoor’s 2017 Employees' Choice Awards, honoring the Best Places to Work.
World Wide Technology, Inc. has an opportunity available for a Sr. Network Engineer located in Pleasanton, CA may need to travel to Folsom, CA.
Job Title : SR. Network Engineer
Locations: Pleasanton, CA with light travel to Folsom, CA
Duration : 6 months
Sr Network Engineer (Data Center)
Provides technical thought leadership both within the network organization as well as outside of his/her domain
Works closely with other network engineers, review, execute technical designs and provide technical direction.
Evaluate, define and develop new and existing reference standards and their adoption, to successfully on-board services with speed, quality and efficiency.
Provide key input around defining and delivering overall network strategy and transformation aligned with key business initiatives.
Informed and involved in the Software-Defined-Network disruption with relevancy in Data Center to deliver a Global Infrastructure strategic roadmap.
Provide 3rd level support to the Network Operations Group for monitoring and troubleshooting of these networks.
Qualifications:
BS in CS, EE, IT, or 8+ years related network technology experience preferably across a variety of industries, including retail.
Advanced knowledge in Enterprise architecture, infrastructure deployments and solutions design
Strong hands-on experience and knowledge on with L4 services specifically within a Global Data Center architecture, Load Balancers and operational experience across multiple Network and Security vendors
Strong hands-on experience in implementing, administering, and troubleshooting network infrastructure devices, including: firewalls(Juniper and Palo Alto), routers, switches, and load balancers
Must have design, implementation and operational experience with; Enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches (Juniper MX and Cisco Nexus preferred).
Extensive hand experience in BGP, OSPF, and MPLS (traffic engineering implementation) and other routing protocols. (VPLS)
Deep knowledge of the SDN space, specifically within WAN, Branch, Data Center and Orchestration.
Exceptional command of datacenter technologies, including Cisco UCS, VMware and storage solutions
Working experience with High availability Data Center design experience and big data models.
Experience and understanding in capacity sharing in a compute environment. Understanding of Database architectures and designs
Must have experience with F5 load balancer
Must have experience configuring and managing Content Delivery Networks such as Akamai

name: Network Engineer / Architect - DOD Top Secret / DOE-Q Clearance Required
summary:
InfoReliance is Hiring!
Network Engineer / Architect
Washington, DC
InfoReliance is looking for a d...
text:
InfoReliance is Hiring!
Network Engineer / Architect
Washington, DC
InfoReliance is looking for a dynamic, results-driven professional to serve as a Network Engineer / Architect in support of one of our National Security customers.
In this role, you will focus on design, integration, and deployment. You will provide tactical and strategic input on improving overall network operations and related projects. The selected candidate must be well versed in architectural best practices and applying them across a breadth of technologies to solve an organizational problem. You should be capable of articulating your views on the future development of technology to varying audiences, and you should understand the interaction between infrastructure and solution architecture.
You will use these insights to design appropriate architectural solutions, applying architectural and engineering concepts to design solutions that meet operational requirements, such as scalability, maintainability, security, reliability, extensibility, flexibility, availability, and manageability. You will contribute to the technical direction for the team, ensuring that technical solutions are clearly relevant to our customer’s goals, meet business needs, and contribute to the business strategy
The responsibilities for this role include but are by no means limited to:
Lead and/or support major network projects to support new initiatives, capacity, life-cycle management, upgrades, new products and/or features, and integration.
Engage in planning, designing, upgrading, implementing, optimizing and supporting the classified network infrastructure
This includes but is not limited to applying your hands-on experience and expert level knowledge of network firewalls, radius authentication / configuration, WAN and LAN architecture design, development, and diagramming, NAT and troubleshooting, DMZ construction and isolation, VPN technologies, network health monitoring, routing protocols, Type 1 Ethernet / SONET encryptors, DoDiis WAN infrastructure, VMware Horizon, PCoIP, Teradici, storage infrastructure and storage virtualization.
Develop and evaluate alternative utilization or configuration options.
Develop processes and programs to enhance network performance and reliability.
Establish and maintain network analysis and monitoring tools; including fine-tuning, health reporting and alerting
Optimize stability, availability, reliability and performance of networking and telephony infrastructure.
Resolve complex networking and other technology issues with multiple parties involved
Develop process and architecture diagrams
Have initiative, ask questions, communicate, and be an expert consultant, motivating yourself and others to execute against plans brilliantly.
Thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment that requires team interaction and coordination of efforts. In order to be successful in this role, we expect that qualified candidates will have the following skills, experience, and credentials:
This position requires an active DoD Top Secret or DOE “Q” clearance , without exceptions.
Note - years of experience noted in the following requirements are estimates.
Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent combination of experience and education.
10 or more years of experience working in Information Technology consulting including several years in a lead or advisory role in network engineering / architecture
Expertise in planning, designing, and implementing enterprise-level network technologies: 7+ years of progressive experience in network architecture, engineering, and administration, designing, documenting, and implementing large scale solutions. Demonstrated skill in drafting technical network specifications and the design of complex network solutions involving multiple vendors.
Ability to drive complex network projects from conception through implementation and from discovery to delivery.
Proven ability to develop technical network specifications (requirements, drawings and diagrams).
Excellent writing skills
Proven ability with MS Office Suite, specifically advanced MS Visio and MS Project skills Experience with the following specific technologies / products are required, at a minimum:
Experience with network architecture for LAN and WAN technologies including design, development, and diagram creation
Experience with Cisco network devices, including wired, wireless, routers, switches, load balancer, firewalls, and VoIP
Experience with network firewalls including Sidewinder, Juniper, and Cisco ASA 5500 series
Experience with access control protocols, TACACS+ and RADIUS, including authentication and configuration
Experience with Network Address Translation (NAT) and troubleshooting
Experience with DMZ construction and isolation
Experience with VPN technologies
Experience with network health monitoring, including SolarWinds
Experience with Type 1 -certified Ethernet Encryptors
Experience with Synchronous Optical Networking (SONET) and Synchronous Digital Hierarchy (SDH) protocols
Experience with Department of Defense (DOD) Intelligence Information System (DODIIS) reference model / WAN infrastructure
Experience with VMware Horizon suite platform
Advanced knowledge and experience with routing protocols: TCP/IP, IPv4 / IPv6, OSI routing framework
Experience with PCoIP (PC over IP) remote display protocol and Teradici Management Console
Experience with Storage Infrastructure and Virtualization, including iSCSI standard, NAS, and SAN infrastructure and configuration
Experience with DSIA STIGs and baselining network devices (routers/switches)
Background including VoIP and VTC network design and segregation
Experience with configuration and utilization of remote datacenter management tools
Experience supporting closed / secure environments Certification
Cisco Certification is desired, CCIE, CCDE, or CCNE. VMware certification would also be a plus.
Finally, your consultative approach and work ethic should be described by the following:
You have the ability to work independently and manage priorities
You take care in learning your customer’s business and drivers in order to ensure that your work products support their mission in a way that makes sense for the culture
You like to make your client look good
You find solutions, not problems
You are proactive, you make and meet commitments, and you execute brilliantly.
You have the ability to work with, lead, and drive diverse, integrated, deliverable-driven teams to accomplish the larger mission
You have strong organizational skills, with the ability to work on multiple tasks/initiatives with multiple deadlines
You are a quick study; you have a unique ability to adapt to new environments and to assimilate information quickly.
You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Thank you for taking the time to read about our opportunity and to consider InfoReliance for your career. We look forward to talking with you about this position.
Our Benefits
All benefits are effective Day 1 of your employment with InfoReliance.
Our reputation is built upon the talents and integrity of our employees. We value the contributions of each and every person that is a part of our organization. We offer exciting, challenging career opportunities, competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package to include the following:
10 Paid Company Holidays Annually
18 days a year of Paid Time Off (PTO) Annually for new employees (accrued)
Comprehensive Medical and Dental Coverage
Tuition & Professional Certification Support
401(k) plan
Flexible work arrangements, where possible
Flexible Spending Accounts for Commuter Costs, Medical and Dependent Care
All employees are eligible for our performance-based bonus program recognizing our outstanding contributors.
About InfoReliance
InfoReliance Corporation is an Information Technology (IT) consulting company that builds, deploys and manages custom solutions that transform the business operations of federal government agencies.

tasks: Duties include:,Install, configure, troubleshoot, upgrade, and support an extensive Cisco LAN/WAN network infrastructure.,Install, configure, troubleshoot, upgrade, and support Checkpoint threat prevention appliances.,Install, configure, troubleshoot, upgrade and support servers/appliances that provide key network services including remote access VPN appliances, SecurID appliances, DNS/DHCP servers, ftp servers, wan acceleration devices, etc.).,Install, configure and support network management/monitoring solutions such as Cisco Prime Infrastructure, NetBrain, and Splunk.,Use packet capture tools (wired and wireless) to identify and resolve user or network communications issues.,Provide daily monitoring/detection of potential threats and develop risk mitigation solution.,Provide technical support and troubleshooting for network infrastructure and security issues.,Work with users, clients, vendors, and ISPs to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to LAN/WAN communications, point-to-point links, site-to-site VPNS, Internet access, etc.,Maintain documents pertaining to network changes and activities.,Ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the data residing on or transmitted to/from/through enterprise networks.
text:
Sargent & Lundy is a worldwide leader in professional services for the electric power industry. Our distinctive capabilities provide domestic and international clients and partners with a thoroughly reliable source of comprehensive expertise. Sargent & Lundy offers challenge, flexibility, competitive salaries and benefits.
Responsibilities We are currently seeking a Senior Network Engineer. In this position you will be involved in a wide range of network infrastructure and security duties including on-premise and cloud network architectures, firewalls, identity, and traffic analysis.
Duties include:
Install, configure, troubleshoot, upgrade, and support an extensive Cisco LAN/WAN network infrastructure.
Install, configure, troubleshoot, upgrade, and support Checkpoint threat prevention appliances.
Install, configure, troubleshoot, upgrade and support servers/appliances that provide key network services including remote access VPN appliances, SecurID appliances, DNS/DHCP servers, ftp servers, wan acceleration devices, etc.).
Install, configure and support network management/monitoring solutions such as Cisco Prime Infrastructure, NetBrain, and Splunk.
Use packet capture tools (wired and wireless) to identify and resolve user or network communications issues.
Provide daily monitoring/detection of potential threats and develop risk mitigation solution.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for network infrastructure and security issues.
Work with users, clients, vendors, and ISPs to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to LAN/WAN communications, point-to-point links, site-to-site VPNS, Internet access, etc.
Maintain documents pertaining to network changes and activities.
Ensure the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the data residing on or transmitted to/from/through enterprise networks.
Qualifications Requirements for the qualified candidate include:
A college degree in Computer Science or equivalent in education/experience
A minimum of ten years actively working in an Enterprise LAN/WAN environment, managing and supporting the integrity and security of a complex network infrastructure consisting of routers, switches, firewalls, wireless access points and other network appliances/servers.
Extensive working knowledge of IP networks, routing, layer 2 and layer 3 switching, routing protocols such as BGP or EIGRP, QOS, VPN technologies, VPLS and network protocols such as DHCP and DNS.
Enterprise level experience configuring, managing and troubleshooting Check Point threat prevention appliances.
Enterprise level experience configuring, managing and troubleshooting Cisco routers and switches (core/distribution and access), IOS firewall features, ASA appliances, wireless controllers and access points for LAN and WAN environments.
Experience with remote access and multi-factor security technologies, such as SSL VPNs and RSA SecurID systems.
Experience with network management software, such as Cisco Prime Infrastructure.
Experience with WAN acceleration technologies, such as Cisco WAAS and Riverbed Steelheads.
Strong analytical network troubleshooting skills and proficiency with packet capture tools.
Ability to perform complex migrations/upgrades and deploy new technologies/features as the network environment evolves.
Ability to apply security and networking concepts to emerging cloud solutions, including Azure and AWS
Strong fundamentals in Disaster Recovery, Change Management, Logging and Alerting, and Incident Response
Willingness to work evenings and weekends as necessary to support testing, maintenance or emergency activities.
Sargent & Lundy is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any protected status as defined by law. INDEEDSL

Required Clearance: TS/SCI with Polygraph
Key Responsibilities:
1. Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;
2. Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.
3. Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;
4. Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement the approved course of action.
5. Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.
6. May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.
7. May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating the current operational status of networks.
8. Perform data of voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance
9. Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls,
10. Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters
11. May be responsible for the configuration, deployment, and management of our customer's next-generation firewall solution.

Two (2) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted for an Associate's degree. Certifications: An IAT level II baseline certification as defined by DoD 8570.01-M is required. CCNA, or equivalent, certification or higher required. Both certifications are HIGHLY DESIRED for this position. *
1. Must be able to lift 50lbs.
2. Must be able to drive a company vehicle.
3. Must be available to work an 8-hour shift between the hours of 6am-6pm, as determined by management, unless otherwise assigned an alternative shift.
Experience with installation and configuration of any levels of network devices, such as firewalls, switches, routers, cabling, Cisco, Brocade, or Juniper devices is a plus.

text:
When you join Verizon
Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
You'll offer engineering and administrative level expertise in the WFM technologies. This role will focus on configuration, implementation and advanced troubleshooting of Aspect eWFM (Core WFM, Perform, Empower).
It will offer back end WFM integration support for PeopleSoft, OpsTel CWA, Kronos, Genesys GPlus and Knowlagent/Intradiem.
Providing technical (break/fix).
Management and leadership of team.
Administration support for the WFM application suite and underlying infrastructure.
Maintaining application availability and functionality within an enterprise Contact Center environment.
Working in concert with other engineers on complex issues and tasks.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll also understand and handle the interrelationships between the various products and the infrastructure systems.You'll support and play a key role in a well-organized, well-documented, stable, and compliant infrastructure environments.
You'll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
WFM experience inclusive of Employee Scheduling, Labor Forecasting, Entitlements and Accruals, Leave Management, Attendance Management, Custom Reporting.
Experience troubleshooting common system and network issues.
Even better if you have:
A degree
Ability to effectively communicate, professional writing, technical writing and effective email writing.
Ability to work with general guidance to effectively perform routine to complex assignments; demanding familiarity with principles, theories, concepts and technologies as well as applied knowledge of established procedures, policies and practices.
Ability to solve a wide range of basic to complex problems with general guidance for the accomplishment of short to medium term goals and operating objectives.independently and exercises independent judgment and discretion within generally defined practices and policies to select appropriate methods or techniques for obtaining solutions.
VMware virtualization experience.
Certifications for CCNA Voice or CCNP Voice.
Experience with other enterprise Contact Center products.
Knowledge of H.323 protocols and Session Initiation Protocol (SIP).
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best.Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

name: IT Telecom Network Engineer
summary:
Position description
The Telecom/Network Engineer will design, configure, manage, troubleshoot, sup...
text:
Position description
The Telecom/Network Engineer will design, configure, manage, troubleshoot, support and implement the Telecom/Network Infrastructure. Will also perform limited project management with some coordination of efforts by various support staff. Communicates project status to project proponents. Under general supervision, participates in decisions on technical direction, architecture design, and product selection for the enterprise telecom/data network. Assists with the deployment of telecom/network technology. Exercises independent judgment. Under general direction works on complex technical issues. Provides input to short and long-term section strategy and budget planning. May be required to perform some of the duties of Telecom/Network Specialist. Receptive to new ideas and to learning new technologies. Plans and leads small projects and performs project management coordinating the efforts of internal and external staff with the customer and business needs. On occasion oversees projects and tasks assigned to project team members and may be asked to provide input to their evaluations. Occasionally works under stressful conditions, participating in implementations and troubleshooting efforts that may have significant patient care and/or financial impact to the organization. May be asked to represent Telecommunications and Networks to committees at Mayo.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline with a minimum of 2 years professional technical work experience or an Associate’s degree with a minimum of 4 years of professional technical work experience. A minimum of 6 years professional technical work experience required for individuals without a degree.
Additional qualifications
Expert knowledge of telecom/network concepts and 7-layer OSI model is required. Knowledge of basic telecom/network management and monitoring tools. Basic understanding of desktop and server operating systems is desirable. Must be able to work with minimum direction and able to work effectively in a team environment. Must be customer focused and possess excellent communications and interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of personnel at various levels within and outside the institution. Good organizational and time management skills are required to handle the workload and track the various projects going on simultaneously. Solid analytical skills are also a necessity.
Site description
Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.

text:
BGPCisco RoutersMac OSCCNAWANLinuxSplunkEIGRPJuniperSolarwindsNetworkRouting ProtocolsCISSP
This Network Engineer will help build the network infrastructure for the Global Security team at Tesla. This will be an exciting fast paced role helping build the infrastructure that supports security and investigate efforts within the most innovative car company in the world. In this role, you will be helping implement network solutions supporting investigations into internal threats around Tesla facilities and property worldwide.
Responsibilities
The Network Engineer is responsible for effective analysis and implementation of new technologies, review and troubleshooting of Global Security’s network infrastructure, and assisting in investigations into network misuse and compromise.
Implement and troubleshoot network infrastructure solutions including Cisco and Juniper routers, switches, wireless access points.
Coordinate with production network engineers to integrate into existing network infrastructure.
Manage network communications testing, installation, and support, including LAN and WAN systems.
Facilitate incident management with circuit providers to expedite outage resolutions.
Analyze existing infrastructure for signs of compromise and interpret log data from network devices
Identify and diagnose problems affecting network performance using software and hardware tools
Follow Infrastructure Solution Design as established by corporate Engineers/Architects
Provide off hours support as needed
Ensure that infrastructure for remote offices and central data center facilities adhere to organizational standards
Work with other team members, providers and customers to design, implement and support new and existing infrastructure solutions.
Create Infrastructure documentation
Stay current on industry trends and new technologies that may increase efficiency or decrease costs associated with installed systems and future technology initiatives
Act as liaison with production information technology and information security teams for network infrastructure issues.
Work with Global Security team personnel to provide solutions to technical challenges worldwide
Bachelors’ Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field of study; or any equivalent combination of relevant experience, education and training.
CCNA, JNCIP, CISSP or equivalent industry certifications
Minimum 10 years related network experience in operational and configuration support
Configuration and management experience of LAN/WAN technologies
Strong experience installing Cisco routers, access layer switches and Wireless Access Points.
Proficiency with Windows, Linux and OSX operating systems
Proficiency with Cisco and Juniper routers, switches and firewalls
Proficiency with Cisco ASA firewalls
Knowledge of routing protocols (EIGRP, BGP)
Working knowledge managing telecom issues
Ability to maintain a profession demeanor when troubleshooting issues
High level of customer care skills and demonstrates change agility around environment and technology
Intrapersonal skills to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among support and project stakeholders
Familiarity with network monitoring tools (Splunk,Cacti, Scrutinizer, Solarwinds, Extrahop)
Ability to travel domestic and international if required (10%-20%)
Apply
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program

text:
Essential Functions:
Responsible for the maintenance, troubleshooting, and daily operations related to enterprise-wide data network systems and associated peripherals.
Evaluates and recommends changes to current and future telecommunications requirements in order to meet organizational needs.
Participates in the planning, installation, operation and maintenance of enterprise-wide telecommunications solutions.
Facilitates the resolution of issues regarding the hardware and software environment.
Control and maintain accurate data network system and device inventories and locations.
Demonstrate excellent inter-personal skills and possess a proven track record in data network systems operations and management.
Provide guidance on data network system selection and remediation policies and best practices Problem/outage resolution including vendor interaction and direction
Assist IT management with technical architecture related to planning, installation, operation and maintenance of all data network devices, systems and software that support mission critical functions.
QUALIFICATIONS: Related Education and Experience may be substituted for one another on a year for year basis.
Education: Required: Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related discipline. Preferred: Cisco systems CCNA or above.
Experience: Required: Four (4) years of network related experience.
Preferred: Prior experience supporting health care organizations is beneficial, knowledge and experience using a variety of networking systems and experience with PC operating systems including Windows and Linux/Unix
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: Knowledge and experience in T1, DS3, metro-Ethernet and Optical communication technologies; strong background with TCP/IP and firewall concepts; hands-on hardware troubleshooting experience directly related to Cisco networking equipment and systems. Ability to read and understand technical manuals; procedural documentation, and OEM guides, write internal technical documentation; effectively delivery training and mentoring other telecommunication staff; lead collaborative research efforts in network related issues and products as required. Ability to be a team player and work well with employees at all levels; ability to work independently.

tasks: Investigating, designing, planning, and implementing communications networks.,Partnering with customer teams to develop solutions that support their requirements.,Preparing network schematics to define and illustrate network design solutions.,Creating hardware and software configuration upgrades.,Providing IP addressing and routing strategies.,Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience.,A degree.,Cisco Certified Network Administrator (CCNA) certification.,Experience with Cisco LAN switching, WAAS, Juniper routing and internal wireless products.,Project management experience.,Experience with contemporary technologies including MPLS, TCP/IP, IPSec, BGP, QoS, IP Telephony, Multicast, and/or other similar tools.,Technical knowledge and CCNP experience.
text:
What you’ll be doing...
Continuous improvement efforts drive our business and you will work with customer technical teams to provide solutions for customers' internetworking communications requirements. You will be performing routed/switched network design activity for our large enterprise customer data networks. As the primary interface to customers in support of their WAN/LAN enterprise projects, you will make us better by creating great enterprise customer data networks.
Investigating, designing, planning, and implementing communications networks.
Partnering with customer teams to develop solutions that support their requirements.
Preparing network schematics to define and illustrate network design solutions.
Creating hardware and software configuration upgrades.
Providing IP addressing and routing strategies.
Preparing detailed work orders for technicians.
What we’re looking for...
Your technical skills are top notch, and you are known for digging into the details to find the best solutions. You know how to get to the bottom of your customers’ needs, and how to manage your stakeholders’ expectations. Talking to people comes very naturally to you and you have an ability to communicate complex information in a way that people understand – whether verbal or written.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience.
Fluency in English.
Even better if you have:
A degree.
Cisco Certified Network Administrator (CCNA) certification.
Experience with Cisco LAN switching, WAAS, Juniper routing and internal wireless products.
Project management experience.
Experience with contemporary technologies including MPLS, TCP/IP, IPSec, BGP, QoS, IP Telephony, Multicast, and/or other similar tools.
Technical knowledge and CCNP experience.
Designed and implemented large scale customer networks.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.
title: Network Engineer

summary:
What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optim...

text:
What you’ll be doing...
Verizon Connect is guiding a connected world on the go by automating, optimizing and revolutionizing the way people, vehicles and things move through the world. Our full suite of industry-defining solutions and services put innovation, automation and connected data to work for customers and help them be safer, more efficient and more productive. With more than 3,500 dedicated employees in 15 countries, we deliver leading mobile technology platforms and solutions.
As a SaaS leader, we know our talent is the most important component to our success. We hire top talent and empower them to do their best work. As a division of Verizon, we combine the fun and excitement of a start-up environment with the resources, operational excellence, and brand recognition of an established tech giant.
We have an immediate need for a Senior Network Engineer to join our Development Operations team. You will help facilitate the deployment maintenance and performance tuning of our award winning SaaS application.
Monitoring performance, troubleshoot network problems and outages; scheduling upgrades; collaborating with Senior System Engineers & Architects on network optimization.
Setting up network monitoring / reporting using Solarwinds, Syslog and other tools.
Securing network systems by enforcing policies and monitoring access.
Designing and building and Document Network deployments.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience.
Experience working with design and troubleshooting of dynamic routing protocols, specifically BGP and OSPF in Production environments.
Even better if you have:
BSc computer science/engineering or similar.
Ten or more years of proven experience as a Network Engineer.
Five or more years of experience of installation, operation and maintenance of Cisco equipment, specifically Nexus 2k, 5k, 7k / ASR & ISR Routers.
CCNP / CCIE and/or equivalent certification.
Experience with installation, operation and maintenance of Load Balancers (preferably F5).
Experience working on Linux and Windows operating systems.
Architectural exposure/experience.
Excellent communications skills to clearly articulate complex technical issues to all levels of the organization (both technical and non-technical).
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Analyze local and wide area network systems, including planning, designing, evaluating, selecting operating systems and protocol suites and configuring communication media.
