text:
Augmedix is a health care services technology platform deployed in 40 states with many of the nation’s largest healthcare systems. We provide remote, real-time medical scribing and associated services to outpatient doctors. Our service saves clinicians up to 15 hours per week and increases clinician efficiency by 40%.
About the Team:
Reporting directly to our Head of Global IT, our IT team balances the technical day to day responsibilities of network/wifi auditing, infrastructure management, and network architecture and administration, all while being a resource to our clients across the US in a post-sales capacity. Working primarily with Smart Glass, Android, and a variety of computer hardware, our Global IT Team supports Augmedix in all things tech and IT, balancing customer facing relationships, and internal inquiries.
About the Role:
As a growing startup, we are seeking an individual who excels at working independently and responsibly with a strong understanding of troubleshooting and critical thinking. The ideal candidate will be personable with customers, excited about new technology, and proficient in wireless connectivity and troubleshooting. There is significant opportunity in this position to rapidly gain experience, with guidance from our team.
This position requires a significant (75%) amount of travel to various locations, often with short notice. Candidates will only be considered if they possess a valid driver’s license, passport, and are able to travel without restriction. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States.
Responsibilities (Included but not limited to):
Wireless network assessments
Android hardware testing
Troubleshooting common IoT hardware issues
Customer facing product education
Maintain high level of customer satisfaction
Qualifications:
2-4 years of experience in a relevant field
Customer facing experience (Hospital, healthcare related experience preferred)
Degree or Certification in relevant fields (CCENT or equivalent | CCNA a plus) IT and Networking background
IT and Networking background
Familiarity with Android a plus
Strong analytical skills
Strong troubleshooting skills
Ability to meet tight deadlines and manage multiple projects
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills
Passionate about client success
Demonstrated ability to continuously learn, update and increase technical skills
Proven experience working in a mixed OS environment
Understanding of physical network infrastructure requirements
Professional customer facing communication

summary:
What you’ll be doing...

tasks: Providing technical support to customers that have problems with their network.,Documenting every interaction using one of many tool sets provided.,Advocating for the customer by escalating unresolved issues to the next level of support.,Monitoring ticket queue and following up to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution to user requests/incidents within agreed SLAs.
text:
What you’ll be doing...
We’ve got more than the industry’s best technology—we’ve got the industry’s best service, as well. When a customer has a problem, you’ll be the one to help them out (even if it means getting a little creative), and if you can’t fix it, you’ll find someone who can. You’ll be the face of our company to our customers, ensuring that every interaction is a best-in-class experience.
Providing technical support to customers that have problems with their network.
Documenting every interaction using one of many tool sets provided.
Advocating for the customer by escalating unresolved issues to the next level of support.
Monitoring ticket queue and following up to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution to user requests/incidents within agreed SLAs.
Maintaining user, customer, and departmental confidentiality at all times.
What we’re looking for...
You exemplify values of integrity, accountability, respect, and excellence in your work. You’re organized, detail oriented, team centric, and have a keen sense of urgency in resolving problems, while maintaining a focus on the customer at all times.
You’ll need to have:
· Technical thinking, basic understanding of ISO/OSI model and IT networks in general.
· Willingness to work in 24x7 environment (weekends, nights and holidays).
Even better if you have:
· A degree in IT.
· Experience in technical customer service. Ideally, an ITIL service desk.
· Computer knowledge. Ideally, with ticketing software.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

text:
Reasons could include: the employer is not accepting applications, is not actively hiring, or is reviewing applications
SCD Information Technology is currently seeking a Telecommunications Network Engineer. The Network Engineer will perform services to enable all aspects of the network to include maintenance, sustainment of existing networks, and identification/correction of complex internetwork issues.
What the right person will enjoy:
Family Oriented company
Work Flexibility
Longevity and uncapped career growth
The opportunity to work on a mix of products
401k Plan
Tuition Reimbursement
100% Paid Benefits for you and your Family that Quality
Required Clearance: TS/SCI with Polygraph
Key Responsibilities:
1. Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;
2. Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.
3. Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;
4. Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement the approved course of action.
5. Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.
6. May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.
7. May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating the current operational status of networks.
8. Perform data of voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance
9. Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls,
10. Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters
11. May be responsible for the configuration, deployment, and management of our customer's next-generation firewall solution.
REQUIREMENTS
Four (4) years of experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity are required. Associate's degree in engineering technology from an accredited college is required. Two (2) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted for an Associate's degree. Certifications: An IAT level II baseline certification as defined by DoD 8570.01-M is required. CCNA, or equivalent, certification or higher required. Both certifications are HIGHLY DESIRED for this position. *
1. Must be able to lift 50lbs.
2. Must be able to drive a company vehicle.
3. Must be available to work an 8-hour shift between the hours of 6am-6pm, as determined by management, unless otherwise assigned an alternative shift.
Experience with installation and configuration of any levels of network devices, such as firewalls, switches, routers, cabling, Cisco, Brocade, or Juniper devices is a plus.
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
Network Engineering: 4 years (Required)
Firewalls: 4 years (Required)
Network Servers: 4 years (Required)
License:
Driver's License (Required)
Work authorization:
United States (Required)
Security Clearance Required:
Top Secret (Required)

summary:

At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possibl...
text:
Req ID: 35638
At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.
NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Network Engineer to join our team in Atlanta, Georgia (US-GA), United States (US).
Provides network solutions for all data center systems, including hardware, software, tools, and facilities. Develops or modifies operating procedures and manuals to solve complex network problems considering network circuits, hardware and protocols, processing platforms hardware and software, and facility systems and cabling. Provides network interface with FDA Business Owners, OIM organization, contractors, and vendor maintenance organizations. Provides analysis and support to ensure proper escalation during outages or periods of degraded network performance. Supports integration and test network activities as hardware or applications are migrated from the development environment to the operational environment. Ensures feedback on network test results, problem resolution, and customer satisfaction. Instructs, directs, and oversees the work of other network personnel.
Basic Qualifications:
BS Education Requirement
6-8 years of relevant experience or equivalent work experience
This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.
About NTT DATA Services
NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.
NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.
NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.
title: Network Engineer

name: Cloud Network Engineer
summary:
Responsibilities
The Cloud Network Engineer position is being created to fulfill requirements withi...
text:
Responsibilities
The Cloud Network Engineer position is being created to fulfill requirements within the Data Services organization in support of Corona and future NFV - Network Function Virtualization and SDN - Software Defined Networks initiatives. The Cloud Network Engineer will have considerable responsibility for deploying and operating the Verizon cloud as well as the network edge for the Verizon Clouds.
The individual will be responsible for collaborating and making informed decisions about deployments as well as corrective actions to take in the event of network or device issues.
The purpose of the role is to support the NNO Transport organization teams in seamlessly implementing virtual environment and transport designs.
Requires expertise in traditional routing/switching as well as a moderate level of proficiency in Openstack and virtual network functions.
This role is directly responsible for integrating network services and virtual solutions in support of the entire VZ business. The Software and Hardware are deployed, upgraded, and mediated by this individual with collaboration from DSV (Data Services Virtualization) Design and other virtualization teams. This role is critical to meeting business timelines and goals over the next few years.
The Cloud Network Engineer will be responsible for modularly deploying solutions in varying environments that will require the individual to determine the manner to best work around the varying environments and must be able to autonomously determine what is best based on the overall design and associated principles.
Qualifications
The requisite knowledge and skills for this role include traditional networking skills as well as Linux skills, SW & programming skills. Network & cloud troubleshooting and automation skills are also critical for this role.
The employee directly interacts with vendors, transport teams, NNO virtualization teams, Planning, and numerous other VZ teams involved in virtualization of various services. Due to the complexity and responsibility, the employee is heavily relied upon for many aspects of the transport and engineering process. Development tools utilized in the role may be built by us or vendors. The individual is directly responsible for helping develop the virtualization integration, troubleshooting, and remediation requirements and practices.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer – and celebrate our employees’ differences, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or Veteran status. Different makes us better.
title: Cloud Network Engineer

name: Network Engineer
requirements: Terms of Employment
summary:
View All Vacancies
Network Engineer
Computing Services
This is a challenging opportunity for a netw...
text:
View All Vacancies
Network Engineer
Computing Services
This is a challenging opportunity for a network engineering expert to work at a leading University. The campus provides an excellent work environment, with a wide range of on-site amenities, including world-class sporting facilities, and is surrounded by beautiful countryside, overlooking the city of Bath, one of the most elegant and vibrant cities in the country,
The Role
Would you accept a challenge to become part of a team of systems and network architects, engineers and designers to ensure the university network infrastructure provides the highest quality experience for all its members while having the ability to change and keep pace with new services and technologies?
Do you appreciate the world in which we inhabit is becoming connected and networked in ways previously hard to imagine and the associated challenges this brings to a service oriented environment?
Can you deal with the fact that the scale and scope of these developments are showing no sign of decelerating and the sheer technical complexity of the underlying infrastructure means you will work in an environment where you will never stop learning and developing?
Our community increasingly expects a seamless IT environment that facilitates a next generation network delivered in a reliable and secure manner. This ubiquitous IT environment must accommodate the needs for truly mobile computing, be always available and be completely reliable & resilient. Furthermore, it is essential that agility is inherently designed to provide the flexibility and extensibility that can accommodate the future generation of networking services technologies our consumers demand.
As a part the Computing Services department, you will work within the network design team to deliver and support a secure and resilient network infrastructure, tailored for the University's core connectivity needs.
Your goals will include planning and delivering the next generation network infrastructure necessary to provide IT services to suit new builds, natural expansion, upgrades and changes to the network infrastructure of the university. You will manage procedures and documentation for network support and make a significant contribution to the investigation, diagnosis and resolution of network oriented problems.
The successful candidate will be technically driven, an assured communicator and will work well in a team and individually. They will be experienced in network planning, have a broad and deep knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 networking technologies, routing and switching, automation and scripting, virtualisation, Linux/Unix systems and will have general associated technical experience to back this up.
Further details:
Terms of Employment
The University of Bath is an equal opportunities employer and has an excellent international reputation with staff from over 60 different nations. To achieve our global aspirations, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

text:
STATE OF UTAH
invites applications for the position of:
This position is eligible for a full benefits package. See benefits tab below for details.
Employees hired for this recruitment will be subject to the Driver Eligibility standards found at the following link: https://rules.utah.gov/publicat/code/r027/r027-007.htm#T3
Administrative Office of the Courts - Matheson Courthouse (450 South State Street, Salt Lake City UT 84114)
(1) Full time, FLSA exempt, at-will position with benefits, typically Monday-Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm with possibility of some evening and weekends.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Infrastructure Architects plan, design, implement, support and administer the infrastructure systems of the court. These systems include LAN, WAN, electronic mail, servers, desktop personal computers, and their operating and application support systems. The position involves hardware and software design and setup, troubleshooting hardware and software problems, consulting with court personnel to determine automation requirements, and developing applicable hardware and software systems necessary to meet these identified needs.
EXAMPLE OF DUTIES:
Develops processes and procedures to ensure business continuity, disaster recovery, and develops applicable backup and restores procedures to promote uninterrupted service and rapid recovery from systems failures.
Designs, develops, configures, and installs hardware and software to include systems and network operating systems, applications, data, file, and print servers, communication gateways, network operating hardware and appropriate application software.
Provides direct customer support to users of the court's network and computing systems.
Identifies security issues and develops system responses to monitor security violations and protects the court systems from unauthorized or unwarranted intrusion.
Establishes procedures to back-up all court data and develops procedures to create and monitors file logs and reports, and resolves any problems that arise.
Monitors infrastructure performance and troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and/or telecommunications problems.
Mentors infrastructure support staff and provides instruction and training on hardware and software installed on the court's computing system.
Develops appropriate operational and tactical project plans, develops applicable tasks, and directs other support staff toward the completion of those tasks.
Administers systems hardware and software including operational systems version control and application of patches and PTFs to ensure systems software is maintained at current release levels.
Evaluates systems environments, make recommendations, implement server consolidation and establish partitions to ensure the operation of stable and responsive applications.
Evaluates new hardware and software products for possible use by the court system.
Attends training and reviews trade journals to maintain current technical knowledge within the field, and identifies how new technology can support court applications.
Maintains emergency maintenance activities and data backup.
TYPICAL QUALIFICATIONS:
(includes knowledge, skills, and abilities required upon entry into position and trainable after entry into position)
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field and three (3) years of relevant work experience, OR an Associate's or technical degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, OR Electronic Equipment and five (5) years of relevant work experience in a technical environment; OR five (5+) years of equivalent work experience in a technical environment; AND completion of CNE, MCSE, CCNA or other applicable industry-standard certification.
Knowledge of desktop, WAN, LAN network operating systems, network topology, network hardware and software, and network security systems.
Knowledge of principles, theories, and practices of computer data storage, retrieval, and/or restoration.
Ability to work with personal computers, servers, network and/or telecommunications equipment through documented telecommunications technical training or full-time work experience in a technical environment.
Ability to create, manage, and meet schedules and deadlines.
Ability to perform physical installation, removal or troubleshooting of equipment
components.
SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION:

summary: The National Society Daughters of the American Revolution, a non-profit women’s membership organiza...
tasks: Administration and daily maintenance, back-up, storage and support of a 15 server Microsoft Windows 2012 network, Microsoft Exchange 2010, firewalls, network switches and routers, VLAN, VPN, and network perimeter security.,Manage network access security, administer anti-virus software, security patches and service packs.,Monitor network services, troubleshoot connections, including identification of root causes, and install, configure and upgrade systems and software packages.
text:
The National Society Daughters of the American Revolution, a non-profit women’s membership organization located near the Ellipse, has a full-time opportunity for a Network Engineer well versed in Microsoft systems to join the Information Systems team and contribute to the goals of the organization through the design, development and maintenance of Microsoft server technologies.
Job Responsibilities:
Administration and daily maintenance, back-up, storage and support of a 15 server Microsoft Windows 2012 network, Microsoft Exchange 2010, firewalls, network switches and routers, VLAN, VPN, and network perimeter security.
Manage network access security, administer anti-virus software, security patches and service packs.
Monitor network services, troubleshoot connections, including identification of root causes, and install, configure and upgrade systems and software packages.
Work closely with outside vendors to maintain and repair systems and equipment in a timely manner.
Required Qualifications and Experience:
A minimum of two years previous network hardware and software troubleshooting experience with Microsoft Windows Server, Active Directory and GPO’s, and a strong foundation of TCP/IP networking and server virtualization.
Microsoft Certified Systems Associate (MCSA) certification is required.
Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE), and/or Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certifications highly desirable.
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, or an equivalent of four years’ experience working in network management.
Outstanding ability to troubleshoot network hardware and software.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Advanced skills in MS Hyper-V and MS Exchange.
This is a dynamic opportunity to gain a wide variety of experience and exposure to working on servers and network switches. This position works at the NSDAR headquarters in Washington, D.C. Relocation assistance is not provided. First preference will be given to local/regional candidates.
For more information about the mission and activities of the DAR please visit our website at www.dar.org.
Please send resumes and cover letters, including salary requirements to:
Attn: Human Resources
NSDAR
1776 D Street NW
Washington, D.C. 20006-5303
E-mail: resumes@dar.org
Fax: (202) 737-5702
Professional
4-year degree

text:
Position: Sr. Network Engineer (Data Center)
Location: San Francisco
Duration: 6-24 + Months Contract
Job Description:
This is your opportunity to work with our team to help build the next generation of retail technology. Through our global network to cloud-based network services, this team will bring a wide variety of strategic technologies to bear on a rapidly changing Retail and Business environment.
Provides technical thought leadership both within the network organization as well as outside of his/her domain
Works closely with other network engineers, review, execute technical designs and provide technical direction.
Evaluate, define and develop new and existing reference standards and their adoption, to successfully on-board services with speed, quality and efficiency.
Provide key input around defining and delivering overall network strategy and transformation aligned with key business initiatives.
Informed and involved in the Software-Defined-Network disruption with relevancy in Data Center to deliver a Global Infrastructure strategic roadmap.
Provide 3rd level support to the Network Operations Group for monitoring and troubleshooting of these networks.
Qualifications:
BS in CS, EE, IT, or 8+ years related network technology experience preferably across a variety of industries, including retail.
Advanced knowledge in Enterprise architecture, infrastructure deployments and solutions design
Strong hands-on experience and knowledge on with L4 services specifically within a Global Data Center architecture, Load Balancers and operational experience across multiple Network and Security vendors
Strong hands-on experience in implementing, administering, and troubleshooting network infrastructure devices, including: firewalls(Juniper and Palo Alto), routers, switches, and load balancers
Must have design, implementation and operational experience with; Enterprise/carrier-class routers and switches (Juniper MX and Cisco Nexus preferred).
Extensive hand experience in BGP, OSPF, and MPLS (traffic engineering implementation) and other routing protocols. (VPLS)
Deep knowledge of the SDN space, specifically within WAN, Branch, Data Center and Orchestration.
Exceptional command of datacenter technologies, including Cisco UCS, VMware and storage solutions
Working experience with High availability Data Center design experience and big data models.
Experience and understanding in capacity sharing in a compute environment. Understanding of Database architectures and designs
Must have experience with F5 load balancer
Must haves for this position are: 1. Experience with Juniper SRX and Palo Alto Firewalls. 2. Experience with F5 or any other load balancers 3. Experience with DNS and DHCP

text:
What you’ll be doing...
The primary responsibility will be to provide complete front-to-end engineering and installation of Cisco and Juniper router-based IP network solutions.
Providing Tier III technical support to Tier II for Cisco and Juniper equipment.
Providing technical support to project planning team for the development and implementation of proposals.
Assisting in the design, writing and execution of various test plans on commercial and in-house developed network elements using various test tools and hardware.
Assisting in the design, prototype and deployment of products and services to meet customer needs.
Maintaining and proposingenhancements to existing customer networks.
What we’re looking for...
You'll need to have:
Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Even better if you have:
Willingness to travel.
Degree in Electronics Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science.
Three or more years of experience that includes network design, operational support and hands-on implementation and configuration of network devices such as servers, routers, hubs and switches.
CCNA or JNCIP certifications.
Knowledge of test equipment to include Spirent TestCenter (Avalanche/Reflector).
Strong communication skills, both oral and written.
Willingness to carry a pager to respond to trouble calls after hours.
Router-Based industry experience.
Knowledge in many data networking protocols.
Knowledge of Frame Relay, Ethernet, MPLS, TCP/IP, VPN, and IP Telephony.
Experience with OSI model, routing protocols and their application to router configurations.
Eligibility to pass an extensive background investigation as a condition of employment.
When you join Verizon
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

name: What is qualification to get job of network engineer?
summary: programs specifically in network or computer engineering. These programs provide an overview of stan...
text:
programs specifically in network or computer engineering. These programs provide an overview of standard industry networking tools and procedures for resolving problems within computer networks. Classes cover topics like operating systems, programming essentials, network administration, and information security. Students may also gain instruction in specific networking systems, like Cisco.
Success Tip:
To get the most out of your degree, complete an internship. Experience is essential to entering this career, and so aspiring computer network engineers may benefit from completing internships to gain practical experience in the industry. In fact, some bachelor's programs offer internships to network engineering students. Some individuals may find that their schools instead offer cooperative learning experiences, which similarly allow the opportunity to gain hands-on experience while earning college credit.
Step 2: Work as a Network Administrator
The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports that many network engineers are promoted from network administration or other similar IT positions. Network administrators mostly focus on installing, maintaining, and monitoring the performance of networks, as well as overseeing IT support specialists, and they may assist engineers in the network design process. After earning at least five years of experience and demonstrating proficiency in networking, these workers may advance to network engineer status.
Success Tip:
You can also choose to earn industry-standard certifications. Software vendors such as Microsoft, Cisco, and Red Hat offer certifications to network administrators who use their products after passage of an exam. Possessing one of these certifications may enable individuals to advance in their careers faster, and some employers even require administrators to be certified in specific programs.
Step 3: Consider Earning a Graduate Degree
The BLS notes that some employers favor network engineers who possess graduate degrees, such as an MBA with a focus on information systems. These MBA programs typically last 2 years and combine instruction in business topics with instruction in IT concepts. Master of Science in Computer Networking degree programs are also available. These programs include classes in wireless networking, telecommunications design, and Internet protocols.

text:
Job Description
Infrastructure Architects plan, design, implement, support and administer the infrastructure systems of the court. These systems include LAN, WAN, electronic mail, servers, desktop personal computers, and their operating and application support systems. The position involves hardware and software design and setup, troubleshooting hardware and software problems, consulting with court personnel to determine automation requirements, and developing applicable hardware and software systems necessary to meet these identified needs.
Develops processes and procedures to ensure business continuity, disaster recovery, and develops applicable backup and restores procedures to promote uninterrupted service and rapid recovery from systems failures.
Designs, develops, configures, and installs hardware and software to include systems and network operating systems, applications, data, file, and print servers, communication gateways, network operating hardware and appropriate application software.
Provides direct customer support to users of the court's network and computing systems.
Identifies security issues and develops system responses to monitor security violations and protects the court systems from unauthorized or unwarranted intrusion.
Establishes procedures to back-up all court data and develops procedures to create and monitors file logs and reports, and resolves any problems that arise.
Monitors infrastructure performance and troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and/or telecommunications problems.
Mentors infrastructure support staff and provides instruction and training on hardware and software installed on the court's computing system.
Develops appropriate operational and tactical project plans, develops applicable tasks, and directs other support staff toward the completion of those tasks.
Administers systems hardware and software including operational systems version control and application of patches and PTFs to ensure systems software is maintained at current release levels.
Evaluates systems environments, make recommendations, implement server consolidation and establish partitions to ensure the operation of stable and responsive applications.
Evaluates new hardware and software products for possible use by the court system.
Attends training and reviews trade journals to maintain current technical knowledge within the field, and identifies how new technology can support court applications.
Maintains emergency maintenance activities and data backup.
Typical Qualifications
(includes knowledge, skills, and abilities required upon entry into position and trainable after entry into position)
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field and three (3) years of relevant work experience, OR an Associate's or technical degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, OR Electronic Equipment and five (5) years of relevant work experience in a technical environment; OR five (5+) years of equivalent work experience in a technical environment; AND completion of CNE, MCSE, CCNA or other applicable industry-standard certification.
Knowledge of desktop, WAN, LAN network operating systems, network topology, network hardware and software, and network security systems.
Knowledge of principles, theories, and practices of computer data storage, retrieval, and/or restoration.
Ability to work with personal computers, servers, network and/or telecommunications equipment through documented telecommunications technical training or full-time work experience in a technical environment.
Ability to create, manage, and meet schedules and deadlines.
Ability to perform physical installation, removal or troubleshooting of equipment
components.

name: Tier 2 Network Engineer
summary:
What you’ll be doing...
You’ll join the team responsible for supporting the largest and most reliab...

This includes ensuring that entries in tickets are accurate and concise as well as being clear and professional in content and style. Verbal communication with customers will be necessary to support the repair process.,Incident Management: Take ownership, diagnose and resolve faults identified on the MN&S networks. This includes the use of back office systems such as ETMS, F&E, ESP, IPSM and IMPACT in accordance with the published working practices documentation.,Drive internal and external groups to provide timely resolution to customer issues in order to exceed both internal and published customer Service Level Agreements, maintaining incident ownership throughout.,Designated Network Engineering: Deliver value add Designated Network Engineer support to your assigned customer by building expert knowledge over your assigned customer’s network design, usage and configuration and by developing a personal relationship with your assigned customer to providedirect access to advanced technical and change management support.,Provide support to other colleagues: Provide mentoring and training to the 24/7 shift and day repair teams as required.,Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience.,A degree.,Four or more years of relevant work experience.,Advanced understanding of network protocols and troubleshooting methodology.,Experience performing WAN or LAN administration on 200 or more network devices.,Industry certifications in CCNA, CCNP, JNCIA, JNCIP, or ITIL v3.
text:
What you’ll be doing...
You’ll join the team responsible for supporting the largest and most reliable customer private networks worldwide. As an EMS Tier 2 Engineer, you’ll join the team responsible for providing 2nd level support to our entire managed customer base and for our entire managed services products portfolio. You will provide escalation support to our Tier 1 team and you will be responsible for the handling and management of complex incidents and problem tickets. Your goal will be to restore services and resolve problems quickly by identifying the cause of the issue(s) through in depth investigation and troubleshooting and to implement permanent fixes while keeping our customers and trouble tickets up to date at all times with the progress of your investigations. You may also get a designated customer assigned to you with whom you will be expected to build a strong technical relationship and become an expert in regards to your customer network design, usage and support requirements. Finally you will be expected to take the lead in the early life support of all the latest products and newest technologies based products, and to facilitate the knowledge transfer downwards within the NOC organization.
You’ll also take proactive steps to improve our processes, coach team members, and help our customers understand the benefits of our many automation tools. Your role will be critical to ensure we’re able to exceed customer expectations and keep improving every day.
Maintain & Protect Quality of Service to customers: Ensure that top priority is always given to maintaining and protecting operational service to customers.
Communication: Ensure all written and verbal communication with customers and colleagues is of the highest professional standard. This includes ensuring that entries in tickets are accurate and concise as well as being clear and professional in content and style. Verbal communication with customers will be necessary to support the repair process.
Incident Management: Take ownership, diagnose and resolve faults identified on the MN&S networks. This includes the use of back office systems such as ETMS, F&E, ESP, IPSM and IMPACT in accordance with the published working practices documentation.
Drive internal and external groups to provide timely resolution to customer issues in order to exceed both internal and published customer Service Level Agreements, maintaining incident ownership throughout.
Designated Network Engineering: Deliver value add Designated Network Engineer support to your assigned customer by building expert knowledge over your assigned customer’s network design, usage and configuration and by developing a personal relationship with your assigned customer to providedirect access to advanced technical and change management support.
Provide support to other colleagues: Provide mentoring and training to the 24/7 shift and day repair teams as required.
Continuously maintaining and developing your skills and competencies through your personal development plan.
What we’re looking for...
You enjoy the process of reviewing, analyzing and understanding customer networks and investigating and diagnosing complex faults. You like working as part of a small dynamic team of technical experts but you are also capable of working on your own assignments with very high focus and attention to details. You are very customer focused, well organized and you have superior written and verbal communication skills.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience.
Experience in a network engineering role.
Willingness to work 24/7 work schedule.
Fluency in English (verbal and written).
Even better if you have:
A degree.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Advanced understanding of network protocols and troubleshooting methodology.
Experience performing WAN or LAN administration on 200 or more network devices.
Industry certifications in CCNA, CCNP, JNCIA, JNCIP, or ITIL v3.
Experience in a client-facing role.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.
title: Tier 2 Network Engineer

text:
Position Outline: A Network Engineer is the front lines for providing onsite computer network installation, management, and support to our client base. You will be installing servers, workstations, cabling, mounts, backup systems, digital imaging software packages, and the other items necessary for our clients to effectively utilize technology in their business. You will also be responsible for providing field and remote support as needed, working in cooperation with our operations center. You don’t report to an office each day, you work from home for support and go directly to client sites for onsite service. If you enjoy working in different offices and changes in scenery, this is a great opportunity.
About the Company: Advantage Technologies (www.adv-tech.com) is pretty much one of the coolest places to work in the world. We treat our people like partners, and everyone pulls together to build our team. No gossip, no backstabbing. We really care about our people, and it shows. Advantage Technologies provides computer hardware, software, security, and networking infrastructure to small business, particularly focusing on professional service organizations (dentists, doctors, engineering companies, insurance agencies, CPA firms, etc). We provide the servers, workstations, cabling, management and integration services to keep our clients serving their clients. We deliver Hassle Free IT. For a quick overview of what we do, check out the following youtube videos:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tZOTf2ZSwqE
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mnAJulX_DGg
Key Responsibilities: The Network Engineer works on the regional team serving clients, and plays a critical role. This position is divided into the following key responsibility areas:
1. Customer Technical Support – providing remote and onsite support to our existing client base in cooperation with the operations and support center. Assist our operations center with coordinating who on your team to send where as needed.
2. Project implementation – once a customer purchases a system, you need to manage the implementation of the project. You need to be technically comfortable with managing server installations, workstation deployments, installation of software and network systems. Additionally, you need to be mechanically inclined. We hang mounts, TV’s, run cabling, install xray machines, and a variety of other mechanical tasks that aren’t considered “classic IT”. If you’re looking to sit in a server room and push buttons, this isn’t for you. If you’re looking to integrate IT into a business and make it look awesome – you could be a fit.
3. Assisting the sales team – Everyone on our team helps the sales team by being “on the lookout” for new sales opportunities. Maybe you’re in an office that has hardware that should be refreshed. Maybe you’re onsite at an office that is currently not managed. These are opportunities to make the sales rep in the area aware of, so that they can pursue these clients.
4. Be accountable with your time – all time and activities should be clearly logged in our CRM system.
Desired Skills and Experience:
Understanding of Windows based networks including servers, workstations, and core networking concepts
Understanding of routers, switches, firewalls, and other basic networking equipment, specifically related to installation and troubleshooting.
Understanding of printers, scanners, and other standard IT peripherals, specifically related to installation and troubleshooting.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to maintain professionalism in challenging situations
Excellent organizational skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment independently and meet aggressive deadlines
Ability to work independently, self-starter
Ability to work with technical teams and internal teams to ensure client success
Experience with Microsoft Office
Experience with ConnectWise and/or LabTech
Compensation Plan: The position is salary plus benefits, profit sharing, retirement plan, and an expense account. The salary is evaluated each year at your annual review, and there are great growth opportunities with our team. Compensation includes:
Salary reflective of experience, skillset, and value brought to the organization
Great growth opportunities based on performance
Paid holidays and personal time off
Monthly vehicle allowance
Monthly cell phone allowance
Travel expense account including meals, gas, and other travel expenses as needed
Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage Available
Company paid short term and long term disability insurance
Company paid IRA plan with company contribution match
Profit sharing on a monthly basis per company guidelines and an annual bonus plan
Corporate card for approved expenses including travel
Advancement Opportunity: The Network Engineer is great opening opportunity in the engineering team. The next position would be a Senior Engineer. As the customer base grows, we make it a policy to promote from within, given that individuals have demonstrated the ability to handle that level of leadership.
Employee Supplied Items: You will be responsible for supplying the following:
Portable computer running Windows 7 or newer, with an i5 or faster processor, 8gb of RAM with a docking solution that allows for dual monitors when working from home, and sufficient battery lift for working at client offices.
Android, iPhone, or Windows phone with adequate voice and data allowances.
High speed internet connection at your home office.
A quiet, distraction free home office.
Probationary Period: The first 90 days of employment is considered to be probationary and a training period. The probationary period will be considered complete (possibly ahead of 90 days), if the individual can demonstrate satisfactory results in the key responsibility areas listed above.

Other Interview Reviews for Rackspace
I applied online. The process took a week. I interviewed at Rackspace (Hayes, England (UK)) in March 2016.
3 stage interview.
1st stage is a technical interview with one of your future colleagues. The covers a variety of topics and technologies which are required for the role.
2nd stage is a technical interview with 2 of your future colleagues who would be more senior. This covers a lot of the same topics.
3rd stage is a 30-minute chat with a member of HR and the Manager from your future department.

summary:
Job description
As a member of our Infrastructure Support team, your endless curiosity about techno...
text:
Job description
As a member of our Infrastructure Support team, your endless curiosity about technology will help you propel innovation and your career. Working in a team of highly motivated people like you, you'll work with customers and be accountable for production incidents, problems, change management, internal and external communications, lifecycle management, and product evolution. You'll help develop functional goals and priorities that align with our overall strategy. You'll collaborate with our talented and dedicated problem-solving technologists across the JPMorgan Chase & Co. global network.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
* BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
* Expertise in product and infrastructure support
* Knowledge of risk and controls landscape, ensuring company-wide standards are met
* Ability to execute within a customer-centric environment
* Executes within a customer-centric environment.
* Ability to use (or learn) scripting languages such as Python, or other object oriented language like Ansible, C++, Java, etc.
* Understanding of version and revision control practices and procedures.
* Understanding of database design and SQL.
* Experience working in a Linux environment.
* Experience working in a banking, exchange or technology type environment within a global organization.
* Expertise of networking fundamentals including: Network topology, VLANs, Routing, Switching, Global/Local Load Balancing and Firewalls.
* Expert in Multicast, low latency networks, and market data related technologies.
* Strong experience in Protocol Analyzers (Endace, Apcon, Wireshark, OpNet)
* Strong experience in capacity management tools (Concord, SevOne)
* Strong work ethic in a mission-critical 24x7 diverse environment with multiple vendor/customer relationships.
* Must be flexible, hands on and able to work in a fast paced, high pressure, client-focused and collaborative environment.
Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you'll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You'll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you-and the products you deliver-will thrive.
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $10B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

SCD Information Technology is currently seeking a Telecommunications Network Engineer. The Network Engineer will perform services to enable all aspects of the network to include maintenance, sustainment of existing networks, and identification/correction of complex internetwork issues.

Family Oriented company
Work Flexibility
Longevity and uncapped career growth
The opportunity to work on a mix of products
401k Plan
Tuition Reimbursement
100% Paid Benefits for you and your Family that Quality

Key Responsibilities:
1. Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;
2. Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.
3. Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;
4. Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement the approved course of action.
5. Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.
6. May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.
7. May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating the current operational status of networks.
8. Perform data of voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance
9. Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls,
10. Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters
11. May be responsible for the configuration, deployment, and management of our customer's next-generation firewall solution.

Two (2) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted for an Associate's degree. Both certifications are HIGHLY DESIRED for this position. *
1. Must be able to lift 50lbs.
2. Must be able to drive a company vehicle.
3. Must be available to work an 8-hour shift between the hours of 6am-6pm, as determined by management, unless otherwise assigned an alternative shift.
Experience with installation and configuration of any levels of network devices, such as firewalls, switches, routers, cabling, Cisco, Brocade, or Juniper devices is a plus.

text:
Temporary Broadcast Network Engineer
Posted: 9/13/2019 | Expires: 10/13/2019
Location: Beaverton, Oregon
Function: Production
Specialty: Operations, Project Management, Television & Film
Level: Experienced (Non-Manager)
Duration: Full Time
Salary Description: competitive
KPTV-KPDX, a Meredith owned duopoly,l is recruiting for a Broadcast Network Engineer. The Broadcast Network Engineer installs, supports, and maintains information systems functions in a broadcast television environment, related directly to on-air broadcast operations. Information systems include, but are not limited to Windows, Linux, Macintosh and other operating systems, network and broadcast video servers, end-user desktop and laptops, telecommunication systems, news editing and automation, printers, custom applications and related-user accounts.
Essential Job Functions:
40% Troubleshoots and repairs hardware and software issues in studio and remote production equipment, RF systems and equipment, Windows and other operating systems, network and broadcast video servers, end-user desktop and laptops, telecommunication systems, news editing and automation.
20% Lead or participate in system implementation(s) and upgrades, including creating and maintaining documentation and related diagrams using applications such as VISIO or VidCad.
20% Performs preventative maintenance as appropriate on station equipment, transmitters and RF equipment.
10% Provides technical support to remote broadcasts
5% Develops and updates technical job skills. Provides training on new systems.
5% Other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications and Requirements:
Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Systems Management, Broadcast Engineering or related field, or equivalent training and/or experience
2+ years experience as a broadcast engineer
RF systems experience a plus
Experiencing troubleshooting methodologies that apply to networked Server/PC environment and standalone workstations.
Windows operating system experience including Window NT 4.0/2000/XP in a corporate network environment. Max OS X support helpful.
Previous project management experience preferred.
Specific Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Solid understanding of RF Systems including VF, UHF, Television Transmitters, Microwave Studio to transmitter/transmitter to studio links.
Solid understanding of ATSC encoding systems.
Solid understanding of TCP/IP networking related to PC function and communication with e-mail and software applications in Ethernet-based networks.
Basic knowledge of electronics troubleshooting and repair.
Good decision-making skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills are essential to understand users' requirements and provide training on new systems.
Ability to communicate with non-technical personnel to resolve equipment issues.
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
Ability to prioritize and make frequent changes to work plans without loss of efficiency or composure.
KPTV-KPDX, a Meredith owned duopoly is located in Beaverton, Oregon. Meredith Corporation (NYSE: MDP; www.meredith.com) has been committed to service journalism for 117 years. Today, Meredith uses multiple distribution platforms - including broadcast television, print, digital, mobile and video - to provide consumers with content they desire and to deliver the messages of its advertising and marketing partners.
Meredith's Local Media Group includes 17 owned or operated television stations reaching 11 percent of U.S. households. Meredith's portfolio is concentrated in large, fast-growing markets, with seven stations in the nation's Top 25 - including Atlanta, Phoenix, St. Louis and Portland - and 13 in Top 50 markets. Meredith's stations produce 700 hours of local news and entertainment content each week, and operate leading local digital destinations.
Meredith Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer

text:
Position Description
Welcome to the next step in joining Fortune one! Is this the right role for you? If these bullet points describe you, apply and let’s connect:
You have a strong interest in learning about and working with Network Security technologies including next generation firewalls, IDP/IPS, VPN and secure authentication platforms.
You're interested in working with a team of international security experts in an integrated physical and digital retail system that spans the globe.
You're eager to learn about security frameworks and fundamentals while expanding your technical-security skillset
You like the challenges of delivering robust high-available solutions at large scale. How do you secure 11,695 stores globally, protect eCommerce sites, and still have time to enjoy life outside of work?
Primary responsibilities:
Learn to troubleshoot and maintain security applications and equipment that support a global network.
Assist senior security engineers with implementing the strategic design and architecture of a complex, high-scale enterprise security programs that protect all levels of the OSI model.
Integrate new systems and applications with existing environments. Assist with the decommission or migration of existing environments. Assist with vulnerability mitigation.
Troubleshoot operational issue escalations
Receive guidance and mentorship from team members in a distributed international setting.
Minimum Qualifications
College degree
Familiarity with fundamental networking concepts.
The ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic operations environment.
Independent problem solver; self-directed, self-starting.
Experience in at least one of the following is a plus: Shell Scripting, Perl, Java, PHP, Python
Additional Preferred Qualifications
Company Summary
The Walmart eCommerce team is rapidly innovating to evolve and define the future state of shopping. As the world’s largest retailer, we are on a mission to help people save money and live better. With the help of some of the brightest minds in technology, merchandising, marketing, supply chain, talent and more, we are reimagining the intersection of digital and physical shopping to help achieve that mission.
Position Summary
Do you have what it takes to be a part of Fortune 1? If you get excited when you think about being part of a global team inventing and protecting the next generation integrated physical and digital retail buying experience, then we want to hear from you! In this role you will be part of a team of network security professionals working in unison to engineer high-available solutions to secure 11,695 stores, under 59 name brands in 28 countries and e-commerce websites in 11 countries.

text:
APOGEE ENTERPRISES, INC.
POSITION: Network Engineer, Level II
REPORTS TO: Senior Director, IT Infrastructure and Operations
DEPARTMENT: Corporate IT
LOCATION: Minneapolis, MN
General Description
A Network Engineer is responsible for ensuring successful operation of our enterprise-wide voice and data network in order to provide maximum performance and availability for the Apogee businesses. This individual is responsible for development and deployment of a network infrastructure based on best practice design, configuration and security policies. In this role, the incumbent will:
Configure, install, and maintain LAN, WLAN, WAN and VoIP infrastructures at all Apogee locations.
Estimate, plan and execute network and infrastructure related project tasks.
Analyze, plan, and document network changes to improve performance and accommodate network growth.
Proactively monitor and resolve quality and technical issues in an effort to provide outstanding customer service to the business.
Configure, install, and maintain LAN, WLAN, WAN and VoIP infrastructures at all Apogee locations:
Maintain, enforce and support an enterprise-wide voice and data network architecture that aligns to the business and IT strategies.
Configure, install and maintain routers, switches and firewalls.
Partner with others IT teams to create and execute other infrastructure related IT strategic initiatives.Estimate, plan and execute network and infrastructure related project tasks:
Measure performance of actual to estimate on scope, time and budget.
Successfully execute project related tasks on time as assigned.
Develop small to medium sized network related project plans.
Execute small to medium sized project tasks to plan. Analyze, plan, and document network changes to improve performance and accommodate network growth:
Analyze data traffic patterns within network infrastructure, detecting operational problems and recommending improvements to ensure optimal performance.
Ensure that all aspects of the network are thoroughly documented and kept up to date.Proactively monitor and resolve quality and technical issues in an effort to provide outstanding customer service to the business:
Implement network backup and recovery plans to maintain reliable network operating systems.
Monitor trends in documented incidents and determine appropriate actions necessary to eliminate future occurrences and improve customer service level in appropriate time frame.
Respond with appropriate sense of urgency to problems escalated to network engineering.
Escalate to management any situation that could adversely impact service provided to the business.
Partner with other IT staff to troubleshoot issues outside the network platforms.
Transfer knowledge and mentor other members of the team.Minimum Requirements
BS/BA MIS, Computer Science or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of progressive IT experience.
Minimum 4 years of direct infrastructure/network experience.
Cisco CCNA, CCDP and/or CCIE preferred, ITIL Certification a plus.
Knowledge in configuration, installation, troubleshooting and support of Cisco wired and wireless network equipment.
Knowledge of Cisco Cyber Security portfolio (WSA, IPS, ISE, CES, etc.) with implementation experience is highly desired.
Understanding of network infrastructure protocols including OSPF and BGP.
Understanding of Cisco ASA firewall configuration and maintenance.
Knowledge of Video Conferencing and VoIP equipment and operation.
Experience documenting network topologies using Visio.
Ability to interact with all levels of the organization.
Solid verbal, written and presentation communication skills.
Familiarity with Service Desk ticketing systems.
Travel up to 25%.
Physically able to lift up to 50 pounds of equipment.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

text:
Description
Planning &Organizing
Ensures the organization is able to work effectively by anticipating issues and mitigating potential risks as it pertains to networking related hardware and software in the organization.
Plans and supports network and computing infrastructure in tandem with internal team and outsourced partners. Makes recommendations to Director of IT Operations regarding best practices, refreshes, etc.
Monitors existing network for threats and prioritizes accordingly from within and outside the organization to ensure risks are anticipated and mitigated.
Documentation
Works with internal staff and vendor partners to generate and update Network Diagrams, Hardware Inventories, etc.
Uses relevant technical change management methodologies to ensure changes are captured, rollbacks are planned, and impacts are understood.
Analysis
In tandem with relevant constituents, conducts root cause analyses and makes specific plans and recommendations to mitigate future issues.
Quickly analyzes and resolves hardware and software issues in an enterprise environment ensuring minimal system downtime.
Supports ongoing maintenance, repairs, and updates to various applications running on relevant technology systems.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, information systems, or similar majors.
Certifications include: CCIE, CCNP, JNCIE-ENT, WCNA
title: Network Engineer

name: Tier 1 Network Engineer Junior
summary:
What you’ll be doing...
We’ve got more than the industry’s best technology—we’ve got the industry’s...
tasks: Providing technical support to customers that have problems with their network.,Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience.,A degree.
text:
What you’ll be doing...
We’ve got more than the industry’s best technology—we’ve got the industry’s best service, as well. When a customer has a problem, you’ll be the one to help them out (even if it means getting a little creative), and if you can’t fix it, you’ll find someone who can. You’ll be the face of our company to our customers, ensuring that every interaction is a best-in-class experience.
Providing technical support to customers that have problems with their network.
Mentoring less experienced colleagues.
Maintaining 35,000 devices in 1,300 customer networks.
Documenting every interaction using one of many tool sets provided.
Advocating for the customer by escalating unresolved issues to the next level of support.
Monitoring ticket queue and following up to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution to user requests/incidents within agreed SLAs.
Maintaining user, customer, and departmental confidentiality at all times.
What we’re looking for...
You exemplify values of integrity, accountability, respect, and excellence in your work. You’re organized, detail oriented, team centric, and have a keen sense of urgency in resolving problems, while maintaining a focus on the customer at all times.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience.
Knowledge of ISO/OSI model and IT networks.
Willingness to work in 24x7 environment (weekends, nights and holidays).
Fluency in English (written and verbal).
A degree or related experience.
Even better if you have:
A degree.
Experience in technical customer service. Ideally, an ITIL service desk.
Computer knowledge. Ideally, with ticketing software.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

text:
SCD Information Technology is currently seeking a Telecommunications Network Engineer. The Network Engineer will perform services to enable all aspects of the network to include maintenance, sustainment of existing networks, and identification/correction of complex internetwork issues.
What the right person will enjoy:
Family Oriented company
Work Flexibility
Longevity and uncapped career growth
The opportunity to work on a mix of products
401k Plan
Tuition Reimbursement
100% Paid Benefits for you and your Family that Quality
Required Clearance: TS/SCI with Polygraph
Key Responsibilities:
1. Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;
2. Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.
3. Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;
4. Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement the approved course of action.
5. Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.
6. May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.
7. May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating the current operational status of networks.
8. Perform data of voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance
9. Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls,
10. Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters
11. May be responsible for the configuration, deployment, and management of our customer's next-generation firewall solution.
REQUIREMENTS
Four (4) years of experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity are required. Associate's degree in engineering technology from an accredited college is required. Two (2) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted for an Associate's degree. Certifications: An IAT level II baseline certification as defined by DoD 8570.01-M is required. CCNA, or equivalent, certification or higher required. Both certifications are HIGHLY DESIRED for this position. *
1. Must be able to lift 50lbs.
2. Must be able to drive a company vehicle.
3. Must be available to work an 8-hour shift between the hours of 6am-6pm, as determined by management, unless otherwise assigned an alternative shift.
Experience with installation and configuration of any levels of network devices, such as firewalls, switches, routers, cabling, Cisco, Brocade, or Juniper devices is a plus.

Firewalls: 4 years (Required)
Network Servers: 4 years (Required)

Driver's License (Required)
Work authorization:
United States (Required)

Top Secret (Required)

text:
Job description
The Principle Network Engineer will lead a team of network engineers in supporting the organization’s network infrastructure, globally. This role plays a crucial part within Vistaprint’s operation and development teams to ensure the highest quality of services are being delivered to Vistaprint’s customers. The Principle Network Engineer will be the teams Lead to identify and implement new technologies, prioritize day-to-day infrastructure issues/requests and implement best practices resulting in consistent, efficient, solution delivery in an on-prem and cloud hybrid.
Responsibilities:
Lead network engineering projects with a global scope.
Develop and drive long-term networking strategy in the public cloud
Automate networking related tasks and build self-service tools
Identify and troubleshoot the WAN, LAN, and Internet infrastructure issues
Explore new technologies/vendors solutions
Lead automation of common network configuration tasks and expose automation to partner teams.
Participate in the design of network solutions for business applications and infrastructure technology peers.
Consult with development teams and business units to determine needs; propose and guide implementation of solutions.
Responsible for outage response, disaster recovery, and developing and documenting processes required for day-to-day operations.
Work in cross-functional teams to collaboratively design and implement new technical solutions.
Troubleshoot infrastructure performance issues, analyze network bottlenecks and provide capacity planning solutions.
Willingness to participate in after hours, weekend, or holiday on call coverage.
Occasional travel to other offices globally may be required.
Documentation of network designs and standards.
Proactively identifies potential issues and drives resolution to avoid customer impact and facilitate continuous improvement
Mentor teammates
Think like an entrepreneur.
Experience/Skillset:
Expert knowledge of AWS networking design and AWS services
Able to design, secure, and automated AWS networking infrastructure
Expert level knowledge of Cisco routing and switching skills
Infrastructure as code
Working experience with Palo Alto Firewallsa plus
Working understanding of SD-WAN technologies
Expert in network design and implementation abilities
Ability to troubleshoot complex network issues
Knowledge of BGP, OSPF,EIGRP
Knowledge of network monitoring, SNMP, NetFlow, Syslog, packet capture and analysis.
Understanding of application design, API fundamentals, SSL connectivity.
Knowledge of Python/Perl; scripting ability is a huge plus.
Knowledge of infrastructure automation platforms such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, and Vagrant is a huge plus
Wireless Implementation and configuration experience. Cisco/Meraki WLAN controllers.
Understanding of RADIUS, TACACS+
Troubleshooting techniques in a micro service and SAAS environment
Ability to interface with senior management and business partners.
Excellent organizational, project management, interpersonal, time management and strong presentation skills.
Ability to interface with remote peers and operate as part of a global team
Ability lead a high performing global team
Equal Opportunity Employer
Vistaprint, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases we strive to do more than the law requires.
