name: Network Engineer II
summary: Network Engineer II is responsible for complex and diverse network platforms/topologies within a ne...
text:
Network Engineer II is responsible for complex and diverse network platforms/topologies within a network management center or organization.
The candidate provides technical support by analyzing hardware and/or software data, identifying the root cause of the problem and developing/implementing hardware and/or software solutions.
Candidate will be responsible for design, integration, operation and management of complex enterprise networks, linking a variety of platforms, operating systems, network topologies and network protocols.
Candidate makes recommendations related to network architecture, evaluation of hardware and software products and problem resolution.
Responsibilities:
Participates and leads configurations, implementation, and support of all network systems.
Participates in a collaborative effort to manage and resolve complex network problems and coordinates resolution.
Participates in incident management, asset management, change management, project management, and continuous improvement of network environment.
Manages, configures, and implements routers, switches, firewalls, wireless, and other network systems and services.
Develops wireless network infrastructures and makes recommendation on systems enhancements for optimization.
Managing assigned projects and program components to deliver services in accordance with established objectives.
Maintain network security through proper configuration of VPN tunnels and Firewall rules.
Be aware of and follow existing network management change procedures.
Work outside of normal business hours when required (scheduled maintenance, outage response, last minute urgent requests).
Create and/or update network documentation in various systems per established process and standards.
Job Requirements:
5+ years of progressive experience in the installation, operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of wired and wireless networks.
Professional level understanding of wireless networking including IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi Standards, Controller based Wi-Fi systems, Client to Network Authentication mechanisms (EAP/TLS, PEAP, etc.), RADIUS, DHCP, DNS, Internet VPNs (IPSEC and SSL).
Possess knowledge of TCP/IP V4 layer 2 switching and layer 3 routing including failover and redundancy configuration (VRRP/ HSRP).
Knowledge and/or experience with Clear pass and Airwave appliances, Aruba Wireless controller technologies and wireless access points.
Knowledge of VoIP implementation and support (SIP based call routing, IVRU, Text to Speech) helpful.
Technical, analytical and interpersonal skills required.
Self-motivation and the ability to work with little supervision.
Ability to manage several concurrent tasks and priorities.
Previous Retail Store network deployments.
Knowledge of new technologies (SD-Wan, Cloud based solutions, virtualization.
Qualification:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or other related field or equivalent experience.
5-8 years of related work experience.
SWIUS

summary: Description The Lead, Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components sup...
text:
Description The Lead, Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Lead, Network Engineer works on problems of diverse scope and complexity ranging from moderate to substantial. Responsibilities Lead Network Engineer will support the Network Engineering Design Team. Product support families will include Cisco, Arista, Aruba, Array, and Palo Alto Datacenter products, Viptela Software-Defined Wide Area Network (SD-WAN), Multi-Cloud Connectivity Hubs, and Cloud connectivity with Amazon Web Services (AWS), G Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Oracle and Azure. This individual will: Develop and evaluate network performance criteria and measurement methods Prepare the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conduct network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develop alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conduct economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Advise executives to develop functional strategies (often segment specific) on matters of significance. Exercise independent judgment and decision making on complex issues regarding job duties and related tasks, and work under minimal supervision, Use independent judgment requiring analysis of variable factors and determining the best course of action. Required Qualifications + a Bachelor's degree + 8 or more years of technical experience + 2 or more years of project leadership experience + Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences Preferred Qualifications + Experience with network integration mergers and acquisitions + Interior Gateway Protocol/Border Gateway Protocol (IGP/BGP) configuration and troubleshooting + Remote Access connectivity solutions using Cisco AnyConnect, Aruba and Array + Equinix Cloud exchange design and configuration + Data Center networking design and configuration including Arista and Cisco Nexus platforms with VXLAN/BGP EVPN + Network security stack design and configuration including Palo Alto and Cisco + Wide Area Network (WAN) and Local Area Network (LAN) design and configuration + QoS, Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) and Network Segmentation Technologies + Wireless Network Technologies + SD-WAN design including Cisco Viptela and Meraki platforms + Software Defined Network including Digital Network Architecture (DNA) + Cloud inter-networking design including AWS, GCP and Azure + Experience with tools eco system including Solarwinds, Stealthwatch and ThousandEyes + Network Documentation and excellent communication skills + Infrastructure automation design and deployment through Ansible and Python Additional Information #cloud #LI-remote Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 About Us Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and thats why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first. Equal Opportunity Employer It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or veteran status, except where age, sex, or physical status is a bona fide occupational qualification. View the EEO is the Law poster. Humana Safety and Security Humana will never ask, nor require a candidate provide money for work equipment and network access during the application process. If you become aware of any instances where you as a candidate are asked to provide information and do not believe it is a legitimate request from Humana or affiliate, please contact mailbox_tas_recruit@humana.com to validate the request. text:
Trimble is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a disciplined and strategic focus on being the best. While GPS is at our core, we have grown beyond this technology to embrace other sophisticated positioning technologies and, in doing so; we are changing the way the world works. Our solutions are used in over 140 countries and we have incredibly diverse lines of business.
Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries, working closely with their colleagues around the world. Due to our geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. Come position yourself with an innovative industry leader and position yourself for success.
Network Engineer
Act as network lead for planning, designing, and implementing networked systems. The candidate will be involved in troubleshooting and maintaining both in-house and vendor networks connections including configurations, supporting/troubleshooting network problems, and coordinating with vendors for installation of such items as direct internet access (DIA) circuits, MPLS circuits as well as configuring routers, switches, wireless access points and other devices or technologies as required. Responsible for project planning, cost analysis, and vendor comparisons.
Key Responsibilities
Operational support and incident resolution.
Work with a team to design, implement and support Trimble's worldwide network infrastructure.
Architect / design and integrate LAN/WAN solutions.
Develop and maintain standard configurations, procedures and guidelines for installing and operating voice & data services.
Participate in capacity planning and technology reviews with the Network Infrastructure team.
Maintain the network infrastructure to high levels of availability with basic and expedited support to resolve networking related issues.
Interface with ISP and carriers to install/commission/test new WAN/Internet circuits at remote sites, as well as interface with vendors to identify hardware & software requirements to meet business requirements.
Design, manage and maintain in building wireless networks.
Occasional on-call duties.
Travel: 50%.
Skills & Experience Required:
Team player
Willingness to learn and continue education.
BS or BA degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or equivalent education, training or work experience.
Proven competence in the development, implementation and maintenance of complex network systems with 4 to 6 years’ experience in a networking enterprise environment.
Experience with global enterprise networks is preferred.
Cisco certifications:
CCNA - Routing and Switching or CCNA - Security
CCNP / CCIE Routing and Switching greatly preferred
Other industry certifications / training is greatly desired (examples, CEH, CISSP, MCP, etc)
Experience with the following technologies in design/implement/troubleshooting capacity is essential:
LAN: Switching - Cisco IOS/Nexus, VLANs, STP/RSTP, CoS, QoS, Ether-channel/Trunking,etc.
Experience with Cisco routers and switches is required, experience with Dell and HP switches desired.
Routing: BGP, EIGRP, HSRP or VRRP, PBR, etc.
WAN: T1/Multi-T1, PTP, MPLS, MetroEthernet, etc.
VPN Solutions: IOS/ASA based L2L and Client access VPN, DMVPN.
Network Management and WAN Optimization: Load balancing/Acceleration experience desired. Working knowledge of Silver Peak SD-WAN solutions desired.
Wireless 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ad, etc and other new/emerging standards. Wireless network design and administration required, experience with AeroHive wireless solutions is greatly desired.
Authentication solutions including Cisco ACS/RADIUS/TACACS /Certificates(PKI) greatly desired.
Network troubleshooting using packet capture and analysis using tools such as Wireshark.
ITIL/ITSM desired but not required.
Experience with a CAPWAP based wireless management system is required. Experience with Aerohive wireless systems is preferred.
Proven experience in setting up new site networks, including racking, installing, configuring LAN/WAN/VoIP hardware/circuits, testing/troubleshooting network connectivity/performance and documentation.
Experience with SolarWinds monitoring/management products or other monitoring systems greatly desired.
Trimble Navigation Limited is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. text:
A great opportunity for a Network Engineer to join a leading Telecommunications company
Sydney
An exciting opportunity to join one of Australia's leading Telecommunications Company as a Network Engineer.
In this role you will work within the Solution Design & Implementation team in to perform complex activation activities with IP Networks and associated infrastructure. You will be responsible for complex IP Network Design and Activation/Implementation on Managed Data Networks.
To be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate the following
An expert understanding of design and activation functions and processes associated with IP networks and associated infrastructure
Have sound knowledge of LAN/WAN/WLAN/Firewall technologies and IP Networks
Extensive hands on experience with IOS, QOS, switching and routing
Valid Cisco and Juniper certifications and experience - CCNP, JNCIP, JNCIS accepted
Ability to lead technical discussions and train technical staff
Strong technical documentation and communication skills
Understanding of customer needs and strong customer service skills
Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with others
Contribute to the management of financial and commercial operations
Commitment to driving program/project management

summary: The Electronic On-Ramp. Inc. (EOR) is looking for the ideal candidate for the following position EO...
text:
The Electronic On-Ramp. Inc. (EOR) is looking for the ideal candidate for the following position EOR invites you to participate in the most heroic journey of our lives together. Our mission, should you choose to accept it is patriotic in nature, humanitarian by design, filled with ecotourism opportunities, and peacekeeping activities. All fueled by high tech solutions and advanced by passion, education, and solid opportunities to live your purpose in our lifetime. Join EOR in support efforts within the United States Department of Defense, and the Department of Navy and Marine Corps on one of the largest cyber security and infrastructure operations in the world, with plenty of upward mobility, growth opportunities and more. COMMUNICATION NETWORK ENGINEER MID The positionrsquos primary role is Field Services Communications Network Engineer servicing a large scale Enterprise network. You will be part of a Team of Network Technicians and Computer Service Technician and IPSOSP technicians. This network includes Cisco, Aruba, Brocade, Juniper, Riverbed and McAfee network devices that include Routers, Switches, Access Points, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), Virtual Private Networks (VPN) and WAN Accelerators. The candidate will be part of a support team responsible in completing the emergent requirements on installing andor moving network devices. Responsibilities As a Communications Network Engineer you will be expected to install and maintain network devices at the site and work with the NOC technicians and Managers to troubleshoot outages andor resolve network related issues. You will create tickets for maintenances using HPE Service Manager. Candidates will be expected to understand, implement, and follow processes in accordance with current policies and procedures. Candidates perform escalation and additional tasks as directed. Candidates complete the regional andor site leader instructions. Requirements The candidate will be an innovative technical professional, service oriented, and knowledgeable engineer in the field of Ethernet and IP data engineering with 4 plus yearsrsquo experience as a Network Technician. The position requires a high level of project coordination skills within management in the execution of maintenance activities andor network outages. OSI model understanding is required. The ideal candidate will have a passion for excellence and continuous improvement, combined with an entrepreneurial spirit, strong oral and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, and innovative thinking in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment. The candidate will be part of the team of Network Technicians and Engineers. Some travel is required. Skills Innovative technical professional, service oriented, and knowledgeable engineer in the field of Ethernet and IP data engineering with 4 plus yearsrsquo experience as a Network Technician Experience must include operational support, and configuration of network devices such as servers, routers, switches, associated software tools, and cabling in a large LANMANBANWAN environment. Knowledge of network protocols such as OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP is a plus. Knowledge and experience working with wireless technologies, Virtual Private Networks (VPN), Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), and WAN Accelerators and associated technologies is highly desirable. Ability to speak, write and read the English language. Familiarity with the US Navy and Marine Corps IT environment is desired. Ability to Obtain Secret Security Clearance is required. Strong service and communication is necessary as it ensures satisfaction and network reliability. Ability to lift up to 50lbs is required. A good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills in severs and Cisco devices are a plus. Education A Background Information Technology field or a related technology field is highly desirable. Candidate may present other evidence of intellectual, technical, business accomplishments, and related technology leadership experiences. Required Certifications. Cisco CCNA required. Security+ required. ITIL foundation V3 certification is highly desirable.

name: Network Engineer II
summary:
JOB SUMMARY
The Engineer II position performs technology engineering work to support and optimize o...
text:
JOB SUMMARY
The Engineer II position performs technology engineering work to support and optimize one or more elements of the infrastructure that are limited in scope of impact and complexity (e.g., stable technologies; established and somewhat routine; used in non-routine critical tasks) following defined procedures, practices, and standards. Escalates issues as needed to the next level of engineer job progression.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Implements patches, fixes, deploys new software releases, and provides other ongoing support to element(s) of the infrastructure.
• Builds productive, inter and intra divisional relationships to learn how assigned subsets interact with other technologies and to develop an understanding of the roles of technology colleagues and the information and/or resources they may require
• Maintains a large subset or more than one subset of the infrastructure to assure operational availability and process integrity; documents maintenance activities; gathers data and monitors capacity, usage, and performance; and performs moderately complex backup activities to maintain continuity
• Recovers dynamic data elements (e.g., transactional data) and restores to a point in time, as directed
• Resolves Tier 3 tickets in their area(s) or responsibility
• Interacts with clients to gather information and elicit details of their needs; provides consultation (within defined parameters) by providing direction, explaining course(s) of action to reach a resolution, and recommending a solution; presents information in a way that optimizes client understanding; works toward achieving an approved solution and implementation within assigned infrastructure subset(s)
• Provides input to the disaster recovery plan for their area
• Interacts with smaller, non-mission critical vendors of assigned subsets for technical support within existing vendor agreements
• Observes experienced project managers to learn technology engineering project management skills and applies learned knowledge and skills by contributing to project plans, RFPs, and RFIs
• Recognizes needs or opportunities; investigates, evaluates, and tests new products and technologies relevant to assigned infrastructure subsets to enhance technology engineering service value
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related fields
• 3 to 5 years experience in one or more of the following technologies: Cisco, VSAT, iDirect, WiMax, Winegard, ShoreTel, Mitel
• 3 to 5 years experience with Solarwinds, WhatsUp Gold
• 3 to 5 years experience working with/for the oil and gas industry.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• 4 years or more of relevant functional experience in engineer role or equivalent
• Sufficient understanding of the principles of IT infrastructure support, and working knowledge in one or two technology areas
* Veterans Welcomed
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS
• Office environment
• While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and use hands. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job includes close vision and distance vision.
BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES
• Accountability
• Excellence
• Innovation
• Safety
• Teamwork & Collaboration
• Communication
• Decision Making
• Process & Analytic Ability
TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES
• Software Systems Infrastructure - Level Two
• Capacity Planning and Management - Level Two
• Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) - Level Two
• Technology Architecture - Level Two
• Emerging Technology - Level Two
• IT Standards, Procedures, Policies - Level Two
• Technology Troubleshooting - Level Two
• Information Management - Level Two
• Product and Vendor Evaluation - Level Two

Overview
As Network & Telecommunications Senior Network Engineer you will be part of the Service Availability team and ICT management team, providing mentoring and expertise to the Network and Telecommunications team. You will be working with a distributed team with engineers and technicians at the different sites. The department provide services and solution to two sites In Salah Gas and In Amenas. Department provide services for network and telecom area, including entertainment systems. This is provided to all sites and temporary facilities, such as Drilling rigs and temporary camps. You are arriving at a time that the business is looking to rationalise and integrate their IT and Telecoms teams into a more cohesive unit and undertake a series of digital transformation projects. The successful candidate will also help to oversee the transformation of traditional telephony service to Unified Communications and development of team skills to reflect emerging cyber and business threats to maintaining a highly available network with robust operational processes.
Team Leadership:
Provide technical assistance, direction and coaching to the team
Together with Telecom supervisor develop and deliver the annual training plans
Carry out regular performance reviews and objective setting
Empower and guide staff to create and maintain accurate, clear and comprehensive network documentation and procedures.
Position Duties & Essential Skills:
Experience: 10 years of Network and Telecom engineering experience
A professional level certification such as CCNP.
Experience in Unified Communication, Analog & Digital PBX configuration and deployment.
Strong Cisco networking skills (LAN/WAN/Nexus/ACI/Security & Automation)
Strong Knowledge of Routed/Routing Protocols: BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, MPLS, VRFs, VPNs
Strong Knowledge of WAN Connectivity through use of Routers, Firewalls, various proxy services and other network and security devices to provide cyber security protection
Working Knowledge of Cloud Network Services integrations like (AWS/Azure)
Strong knowledge on SDWAN technology and deployment
Security engineering, administration, and cyber threat research/analysis experience.
Experience with Web Application Firewall (WAF) experience.
knowledge of Cloud security (AWS - Azure) architecture, environment, and WAF experience.
Active Directory working experience, AD integration, AD trust relationships, AD security.
Relevant experience as threat intelligence, incident response or similar role.
Strong understanding of malware and network attack vectors.
Proficient at data analysis from logs or security controls, such as firewalls, IPS/IDS, enterprise AV, network analyzers.
Keep pace with emerging security threats, technologies, and systems.
Advanced Persistent Threats (APT), phishing and social engineering, network access controllers (NAC), gateway anti-malware and enhanced authentication.
experience with networking technologies and core Internet protocols (e.g. BGP, OSPF, MPLS-VPN, VXLAN/EVPN, DMVPN, vPC, and distributed networks)
Cisco ACI, Spine/Leaf technology knowledge
Strong skills with automation (REST API, Ansible, Python, Powershell, etc.
Must have F5 load balance as well as LTM/GTM experience
Solid understanding of network infrastructure, firewall, proxy, and packet level detail in order to troubleshoot PC, server, storage, and application issues.
Expert understanding of BGP (confederations, communities,) as well as real world implementation and troubleshooting experience
Professional understanding of QoS as well as real world implementation and troubleshooting experience
Self-motivation and the ability to work with almost no supervision
About Petroplan
Petroplan is the trusted, specialist global Talent Solutions partner of choice for employers and professionals in the Energy sector. Since 1976, Petroplan has been here to help people like you make the most of the opportunities available and find the best fit for you as an individual.
Over 10,000 placements in more than 55 countries for over 550 clients across 65 disciplines.
In an industry where skilled and experienced professionals are increasingly sought after resource, we appreciate the true value of what you have to offer. What's more, we understand that different things are important to different people in today's world of work - it's about making exactly the right connections for you as an individual.
Our reputation for contractor and candidate care, understanding what makes you tick, and finding you the best match is second-to-none. We understand the industry inside-out and seek to understand YOU and your motivations in the same way. We take the time to evaluate your individual strengths, understand the most important things to you, and establish exactly what you're looking for from your next role.
title: Senior Telecom Network Engineer

name: Network Engineer, Deployment and Support
summary: Facebook's Edge & Network Service (ENS) team is actively looking for passionate people to help us t...
text:
Facebook's Edge & Network Service (ENS) team is actively looking for passionate people to help us tackle the unique set of challenges and opportunities we face, while contributing to our company mission of connecting the world. Our team is the execution arm of the Facebook network team and is responsible for the deployment and support of all production networks (Edge, Backbone, Optical, and Data center) as well as our content delivery network (CDN) across the globe. This truly global team offers a unique career opportunity to work with all of the latest network technologies and talented engineers solving some of the most complex problems in the industry.
Network Engineer, Deployment and Support Responsibilities
Deployment, configuration, and management of all network infrastructure on our data center campus
Work with partner teams and vendors to manage day-to-day operations and reliability of the regional network
Schedule and perform maintenance including upgrades, migrations, and decommissioning of production networks
Create deployment packages and maintain as-built documentation and asset database for installed network gear
Establish and implement global best practices and contribute to the design of new scalable network solutions
Support the development, testing and integration of new hardware and software platforms into the network
Participate in an on-call rotation to support the regional network infrastructure 24x7
10% of travel required, up to 30% based on projects
Minimum Qualifications
6+ years of work experience responsible for designing, deploying and operating large-scale networks
Experience configuring and troubleshooting routing and switching protocols (BGP, IS-IS, MPLS, RSVP-TE, VRRP)
Working knowledge of network protocols (TCP/UDP, DHCP, DNS) and experience with IPv4 and IPv6
Experience working in a multi-vendor environment with hands-on experience with networking hardware
Working knowledge of physical infrastructure design including structured cabling and fiber-optic cabling
Proven experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and deliver against mission critical deadlines
Proven experience working in a global team environment and solving problems with limited supervision
Ability to lift/move 30-40 pounds on a daily basis
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge of 40/100G Ethernet and CWDM, DWDM and optical transport network technologies
Experience with field-based work in Data Centers, Colocation Facilities, Internet Exchanges, or Central Offices
Working knowledge of data center power and cooling infrastructure and critical facility operational best practices
Familiarity with the Linux based systems and experience with scripting and automation (Bash, Python, Perl)
Technical leadership and people management experience
Locations
About the Facebook company
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Facebook

name: Senior Network Engineer 20
summary:
Job Description
Designs, configures, implements, troubleshoots, optimizes, and documents multi-vend...
text:
Job Description
Designs, configures, implements, troubleshoots, optimizes, and documents multi-vendor LAN/WAN topologies utilizing OSPF, BGP, EIGRP, SD-WAN, Software Defined Networking (NSX), microsegmentation and security (NSX, ISE, etc.), Virtual Local Area Networks (VLAN), routers (Cisco), switches (multi-vendor), wireless networks (Cisco WLCs), WAN optimization (Riverbed), Network Address Translation (NAT/PAT), Load Balancers (F5), Firewalls (Palo/Meraki/Cisco), and Virtual Private Networks (VPN).
Tests for known vulnerabilities. Designs and reviews data center, closet and floor diagrams. Determines cabling, power, UPS, and rack space requirements for new office builds and remodels. Works with vendors to order and provision telecom circuits.
Installs, configures, monitors, and maintains the network operating system and network devices.
Responsible for stability, availability, and reliability of equipment (routers, switches, network devices, etc.) under their control.
Ensures that all systems for which they are responsible operate at peak efficiency and meet established firm security guidelines.
Maintains applicable written procedures and documentation of network functions.
Provides after-hours support by being on call 24 hours a day periodically.
While on-call remains in a position to respond to calls, receive help calls, and to answer them quickly, thoroughly, and in a professional manner.
Coordinates scheduling of maintenance activities with Lead Engineer and other management.
Participates in testing of new hardware and software under guidance of Lead Engineer.
Recommends any improvements to equipment (routers, switches, network devices, etc.) to supervisor.
Participates in the firm's data disaster recovery program, which may require travel with minimal notice.
Performs audits on the network equipment with minimal notice.
Works, occasionally, at different shifts outside of stated regular office hours.
May be required to travel to firm office and/or trial site locations including international destinations (10-25% travel).
Attends training sessions concerning skill development; travels to these sessions as required.
May lead the work of junior level engineers.
Keeps supervisor abreast of current issues and potential problems as they develop; seeks advice as needed.
Follows adequate safety procedures while carrying out all duties.
Requirements
Four years related experience; Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school in computer science or a related discipline; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Demonstrates the ability to potentially supervise staff members, through organizational skills and interpersonal communications. Experience with packet capture and analysis (Wireshark, Fiddler, etc.), Mobile Device Management (Airwatch, InTune), Web Application Firewall, IPS/IDS, and Cisco Call Manager is preferred. The following certifications are preferred, but not required:
CCNA -- Cisco Certified Network Associate
CCNP -- Cisco Certified Network Professional
VCP6-NV -- VMware Certified Professional 6 -- Network Virtualization
VCIX-NV -- VMware Certified Implementation Expert -- Network Virtualization
Shook Hardy & Bacon

We are looking for a high energy Network Implementation Engineer who can support router / wireless AP implementations. This role will be responsible for working from onsite technicians to validate configurations and connectivity.

summary:
Company Profile
Oceaneering is a global oilfield provider of engineered services and products prima...
text:
Company Profile
Oceaneering is a global oilfield provider of engineered services and products primarily to the offshore oil and gas industry, with a focus on deepwater applications. Through the use of its applied technology expertise, Oceaneering also serves the defense, entertainment, and aerospace industries. Oceaneering’s business offerings include remotely operated vehicles, built-to-order specialty subsea hardware, deepwater intervention and manned diving services, non-destructive testing and inspection, and engineering and project management.
Position Summary
The responsibilities include the design, installation and maintenance of the Global Data Solutions Data Network globally. The individual must be qualified at all levels of LAN, WAN, Voice, and Security technologies. The candidate must be competent to work as a SME in the design, support, and troubleshooting of the Network Infrastructure.
Knowledge of standard project management practices with excellent written and oral communications skills are also required.
Duties & Responsibilities
Other duties may be assigned.
Configuring, testing, and troubleshooting of network equipment such as Cisco routers/switches, IP phones, CME, CUE, and wireless LAN equipment in coordination with Project, Engineering, and Customer teams
Configuring, Testing, Installation, Troubleshooting of global data routing, global call routing, global video routing and general network connectivity in coordination with Project, Engineering, and Customer teams
Document all network designs, configurations, and network change requests to maintain real time accountability network architecture for Network Operations Center
Standardize global design and documentation of data, voice, and video globally
Flexible schedule and sense of urgency to support escalations that impact business operations and client services
Lead network activity for mobilizations and demobilization's while updating all documentation and systems pertaining to defined activity
Lead and mentor junior technicians on troubleshooting Global Data Solutions systems
Participate in project planning activities
Answer phone and email client requests for support on GDS services
Available after hours and weekends as needed and willing to work on-call rotation
Maintain procedures and standards in support of Network operations and documentation required for network administration
Strong verbal and written communications skills and ability to work well in a team or individually.
Continuously strive to learn new technology and product solutions required for Projects and Services
Promote positive work environment attitude
Promote customer service
Update and maintain site cards and Network drawings
Promote safety in workplace that aligns with Oceaneering’s policies
Ability to work as a team member, team lead and/or independently
Qualifications
Education and/or Experience
5-7 years working on Data, Wireless and Security technologies
5-7 years experience directly working with customer and client technical teams
Minimum 5 years designing wireless networks for WAN and LAN solutions
Minimum 5 years in IPv4 and IPv6 subnetting and routing
Minimum 5 years designing global call routing with on Cisco VG, CME, CUE, and CCM.
Minimum CCNP Route & Switch/ CCNP Security / CCNP Voice / CCDA / CCDP / Cisco Data Center Unified Computing Design Specialist / Cisco Data Center Unified Computing Support Specialist (P)
ITIL V3 Foundation Certified
Bachelor Degree preferred.
Expert understanding of:
TCP/IP network protocols following the OSI model
Cisco ASA Firewall with working knowledge of DMZ design and security best practices
Wireless design typically gained from past experiences with the Cisco product line
Configuring and troubleshooting GRE/IPSEC in a dynamic vpn environment
QOS policies across the Enterprise for Data, Voice and Video solutions
Cisco ASR’s, Nexus, Catalyst 6500’s, 2960’s, 2900 ISR, 4000 ISR, 819, 829, 3560, ASA and WISM product lines
Cisco CME, CUE, SIP, SCCP, Telephony services, Voice Codec’s, and Translation patterns
Routing protocols such as EIGRP, BGP, RIPv2, OSPF, PFRv3 and Static routing protocols while using IPSLA
Knowledge of:
Troubleshooting software such as Solarwinds, Wireshark, and packet tracers
DNS resolution
Routing over VSAT, 4G LTE, WiMAX, Metro-ethernet, and fiber
Cisco Wireless VoIP, Wireless Controllers, and autonomous and lightweight Access Points
Switching technology fundamentals
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Good technical capabilities and a background in the network arena are required for this role, along with a basic understanding of the UK and global markets. Ideally you will have experience with multinational companies and a good track record of achievements.
You should have a genuine interest in and the basic capability to design small size LAN/WAN and WiFi solutions and to see them through build and into implementation. Knowledge of LAN technologies based on key vendor equipment (Cisco, Juniper) is therefore required along with a good knowledge of routing and switching techniques and protocols.
Knowledge of the following is sought to varying degrees;
Large scale routing protocols EIGRP, OSPF, BGP
Knowledge of IP VPN, MPLS, ATM, Frame Relay, X.25, xDSL, Voice, VoIP, WLAN
Knowledge of infrastructure services including SDH,CWDM, DWDM,
Knowledge of load balancing solutions such as SSL offloading
Knowledge of network based applications and their security dependencies
Experience of security designs, products, implementations and principles
Experience of designing and configuring QoS
Computer Experience
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have complete knowledge of such programs as Microsoft Visio, Word, Excel, and Powerpoint.
How To Apply
We offer a competitive salary and the opportunity to advance in an international company. Visit www.oceaneering.com, select ‘Careers > Career search and then click ' Oceaneering Job Search' to apply
Additional Information
Technical Implementation
Support activities within the planning / detailed design cycle to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction
Develop technical design documentation for initial roll-outs, moves, adds and changes
Provide technical support to senior roles within the team
Undertake ad-hoc implementation support
Relationship Management
Respond effectively and courteously to all internal/client requests
Seek and collate internal feedback on performance
Support customer project work at an appropriate level
Communication
Keep team well informed of quality issues which may impact client satisfaction
Liaise closely with all internal/external resources for implementation type activity
Effectively communicate project information to superiors as relevant

text:
Are you a vibrant and energetic individual looking to boost your career within a technical environment? GO's Technical Team is looking for an energetic individual to join the team in the role of Junior Network Engineer - IP Core.
It would be essential for you to have:
A first degree in Engineering with a focus on Telecommunications
Basic technical knowledge ( we will also train you ) on IP and Internet related technologies to be able to operate and maintain network infrastructure, such as:
ISP services such as email, dns, web services, databases
Systems: Linux
Networking and Transport infrastructure
Scripting: Shell, perl, PHP,phyton
Computer skills and IP knowledge
Willingness to learn and the ability to work on own initiative
Have problem Solving and communication skills
We would prefer if you also have:
Cisco certification to at least the CCNA level; training will be provided to achieve this certification.
If this describes you that this is a glimpse of what you will be doing:
Together with the Core IP team, you will be responsible to maintain and operate the company's IP and transport network. You shall take prime interest in researching technologies related to IP Service Provider Network since this role is critical in providing the knowledge required to create a competitive edge and improve efficiency.
Operate, manage and maintain the company’s
Core IP Network
Metro Ethernet Network
Mobile Backhaul Network
Data Center Network
Broadband Network Gateway
Review the network performance to ensure the appropriate forecasting, dimensioning and sizing of the various Network elements so as to meet the demand for Service Provisioning as well as maintain the required Service Levels;
Implement appropriate operational procedures in accordance with international norms and standards in order to ensure that system downtime is minimised and a high-level quality of service is guaranteed;
Provide on the job training when necessary;
Assist and liaise with other sections in the design, build and operation of customers’ networks;
Provide 3rd level support and liaise directly with third parties, including clients and suppliers for technical problem resolution on a 24x7 basis.
*Dear Candidate, kindly note that this role is not managed by Castille. The client, in this case, is responsible to manage the application process. In case of any difficulties, feel free to contact brand@castilleresources.com, and we will direct your query to the relevant contact at this company.

Working knowledge of Silver Peak SD-WAN solutions desired.,Wireless 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ad, etc and other new/emerging standards. Wireless network design and administration required, experience with AeroHive wireless solutions is greatly desired.,Authentication solutions including Cisco ACS/RADIUS/TACACS /Certificates(PKI) greatly desired.,Network troubleshooting using packet capture and analysis using tools such as Wireshark.,ITIL/ITSM desired but not required.,Proven experience in setting up new site networks, including racking, installing, configuring LAN/WAN/VoIP hardware/circuits, testing/troubleshooting network connectivity/performance and documentation.
text:
Trimble is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a disciplined and strategic focus on being the best. While GPS is at our core, we have grown beyond this technology to embrace other sophisticated positioning technologies and, in doing so; we are changing the way the world works. Our solutions are used in over 140 countries and we have incredibly diverse lines of business.
Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries, working closely with their colleagues around the world. Due to our geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. Come position yourself with an innovative industry leader and position yourself for success.
Network Engineer
Act as network lead for planning, designing, and implementing networked systems. The candidate will be involved in troubleshooting and maintaining both in-house and vendor networks connections including configurations, supporting/troubleshooting network problems, and coordinating with vendors for installation of such items as direct internet access (DIA) circuits, MPLS circuits as well as configuring routers, switches, wireless access points and other devices or technologies as required. Responsible for project planning, cost analysis, and vendor comparisons.
Key Responsibilities
Operational support and incident resolution.
Work with a team to design, implement and support Trimble's worldwide network infrastructure.
Architect / design and integrate LAN/WAN solutions.
Develop and maintain standard configurations, procedures and guidelines for installing and operating voice & data services.
Participate in capacity planning and technology reviews with the Network Infrastructure team.
Maintain the network infrastructure to high levels of availability with basic and expedited support to resolve networking related issues.
Interface with ISP and carriers to install/commission/test new WAN/Internet circuits at remote sites, as well as interface with vendors to identify hardware & software requirements to meet business requirements.
Design, manage and maintain in building wireless networks.
Occasional on-call duties.
Travel: 50%.
Skills & Experience Required:
Team player
Willingness to learn and continue education.
BS or BA degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or equivalent education, training or work experience.
Proven competence in the development, implementation and maintenance of complex network systems with 4 to 6 years’ experience in a networking enterprise environment.
Experience with global enterprise networks is preferred.
Cisco certifications:
CCNA - Routing and Switching or CCNA - Security
CCNP / CCIE Routing and Switching greatly preferred
Other industry certifications / training is greatly desired (examples, CEH, CISSP, MCP, etc)
Experience with the following technologies in design/implement/troubleshooting capacity is essential:
LAN: Switching - Cisco IOS/Nexus, VLANs, STP/RSTP, CoS, QoS, Ether-channel/Trunking,etc.
Experience with Cisco routers and switches is required, experience with Dell and HP switches desired.
Routing: BGP, EIGRP, HSRP or VRRP, PBR, etc.
WAN: T1/Multi-T1, PTP, MPLS, MetroEthernet, etc.
VPN Solutions: IOS/ASA based L2L and Client access VPN, DMVPN.
Network Management and WAN Optimization: Load balancing/Acceleration experience desired. Working knowledge of Silver Peak SD-WAN solutions desired.
Wireless 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ad, etc and other new/emerging standards. Wireless network design and administration required, experience with AeroHive wireless solutions is greatly desired.
Authentication solutions including Cisco ACS/RADIUS/TACACS /Certificates(PKI) greatly desired.
Network troubleshooting using packet capture and analysis using tools such as Wireshark.
ITIL/ITSM desired but not required.
Experience with a CAPWAP based wireless management system is required. Experience with Aerohive wireless systems is preferred.
Proven experience in setting up new site networks, including racking, installing, configuring LAN/WAN/VoIP hardware/circuits, testing/troubleshooting network connectivity/performance and documentation.
Experience with SolarWinds monitoring/management products or other monitoring systems greatly desired.

summary: Senior Network Engineer Lead (CCIE, CCNP) This is a Senior Network Engineer Lead (CCIE, CCNP) posit...
text:
Senior Network Engineer Lead (CCIE, CCNP) This is a Senior Network Engineer Lead (CCIE, CCNP) position for supporting a Navy program located in Quantico, Virginia. We are seeking a Senior Network Engineer (CCIE, CCNP) to join our team of committed technical professionals to protect those who serve against criminal, terrorism and emerging threats. Are you passionate about creating solutions and innovation? Our employees enjoy a fast-paced, collaborative culture and the ability to directly impact our business. You will work with a high-achieving team to design and deliver high-quality technical solutions. This position provides an excellent opportunity to apply and extend your skills in a complex and varied environment and experience new technologies. Engineer will be required to modernize, design, operate, maintain, support and interact with complex LAN, WAN and wireless environments in a production environment. How you will make a difference: Lead a team of eight experienced network engineers for both engineering and production responsibilities Expert level network engineering and architecture design services Expert level configuration of Cisco routers and switches Expert level with configuring routing protocols, OSPF and BGP in enterprise environments Expert knowledge of network performance metrics, packet capture and analysis, and network troubleshooting Solid understanding of network and system performance monitoring and upgrades Configuration of F5 Load Balancers (LTM and GTM) Experience with Cisco ASA for Client and Site-to-site VPN, Solid experience with Cisco enterprise wireless (WLCs, APs) Experience with configuration and management of firewalls; Palo Alto, Forcepoint Sidewinder, and Juniper Experience with Solarwinds, Kiwi Cat Tools, ISE, Prime Experience with ACI, NSX or other SDN solutions Experience with SD-WAN, preferably migration from MPLS to SD-WAN Ability to support Network based infrastructure solutions based on industry best practice Experience with and ability to understand, distill and document solution requirements. Experience performing system administration duties on Cisco and monitoring systems. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve LAN, WAN, wireless, SAN problems using various types of tools and troubleshooting methodologies. Skill in managing one's own time and the time of others based on an established project plan Experience managing multiple priorities simultaneously Minimum Requirements (including education): Candidates must have: Expert level of support for a WAN consisting of NIPRNet, SIPRNet, JWICS, and SAP network devices; supporting 190 offices worldwide Preferred: Active CCIE, CCNP certification (Route/Switch) Minimum: CCNP Security Clearance: Minimum Active Secret to start. Top Secret w/SCI eligibility 10 or more years’ experience supporting an enterprise class production network BS in computer science or related field
Clearance Jobs

text:
Position Pupose/Summary
OPPORTUNITY TO JOIN THE INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY TEAM AS A
Cyber Security / Network Engineer
Benton PUD is looking for a Cyber Security/Network Engineer with a strong understanding of Cyber Security methodologies coupled with a knowledge of LAN/WAN network infrastructure design, troubleshooting, and implementation. This position is an exciting role that will utilize state-of-the-art networking and computing resources and will help shape and meet future infrastructure technology and security requirements. The work is diverse and challenging and the size of the organization allows for innovation, creativity, and focused training in a small, personal environment.
The preferred candidate will have experience with: Cyber Security policy development, Penetration Testing, Firewalls, VPN, Data Loss Prevention, IDS/IPS, Web-Proxy and Security Audits. Top candidates will be comfortable working with a variety of technologies, security problems and troubleshooting of the network.
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled
Accountabilities
The primary purpose of this position is to lead the District's LAN/WAN business and control system network infrastructure and cyber security program, to include: researching, troubleshooting, designing, documenting, and implementation of key network and computing resources; provide the enterprise security architecture for District technology and information systems, including web or cloud -based systems; safeguard systems from attack by unauthorized users and design systems and countermeasures to protect against security breaches; develop and carry out information security plans and policies.
Accountabilities and Essential Functions:
Support the District's mission to serve our customers and foster a positive workplace by personally choosing behavior aligned with our values and ethical code.
Monitor, audit, and execute security controls and tools to maintain network security by identifying potential security issues to include performing network security threat/impact assessments and scans, recommending security measures, installing and monitoring security devices, installing patches, and updates as needed; lead mitigations efforts to remediate discovered security deficiencies.
Manage the risk of security exposure or compromise with District systems by providing awareness training on information security standards, policies and best practices.
Participate on the Security Incident Response Team by following the approved Cyber Security Incident Response Plan, providing key network security analysis, documentation, evidence gathering, and remediation as needed.
Provide guidance and recommendations to ensure the security and resiliency of the District's IT Infrastructure and business systems by staying current with emerging trends in cyber security.
Ensure a reliable network infrastructure by promoting system changes to production environments and documenting current system configuration in accordance with the approved District Configuration Change Management process, monitoring infrastructure performance and availability, and troubleshooting and tuning programs.
Ensure a reliable and scalable network infrastructure by designing and maintaining a robust infrastructure including cabling, switches, routers, terminal servers, fiber optics, and other networking equipment.
Monitor performance of District network resources by establishing real-time and historical monitoring and reporting tools, setting up threshold-based notifications to alert key staff of potential service-impacting issues, and logging and interpreting network traffic and throughput for required analysis.
Ensure resiliency of secure network authentication and access by designing and implementing appropriate encrypted communication methods.
Ensure the District achieves and maintains mandated compliance with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), NERC CIP, and PCI-DSS by designing and implementing a comprehensive network security architecture and adhering to internal District security policies.
Complete special projects and other duties as assigned to meet team, department and organizational goals.
Minimum Qualifications, Experience and Certifications
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS/LICENSING OR CERTIFICATIONS:
BA/BS in Computer Science, Cyber Security or related area; OR a combination of an AA/AS with 2 additional years of directly related experience
Specific to Network/Cyber Security Engineer II - Three (3) to four (4) years experience in implementation theory and troubleshooting as a network/security engineer
Specific to Network/Cyber Security Engineer III - Five (5) to seven (7) years experience in design, implementation, theory and troubleshooting as a network/security engineer
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Security
Knowledge of server operating systems (Linux, Windows)
Working experience with security testing (DoS, XRSF, XXS, Brute Force)
Knowledge of SIEM application
Knowledge of Network Management Software and Monitoring Tools
Knowledge of Data Loss Prevention, Intrusion Detection and Intrusion Prevention
Knowledge of Automated security testing software
Knowledge of Forensic investigation and analysis
Network
Experience with network protocols (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, VLAN, TCP/IP, etc.)
Experience configuring, maintaining, designing, and deploying Cisco networking equipment including Sourcefire Next Generation Firewall, ISE
Experience in deploying and managing Firewalls, and troubleshooting VPN tunnels
Knowledge of server hardware, routing and switching equipment and interconnecting cabling
Knowledge of internet Protocols, firewalls, static IP addressing schemes, IPAM, DNS, DHCP
General
Strong problem-solving skills to effectively research, investigate and offer solutions to issues that are more complex and difficult in nature
Good verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate security-related concepts to a broad range of technical and non-technical staff to include leadership
Ability to stay current with technology and apply training and experience to real world problems
Highly motivated and independent strategist capable of creating and implementing comprehensive security policies
Attendance: Consistent need to attend work at the job site or work location. Frequent or constant need for punctuality.
Physical Effort: Most of the time is spent sitting in the same position or standing/walking, or there is some requirement to lift or handle material or equipment of moderate weight (8 - 20 pounds, sometimes more).
Environment: Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.
Hazards: Most of the time is spent in general office or equivalent conditions.
Sensory Attention: Typically requires regular use of one or more senses of medium intensity and long duration.
Job Pressure/Deadline Orientation: Must meet reasonable deadlines, quotas or demands for accuracy and/or may be involved in some mildly unpleasant situations.

text:
Overview/ Job Responsibilities
The Mobility Network Engineer I will work in a Customs & Border Protection’s (CBP) Enterprise Network Architecture & Engineering support services contract (ENAESS) on client site in Springfield VA. The Mobility Network Engineer I must be familiar with Mobile Device Management (MDM) user support and issue resolution.
Should have working experience in supporting Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and MDM solutions at large scale Enterprise customers with proven delivery in supporting, maintaining, and troubleshooting “complex” Airwatch or equivalent MDM systems.
Job Responsibilities:
Working on a team consisting of Network Architects & Engineers supporting the CBP network, the Mobility Network Engineer I must have the ability to:
Resolve customer’s issues via the telephone, email or Webex session
Reproducing issues in-house and responding back in a timely manner.
Regular follow ups with customers with recommendations, updates and action plans.
Escalate issues in a timely manner according to Standard Operating Procedures.
Leverage internal technical expertise, including peers, mentors, knowledge base, community forums and other internal tools, to provide the most effective solutions to customer issues.
Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions.
Support, maintain and troubleshoot Airwatch systems
Support the design and implementation of complex MDM solutions
Address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues
Provide network administration support: firewalls, general network infrastructure and security fundamentals, VPN, DNS
Assist in the preparation of test reports
Follow and perform ITIL Incident, problem, and requirements management
Develop and implement test strategies and documents results
Provides documentation, guidance and training to end-users as needed
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Receive mentoring for MDM Airwatch solutions design and implementation by solutions architect
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s in Information Technology, Computer Science or related degree; Without a degree a H.S. Diploma required and 7-9 additional years of relevant work experience.
4 years’ work experience as a System Administrator – supporting, maintaining, and troubleshooting MDM systems AND Smart Devices (Apple, Android devices like tablet and smart phone, Windows iOS, etc.
Strong understanding of servers & configuration & maintenance: Windows Server 2008 / 2003 / 2013, Exchange, 0365, Azure AD, Active Directory, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache), Linux Forms (Ubuntu, Fedora, Red Hat, Photon, Open Suse), other mail systems, web certifications such as SSL and IIS
Strong knowledge of ITIL and Security Administration experience: Authentication, Certificate system, etc.
Technical Certifications or demonstrable experience in in one or more MDM Products (AirWatch, MobileIron, XenMobile, Symantec MDM, Good Tech)
MS-SQL, Mail Server – Added Advantage
Wireless hardware, networks and respective components
Client Server architecture
Experience with server configuration a plus: Windows Server 2008 / 2003, Linux Forms, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache)
Exchange 2010/2013/O365 or Google apps for business
Seeking candidate who can mentor, teach and grow a small team from within to support growing customer requirements
Must have great communication and documentation skill
Eligibility/Clearance Requirements: Must be able to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship with the ability to obtain a federal government clearance
Desired Qualifications
Microsoft Intune a plus
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st preference
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret or Secret - 2nd preference
DoD Secret or Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd preference (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated)

Founded in 2010, Sev1Tech provides IT, engineering, and program management solutions delivery. Sev1Tech focuses on providing program and IT support services to critical missions across Federal and Commercial Clients. Our Mission is to Build better companies. Enable better government. Protect our nation. Build better humans across the country.
Join the Sev1Tech family where you can achieve great accomplishments while fostering a satisfying and rewarding career progression. Please apply directly through the website at: #joinSev1tech

name: Network Engineer II
summary: Network Engineer II is responsible for complex and diverse network platforms/topologies within a ne...
text:
Network Engineer II is responsible for complex and diverse network platforms/topologies within a network management center or organization. The candidate provides technical support by analyzing hardware and/or software data, identifying the root cause of the problem and developing/implementing hardware and/or software solutions. Candidate will be responsible for design, integration, operation and management of complex enterprise networks, linking a variety of platforms, operating systems, network topologies and network protocols. Candidate makes recommendations related to network architecture, evaluation of hardware and software products and problem resolution. Bachelors Degree in Engineering or other related field or equivalent experience. 5-8 years of related work experience. Must be eligible to work in the US.
10 hr. shifts, 4 days a week, Sun-Wed or Wed-Sat.
Participates and leads configurations, implementation, and support of all network systems
Participates in a collaborative efforts to manage and resolve complex network problems and coordinates resolution
Participates in incident management, asset management, change management, project management, and continuous improvement of network environment.
Manages, configures, and implements routers, switches, firewalls, wireless, and other network systems and services.
Develops wireless network infrastructures and makes recommendation on systems enhancements for optimization.
Managing assigned projects and program components to deliver services in accordance with established objectives.
Maintain network security through proper configuration of VPN tunnels and Firewall rules
Be aware of and follow existing network management change procedures
Work outside of normal business hours when required (scheduled maintenance, outage response, last minute urgent requests)
Create and/or update network documentation in various systems per established process and standards.
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
5+ years of progressive experience in the installation, operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of wired and wireless networks.
Professional level understanding of wireless networking including IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi Standards, Controller based Wi-Fi systems, Client to Network Authentication mechanisms (EAP/TLS, PEAP, etc.), RADIUS, DHCP, DNS, Internet VPNs (IPSEC and SSL)
Possess knowledge of TCP/IP V4 layer 2 switching and layer 3 routing including failover and redundancy configuration (VRRP/ HSRP)
Knowledge and/or experience with Clearpass and Airwave appliances, Aruba Wireless controller technologies and wireless access points.
Knowledge of VoIP implementation and support (SIP based call routing, IVRU, Text to Speech) helpful
Technical, analytical and interpersonal skills required .
Self-motivation and the ability to work with little supervision.
Ability to manage several concurrent tasks and priorities.
Previous Retail Store network deployments.
Knowledge of new technologies (SD-Wan, Cloud based solutions, virtualization.

text:
Business Group Highlights
Intelligence
The Intelligence group provides high-end systems engineering and integration products and services, data analytics and software development to national and military intelligence customers. Serving federal agencies and the Intelligence Community for more than 50 years, the Intelligence group helps our clients meet their mission needs by providing trusted advisors, leading-edge technologies, and innovative solutions.
Responsibilities
Perspecta, provides high-end Systems Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) support to government clients.We are currently seeking a SeniorSystemsEngineer with a Networking and Telecommunications background to providetechnical leadership and supportfora program that delivers a broad range of engineering and scientific services to a national level customer.The Program provides cradle-to-grave engineering support for the definition, design, development, integration, verification, fielding, and eventual termination/disposal of the system and system components.Perspecta is looking for team memberswith the depth and breadth to answer complex technical questions across the program.
The candidate will oversee the engineering activities of component system and software developers, verify the capabilities and interfaces of their developed products, integrate the components into a system, support system test and deployment activities, and perform tier-2 support for fielded systems.Thecandidate will interface with clients and other contractors.Communicationis key to success in this position. Background in the following Systems Engineering areas is key to success:
Participate in the design and definition of system functionality and component interfaces
Develop system solutions by studying information needs, conferring with users, studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes, investigating problem areas, and following the system development life-cycle
Work with contractor development teams on requirements definition, development, standards, and testing
Interact with clients on technical matters, often requiring coordinated activity across organization lines
Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, and charts
Troubleshoot system problems
Qualifications
Requires Bachelors degree (in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Math, or related field) or equivalent, and twelve to fifteen years of related experience, advanced degree a plus.
Requires 12 to 15 years with BS/BA or 10 to 13 years with MS/MA or 7 to 9 years with Ph.D.
The successful candidate will have a demonstrated ability to analyze and assess a problem, decompose complex issues, and develop solutions and strategies to operational scenarios. Additional qualifications include:
Background in Networking and Telecommunications
Working knowledge of systems engineering principles and processes
Experience with various development approaches, e.g., agile programming, crowd sourcing, waterfall, etc.
Applied knowledge of the systems development life cycle, including requirements analysis, documentation development, control gates, and system verification
Ability to work within and across multi-discipline teams to ensure interfaces are thoroughly defined, properly designed, and correctly implemented
Familiarity with IC organizations and experience working across multiple organizations within the IC
Excellent communication skills
About Perspecta
What matters to our nation, is what matters to us. At Perspecta, everything we do, from conducting innovative research to cultivating strong relationships, supports one imperative: ensuring that your work succeeds. Our company was formed to bring a broad array of capabilities to all parts of the public sectorfrom investigative services and IT strategy to systems work and next-generation engineering.
Our promise is simple: never stop solving our nations most complex challenges. And with a workforce of approximately 14,000, more than 48 percent of which is cleared, we have been trusted to do just that, as a partner of choice across the entire sector.
Perspecta is anAA/EEOEmployer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories.
As a government contractor, Perspecta abides by the following provision
Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of the other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractors legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c).

text:
Network Engineer
Job ID R0063317 Publicatiedatum 17/05/2019 Lieu: Singapore, Singapore
Full time, Contract voor onbepaalde tijd
Location: Singapore, Singapore
Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.
Thales in Singapore has been present since 1973, providing state-of-the-art solutions for customers in the aerospace, defence, security and transportation markets. Today, Thales in Singapore employs over 600 people and is home to all regional avionics services, a ground transportation integration centre, and regional innovation hub.
Main Tasks & Responsibilities:
Design, specify & costing of detailed Network solution, including
Interpreting customer requirement and producing fully detailed & compliant design.
Interfacing with customer engineer for design definition.
Interfacing with other system-wide designers for service definition.
Interfacing with suppliers and vendors for product definition.
Evaluating and costing of the most suitable products and system.
During site implementation, testing & commissioning the Network
Leading the commissioning activities on site, as well as producing the commissioning documentation
Providing support to the installation and maintenance works.
Keep track of progress of all design & interface tasks
Carrying out all assigned work efficiently, with a minimum of supervision,
Expediting response and deliverables (documents & including engineering drawings, specifications, design reports and calculations, equipment details and other project information).
Requirements:
Diploma or Degree in Electrical / Electronic / Telecommunications Engineering
Cisco Certified Networking Associate (CCNA), Cisco Certified Networking Professional (CCNP), Cisco Certified Design Associate (CCDA) is an advantage
More than 5 years of experience in designing and implementing telecommunications networks
Development and deployment of Fixed Communication networks (Gigabit Ethernet, SDH, IP/MPLS, etc.)
Development and deployment of Radio-communication Systems in various technologies (TETRA, WiFi )
IT Systems (servers, high availability IT architectures and clustering, databases, SAN storage, NAS, etc.)
Specific knowledge for Communication System - Closed-Circuit Television (CCTV), Passenger Information Display System (PIDS),Passenger Announcement System (PAS), Radio Communication System (RCS) etc.
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

One of our clients, a global tech company is looking for a Network Engineer.
Duties:

Ensure consistent customer satisfaction.
Document all communication with customers in the CRM
Notify/Discuss with L2 /TL/Manager on Tickets that require assistance.
Timely handoff (escalation) of cases that require technical or political to L2/L3 TAC.
Plan and constantly work on upgrading tech and product expertise.
Contribute to the knowledge base/ Tech Forum.
Ensure to gain Certified Expertise (Certifications) to provide better service.

Networking Concepts like OSI model, TCP/IP,(Logical Link Control, Flow Control, Link Negotiation) (IP, ARP, ICMP, TCP, UDP, SNMP, TFTP, FTP, BootP)
Ethernet Concepts and Cablings.
Bridging and Switching Concepts, LAN Technologies such as Ethernet - CSMA/CD
STP, RSTP, MSTP, VLAN tagging
Good Knowledge in Routing concepts, with Good knowledge in Routing Protocols like: RIP, OSPF, IGRP, EIGRP, BGP
Basic Wireless Knowledge 802.11a/b/g, Access Points, controllers
Server Concepts and working knowledge in DHCP, DNS, Radius, SNMP, web server etc.
Competencies:
Customer focused
Proactive, with the ability to work on his/her own initiative
Willingness to learn
Excellent communication skills in English
Good Team player
Debugging hardware & software system level problems in a multi-vendor multi-protocol network environment.
Bachelor’s degree or related experience is required. Microsoft MCSE and/or CISCO certifications are considered a plus.

text:
Support our entire enterprise and build the networks, staff the teams, and develop the processes that will keep us defining whats possible. We have opportunities across our enterprise with 90,000 team members throughout the world. The only limit to your growth is your ambition and drive. We want to empower you to bring your best, with resources, support, and talented team members that will launch your career. Northrop Grumman Enterprise Services is seeking a well-qualified Network Engineer to join its dynamic team of technical professionals in the Chandler, AZ area. Roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Maintains smooth operation of LAN/WAN/VPNs. Plans, designs, configures, and installs network hardware in support of customer requirements. Maintains technical expertise in all areas of networks and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, multiplexers, firewalls, switches, gateways, etc. Proposes solutions to management to ensure all communications requirements based on future needs and current usage, configuring such solutions to optimize cost savings. Creates and ensures that appropriate network documentation exists, including operational instructions. Provides regular monitoring and network analysis regarding short- and long-range planning for in-house systems. Perform troubleshooting analysis of network infrastructure and associated systems. Install and configure Cisco routers, switches and firewalls. Implement and troubleshoot LAN technologies such as VLANs, Trunking (port tagging), Spanning-Tree, and Port Security. Provide third-level support and troubleshooting of network problems. Periodically provide after-hours and weekend support. Implement and troubleshoot WAN technologies such as EIGRP, BGP, OSPF, and telco circuits (T1, T3, OC3) Interface regularly with customers and manage customer installation timelines and deliverables tBasic Qualifications: Associate's degree and 7 years of experience OR Bachelors degree and 5 years of related experience OR Master's degree and 3 years of experience; 9 years of experience may be considered in lieu of degree Active Secret Clearance Current Security + CE or ability to obtain within 6 months of hire Ability to be cleared to special access programs Experience designing and maintaining LAN & WAN based networks Experience with managing routing protocols on large LAN environments Experience with Cisco hardware including routers, switches, and firewalls Preferred Qualifications: Bachelors or Masters degree in IS related field Active Top Secret clearance Cisco CCNA, CCNP, CCIE Previous experience troubleshooting network procedures and best practices; experience with network challenges associated with systems integration, including COTS integration, capacity analysis and system architecture design Demonstrated strong leadership skills and has effectively managed small teams Demonstrated experience in the use of network analysis tools (i.e. WireShark, Opnet, etc.) Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.
