text:
Summary
** This is an internal posting for current Skagit County Employees. **
The Skagit County Network Group, which is a division of Skagit County Information Services, is responsible for the network perimeter, network access and associated security, including but not limited to; network design and implementation, Internet Protocol (IP) scheme and management, backbone, distribution, data center and edge switching, routing, perimeter and data center firewalls, network Intrusion Detection System (IDS)/Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), Secure Demilitarized Zones (DMZ), web proxy content filtering, perimeter anti-virus/anti-malware, network access control, wireless access and wireless security, remote access Virtual Private Network (VPN), the physical network layer to include both copper and fiber infrastructure including horizontal cabling, fiber and copper patch cables, patch panels, Light Interface Units (LIU), all data circuits as required for network connectivity and network supporting systems such as Network Time Protocol (NTP) systems, syslog, Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) systems and network management systems.
In addition to the above, this position may also be assigned responsibilities for other systems as needed that may not be directly related to network support.
Essential Functions
Provide Tier 2 and 3 on-site and remote network support/troubleshooting for County departments or other customers.
Prepare, plan, design, implement, operate, and optimize network switching, perimeter firewalls, data center firewalls, VPN systems and other related technology.
Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations of all network related systems.
Monitor network performance and system confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
Network design and architecture for new and existing infrastructure.
IP scheme design and management.
Design, install, and maintain copper and fiber telecommunications cabling, security system cabling, audio and video cabling, and other low-voltage infrastructure as required adhering to published standards and best practices.
Install, terminate, test, label and document horizontal, backbone and other cables
Dress and route cable into telecommunications closets, modular furniture and other work area outlets.
Build out telecommunication and equipment rooms.
Test, troubleshoot, and document test results for cabling.
Activation/Deactivation of network jacks to support moves/add/changes
Installation of server racks, communication racks, cable management systems and raceways, servers, switches, firewalls and other gear.
Implements, installs, and supports network supporting UPS systems.
Design, install, and maintain proper electrical bonding in data centers and network closets.
Coordinate installation of network infrastructure with facilities and other Information Services teams and providing documentation and training on new systems and installations.
Travel for training and/or other County purposes.
Provides extended or off shift support during critical processing or failed systems.
Demonstrate a customer service orientation.
Works with Information Services and customer teams to design and implement new systems where those systems relate to Skagit County's network business needs.
Supervisory:
This position has no supervisory responsibility
OTHER JOB FUNCTIONS:
May be tasked with performing related duties. Related duties as required are duties that may not be specifically listed in the position description, but are within the general occupational series and responsibility level typically associated with the employee's classification of work.
Minimum Qualifications
Strong understanding of TCP/IP networks
Experience with Cisco switching, routing, firewalls
Cisco Identity Service Engine and related technology is a plus
Experience with network cabling and associated systems
Experience with security systems, video surveillance systems, UPS systems
Comfortable working with Windows and Linux
Comfortable working in both command line and Graphical User Interfaces (GUI)
Ability to work on ladders, in lifts, confined spaces and in outdoor elements as required
Highly focused and detail oriented
Network Engineer I
Entry Level engineer position requires at least one (1) year experience with a Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification or demonstrate equivalent knowledge. Must have the ability to troubleshoot and resolve network connectivity, configure and deploy switches, firewalls and other network devices based on pre-configured templates and at the direction of a senior engineer.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted which provides the skills, knowledge and abilities to perform the essential functions of the position.
Requires knowledge of:
TCP/IP
Cyber-Security specifically related to the network perimeter and network access
Cisco Network technologies
Microsoft Windows operating systems
Linux operating systems
Low-voltage infrastructure
Fiber infrastructure
ANSI, EIA, TIA standards
Servers, workstations, printers
Typing skills, basic power tools and hand tools
Requires the ability to:
Troubleshoot and resolve problems
Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Work independently within department objectives
Use specialized test and performance equipment including multi-meters, cable testers, protocol analyzers, for troubleshooting cabling problems and validating conformance to industry standards
Problem solve under pressure when there are different agencies, vendors and employees involved
Plan, organize work, assign and check the work of and/or assist and instruct others
Do research both occupational and Internet based
Continue training, expand skills and learn new technology as business requirements dictate
Be focused and be detail oriented
Maintain a professional and respectful demeanor
Maintain a high level of integrity
Work on ladders, in lifts, and in confined spaces such as closets, attics, and crawl spaces
Document your work and provide status updates as required
Licenses and/or Certifications:
Valid Washington State driver's license required
CCNA, CCNP, CCIE certifications desired
Electrical energy system (06) desired
Special Clearances:
Employee is required to pass a state of residency fingerprint background check to be completed within 30 days of employment with Skagit County.
Supplemental Information
WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Requiring extended periods of sitting, bending, operating a monitor requiring manual finger dexterity, traveling, climbing ladders, working in lifts, working in confined spaces such as closets, attics, crawl spaces, under desks, and some lifting up to 60 pounds. Some work is performed outside in various weather conditions on uneven terrain.
Hazards:
Those present in a normal office environment. Exposure to chemicals routinely encountered in computer repair and soldering, dust and dirt, possible technological equipment failure resulting in electric shock and/or noxious fumes, dangerous electrical voltages, exposure to criminal elements in correctional facilities, chemicals found in custodial closets, working extended periods of time in computer room environment, telephone wiring closets, boiler rooms, or outdoor areas such as roofs and traveling as needed.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Skagit County, as an equal employment opportunity employer, encourages applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply.
It is the policy of Skagit County to follow all federal and state laws to ensure non-discrimination in its employment practices.
The statements contained herein reflect general details as necessary to describe the essential functions of this position, the level of knowledge and skill typically required, and the scope of responsibility, but should not be considered an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. Individuals may perform other duties as assigned, including work in other functional areas to cover absences or relief, to equalize peak work periods, or otherwise to balance the workload. Changes to the position description may be made at the discretion of the employer.

text:
POLITICO s mission from the very beginning was to win the audience. We dedicate ourselves to providing accurate, non-partisan, impactful information to the right people at the right time so that they can act with confidence and speed. We experiment to avoid being disrupted and we have fun disrupting others. And we are not afraid to risk failure if it means being the best at what we do.
POLITICO is looking for a Cloud Network Engineer with dedication and drive to implement positive change. You will be responsible for supporting existing highly-available infrastructure in a multi-site environment while recommending and implementing strategic cloud migrations and learning new technologies. In this position, you will work hand in hand with DevOps and systems engineering resources and will be a valued technical support partner in AWS. You will be the subject matter expert for networking configuration and design and a mentor to junior team-members in efficient and effective problem management. You will work to increase the baseline of support and redefine quality service to support this fast-paced and growing organization. This position is uniquely defined to allow for creative problem solving, implementation of new technologies, and drive strategy. As the organization grows, you will have the opportunity to learn new technologies and expand your expertise through hands-on project support.
What You ll Do:
Maintain and support a multi-site Hybrid environment while working with various teams across Technology to simplify and improve performance
Develop and recommend network strategy and new technology solutions that support an expanding environment with multi-organizational flexibility
Produce, maintain and test a runbook and documentation on configuration, problem management and troubleshooting
Directly interface with employees in the pursuit of resolving advanced problems
Perform regularly scheduled firmware upgrades and maintenance, and implement security remediations
Successfully meet compliance standards and pass recurring audits through configuration management
Respond promptly to system outages and interface with other business units and vendors as needed
Contribute to planning efforts relating to business continuity and disaster recovery
Identify inefficiencies and determine solutions
Perform ad hoc responsibilities as needed
How You're Measured:
Accuracy of work and support of team
Ability to work proactively as part of a team as well as independently
Ability to recommend and implement strategic plans
Meet established deadlines
Meet compliance standards and maintain accurate configuration management
Accurately and efficiently respond to service-impacting incidents and recommend problem resolution
What You ll Need:
Bachelor s degree in technical discipline with 3 to 5 years of enterprise experience or a combination of education and 5 to 7 years of enterprise experience
3 to 5 years of vendor-agnostic networking experience in a multi-site Hybrid environment
Demonstrated knowledge and experience of cross connectivity between physical sites and AWS/Azure
Strong knowledge of network segmentation, tunneling, and role-based permissions
1 to 3 years of SAML/Federation experience preferably with Office 365/Azure Active Directory
1 to 3 years of experience in Windows Server and enterprise systems support
1 to 3 years of experience in direct user/customer support and ticket triage
Certified AWS Solutions Architect/Associate or 3 to 5 years of experience in the design, migration, and support of AWS network infrastructure with the desire to obtain certification
Knowledge of SANS storage devices and Hyper-V environments a plus
Past experience in replacement of full stack network infrastructure and Hybrid client VPN configurations
Functional competency in Linux preferred
Certification or knowledge in Cybersecurity strongly desired
ITIL Foundation level knowledge or certification desired
Ability to excel in a fast moving, high visibility environment working with new technologies and facing new challenges daily
We are driven by our values. We are relentless contributors, disruptors, collaborators, and talent cultivators. Our culture is defined by grit, total integrity, and a prioritization on innovation.
We value our people. We offer a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package, including health and wellness benefits, commuter benefits, retirement plans, as well as work-life balance flexibility and opportunities for career development.
Let s keep in touch. Follow us on , and at @politicocareers and #meetPOLITICO for a deep dive into what makes us POLITICOs and our adventures. We d love to hear from you!

summary:
WHAT DO NETWORK ENGINEERS DO?
Also known as computer network architects, network engineers work wit...
tasks: Analytical Skills: Network engineers have to look at complicated network systems to find flaws or room for improvement.,Attention to Detail: Network engineers have to create complex blueprints for communication networks, and must make sure the systems will work together.,Leadership Skills: Network engineers may be a leader of other engineers to create the network.,Organizational Skills: Sometimes many different networks come together at once. Keeping them all organized will take skill.
text:
WHAT DO NETWORK ENGINEERS DO?
Also known as computer network architects, network engineers work with a company's computer network, using information technology to make network systems for all employees to use. These data networks can include local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), intranets and extranets. Network complexity can vary depending on the organization, and the company may have one dedicated engineer or many globally connected engineers working together with the Chief Technology Officer.
Network engineers must have skills to analyze where communications are going to be needed, create plans for the network, present it to senior management, be up-to-date on the latest technology, understand and determine the hardware and wiring needs for buildings, and make sure Mike in Accounting doesn't accidentally forward his Star Wars fan fiction to all staff.
HOW MUCH DO NETWORK ENGINEERS MAKE?
According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) a Robert Half Technology survey estimated that network architects made between $85,000 and $117,750 a year.
WHAT ARE THE EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS?
You must at least have a bachelor's degree in a computer related field, such as programming, computer science, engineering or similar, and many employers prefer applicants to have an MBA in information systems. Employers also look for experience in the field, either working with IT systems or in network administration.
JOB SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS
Analytical Skills: Network engineers have to look at complicated network systems to find flaws or room for improvement.
Attention to Detail: Network engineers have to create complex blueprints for communication networks, and must make sure the systems will work together.
Leadership Skills: Network engineers may be a leader of other engineers to create the network.
Organizational Skills: Sometimes many different networks come together at once. Keeping them all organized will take skill.
Teamwork: Larger firms have many employees and many engineers working together.
THE FUTURE OF NETWORK ENGINEERS
According to the BLS, network engineer jobs will decline between 2010 and 2020, as the rise in cloud computing will create less demand for in-house networks.

text:
Network engineer
Job ID R0070381 Publicatiedatum 22/07/2019 Lieu: Hengelo, Overijssel, Netherlands
Full time, Contract voor onbepaalde tijd
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our achitects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
About us
With 80.000 talents working in 68 countries, we are one of the biggest high-tech employers in the field of safety and security. In the Netherlands, where 2000 employees are based, we are located in four cities: Huizen, Delft, Eindhoven and Hengelo (HQ). Together with an extensive ecosystem of knowledge partners, customers and suppliers, we work on radars for naval vessels, cyber security solutions, transportation systems, communication equipment for land forces, cryogenic cooling solutions and research & development for radar tech (in collaboration with TU Delft).
Within the Engineering cluster the Applications department is responsible for the development of combat and information management systems for navy ships, integration with sensor- and weapon systems as well as the development of sensor processing applications. These complex systems contain advanced solutions for information processing, information management and the user interaction with both sensor- and weapon systems. Our product offers essential support for missions varying from anti-piracy to ballistic missile defense.
For the applications engineering platform team Thales is looking for a talented
Network Engineer
About the job
As a Network engineer you will design, develop and test the network capabilities for the combat management systems, the radar systems and the optical sensor systems. The platform team is responsible for the entire development chain – requirements analysis, development, testing, validation and demonstrating the current status of the product.
Thales highly values the application of modern technologies and methodologies.
About you
Do you have a passion for technology, do you enjoy constantly developing your skills and are you interested in working on highly complex network environments? Then you are the person we are looking for.
You are a talented engineer that enjoys specifying, developing and testing IT infrastructure components. The infrastructure is part of the sensor and information management systems aboard navy ships. Relevant products and technologies include Cisco, Linux & Python. An expert level understanding of networking equipment by several vendors is important for successfully fulfilling the role. Knowledge of configuration management tooling (e.g. Ansible) and additional programming languages (e.g. C, C++) is preferred.
You hold an bachelor or master degree in computer science, IT service management, system & network engineering or comparable. Your colleagues are recognized experts in the field and will help you get up to speed and Thales will gladly invest in your development.
An important requirement to fulfil this role is flexibility and the ability to communicate efficiently in English to all types (technical, management) of stakeholders.
Thales offers
An interesting job within a nice team in an international high-tech environment;
Room for and attention to personal development and personal initiative;
The opportunity to grow within the organization, for instance on a technical, managerial, commercial or international level;
An open and flexible work environment where a good work-life balance is considered important;
A pleasant workplace in "the best building in the Netherlands" (Public’s Choice Award, 2015) with our own Starbucks corner;
Excellent work conditions, with 40 holidays a year, among other benefits.
Interested?
Would you like to apply directly? Then click on the button ‘Apply now’ to show your interest.
An assessment could possibly be part of the procedure.
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

text:
Job Description:
GBH enriches people's lives through programs and services that educate, inspire, and entertain, fostering citizenship and culture, the joy of learning, and the power of diverse perspectives.
DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW
The Network Engineer has overall responsibility for supporting the implementation, operation, and testing of WAN, LAN, Wireless LAN, VPN, and VoIP networks for the enterprise. WGBH is a mixed platform environment including: Macintosh, Windows, Sun Solaris, Linux and others. We primarily use Cisco networking gear.
Information Technology supports a diverse community of GBH’ers working in Broadcasting, Content Creation, Education, Digital, Assistive Technologies, Local News and Administrative roles. Roughly 40 staff work in 6 teams within the Department and the team is committed to creative problem solving and respectful candor. We like to build, improve, launch, automate and repair.
JOB OVERVIEW
The Network Engineer has overall responsibility for supporting the implementation, operation, and testing of WAN, LAN, Wireless LAN, VPN, and VoIP networks for the enterprise. WGBH is a mixed platform environment including: Macintosh, Windows, Sun Solaris, Linux, Cisco IOS and others. We primarily use Cisco networking gear.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Effectively identify and resolve issues across all networks; server as a focal-point for customer-servicing for infrastructure related issues.
Analysis, testing, documentation, troubleshooting, installation, implementation, configuration and support of data networking technologies, generally Cisco IP routers and Ethernet switches.
Review deployment plans for new networks or changes to the networks.
Provide installation, configuration and acceptance testing for a Cisco-based data network infrastructure Layer 2 and Layer 3.
Provide 24x7 On-Call support on a rotational basis.
SKILL SET
Strong ability to identify, determine and document customer requirements.
Solid written and verbal communication proficiencies
Professional Certifications preferred. Cisco certification preferred.
Solid understanding of IP addressing, 802.1x Network Access Control, Subnetting, and VLANs.
IP Routing: EIGRP, BGP, iBGP
Protocols: TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, SNMP, Radius, Netflow
Bridging/switching Protocols: Spanning Tree Protocol (STP, PVST+)
Strong understanding of QoS, routing protocol redistribution, route filtering and ACLs
WAN: IPSEC and SSL VPNs, Frame Relay, MPLS, Ethernet
Physical Layer: 10/100/1000BaseT, UTP/STP, AUI, Transceiver, Converter, Multi-mode/Single-mode fiber, CSU/DSU, MUX/IMUX
Hardware: Cisco Nexus 9000, 6800, 4500, 3800, and others
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Five (5) plus years network and communications engineering experience, including experience installing, configuring and testing Cisco Layer 2 and Layer 3 network devices in an enterprise multi-site environment..
Bachelor's degree/work in engineering, math, computer science, information technology, systems engineering, or science preferred.
Solid understanding of IP addressing, 802.1x Network Access Control, Subnetting, and VLANs.
IP Routing: EIGRP, BGP, iBGP
Protocols: TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, SNMP, Radius, Netflow
Bridging/switching Protocols: Spanning Tree Protocol (STP, PVST+)
Strong understanding of QoS, routing protocol redistribution, route filtering and ACLs
WAN: IPSEC and SSL VPNs, Frame Relay, MPLS, Ethernet
Physical Layer: 10/100/1000BaseT, UTP/STP, AUI, Transceiver, Converter, Multi-mode/Single-mode fiber, CSU/DSU, MUX/IMUX
Hardware: Cisco Nexus 9000, 6800, 4500, 3800, and others
JOB SPECIFICS
Staff Position
GBH is an equal opportunity employer. The community and audience we serve is diverse, and we wish to foster that diversity in our workplace. Toward that end, GBH does not discriminate against individuals in hiring, employment or promotion on the basis of race, religion, color, sex/gender, gender identity and gender expression, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship, handicap or disability, veteran or military status, political belief, pregnancy, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

summary: NexGen Data Systems is seeking a Senior Network Engineer with experience engineering and administer...

text:
NexGen Data Systems is seeking a Senior Network Engineer with experience engineering and administering complex worldwide WAN and LAN environments supporting networks running a variety of different routing and encryption protocols (BGP, OSPF, LISP, GetVPN, IPSec). The candidate will be expected to have a detailed understanding of large-scale WAN concepts and associated technologies (i.e. QoS, monitoring, security, network automation) as they relate to providing a secure, reliable, fault-tolerant network supporting a large health provider. The candidate will join a team of Senior Network Engineers and work in a collaborative multi-functional team environment.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Research and design complex network solutions to provide creative network solutions.
Provide Tier 3 support in the troubleshooting of complex network and routing issues and, if needed, perform analysis to identify root cause of any performance issues and take appropriate corrective action to resolve issues.
Perform security hardening and work with IA/C&A teams to conduct security scans/audits.
Work with deployment and sustainment teams to ensure feasibility of deployment and operation of network designs.
Work with senior leadership to communicate network designs and solutions clearly and effectively.
Evaluate, design, and test new cloud-based systems and solutions sets.
Other duties as assigned.
Requirements
Desired/Required Skills:
7+ years of experience working with WAN technologies such as BGP, MPLS, or LISP is required.
4+ years of experience with LAN technologies such as QoS, OSPF, or Spanning Tree.
3+ years of experience with encryption transport protocols such as IPSec, GetVPN, or DMVPN.
4+ years of experience in the documentation and diagramming of complex network environments is required.
2+ years of experience in the evaluation network equipment against a set of requirements.
Virtualization experience using VMware and other virtualiztion technologies.
8570.01m compliance (IAT level I) is required and must be obtained prior to start date or within 60 days (Minimum CCNA)
Experience in the DoD STIG security requirements is desired.
Experience with Ixia Breakingpoint appliance for performance testing is desired.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work cooperatively in a multi-functional team environment (team player) is a must.
Benefits:
Company covers 100% of premiums for the employee’s medical, dental, and vision insurance and subsidizes premiums for spouse and dependents.
Company provides short and long term disability plans.
401(k) match up to 10% of the employee’s salary contributions to 401(K) plan.
Comprehensive training and development program.
10 paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) accrual level starts at 15 days annually.
NOTE: US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. In order to be qualified for this position, you must be able to obtain and maintain a United States Department of Defense (DoD) security clearance. We are unable to sponsor Visas at this time. NexGen Data Systems provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.
Company Description:
About the Company:
NexGen Data Systems is an emerging technologies focused company providing expert systems and network engineering solutions to the Department of Defense. NexGen Data Systems promotes a culture of knowledge and career advancement through continued learning, keeping our team current on the latest advances in systems and networking, and enabling our team to provide the best available solutions to our clients. www.ngds.com

text:
What You'll Do?
The Cloud Collaboration Cloud Engineering team is primarily responsible for the wide variety of services required to support multiple Cloud collaboration application micro-services in a DevOps model. As a Network Engineer you will work with distributed team of engineers who are responsible for maintaining and evolving the network as a service.
Other responsibilities include the following:
Responsible for projects, development, automation, and operations related to WebEx network and data center infrastructure.
Create and/or improve the tools that provide insight into availability and performance of our services
Create and deliver automation software required for improving the functionality, availability, and manageability of network systems, data center services, and OS delivery components
Solve problems related to mission critical services and implement automation to pro-actively detect and prevent their re-occurrences along with driving down time to resolution
Share in the creation of new designs and architectures for multi-region, multi-data center distributed systems
Collaborate with application engineering teams in solving business needs with our services
Partner with cross functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve incidents and customer cases.
Partake in on-call duties for provided services (including weekends)
Who you'll work with?
The Cloud Collaboration Cloud Engineering team is a dynamic group that is developing the next generation of cloud-based collaboration and mobile applications for Cisco. With a head start of 50 million users and nearly all Fortune 500 companies, this group leads the industry. Help change the way that people collaborate.
Who are you?
You are a talented Network Engineer with development experience or are a talented Developer with Network engineering experience, you have a passion for developing your technical expertise, diving deep into issues and uncovering and implementing the necessary actions that deliver systems and software stability. You will have a good background in, and understanding of software and opensource applications with a strong ability to troubleshoot interconnecting systems. Solid experience in coding Python or other languages with the ability to work closely with Application and Engineering teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues. The ideal candidate will be passionate about this role which involves deep knowledge of both the application and the product, and he/she will also believe that automation is key to operating large-scale systems.
Our minimum requirements for this role are as follows:
BS, CS, or equivalent plus 5+ years progressive experience in network engineering, development or telecommunications support environment.
Experience with Python
Expertise on latest Cisco hardware and operating systems (CRS, Nexus, IOS-XR, NX-OS)
IP internetworking and Routing & Switching.
Expert level internetworking troubleshooting in a large scale network environment.
WAN circuits and protocols (Ethernet, MPLS).
Dynamic IP Routing protocols (OSPF, ISIS, BGP, PIM Multicast).
Expertise in AS connectivity (eBGP, MPLS)
Requires strong interpersonal and organizational skills, including the ability to meet deadlines, work in a team environment, follow written policies and procedures, and maintain superior customer service at all times.
Must exercise a reasonable amount of independent judgment under a minimum of supervision.
Provide extraordinary service.
Other knowledge areas for this role are as follows:
High Availability protocols and Global Server Load Balancing technologies
Stateful firewalls, SSL, VPN
Virtualization technologies, both networking (VRF, VDC, Nexus1kv) and compute (VMware, Openstack)
Knowledge of network management, network availability and capacity planning.
Understanding of Software Development Life Cycle, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
Knowledge of Cisco ASA and or Firepower
"Cloud" (supporting IaaS) experience desirable
CCIE or equivalent is a plus.
Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.
Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
We Are Cisco
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Heres how we do it.
We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think were old (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but were also a software company. And a security company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do you cant put us in a box!
But Digital Transformation is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, we take bold steps, and we take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a commitment to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
So, you have colorful hair? Dont care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? Thats cool.

text:
Description
SAIC is looking for a Sr. Network Engineer to support the NASA NICS program at Goddard Space in Greenbelt, MD.
Â
A successful candidate will be part of a Network Engineering team responsible for the design of the LAN at NASAâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).Â GSFC has remote sites including Goddard during an amazing period in NASAâ€™s history.Â This network supports NASAâ€™s Artemis Program (which will return Americans to the moon) and the Mars Exploration Program among many, many others.Â
Job Responsibilities:
The candidate will lead activities related to NASA Corporate network total life-cycle support to include requirements gathering, designing, implementing, and maintaining.
Network Engineering support for a 3 layer campus architecture consisting of hundreds of both Juniper and Cisco switches and routers that provide LAN connectivity as well as VoIP, Collaboration, and wireless services.
Support Multi-protocol label switching (MPLS) network and zone architecture
Planning for the transition of GSFCâ€™s LAN into a Software-Defined Architecture utilizing Ciscoâ€™s DNAC Appliance and Identity Services Engine (ISE).
Detailed design and implementation of the transition of both new and existing Cisco routers and switches into the SDA fabric.Â
Qualifications
Required Education:
Bachelors and nine (9) years or more experience OR High School Diploma and 13 years of related experience.
4 years of related experience accepted in lieu of degree.
Required Skills:
The candidate must have excellent oral and written skills and be able to present technical information in formal presentations to both internal and external customers.Â Â
Candidate must have extensive experience with Cisco campus networks.Â
The candidate must have a concrete working knowledge of LAN network design, routed data protocols and hardware platforms.Â Â
Candidate must be a self-starter, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, able to develop technical guidance documents and multitasking between multiple ongoing projects to ensure customer requirements and timelines are met.
Clearance:
Must be able to obtain a Public Trust.
Â Desired Skills:Â Â Â Â
Aruba wireless experience
Fortigate firewall management
Experience with Cisco ISE and Cisco Software Defined Access (SDA).Â Â
Additional experience supporting large-scale networks in an enterprise environment is preferred.Â Â
Certifications / Training:
Advanced vendor certifications including: CCNA/CCNP/CCIE.
Travel (if any):
Overview
SAIC is a premier technology integrator solving our nation's most complex modernization and readiness challenges. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes high-end solutions in engineering, IT, and mission solutions. Using our expertise in existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions. We are 25,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has pro forma annual revenues of nearly $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For ongoing news, please visit our newsroom. For SAIC benefits information, see Working at SAIC. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

text:
Cyber Security Network Engineer (d/f/m)
Airbus Cybersecurity GmbH
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2019 it generated revenues of € 70.5 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world’s leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.
Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
As the European specialist in cyber security, the mission of Airbus’ CyberSecurity business is to protect governments, companies and critical infrastructures from cyber threats. Its trusted, high performance security products and services are able to detect, analyse and counter the most advanced cyber attacks.
We are looking for a Cybersecurity Network Engineer (d/f/m) to join the IT Security Team at Airbus CyberSecurity in Munich/Ottobrunn to design and review network architectures as well as their handover to operations.
Disabled applicants with equal qualifications will be given special consideration.
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:
Creation of design and specifications for network architectures
Evaluation, design, and definition of network zones
Design of routing and switching concepts
Support of projects like design and operation of security operation centers (SOCs), network infrastructures for industrial control systems and aerospace products.
You have the following skills and experience:
Studies of computer science, communications, electrical, or information engineering, B.Sc. or M.Sc., Ph.D. is a plus
Experience in the deployment and configuration of current and next generation firewalls
Experience with Cisco routers and switches
Very good English skills, fluent German is a plus
Willingness for occasional business trips.
Please apply online for this vacancy at our careers site (www. airbus.com) with your CV attached.
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
What we offer:
Flexible working time
Balance of work and family life
Interesting development opportunities and exciting perspectives
Extensive company training offers (eLearning and classroom trainings)
Challenging tasks on unique services and products
Pleasant working atmosphere in a professional and international working environment
An extensive range of social benefits, such as an attractive company pension scheme and numerous employee discounts (e.g. leasing-specials)
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

text:
Pomeroy is seeking multiple Network Engineers to support one of our clients in the Kansas City area. Required Skills Familiar with the CISCO ACI in deployments and operations. Also familiar with the use of ACI in the Azure cloud space. To provide the network connectivity from on prem to the cloud. Familiar with the implementation support and operation of F5 hardware running LTM, GTM, and AFM. This would include the building out virtual server configuration, configuring networking components, and configuration of the global load balancing in the GTM software Familiar with Cisco DNA Center, Cisco ISE, and Cisco Catalyst 9k hardware CCNA and CCNP Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field Knowledge and ability to perform advanced administration on multiple company standard network technologies or similar platforms such as Cisco enterprise LANWAN gear, F5 load balancing, Aruba wireless networking, and CheckpointPalo Alto security platforms Understands and considers business goals, corporate IT standards, department strategy, service level agreements, EVA's and budgetary implications. Understands and considers and applies standard concepts, best practices, and procedures related to LAN, WAN and wireless networks Knowledge of established configuration management, network architecture development and project methodologies Communicates effectively with all levels of employees, both technical and non-technical Monitors emerging trends and evolving technologies, evaluating and understanding the implications for inclusion in department strategy Takes the initiative to search for and identify alternative andor innovative solutions to architecture problems. Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget Responsibilities Providers and applies technical strategies in the design, configuration, and maintenance of LAN, WAN, and wireless networks to ensure the stability, integrity, and operational effectiveness and efficiency of network services. Participate in the design, purchase, installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links. Analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training where required. Participate in the design and configuration of internal andor external networks as required for assigned projects, assuring that requirements are met Translates businesscustomer requirements into network or process designs Assist in development, implement, and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget Conduct research on software and systems products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts Identifies innovative approaches to accomplish departmental goals while maintaining alignment and compliance with business goals, corporate IT standards, strategy, and SLAs. Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure network products and services Coordinates network technology and configuration activities to ensure integration and alignment with other IT technology, systems, applications, and environment Provides technical support and guidance (Level 3) in troubleshooting network performance issues. Researches problems that cannot be resolved by routine procedures. Creates troubleshooting procedures, designing resolution scripts, workflows or flowcharts. Ensures timely resolution of problems. Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information. Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistic and reports Participate in managing all network security solutions

text:
Company: Baker Hughes
Skills: IT - Networking & Telecom
Education: Bachelors/3-5 yr Degree
Location: Longmont, Colorado, United States
Job Requirements
At Baker Hughes, we are building a Talent Community of highly talented and motivated professionals for future job roles. If you match the described job role and are as excited as we are to have you on board in the future, please hit the apply button to be a part of our Talent Community.
As a member of our talent community, you will be amongst the first to get exclusive news about Baker Hughes, various cool projects we are working on, our employee success stories, and new job opportunities you may be interested in.
Would you like to be involved in designing innovative products?
Do you enjoy solving complex design challenges?
Join our cutting-edge Engineering team!
Baker Hughes Nexus Controls offers a plant-wide, holistic suite of machine condition monitoring and protection hardware, software and services that help achieve the highest level of asset reliability possible.
Partner with the best
As an HMI ( Human Machine Interface) Engineer, you will take ownership of the technical scope of projects from order through design and build of our systems to supporting commissioning. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet customer needs and help to bring energy to the world.
As HMI ( Human Machine Interface) Engineer you will be responsible for:
Designing and implementing Human Machine Interface (HMI) screens for turbine control retrofit, Balance of Plant (BOP) and HMI upgrade projects using a variety of HMI software packages
Providing technical support to software engineers in meeting customer needs on HMI applications and cyber asset requirements
Designing, implementing and supporting industrial communication networks for control system applications
Providing system design engineering as required to facilitate the ordering, engineering, installation (construction) design and commissioning of control systems and industrial networks
Supporting Engineering Services field personnel in the technical resolution of field problems
Providing assistance with quality assurance on projects
Work Experience
Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will:
Have a Bachelors' Degree in Engineering or Computer Science
Experience working with HMI Software
Additional Information:
The pay range for this role will be: Professional Band 2
You will be eligible to participate in the Baker Hughes Fullstream Short-Term incentive program applicable for the above position. The actual payout for your short-term incentive award will be based on company and individual performance and is contingent upon Baker Hughes achieving pre-determined financial results.
You will be eligible to participate in Company-sponsored benefit programs, including health & welfare programs and the Thrift Plan (401k). You will have a choice of coverage options that best suit your needs. Coverage options and contribution amounts are related to your benefit elections, base salary level, and specific requirements of each of these plans.
Work in a way that works for you
We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. In the Senior Director, Business Productivity Platforms Product Manager, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:
Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit in everything in and work when you are the most productive
Working with us
Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.
Working for you
Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:
Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits
*Please remember that joining the Talent Community is not an application for any specific job at Baker Hughes but to have the privilege of being considered for an opportunity that suits your profile on priority.

summary: Amazon’s EU Global Delivery Service team is looking for an enthusiastic and customer obsessed Trans...
text:
Amazon’s EU Global Delivery Service team is looking for an enthusiastic and customer obsessed Transportation Network Engineer to help us design and optimize our transportation network. The role will involve understanding the physical and virtual transportation processes, from our fulfillment centers on to our final mile carriers who deliver our packages to our customers. As part of the Network Design team you will combine business process knowledge, data expertise, and analysis skills to identify and drive programs within our transportation network. To be successful in the role, you need to be an excellent communicator with a strong analytical mindset, able to influence across business functions and manage stakeholders’ expectations effectively. You will work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment that requires you to be detail-oriented and comfortable in working with multiple business and technical teams. Development and execution of network design and optimization strategy to support cost reductions, increase delivery speed and improve delivery experience for Amazon customers. Continually optimize the network through evaluation of changes and driving network related projects. Development of necessary tools to enable optimal design of network Work closely with commercial, operational and technical stakeholders to drive the implementation of initiatives. Drive cross functional teams to deliver programs. Job Description
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is seeking qualified candidates for the role of ...
text:
Job Description
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is seeking qualified candidates for the role of the Senior Network Engineer who will have Wireless experience. This person will support the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) - Information Technology (IT) program. The Army Corps of Engineers - Information Technology (ACE-IT) provides secure enterprise-wide IT and information management support services to more than 37,000 USACE end users located throughout the Continental U.S. (CONUS) and outside the Continental U.S. (OCONUS). ACE-IT is the enterprise IT service delivery team for the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, supporting mission requirements using a site-specific support model aligned along the USACE Regional Business Centers.
ACE-IT provides direct on-site command and control, coordination, planning, and operations and maintenance support for routine and emergency IT services. Leidos is actively seeking personnel to support USACE headquarters locations in Washington, DC; Vicksburg, MS; Huntsville, AL; and Hillsboro, OR; across other USACE locations; and virtual positions.
In this role, you will provide expert level design solutions for the current corporate WAN system within ACE-IT taking into account availability, scalability, security and manageability as appropriate. You will also perform network engineering on a broad range of programs providing overall support for various business-critical networks. Some tasks involve the full system engineering life-cycle including requirements analysis, design, development, integration, test, and implementation. This role will be based in either Vicksburg, MS, Hillsboro, OR, or remotely.
Primary Responsibilities:
- Provide recommendations to Operations on what features to enable and how to use them.
- Provide Tier III support to Operations in support of the WAN service.
- Respond to problem (architecture and design level) tickets associated with WAN/LAN.
- Provide project-based engineering and on-going enhancement engineering support for WAN/IWAN, LAN, and WAN acceleration.
- Develop WAN/IWAN/SDN system analysis and design documents for ACE-IT corporate WAN architecture, specific projects, assessment of business process and design artifacts provided by project, program or service support staff
- Work with the other departments in designing, staging configuration, implementation and support as applicable.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and minimum 8 years of IT related experience, including Network Administration / Engineering. Additional years of relevant experience will be considered in lieu of Bachelor's degree.
Must hold current DOD 8570 IAT III Certification (i.e CISSP, CASP, or any other IAT III certifications)
Current or former Cisco certifications - CCNA, CCNP, CCDA, etc.
Proven understanding of wireless architecture and CISCO wireless technologies
Deep understanding of WLAN technologies, network management, and security, including IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac WLAN standards and industry best practices
Strong Wireless Network Troubleshooting and configuration skills
Experience with CISCO Switching: STP, RSTP, MST, LAN tuning / protection, VTP.
Experience with WAN and VPN Solutions, GET-VPN/GDOI, MPLS, DMVPN Phase1/2/3, IPsec, IPsec/GRE, iWAN and Performance Routing.
Experience with Riverbed WAN Acceleration, SSL.
Experience with Network Hardware Design and Configuration, Network Troubleshooting, and Network Performance Tuning.
Experience with Cisco WAN/LAN technologies - VLANs, Spanning Tree, MPLS tagging.
Knowledge of ITIL Change & Configuration Management.
US Citizenship and ability to obtain Interim Secret security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Customer Service Focused - the ability to deliver sustained high performance and high levels of customer satisfaction
Analytical thinker, Metrics Driven
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills to effectively translate and communicate complex technical information and risk to all levels of internal and external organizations
Strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking, excellent analytical ability
Team building, mentoring and coaching skills
Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing in a clear and concise manner
Work well under pressure with differing levels of Management
Ability to maintain confidential information and communications
Exposure to other network monitoring systems and IT Service Management
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Work, Excel, PowerPoint)
Experience with Multicast
Experience with Network Access Controls (NAC) 802.1x
Experience in Analysis of Alternatives (AoA) for new technologies
Familiarity with DNS/DHCP, IPAM (BlueCat), load balancers (F5), WAN Optimization (Riverbed), and Authentication Systems (Clearpass), SSL VPN.
Experience with enterprise network management tools such as HPNA, SolarWinds, Cisco Smartnet, LiveAction, Splunk, or similar technologies
VoIP implementation and Support
External Referral Bonus:
Eligible
Potential for Telework:
Yes

Secret
Travel:
Yes, 10% of the time

40

Day

Network Administration and Ops
Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.

name: Network Engineer
requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field and five years of experience in in network engineering that includes experience in all areas of network management, systems configuration, application development, setup, troubleshooting, planning, designing, implementation, VoIP support, project management, and end user support; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience.,Certification in at least one of the following with a specified period of time after hire: CCNA or equivalent.,Valid New Mexico driver's license or ability to obtain a valid New Mexico driver's license within 30 days of hire.,Plans, designs, coordinates, implements, evaluates, and modifies as necessary, network services and solutions; resolves network service problems; troubleshoots network problems and issues; assists in the planning for the acquisition, installation, operation and maintenance of network and internet hardware and software in support of the County strategic mission and goals.,Monitors network resources and devices to ensure proper and full functioning.,Assists users in accessing network resources; assists the helpdesk for tier 3 support; and provides training as needed or requested; schedules, coordinates, performs testing, and documents analysis and general maintenance of hardware and software on network resources.,Coordinates and works on scheduled projects; builds new infrastructure; adds new services to existing sites; manages VPN systems.,Serves as a network engineering resource for the IT department as well as for Sandoval County; documents and maintains the network infrastructure.,Designs and researches alternative configurations, devices, methods or network infrastructure changes that will impact Sandoval Counties network connectivity.
summary:
General Purpose
Under general direction, plans, designs, coordinates, evaluates, and maintains the ...
text:
General Purpose
Under general direction, plans, designs, coordinates, evaluates, and maintains the network infrastructure for Sandoval County; monitors network statistics; provides tier three engineering support to the IT department; and serves as general engineering resource on infrastructure issues when assessing new technology or requiring new services or access for users or vendors; leads a collaborative team for the County's information security reviews and monitoring; and performs other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Education and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field and five years of experience in in network engineering that includes experience in all areas of network management, systems configuration, application development, setup, troubleshooting, planning, designing, implementation, VoIP support, project management, and end user support; OR an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Required Licenses or Certifications:
Certification in at least one of the following with a specified period of time after hire: CCNA or equivalent.
Valid New Mexico driver's license or ability to obtain a valid New Mexico driver's license within 30 days of hire.
Essential Job Functions
Plans, designs, coordinates, implements, evaluates, and modifies as necessary, network services and solutions; resolves network service problems; troubleshoots network problems and issues; assists in the planning for the acquisition, installation, operation and maintenance of network and internet hardware and software in support of the County strategic mission and goals.
Monitors network resources and devices to ensure proper and full functioning.
Assists users in accessing network resources; assists the helpdesk for tier 3 support; and provides training as needed or requested; schedules, coordinates, performs testing, and documents analysis and general maintenance of hardware and software on network resources.
Coordinates and works on scheduled projects; builds new infrastructure; adds new services to existing sites; manages VPN systems.
Serves as a network engineering resource for the IT department as well as for Sandoval County; documents and maintains the network infrastructure.
Designs and researches alternative configurations, devices, methods or network infrastructure changes that will impact Sandoval Counties network connectivity.
SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED:
Position reports to the Director of Information Technology and does not exercise supervision over lower level staff. Position may provide supervision of personnel during project management for the IT department.

summary: Pomeroy is seeking multiple Network Engineers to support one of our clients in the Kansas City area...
text:
Pomeroy is seeking multiple Network Engineers to support one of our clients in the Kansas City area. Required Skills Familiar with the CISCO ACI in deployments and operations. Also familiar with the use of ACI in the Azure cloud space. To provide the network connectivity from on prem to the cloud. Familiar with the implementation support and operation of F5 hardware running LTM, GTM, and AFM. This would include the building out virtual server configuration, configuring networking components, and configuration of the global load balancing in the GTM software Familiar with Cisco DNA Center, Cisco ISE, and Cisco Catalyst 9k hardware CCNA and CCNP Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field Knowledge and ability to perform advanced administration on multiple company standard network technologies or similar platforms such as Cisco enterprise LANWAN gear, F5 load balancing, Aruba wireless networking, and CheckpointPalo Alto security platforms Understands and considers business goals, corporate IT standards, department strategy, service level agreements, EVA's and budgetary implications. Understands and considers and applies standard concepts, best practices, and procedures related to LAN, WAN and wireless networks Knowledge of established configuration management, network architecture development and project methodologies Communicates effectively with all levels of employees, both technical and non-technical Monitors emerging trends and evolving technologies, evaluating and understanding the implications for inclusion in department strategy Takes the initiative to search for and identify alternative andor innovative solutions to architecture problems. Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget Responsibilities Providers and applies technical strategies in the design, configuration, and maintenance of LAN, WAN, and wireless networks to ensure the stability, integrity, and operational effectiveness and efficiency of network services. Participate in the design, purchase, installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links. Analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training where required. Participate in the design and configuration of internal andor external networks as required for assigned projects, assuring that requirements are met Translates businesscustomer requirements into network or process designs Assist in development, implement, and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget Conduct research on software and systems products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts Identifies innovative approaches to accomplish departmental goals while maintaining alignment and compliance with business goals, corporate IT standards, strategy, and SLAs. Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure network products and services Coordinates network technology and configuration activities to ensure integration and alignment with other IT technology, systems, applications, and environment Provides technical support and guidance (Level 3) in troubleshooting network performance issues. Researches problems that cannot be resolved by routine procedures. Creates troubleshooting procedures, designing resolution scripts, workflows or flowcharts. Ensures timely resolution of problems. Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information. Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistic and reports Participate in managing all network security solutions

title: Network Engineer

name: Staff Network Engineer (REF14851B)
summary: As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world throug...
text:
As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company’s dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You’re an Individual. We’re the team for you. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.
POSITION SUMMARY
The global network operations team provides 2nd level support to manage the day to day operations for Visa Inc’s network. As a Staff Systems Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to provide a senior role in supporting, managing, and implementing improvements to Visa’s network based on ITIL change, incident and problem management process. This involves working with a 1st level and 2nd level global operations team with 24x7 follow-the-sun coverage. You will work closely with the Network Engineering, Network Tools, and Network Systems and Programs teams in supporting, managing and implementing improvements to Visa’s network and also with applications and systems teams to manage and troubleshoot network connectivity. This position is within Global Infrastructure Network Services (GINS) team, that architects, engineers and operates Visa’s global backbone, datacenter, and access networks. The GINS team is centered around hiring and developing diverse talents who are passionate about building and operating best-in-the-breed infrastructure through technology and innovation.
JOB SCOPE
This is an individual contributor responsible for identifying and resolving issues of advanced complexity. This position is at a senior professional level and requires strong/advanced execution and analytical abilities. This role works independently and receives minimal guidance.
RESPONSIBILITIES
• Lead and take ownership in troubleshooting and resolving complex 2nd level network related problems, coordinate resources where necessary and serve as escalation point to 1st level operational teams
• Respond to and resolve IP network issues within the timeframe of severity level agreements
• Observe and identify trends of recurring problem and provide resolution to prevent recurrence
• Deploy client solutions and network design implementations
• Support all aspects of the network management process assuring requests, implementation, and problems are delivered as required with no impact to the global communications environment
• Take initiative to proactively discover potential network impacts
• Lead and take ownership in problem resolution and root cause analysis
• Participate in tasks related to change, incident and problem management
• Mentor and coach junior Network Support Engineer
• Document, create and maintain operational run-books based from best practice and from knowledge/experience gained from day-to-day operations for continuous operational improvement.
• Conduct internal technical briefing/training for level1 and level2 network operations team
• Deploy and document changes in accordance with problem and change management process
• Participate in full implementation of projects and ensure documentation standards are adhered to. Complete the projects objectives within timelines.
• Lead and ensure all new implementations and designs are operationally supportable
• Communicate to customers, resolution and root cause resulting from the outage or service interruption
• Perform most effective approach to restore, recover, or alter configurations, logical or physical, to maintain service integrity
• Ability to write fluently and communicate to senior management in non-technical terms
• Candidate is expected to be On-call duty and work over weekends on rotational basis with other team members.
• Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science or a related field is required. Post graduate degree a plus
• Requires a minimum of 6 years experience in network support/administration.
• Current CCNP qualified or other similar industry certifications with related professional experience. CCIE would be an advantage.
• Have strong technical problem determination ability, analytical skills, exceptional system implementation, installation, and disaster recovery planning and ongoing administration experience.
• Broad knowledge in background in TCP/IP, MPLS, WAN, and LAN.
• Strong working knowledge with network packet analysis using wireshark or similar tools.
• Good working knowledge in F5 LTM/GTM, Cisco Nexus switches, Arista switches, Cisco/Juniper routers and Riverbed WAN Optimizers
• Experience with Ansible and Python.
• Experience in using network tools like Solarwinds (creating/maintaining dashboards), Netbrain (creating/maintaining runbooks) and Netscout.
• Experience in an application hosting or data center environment.
• Experience maintaining highly available and highly secure networks.
• Good process orientation and ability to clarify objectives, evaluate options, consider implications, assess risks, and make key decisions.
• Good interpersonal and facilitation skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal) skills.
• Sound planning, organizational and problem solving skills.
• Good project management skills.
• ITIL certification preferred with good understanding of change, incident and problem management process
• Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments in an environment that requires multitasking among concurrent projects.
• Willing to work as a team and share responsibilities where needed
• Ability to convey network concepts and issues to both technical and non-technical audiences.

summary: As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world throug...
text:
As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company’s dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You’re an Individual. We’re the team for you. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.
Visa operates the world's largest retail electronic payments network and is one of the most recognized global financial services brands. Visa facilitates global commerce through the transfer of value and information among financial institutions, merchants, consumers, businesses and government entities.
We offer a range of branded payment product platforms, which our financial institution clients use to develop and offer credit, charge, deferred debit, prepaid and cash access programs to cardholders. Visa's card platforms provide consumers, businesses, merchants and government entities with a secure, convenient and reliable way to pay and be paid in 170 countries and territories.
The Infrastructure Service Reliability team is responsible for the strategy, architecture, design, support, availability, and reliability of Visa Inc.'s mission critical infrastructure ie- infrastructure supporting all credit and debit systems. This team has a special charter to focus solely on mission critical network and storage infrastructure and to provide the highest level of support to these services.
This role is a recognized expert within Visa responsible for contributing to the development of functional strategy. This is an individual contributor role responsible for solving unique and complex problems that have a broad impact on the business.
This position will be located in Singapore.
Basic Qualifications
Minimum of Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
Preferred Qualifications
7-10 years of work experience and a Bachelor’s Degree or
6 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or
3 years of experience with a PhD.
Cisco certification or a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or Engineering is preferred
3 years related experience in infrastructure/network environments and designing, planning, documenting and implementing LANs and WANs using latest technology
Advanced process orientation and exhibited planning, organizational and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, facilitation, and leadership skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal) skills
Advanced understanding of TCP/IP network protocols, including common application protocols
Python and Ansible experience needed
Experience with Brocade storage switching required and scripting/automation for storage fabric preferred
Experience in high-availability networks in load-balanced, n-tier application environments
Experience leading complex global projects from development through implementation
Demonstrated ability to solve complex systems and network environment issues
Ability to understand systems from all levels, from the "big picture" enterprise-level view to the low level technical view
Ability to write technical design and build documentations for all aspects of a technical infrastructure
Ability to represent technical and business issues and solutions to multiple levels internally and externally to support strategic organizational plans
Demonstrate ability to work in a complex organization to determine business and customer needs, providing the best solution to meet those needs
ITIL certification preferred
Provide technical coordination, oversight and leadership for staff and serve as escalation point for complex technical issues
Plan, design, implement and provides ongoing support of network systems of high complexity in commercial and Cybersource environments to fulfill the business needs
Design appropriate solutions based on environment, create detailed network designs, assess and test new and evolving technologies for performance and cost benefits
Provide third level technical support to the Visa client institutions and to technical teams within Visa to resolve network issues and to support the implementation of new network solutions
Build and maintain relationship with global and virtual teams and third parties on network development or support issues
Lead development, testing and QA functions to ensure that projects are securely delivered and fulfill expectations
Provide highest level of technical consultancy to ensure problem resolution is achieved in the shortest possible timeframe
Requirements and provide technical assistance for investigation and analysis of security alerts
Develop processes and procedures for use by the Network team and third parties in the management of network environments
Develop and position solutions and create a roadmap to effectively gain buy-in from all stakeholders
Mentor junior team members, develop departmental procedures and best practices standards
Provide recommendations to management team to increase effectiveness of organization and technology solutions
Physical Requirements
This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, reach with hands and arms, and bend or lift up to 25 pounds.
Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

text:
We are looking for a high energy Network Implementation Engineer who can support router / wireless AP implementations. This role will be responsible for working from onsite technicians to validate configurations and connectivity.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Coordination with on-site technicians
Verify Configuration of Network gear and Access Points (i.e. Cisco, Meraki, Aruba & Dell)

Troubleshoot and resolve configuration issues against templates
