Certification in Cisco (CCNA and/or CCNP) is required
Degree in IT, Engineering, Computer science, Information System, or any related area of study
Experience working in accessing & configuring router & switches (i.e. Cisco, Meraki AP’s, Aruba & Dell)
Good working knowledge of Network functions (WAN and LAN) and Network & Data protocols (i.e. Vlans, IP addressing, routing & switching)
Working knowledge in wireless AP is an added advantage
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong critical thinking, analytical and decision-making skills
Excellent project management skills and a strong ability to prioritize & customer-oriented

title: Network Engineer - CCNP

name: Network Engineer G21 - Information Technology
summary:
Major Duties and Responsibilities
Assists in coordinating and executing the installation of new por...
text:
Major Duties and Responsibilities
Assists in coordinating and executing the installation of new portions of the network for network expansion. Assists in documenting the design and construction of all building and administrative networks and their inter-connection. Attends various City meetings for the purpose of communications and/or gathering information. Collaborates with IT unit and city personnel for the purpose of meeting end-user needs with the best possible solutions according to CCG standards. Installs, configures, and troubleshoots data communication devices, including wireless access points, wireless clients, switches, and routers with appropriate supervision. Manages, under appropriate supervision, CCG network resources, including file servers, server operating systems, email systems, user accounts, and related components. Participates as a CCG resource in large-scale project implementations in providing technical support and other duties as assigned for the purpose of implementing key initiatives associated with the CCG's strategic Technology Blueprint. Prepares documentation for the purpose of providing written technical support and/or conveying information. Researches resources and methods (e.g. journals, literature, vendor information, Internet, etc.) for the purpose of maintaining current working knowledge of new and emerging technologies as well as district/state/federal rules, regulations, and policies. Troubleshoots and repairs malfunctions in existing network to ensure minimal user impact from equipment failures; monitors networks; troubleshoots network performance. Assists other personnel as may be required in the completion of their work activities. Facilitates work and communication between the units within IT. Participates in after-hours on-call rotation for the purpose of support to CCG data centers and data network. Serves as an information resource for the IT department to agencies, businesses, and the community. Serves as member of cross unit project teams for the purpose of implementing city and departmental initiatives. Performs other related duties, as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of server operating systems, including the latest Microsoft Windows or Windows Advanced Server Active Directory Operating Environment. Knowledge of local area networking, wide area networking, metropolitan area networking, and other computer-related technologies. Knowledge of computer installation, maintenance, and software support to perform computer troubleshooting. Knowledge of transport and framing protocols. Knowledge of math at a level to apply algebra and/or statistics. Skill in effective customer service. Skill in providing technical advice and instruction to non-technical staff. Skill in personal computer operation and ability to learn and operate a variety of software programs. Skill in Problem solving and analyzing complex situations and synthesize diverse information. Skill in maintaining records and writing reports. Skill in interpersonal relations. Skill in oral and written communication.
Minimum Educational and Training Requirements
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university required, preferably in Computer Sciences, Computer Technology, Management Information Systems or related field is required. Experience sufficient to thoroughly understand the work of subordinate positions and to be able to answer questions and resolve problems; five years experience in network administration and/or technical support of a complex LAN/WAN environment; Server Clustering and Active Directory experience required. Knowledge of virtualization (VMWare, Hyper-V), Office 365, SAN's, and Azure Government preferred. Possession of or ability to readily obtain a Cisco CCNA certification or must hold a current Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) certificate in Windows Server within 36 months of placement date. Within 48 months of placement, employee must achieve the missing certification listed above or possess any combination of experience and training, which provides the applicant with the knowledge, skills, and ability required to perform the equivalent work.
Physical Requirements
The work is typically performed while sitting at a desk or table with intermittent standing, walking, bending, crouching, or stooping. The employee must occasionally lift light and heavy objects, climb ladders, and distinguish between shades of color.

name: Senior Network Engineer-2 ( Work at Home / Remote / Virtual eligible )
summary: Description The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and mea...
text:
Description The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence departments strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to more complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. Responsibilities Humana is seeking a Senior Network Engineer who will deliver solutions for the future underlay fabric for the enterprise. This is an exciting opportunity for forward-looking technology leaders to make key contributions to the evolution and transformation of the companys networks toward next-generation technologies. This is a critical role within Humanas IT organization responsible for the engineering and design, planning, implementation, and establishment of operational and maintenance programs to deliver best-in-class next generation network infrastructure. This includes optimizing all aspects of network eco-system, including performance, resiliency, availability, resource utilization and innovation. This person will provide network design, engineering and administrative support of both physical and virtual networking devices within our SDI environments. This person will be responsible for leveraging state-of-the-art networking technologies, including virtualization and software-defined networking (SDN), to develop and deliver a robust, scalable, network eco-system. He/she will work with various leaders across the enterprise to coordinate network solutions to meet challenges of technology, regulatory, security, and competitive conditions. The scope will include the following areas of concentration: + Network fabric for the internal Data Centers / Private Cloud platforms supporting multiple software defined network overlay technologies; + Planning, designing, and deploying new LAN/WAN network infrastructure and connectivity for managed services environment. + Overseeing and performing administration, configuration, and monitoring of all network equipment (switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, VPN concentrators, etc.). + Remote Access VPN solutions (Aruba, Cisco AnyConnect and Aruba) + Support the elimination of existing datacenter dependencies to enable cloud/fastest-path access (i.e. VPN, Web Proxy, etc...) + End-User device connectivity architecture & implementations + Connectivity solutions for supporting a hybrid cloud strategy; + Remote site and campus network technology to support SDWAN and SD-LAN implementations; + Internal company wireless connectivity; + WAN circuit topology and telco/carrier technical integration; + Remote user network end-point technology. Engineering responsibilities for these areas of concentration include, but are not limited: + Design for new solutions; + Standard solution configuration; + Technology roadmap development, management, and maintenance; + Documenting and updating all network infrastructure and supported business processes. + Capacity and performance planning; + Integration with related infrastructure engineering efforts; + Alignment and integration with information security requirements; + Definition and development of operational KPIs and metrics; + Disaster recovery/business continuity integration; + Continuous knowledge and skills improvement + Assist in motivating and growing the Network Engineering team to its next level of maturity, agility (NetDevOps) and scalability. Help build foundation and help define capabilities and processes to address network needs in tactical and strategic terms. Required Qualifications: + BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field + Network engineering certification such as CCNA through CCIE or the equivalent + 8+ years of technical network engineering experience, and 3+ years of project leadership experience + 5+ years of Layer 2/ Layer 3 network architectural design (LAN/WAN/VPN) and engineering experience + 5+ years of experience working with MPLS, BGP, OSPF, and other LAN/WAN technologies + 5+ years of 802.11 wireless infrastructure and administration + 5+ years of experience architecting large-scale wireless network infrastructure, with advanced experience designing carrier-grade WiFi + Strong understanding and support of 4G, LTE, 5G network deployments across remote sites + Strong experience supporting large-scale datacenters and remote sites + Strong experience with end-user device connectivity architecture & implementations (i.e. IoT, iPads, etc...) + Experience with Cisco networking equipment + Experience in VPN technologies + Knowledge of QoS and network security functions (firewalls, VPN, IPS, etc) + Ability to manage complex multi-organizational projects + Experience with implementing and operating a software-defined network environment (VXLAN, EVPN, etc.) + Vendor management skills (hardware/software security vendors as well as third party vendors) Preferred Qualifications: + Programminging languages and frameworks knowledge and experience, in support of automation (Python, Ansible, etc.) + Familiarity with cloud architecture network designs, implementations, and support (AWS, Azure, GCP) + Data Center infrastructure solutions: Cisco (R&S), F5 (LTM, APM, ASM), Palo Alto (NGFW + IDS/IPS functions), Infoblox (DDI), Citrix Netscaler (VDI), Cisco ISE and ACS campus LAN and WLAN solutions, also implemented on Cisco products, network segmentation and access control in remote offices + Experience with Arista, VMware NSX-T, and other SDN technologies + Experience architecting and implementing large-scale SD-WAN solutions + Demonstrated experience with DevOps, ITIL, and platform process & technology + Master's Degree in a Technical Field Required Qualifications + Bachelor's degree + 5 or more years of technical experience + Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences Preferred Qualifications Additional Information #Cloud #LI-remote Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 About Us Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and thats why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first. text:
Overview/ Job Responsibilities
The Mobility Network Engineer III will work in a Customs & Border Protection’s (CBP) Enterprise Network Architecture & Engineering support services contract (ENAESS) on client site in Springfield VA.
Success in this position requires experience with Mobile Device Management (MDM) user support and issue resolution with working experience in supporting Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) on large scale Enterprise customers with proven delivery in supporting, maintaining, and troubleshooting “complex” Airwatch or equivalent MDM systems.
Working on a team consisting of Network Architects & Engineers supporting the CBP network, the Mobility Network Engineer III must have the ability to:
Able to design and implementation tasks and address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues and support escalation and root cause analysis activities
Support of all updates to all documents when there is change in the transport design and/or technologies and collaborating with all stakeholders to test all related systems and processes to verify that the systems meet requirements and can host applications with no degradation to performance or security
Responsible for the preparation of test reports and Implementation Plans for each change impacting the Production environment
Resolve customer’s issues via the telephone, email or Webex session
Reproducing issues in-house and responding back in a timely manner
Regular follow ups with customers with recommendations, updates and action plans.
Escalate issues in a timely manner according to Standard Operating Procedures
Leverage internal technical expertise, including peers, mentors, knowledge base, community forums and other internal tools, to provide the most effective solutions to customer issues
Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions.
Support, maintain and troubleshoot Airwatch systems
Support the design and implementation of complex MDM solutions
Address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues
Provide network administration support: firewalls, general network infrastructure and security fundamentals, VPN, DNS
Follow and perform ITIL Incident, problem and requirements management
Develop and implement test strategies and documents results
Provides documentation, guidance and training to end-users as needed
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Receive mentoring for MDM Airwatch solutions design and implementation by solutions architect
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s in Information Technology, Computer Science or related degree; Without a degree a H.S. Diploma required and 14 additional years of relevant work experience.
14 years’ work Experience as a System Administrator – supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting MDM systems AND Smart Devices (Apple, Android devices like tablet and smart phone, Windows iOS, etc.
Strong understanding of servers & configuration & maintenance: Windows Server 2008 / 2003 / 2013, Exchange, 0365, Azure AD, Active Directory, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache), Linux Forms (Ubuntu, Fedora, Red Hat, Photon, Open Suse), other mail systems, web certifications such as SSL and IIS
Experience with ITIL based Service Management workflow applications such as incident, problem and requirements management and Security Administration experience: Authentication, Certificate system, etc.
Technical Certifications or demonstrable experience in in one or more MDM Products (AirWatch, MobileIron, XenMobile, Symantec MDM, Good Tech)
MS-SQL, Mail Server – Added Advantage
Network engineering experience required include admin level experience with firewalls, VPN, DNS and general network and network security infrastructure
Wireless hardware, networks and respective components
Client Server architecture
Experience with server configuration a plus: Windows Server 2008 / 2003, Linux Forms, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache)
Exchange 2010/2013/O365 or Google apps for business
Seeking candidate who can mentor, teach, and grow a small team from within to support growing customer requirements
Must have great communication and documentation skills
Eligibility/Clearance Requirements: Must be able to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship with a government clearance
Desired Qualifications
Microsoft Intune a plus
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st preference
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret or Secret - 2nd preference
DoD Secret or Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd preference (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated)
About Sev1Tech LLC
Founded in 2010, Sev1Tech provides IT, engineering, and program management solutions delivery. Sev1Tech focuses on providing program and IT support services to critical missions across Federal and Commercial Clients. Our Mission is to Build better companies. Enable better government. Protect our nation. Build better humans across the country.
Join the Sev1Tech family where you can achieve great accomplishments while fostering a satisfying and rewarding career progression. Please apply directly through the website at: #joinSev1tech
For any additional questions or to submit any referrals, please contact:
Sev1Tech is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Sev1Tech

name: Transportation Network Engineer
summary: Amazon’s EU Global Delivery Service team is looking for an enthusiastic and customer obsessed Trans...
text:
Amazon’s EU Global Delivery Service team is looking for an enthusiastic and customer obsessed Transportation Network Engineer to help us design and optimize our transportation network. The role will involve understanding the physical and virtual transportation processes, from our fulfillment centers on to our final mile carriers who deliver our packages to our customers. As part of the Network Design team you will combine business process knowledge, data expertise, and analysis skills to identify and drive programs within our transportation network. To be successful in the role, you need to be an excellent communicator with a strong analytical mindset, able to influence across business functions and manage stakeholders’ expectations effectively. You will work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment that requires you to be detail-oriented and comfortable in working with multiple business and technical teams. Development and execution of network design and optimization strategy to support cost reductions, increase delivery speed and improve delivery experience for Amazon customers. Continually optimize the network through evaluation of changes and driving network related projects. Development of necessary tools to enable optimal design of network Work closely with commercial, operational and technical stakeholders to drive the implementation of initiatives. Drive cross functional teams to deliver programs. Basic Qualifications Completed Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Engineering, Economics or Science degree 5+ years experience in similar role including program/project management, process improvement or operations management Experience in manipulating complex data, data processing and analyzing, drawing conclusions from data, and building basic models that support business decisions Ability to think quantitatively and qualitatively about operating processes and outcomes Strong data processing and analysis skills, ability to produce, interpret and draw conclusions from data Ability to handle multiple priorities and work independently in an often times ambiguous environment Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and operational know-how English proficiency (written/spoken) Preferred Qualifications MBA or Master’s Degree Familiarity with statistics and application of statistics in operations Knowledge of SQL, Oracle BI, Tableau, Unix, Visual Basic and/or other pro… Originele vacature is te vinden op StepStone.be – Maak nu een Jobagent aan op StepStone en vind je droombaan! https://bit.ly/2jPYsZC Vind gelijkaardige jobs, informatie over werkgevers en carrièretips op StepStone.be!

Cinteot is seeking an experienced Network Engineer to join our team in Mc...
tasks: Develop and maintain scripts to support automation of cloud configuration and administration,Support security audits, accreditation and certification processes, and obtaining approval to operate (ATO) for cloud-based system architectures,Develop system hardening approaches for remediation to vulnerabilities,Create Virtual Machine templates and deploy virtual machines from templates and allocate resources,Assist in defining and implementing Microsoft Azure solution architectures,Maintain configuration oversight of the network,Implement, monitor and maintain systems, network activities and services
text:
Job Location: Mc Lean, VA
Cinteot is seeking an experienced Network Engineer to join our team in McLean VA. The selected candidate will work closely with the architecture team and the customer to design and implement network solutions in the cloud utilizing open source and commercial infrastructure, platform, and software as a service (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) offerings. Roles and Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain scripts to support automation of cloud configuration and administration
Support security audits, accreditation and certification processes, and obtaining approval to operate (ATO) for cloud-based system architectures
Develop system hardening approaches for remediation to vulnerabilities
Create Virtual Machine templates and deploy virtual machines from templates and allocate resources
Assist in defining and implementing Microsoft Azure solution architectures
Maintain configuration oversight of the network
Implement, monitor and maintain systems, network activities and services
Conduct testing of network design
Basic Qualifications:
Active Secret security clearance (interim acceptable)
Bachelor's degree and 10 years experience
At least 2 years experience developing, configuring, and managing secure networking solutions
Experience in Bash scripting
Experience in virus and malware prevention, detection and remediation
Experience working with Technical Implementation Guides (STIGS)
Strong working knowledge of NIST, FISMA, and FedRAMP Compliance sets
Experience with Active Directory, Group Policy and patch management
Working knowledge with different Windows and Linux versions and varieties
Understanding of TCP/IP, IP sub-netting, ACLs, advanced routing protocols
This position requires the selected candidate to be a US Citizen. Must possess an active Secret security clearance in order to qualify. Desired Skills:
Experience with Configuration management systems
Experience with Python and PowerShell scripting
Familiarity with Docker
Familiarity with Terraform and Packer
Benefits:
Complete insurance coverage Blue Cross Medical, Delta Dental, vision, life
401(k) with company contribution
Generous paid time off
Cinteot is an Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
How To Apply:
You will be directed to another website for application instructions.

name: Senior Network Engineer-1 ( Work at Home / Remote / Virtual eligible )
summary: **Description** The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and...
text:
**Description** The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to more complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. **Responsibilities** Humana is seeking a Senior Network Engineer who will deliver solutions for the future underlay fabric for the enterprise. This is an exciting opportunity for forward-looking technology leaders to make key contributions to the evolution and transformation of the company's networks toward next-generation technologies. This is a critical role within Humana's IT organization responsible for the engineering and design, planning, implementation, and establishment of operational and maintenance programs to deliver best-in-class next generation network infrastructure. This includes optimizing all aspects of network eco-system, including performance, resiliency, availability, resource utilization and innovation. This person will provide network design, engineering and administrative support of both physical and virtual networking devices within our SDI environments. This person will be responsible for leveraging state-of-the-art networking technologies, including virtualization and software-defined networking (SDN), to develop and deliver a robust, scalable, network eco-system. He/she will work with various leaders across the enterprise to coordinate network solutions to meet challenges of technology, regulatory, security, and competitive conditions. The scope will include the following areas of concentration: + Network fabric for the internal Data Centers / Private Cloud platforms supporting multiple software defined network overlay technologies; + Planning, designing, and deploying new LAN/WAN network infrastructure and connectivity for managed services environment. + Overseeing and performing administration, configuration, and monitoring of all network equipment (switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, VPN concentrators, etc.). + Remote Access VPN solutions (Aruba, Cisco AnyConnect and Aruba) + Support the elimination of existing datacenter dependencies to enable cloud/fastest-path access (i.e. VPN, Web Proxy, etc...) + End-User device connectivity architecture & implementations + Connectivity solutions for supporting a hybrid cloud strategy; + Remote site and campus network technology to support SDWAN and SD-LAN implementations; + Internal company wireless connectivity; + WAN circuit topology and telco/carrier technical integration; + Remote user network end-point technology. Engineering responsibilities for these areas of concentration include, but are not limited: + Design for new solutions; + Standard solution configuration; + Technology roadmap development, management, and maintenance; + Documenting and updating all network infrastructure and supported business processes. + Capacity and performance planning; + Integration with related infrastructure engineering efforts; + Alignment and integration with information security requirements; + Definition and development of operational KPIs and metrics; + Disaster recovery/business continuity integration; + Continuous knowledge and skills improvement + Assist in motivating and growing the Network Engineering team to its next level of maturity, agility (NetDevOps) and scalability. Help build foundation and help define capabilities and processes to address network needs in tactical and strategic terms. Required Qualifications: + BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field + Network engineering certification such as CCNA through CCIE or the equivalent + 8+ years of technical network engineering experience, and 3+ years of project leadership experience + 5+ years of Layer 2/ Layer 3 network architectural design (LAN/WAN/VPN) and engineering experience + 5+ years of experience working with MPLS, BGP, OSPF, and other LAN/WAN technologies + 5+ years of 802.11 wireless infrastructure and administration + 5+ years of experience architecting large-scale wireless network infrastructure, with advanced experience designing carrier-grade WiFi + Strong understanding and support of 4G, LTE, 5G network deployments across remote sites + Strong experience supporting large-scale datacenters and remote sites + Strong experience with end-user device connectivity architecture & implementations (i.e. IoT, iPads, etc...) + Experience with Cisco networking equipment + Experience in VPN technologies + Knowledge of QoS and network security functions (firewalls, VPN, IPS, etc) + Ability to manage complex multi-organizational projects + Experience with implementing and operating a software-defined network environment (VXLAN, EVPN, etc.) + Vendor management skills (hardware/software security vendors as well as third party vendors) Preferred Qualifications: + Programminging languages and frameworks knowledge and experience, in support of automation (Python, Ansible, etc.) + Familiarity with cloud architecture network designs, implementations, and support (AWS, Azure, GCP) + Data Center infrastructure solutions: Cisco (R&S), F5 (LTM, APM, ASM), Palo Alto (NGFW + IDS/IPS functions), Infoblox (DDI), Citrix Netscaler (VDI), Cisco ISE and ACS campus LAN and WLAN solutions, also implemented on Cisco products, network segmentation and access control in remote offices + Experience with Arista, VMware NSX-T, and other SDN technologies + Experience architecting and implementing large-scale SD-WAN solutions + Demonstrated experience with DevOps, ITIL, and platform process & technology + Master's Degree in a Technical Field **Required name: Lead Network Engineer ( Work at Home / Remote / Virtual eligible )
summary: Description The Lead, Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components sup...
text:
Description The Lead, Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Lead, Network Engineer works on problems of diverse scope and complexity ranging from moderate to substantial. Responsibilities Lead Network Engineer will support the Network Engineering Design Team. Product support families will include Cisco, Arista, Aruba, Array, and Palo Alto Datacenter products, Viptela Software-Defined Wide Area Network (SD-WAN), Multi-Cloud Connectivity Hubs, and Cloud connectivity with Amazon Web Services (AWS), G Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Oracle and Azure. This individual will: Develop and evaluate network performance criteria and measurement methods Prepare the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conduct network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develop alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conduct economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Advise executives to develop functional strategies (often segment specific) on matters of significance. Exercise independent judgment and decision making on complex issues regarding job duties and related tasks, and work under minimal supervision, Use independent judgment requiring analysis of variable factors and determining the best course of action. Required Qualifications + a Bachelor's degree + 8 or more years of technical experience + 2 or more years of project leadership experience + Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences Preferred Qualifications + Experience with network integration mergers and acquisitions + Interior Gateway Protocol/Border Gateway Protocol (IGP/BGP) configuration and troubleshooting + Remote Access connectivity solutions using Cisco AnyConnect, Aruba and Array + Equinix Cloud exchange design and configuration + Data Center networking design and configuration including Arista and Cisco Nexus platforms with VXLAN/BGP EVPN + Network security stack design and configuration including Palo Alto and Cisco + Wide Area Network (WAN) and Local Area Network (LAN) design and configuration + QoS, Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) and Network Segmentation Technologies + Wireless Network Technologies + SD-WAN design including Cisco Viptela and Meraki platforms + Software Defined Network including Digital Network Architecture (DNA) + Cloud inter-networking design including AWS, GCP and Azure + Experience with tools eco system including Solarwinds, Stealthwatch and ThousandEyes + Network Documentation and excellent communication skills + Infrastructure automation design and deployment through Ansible and Python Additional Information #cloud #LI-remote Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 About Us Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and thats why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first. Equal Opportunity Employer It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or veteran status, except where age, sex, or physical status is a bona fide occupational qualification. View the EEO is the Law poster. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact mailbox_tas_recruit@humana.com for assistance. Humana Safety and Security Humana will never ask, nor require a candidate provide money for work equipment and network access during the application process. If you become aware of any instances where you as a candidate are asked to provide information and do not believe it is a legitimate request from Humana or affiliate, please contact mailbox_tas_recruit@humana.com to validate the request. Title: Network Engineer
Location: Minnetonka, MN
Trimble Transportation
Trimble Transportation is in...
text:
Title: Network Engineer
Location: Minnetonka, MN
Trimble Transportation
Trimble Transportation is in business for optimizing the movement of freight by providing shippers and carriers both mobility, enterprise and visibility software tools they need to run their businesses more efficiently. As the leading provider of Transportation Management Software (TMS), Asset Management Software (AMS), and Fleet Management Software (FMS) we are devoted to propelling companies in the trucking industry toward increased efficiency, lower costs and optimize operations.
Position Overview:
40% Operational support and incident resolution.
20% System maintenance: Perform firmware / OS upgrades on routers, switches, firewalls, access points, and other devices in accordance with company needs.
20% Architect/design and integrate LAN/WAN solutions.
10% Develop and maintain standard configurations, procedures, and guidelines for installing and operating data services.
10% Writing and maintaining network documentation.
Minimum Qualifications:
5+ years Cisco Enterprise and Datacenter Network experience
4+ years of Palo Alto Technology experience in solutions design and systems engineering with a focus on Next-Generation Firewall and some comparative technologies.
3+ years on F5 Hardware/Software –primary on designing, implementing, and supporting LTM, APM, ASM, and GTM running vCMP on VIPRION HA platforms in a multi-datacenter infrastructure.
AWS services
Extensive background in internetworking, LAN, and WAN technologies.
Strong TCP/IP networking skills.
Experience that emphasizes L2-L4 Networks (L2 switching architectures including Spanning Tree
IP routing that includes OSPF and BGP, and L4 Load balancing).
Excellent troubleshooting skills.
Experience and knowledge of modern network threats and malware, network forensics, automation tools and technologies, and endpoint security technologies.
Preferred Skills:
F5 Certificated Administrator, F5 Certified Technology Specialist (LTM, DNS, ASM and APM), and/or F5 Certified Solution Expert.
CCNP / CCIE Routing and Switching.
UNIX/Linux, and Windows-based systems.
Mature and effective time-management skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience working in 24 x 7 infrastructure with complex, high availability applications.
Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D

text:
Apply
Sr. Network Engineer (Wireless)
As a member of the Core BizTech Experience (Core BTX) team at Slack, you will be part of a team of engineers who specialize in delivering reliable infrastructure and SaaS services to our users. Slack is a global company, and these services are critical to ensuring our employees have delightful technology experiences. This role is based at our Slack office in Pune, India.
The Core BTX Engineering team is seeking a senior network engineer with an accomplished background in administration and automation. The Network Engineer will partner with our SF-based team to design, implement, and support our global network footprint.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and support scalable networking solutions to address a variety of business challenges.
Excel in a dynamic environment with the ability to multi-task and work not only on projects, but also provide operational support.
Be a collaborative teammate that will work across multi-functional groups and mentor others.
Drive consistent improvement by refining tooling, automation, and documentation.
Provision and solve carrier transport and IP transit circuits.
Configure and administer network monitoring tools.
Configure and administer routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless infrastructure in a multi-vendor environment.
Fix network failures and performance issues.
Occasionally be required to travel domestically and internationally.
Participate in an on-call rotation covering all of the above.
Maintain and implement network configuration and security compliance standards.
Identify internal process and automation improvements and deploy scalable technical solutions.
Work proficiently with minimal daily mentorship and bring mature seasoned skills when working with production systems.
Build and maintain detailed and accurate documentation.
Requirements:
7+ years of hands-on experience with routing, switching and enterprise wireless technologies.
Solid understanding and hands-on experience with network routing protocols and configuration, specifically BGP and OSPF.
Fundamental understanding of enterprise network design, including office, campus, and global connectivity.
Slack is a layer of the business technology stack that brings together people, data, and applications – a single place where people can effectively work together, find important information, and access hundreds of thousands of critical applications and services to do their best work. From global Fortune 100 companies to corner markets, businesses and teams of all kinds use Slack to bring the right people together with all the right information. Slack is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has ten offices around the world. For more information on how Slack makes teams better connected, visit slack.com.
Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work.
Come do the best work of your life here at Slack.

text:
Network Voice Engineer
Immediate Start
Friendly team and flexible working environment
Great opportunity to work within this highly regarded organisation with an international reach and reputation. An experienced Network Engineer is required to commence work in a permanent position immediately. The position sits within a team of engineers, reporting to the General Manager. As part of a supportive and team orientated environment with a great work/life balance you will really enjoy working in this team. Key Criteria:

Any Cisco certifications [CCNA, CCNA (Voice), CCNP, CCVP] will be beneficial
Cisco Contact Centre Express (UCCX) experience and Cisco Call Manager (CCM) experience will also be viewed positively
Strong communication and team work skills

title: Network Engineer - Cisco Voice

name: Network Engineer
summary:
Participates and leads configurations, implementation, and support of all network systems
Participa...
text:
Participates and leads configurations, implementation, and support of all network systems
Participates in a collaborative efforts to manage and resolve complex network problems and coordinates resolution
Participates in incident management, asset management, change management, project management, and continuous improvement of network environment
Manages, configures, and implements routers, switches, firewalls, wireless, and other network systems and services.
Develops wireless network infrastructures and makes recommendation on systems enhancements for optimization.
Managing assigned projects and program components to deliver services in accordance with established objectives.
Maintain network security through proper configuration of VPN tunnels and Firewall rules
Be aware of and follow existing network management change procedures
Work outside of normal business hours when required (scheduled maintenance, outage response, last minute urgent requests)
Create and/or update network documentation in various systems per established process and standards.
Job Requirements:
5+ years of progressive experience in the installation, operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of wired and wireless networks.
Professional level understanding of wireless networking including IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi Standards, Controller based Wi-Fi systems, Client to Network Authentication mechanisms (EAP/TLS, PEAP, etc.), RADIUS, DHCP, DNS, Internet VPNs (IPSEC and SSL)
Possess knowledge of TCP/IP V4 layer 2 switching and layer 3 routing including failover and redundancy configuration (VRRP/ HSRP)
Knowledge and/or experience with Clearpass and Airwave appliances, Aruba Wireless controller technologies and wireless access points.
Knowledge of VoIP implementation and support (SIP based call routing, IVRU, Text to Speech) helpful
Technical, analytical and interpersonal skills required .
Self-motivation and the ability to work with little supervision.
Ability to manage several concurrent tasks and priorities.
Previous Retail Store network deployments.
Knowledge of new technologies (SD-Wan, Cloud based solutions, virtualization.

name: Transportation Network Engineer
summary: Amazon’s EU Global Delivery Service team is looking for an enthusiastic and customer obsessed Trans...
text:
Amazon’s EU Global Delivery Service team is looking for an enthusiastic and customer obsessed Transportation Network Engineer to help us design and optimize our transportation network. The role will involve understanding the physical and virtual transportation processes, from our fulfillment centers on to our final mile carriers who deliver our packages to our customers. As part of the Network Design team you will combine business process knowledge, data expertise, and analysis skills to identify and drive programs within our transportation network. To be successful in the role, you need to be an excellent communicator with a strong analytical mindset, able to influence across business functions and manage stakeholders’ expectations effectively. You will work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment that requires you to be detail-oriented and comfortable in working with multiple business and technical teams. Development and execution of network design and optimization strategy to support cost reductions, increase delivery speed and improve delivery experience for Amazon customers. Continually optimize the network through evaluation of changes and driving network related projects. Development of necessary tools to enable optimal design of network Work closely with commercial, operational and technical stakeholders to drive the implementation of initiatives. Drive cross functional teams to deliver programs. Basic Qualifications Completed Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Engineering, Economics or Science degree 5+ years experience in similar role including program/project management, process improvement or operations management Experience in manipulating complex data, data processing and analyzing, drawing conclusions from data, and building basic models that support business decisions Ability to think quantitatively and qualitatively about operating processes and outcomes Strong data processing and analysis skills, ability to produce, interpret and draw conclusions from data Ability to handle multiple priorities and work independently in an often times ambiguous environment Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and operational know-how English proficiency (written/spoken) Preferred Qualifications MBA or Master’s Degree Familiarity with statistics and application of statistics in operations Knowledge of SQL, Oracle BI, Tableau, Unix, Visual Basic and/or other pro… Originele vacature is te vinden op StepStone.be – Maak nu een Jobagent aan op StepStone en vind je droombaan! https://bit.ly/2jPYsZC Vind gelijkaardige jobs, informatie over werkgevers en carrièretips op StepStone.be!

text:
Overview
Plans, designs, and monitors complex telecommunications networks and associated broadcasting equipment.
Skills
Most occupations in this unit group have a level of skill commensurate with a bachelor degree or higher qualification. At least five years of relevant experience and/or relevant vendor certification may substitute for the formal qualification. In some instances relevant experience and/or on-the-job training may be required in addition to the formal qualification (ANZSCO Skill Level 1).
Tasks
planning, designing, building, configuring and commissioning telecommunications devices, networks and systems, such as voice, radio, two-way, data, microwave, satellite and digital data systems, and ensuring telecommunications systems interconnect with equipment from different manufacturers, service providers and users
compiling engineering project proposals to define goals, identify scope, background and need, and ascertain cost of equipment, parts and services
evaluating and procuring new products and services from vendors
ensuring compliance with laws, regulations, policies and procedures in the provision of telecommunications systems
selecting and developing new telecommunications sites by locating sites, filing documents, drawing up documents for approval, drafting construction drawings and following through to approval
determining appropriate configurations of telecommunications hardware and software, ensuring desired performance of telecommunications equipment
preparing and interpreting specifications, drawings and regulations for the use of telecommunications equipment
determining the type and arrangement of circuits, transformers, circuit-breakers, transmission lines and equipment
identifying and analysing problems and needs of existing telecommunications systems, such as interference, intelligibility and clarity, to determine the most appropriate means of reducing, eliminating and avoiding current and future problems and improve communications
monitoring telecommunications systems to assess need for updates, upgrades, enhancements, preventive maintenance and new systems
assessing performance levels of system hardware and software to project future needs, and developing short- and long-terms plans for updating equipment, adding capabilities, enhancing existing systems and providing improved telecommunications
Alternative Titles
Communications Consultant
Communications Specialist (ICT)
Telecommunications Consultant
Telecommunications Specialist
Source: 1220.0 - ANZSCO - Australian and New Zealand Standard Classification of Occupations, First Edition.
Note: The tasks associated with the occupation are to be used as guidance only. The tasks listing may include tasks associated with the grouping/category to which the occupation belongs.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Establishes networking environment by designing system configuration; directing system installation; defining, documenting, and enforcing system standards.

Secures network system by establishing and enforcing policies; defining and monitoring access.
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
Accomplishes information systems and organization mission by completing related results as needed.

text:
Network engineer
Job ID 12634796 Veröffentlichungsdatum 22/07/2019
In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our achitects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible.
About us
With 80.000 talents working in 68 countries, we are one of the biggest high-tech employers in the field of safety and security. In the Netherlands, where 2000 employees are based, we are located in four cities: Huizen, Delft, Eindhoven and Hengelo (HQ). Together with an extensive ecosystem of knowledge partners, customers and suppliers, we work on radars for naval vessels, cyber security solutions, transportation systems, communication equipment for land forces, cryogenic cooling solutions and research & development for radar tech (in collaboration with TU Delft).
Within the Engineering cluster the Applications department is responsible for the development of combat and information management systems for navy ships, integration with sensor- and weapon systems as well as the development of sensor processing applications. These complex systems contain advanced solutions for information processing, information management and the user interaction with both sensor- and weapon systems. Our product offers essential support for missions varying from anti-piracy to ballistic missile defense.
For the applications engineering platform team Thales is looking for a talented
Network Engineer
About the job
As a Network engineer you will design, develop and test the network capabilities for the combat management systems, the radar systems and the optical sensor systems. The platform team is responsible for the entire development chain – requirements analysis, development, testing, validation and demonstrating the current status of the product.
Thales highly values the application of modern technologies and methodologies.
About you
Do you have a passion for technology, do you enjoy constantly developing your skills and are you interested in working on highly complex network environments? Then you are the person we are looking for.
You are a talented engineer that enjoys specifying, developing and testing IT infrastructure components. The infrastructure is part of the sensor and information management systems aboard navy ships. Relevant products and technologies include Cisco, Linux & Python. An expert level understanding of networking equipment by several vendors is important for successfully fulfilling the role. Knowledge of configuration management tooling (e.g. Ansible) and additional programming languages (e.g. C, C++) is preferred.
You hold an bachelor or master degree in computer science, IT service management, system & network engineering or comparable. Your colleagues are recognized experts in the field and will help you get up to speed and Thales will gladly invest in your development.
An important requirement to fulfil this role is flexibility and the ability to communicate efficiently in English to all types (technical, management) of stakeholders.
Thales offers
An interesting job within a nice team in an international high-tech environment;
Room for and attention to personal development and personal initiative;
The opportunity to grow within the organization, for instance on a technical, managerial, commercial or international level;
An open and flexible work environment where a good work-life balance is considered important;
A pleasant workplace in "the best building in the Netherlands" (Public’s Choice Award, 2015) with our own Starbucks corner;
Excellent work conditions, with 40 holidays a year, among other benefits.
Interested?
Would you like to apply directly? Then click on the button ‘Apply now’ to show your interest.
An assessment could possibly be part of the procedure.
At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Departme...
text:
City Newark
State California [CA]
Title Network Engineer
Job ID 869XX
Date Added 1/18/2017
Department Information Technology
Description
JOB SUMMARY
Responsible for the design, implementation, and support and administration of Depomed’s enterprise networks, including corporate wired and wireless, data center, and colocation facilities. This position requires a highly technical person that has a deep understanding or routing and switching protocols, good operational experience, and ability to isolate, analyze, and resolve issues.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
•Design, deploy, and maintain network infrastructure, including switches, access points, firewalls, load balancers, and other network related hardware.
•Produce secure technical solutions that will enhance performance, increase redundancy, and add flexibility to existing and future infrastructure.
•Provide technical leadership in network and security design, using industry proven best practices to build secure, stable networks
•Assist in the development and implementation of guidelines and procedures for administration and security best practices.
•Create and maintain comprehensive network documentation.
Requirements
REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
•Bachelor’s Degree, technical software certification, or equivalent work experience
•Minimum of 5 years prior experience in network engineering.
•Must have strong technical knowledge of and expertise with:
•Implementing, administering, and troubleshooting network infrastructure.
•Enterprise LAN/WAN environments, network capacity planning, security principles, and management best practices.
•Design, implementation, and operational experience with Cisco product offerings (Nexus/Catalyst switches, ASA firewalls, and wireless), load balancing, and VPN.
•Excellent analytical skills and the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
•Self-motivated with strong ability to prioritize and multitask.
•Rapidly learn new technologies and implement knowledge effectively.
•Familiarity in the following areas is a strong plus:
•Current Microsoft Windows Server technologies, including security, GPO, AD, Hyper-V, PKI, and clustering.
•Disaster Recovery sites and colocation of AD, Exchange, and SQL
•HP workstation-grade switches (ProCurve/Aruba)
•Accurately document existing and new systems and processes. (e.g., work instructions, network documentation, and operating procedures)
•Strong oral and written communication skills
•Experience working in regulated environments (i.e., GXP, Dept of Defense, or SOX) and complying with change control systems
•Team players with positive attitude and willingness to innovate are necessary.
•Communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely to non-technical customers.
•Strengths in working across all levels of the company in a calm and diplomatic manner.
DEPOMED COMPETENCIES INCLUDE
•Integrity
•Decisions & Judgment
•Ownership & Initiative
•Adaptability & Change Readiness
•Teamwork & Collaboration
PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS
•Sitting 80%; walking / standing 20%
•Able to perform repetitive motion, keyboarding
•Physically transporting items weighing up to 50 pounds from one location to another
•Able to see and read PC screens; detect color coding, read fine print, and/or normal type size print
•Ability to communicate clearly and professionally both verbally and in writing
•Ability to manage highly confidential information
•Ability to conduct oneself professionally at all times
•Ability to understand complex problems and to collaborate and explore alternative solutions
About Us
Depomed, Inc. is a specialty pharmaceutical company focused on developing and commercializing products to treat pain and other central nervous system conditions. Founded in 1995, Depomed has successfully executed on strategy of acquiring, integrating and growing differentiated therapeutic products and building each into a strong market presence. The result is a broad portfolio of pain and neurology specialty pharmaceuticals currently comprised of five FDA-approved products. These include Gralise® for the management of Postherpetic Neuralgia (PHN), Cambia® for the acute treatment of migraine attacks, Zipsor® for the relief of mild to moderate acute pain, Lazanda® for the management of breakthrough pain in cancer patients and our most recent addition, the company’s flagship asset, the NUCYNTA® franchise.
Acquired in April 2015 and re-launched in June 2015, the NUCYNTA franchise includes NUCYNTA® ER for the extended management of pain, including neuropathic pain associated with diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) and NUCYNTA® for immediate management of moderate to severe acute pain in adults.
Depomed also has successfully developed and licensed its unique drug-delivery technology, Acuform®. This patented oral-delivery technology allows for the targeted, extended release of pharmaceutical compounds into the upper gastrointestinal tract. The company’s Acuform technology is currently being used in four marketed drugs, including Gralise.
Depomed’s successful execution on strategy and has resulted in solid product revenue growth over the past three years. Located in Newark, California in the East Bay of San Francisco, Depomed is listed on the NASDAQ market under the ticker DEPO and employs approximately 500 people, of which approximately 350 are part of the Commercial organization.
Depomed is an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer.

Working knowledge of Silver Peak SD-WAN solutions desired.,Wireless 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ad, etc and other new/emerging standards. Wireless network design and administration required, experience with AeroHive wireless solutions is greatly desired.,Authentication solutions including Cisco ACS/RADIUS/TACACS /Certificates(PKI) greatly desired.,Network troubleshooting using packet capture and analysis using tools such as Wireshark.,ITIL/ITSM desired but not required.,Proven experience in setting up new site networks, including racking, installing, configuring LAN/WAN/VoIP hardware/circuits, testing/troubleshooting network connectivity/performance and documentation.
text:
Trimble is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a disciplined and strategic focus on being the best. While GPS is at our core, we have grown beyond this technology to embrace other sophisticated positioning technologies and, in doing so; we are changing the way the world works. Our solutions are used in over 140 countries and we have incredibly diverse lines of business.
Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries, working closely with their colleagues around the world. Due to our geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. Come position yourself with an innovative industry leader and position yourself for success.
Network Engineer
Act as network lead for planning, designing, and implementing networked systems. The candidate will be involved in troubleshooting and maintaining both in-house and vendor networks connections including configurations, supporting/troubleshooting network problems, and coordinating with vendors for installation of such items as direct internet access (DIA) circuits, MPLS circuits as well as configuring routers, switches, wireless access points and other devices or technologies as required. Responsible for project planning, cost analysis, and vendor comparisons.
Key Responsibilities
Operational support and incident resolution.
Work with a team to design, implement and support Trimble's worldwide network infrastructure.
Architect / design and integrate LAN/WAN solutions.
Develop and maintain standard configurations, procedures and guidelines for installing and operating voice & data services.
Participate in capacity planning and technology reviews with the Network Infrastructure team.
Maintain the network infrastructure to high levels of availability with basic and expedited support to resolve networking related issues.
Interface with ISP and carriers to install/commission/test new WAN/Internet circuits at remote sites, as well as interface with vendors to identify hardware & software requirements to meet business requirements.
Design, manage and maintain in building wireless networks.
Occasional on-call duties.
Travel: 50%.
Skills & Experience Required:
Team player
Willingness to learn and continue education.
BS or BA degree in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, or equivalent education, training or work experience.
Proven competence in the development, implementation and maintenance of complex network systems with 4 to 6 years’ experience in a networking enterprise environment.
Experience with global enterprise networks is preferred.
Cisco certifications:
CCNA - Routing and Switching or CCNA - Security
CCNP / CCIE Routing and Switching greatly preferred
Other industry certifications / training is greatly desired (examples, CEH, CISSP, MCP, etc)
Experience with the following technologies in design/implement/troubleshooting capacity is essential:
LAN: Switching - Cisco IOS/Nexus, VLANs, STP/RSTP, CoS, QoS, Ether-channel/Trunking,etc.
Experience with Cisco routers and switches is required, experience with Dell and HP switches desired.
Routing: BGP, EIGRP, HSRP or VRRP, PBR, etc.
WAN: T1/Multi-T1, PTP, MPLS, MetroEthernet, etc.
VPN Solutions: IOS/ASA based L2L and Client access VPN, DMVPN.
Network Management and WAN Optimization: Load balancing/Acceleration experience desired. Working knowledge of Silver Peak SD-WAN solutions desired.
Wireless 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ad, etc and other new/emerging standards. Wireless network design and administration required, experience with AeroHive wireless solutions is greatly desired.
Authentication solutions including Cisco ACS/RADIUS/TACACS /Certificates(PKI) greatly desired.
Network troubleshooting using packet capture and analysis using tools such as Wireshark.
ITIL/ITSM desired but not required.
Experience with a CAPWAP based wireless management system is required. Experience with Aerohive wireless systems is preferred.
Proven experience in setting up new site networks, including racking, installing, configuring LAN/WAN/VoIP hardware/circuits, testing/troubleshooting network connectivity/performance and documentation.
Experience with SolarWinds monitoring/management products or other monitoring systems greatly desired.
Trimble Navigation Limited is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D.

text:
Description:
Title: Network Engineer Location: Blacksburg, VA
Clearance Requirement: Eligibility for a Government Public Trust (SF-85) background investigation (US Citizenship required) Who Are We?
1901 Group prides itself on looking ahead of our competitors for the next wave of IT trends. We provide our employees with training and development opportunities, preparing them for upcoming technical challenges. With primary office locations in Blacksburg and Reston, VA, our teams support customers from across the United States. Our innovative IT As-A Service delivery model is supported by industry certifications that ensure quality and efficient IT solutions. We are transforming the delivery of IT services through the use of enterprise managed services that leverage the cloud to securely monitor, manage, and optimize complex IT environments.
The history of automation is what inspired the name of our company. 1901 was the year that another disruptive technology changed the world: the assembly line. Leveraging skills and materials in an efficient manner within a repeatable process that quadrupled output applies to IT services today. Who We Need: * Highly experienced professional who can work well with customers while addressing day to day operations, support, and management of their network infrastructure
Organized technician who can work with onsite customers to document and map their network infrastructure and communicate back with the 1901 Group Enterprise IT Operations Center (EITOC).
Essential member of a team focused on the design, installation, day to day operation of enterprise networks
Seasoned troubleshooter who can ask good questions and research alternative solutions
Proactive mind that steps toward the next task, understanding the impact to customer operations and company metrics.
Engaged personality, providing feedback to management to improve efficiency and effectiveness. What You'll Spend Most of Your Time Doing * First 90-Days
Complete internal training and support 1901 Group infrastructure operations
Enter clearance process for key customers and support structures
Support internal documentation
First 6-Months
Engage with customer environments, supporting 1901 Group onboarding and transition to EITOC
Mature capabilities using team toolsets and processes
Improve and support security and process audits
At the end of your first year with 1901
Develop strong operational picture of supported environments
Integrate into team tasking and establish your contributions
Assess future training and clearances to maintain career growth As a Network Engineer, you will: * Integrate compute, storage, security, and cloud access into network architectures
Work hand-in-hand with customers to refine and finalize designs
Mentor junior staff in skill development in network engineering and design
Work with company management developing solutions for future customer engagements, including meeting with potential customers to understand requirements and develop solutions
Assist with the development of proposals and white papers describing potential solutions
Troubleshoot complex network issues and assist with the development of solutions
Perform incident analysis to determine possible cause and potential fix Are You: * Bringing 6+ years of experience in Networking, able to offer both a strong knowledge of networking as well as practical application?
Experienced in customer communications, engaging key stakeholders and identifying critical information?
Certified in any of Cisco's certification programs, such as CCNP?
Eager for new opportunity and willing to put in the time and effort take advantage of it?
Self-motivated in pursuing new issues and driving them to resolution?
Familiar with ticketing systems and the value of good documentation?
Understanding essential networking concepts around LAN / WAN Optimization, IPV4/IPV6, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, Carrier Services, MPLS, Network monitoring tools, DNS, DHCP and Equipment vendors such as Cisco and Fortigate?
Able to train team members to support network issues?
Able to configure and manage Firewalls?
Able to configure data/voice VLANs, as well as supporting LAN/WAN cabling and connections?
Able to estimate level of effort, request quotes, and support Statement of Work documentation for potential clients?
Familiar with cloud networking through providers such as AWS or Azure?
A US Citizen who can obtain a public trust clearance? Successful Traits in this Role include:
Enjoys technology
Not satisfied with good enough
Likes to work with motivated and gifted team
Collaborates well
Engaging problem solver Minimum Essential Functions: * Occasional travel to customer sites, including overnight travel
Flexible schedule to support necessary off-hours maintenance and upgrades
Support on-call rotation
Ability to use necessary equipment to execute primary job functions (long term computer use, etc.)
Assessing risk of specific issues and escalating to management for support in a timely manner. Why 1901 Group is a Great Place to Work Benefits:
The health and happiness of our employees and their families is our top priority. That's why we offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package to help you and your loved ones feel secure. We strive to create the best experience for you, so you can continue doing the things you love. The following represents an overview of our offerings: Health & Wellness * 1901 Group offers above-industry standard, high-quality medical, pharmacy, dental and vision plans. A single carrier supports our offerings of two medical, two dental and a single, comprehensive vision plan.
Two Telehealth/Telemedicine services as part of the medical plan, allowing you to get the care you need - including most prescriptions - for a wide range of minor conditions. Flexible Payment Options via Pretax Deductions * Health Savings Account (HSA)
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account
Limited Purpose Flexible Spending Account Paid Time Off * Generous leave options to include: vacation, sick leave, all major and federal holidays, jury duty, bereavement, military leave, maternity, and paternity leave. Retirement Savings * Pre-tax and Roth 401(k) Savings Programs with company match Coverage for the Unexpected or "Just in Case" Moments * Two Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs)
Company-paid Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
Company-paid Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance for Employees, Spouses, and Children Our Focus on Professional & Team Growth:
At 1901 Group we empower our employees with exponential career development and growth opportunities by utilizing a more modern form of employee assessment - quarterly reviews. We put our employees in the driver's seat of their evaluation process - and their development. Learning and development is offered through a variety of platforms, designed to satisfy different learners at different stages within their careers. Employee-Driven Performance Management & Learning
We support a philosophy and approach where "Everyone Learns". Whether it be via online training or domain specific classroom & instructor lead training - we anticipate our employees will constantly seek out new ways to improve themselves - personally and professionally. OTHER CONSIDERATIONS:
Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation. Individual's primary workstation is located in an office area with overhead lighting. The noise level in this environment is low to moderate. Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc. Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of time.
This position profile incorporates the core responsibilities of the job. It is recognized that other related duties not specifically mentioned may also be performed, and that not all responsibilities may be carried out depending on operational needs. Nothing in this profile restricts management's rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
1901 Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer

text:
This technology giant is seeking an experienced IT Network Engineer with a broad skill set to join their talented team on a long-term basis.
Sydney
Network Engineer
This technology giant is seeking an experienced Engineer with a broad skill set to join their talented team on a long-term basis.
Responsibilities and required experience
WAFs, Routing, Switching, Multi-Tier Applications
Knowledge of common networking concepts with a thorough understanding of Ethernet, IP (IPv6 and IPv6), TCP, and UDP.
In-depth knowledge of the HTTP protocol and related technologies, such as HTML, XML, JSON, AJAX, and JavaScript.
Working knowledge of Linux, UNIX, and Windows variants.
Working knowledge of cryptographic concepts and implementations (OpenSSL, DNSSEC, SSL, PKI, IKE).
Working knowledge of AAA related technologies: Active Directory (AD), LDAP, NTLM, Kerberos, SAML, RADIUS, DIAMETER, and TACACS.
VPN and tunneling technologies: IPsec, SSL, PPTP, GRE, MPLS.
GateD, ZebOS, Named, BIND, SSH daemons and clients, tcpdump, snoop, ethereal/Wireshark and other packet sniffing software or products.
IIS, Apache, WebSphere, WebLogic, Oracle or similar web and application platforms.
Scripting and development experience in F5 iRules and other technologies such asUnix Shell, Perl, Python, C, C++, C#.
Scripting and development experience in web technologies such as: Java, JSP, PHP, .NET.
Security certifications (OSCP, OSWE, GIAC, CISSP, Security+, etc), preferred
Experience with risk identification, analysis/assessment, auditing, and mitigation; including PCI Compliance experience, preferred
BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience.
At least 3 years' experience in customer-facing positions as a professional services consultant or engineer.
Self-starter and able to work independently, while also able to share responsibilities, ideas and other information.
Proven experience to work as part of a team of Engineers and to deliver one or several projects simultaneously.
Demonstrated ability to articulate and transfer complex ideas to a wide audience through both verbal and written communication.
Self-motivated and adaptable to changing environments.
Demonstrated strong written communication, presentation writing, and project scoping and technical documentation skills.
Experience managing multiple concurrent network and security projects
Must be able to read, write and speak English and local language fluently, including technical concepts and terminology.
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a talented team.
To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Michael Waters on 02 94645704. Please quote our job reference number: 200165126.
Reference Number: 200165126_1
Contact Details:
