text:
Description:
Title: Network Engineer Location: Blacksburg, VA
Clearance Requirement: Eligibility for a Government Public Trust (SF-85) background investigation (US Citizenship required) Who Are We?
1901 Group prides itself on looking ahead of our competitors for the next wave of IT trends. We provide our employees with training and development opportunities, preparing them for upcoming technical challenges. With primary office locations in Blacksburg and Reston, VA, our teams support customers from across the United States. Our innovative IT As-A Service delivery model is supported by industry certifications that ensure quality and efficient IT solutions. We are transforming the delivery of IT services through the use of enterprise managed services that leverage the cloud to securely monitor, manage, and optimize complex IT environments.
The history of automation is what inspired the name of our company. 1901 was the year that another disruptive technology changed the world: the assembly line. Leveraging skills and materials in an efficient manner within a repeatable process that quadrupled output applies to IT services today. Who We Need: * Highly experienced professional who can work well with customers while addressing day to day operations, support, and management of their network infrastructure
Organized technician who can work with onsite customers to document and map their network infrastructure and communicate back with the 1901 Group Enterprise IT Operations Center (EITOC).
Essential member of a team focused on the design, installation, day to day operation of enterprise networks
Seasoned troubleshooter who can ask good questions and research alternative solutions
Proactive mind that steps toward the next task, understanding the impact to customer operations and company metrics.
Engaged personality, providing feedback to management to improve efficiency and effectiveness. What You'll Spend Most of Your Time Doing * First 90-Days
Complete internal training and support 1901 Group infrastructure operations
Enter clearance process for key customers and support structures
Support internal documentation
First 6-Months
Engage with customer environments, supporting 1901 Group onboarding and transition to EITOC
Mature capabilities using team toolsets and processes
Improve and support security and process audits
At the end of your first year with 1901
Develop strong operational picture of supported environments
Integrate into team tasking and establish your contributions
Assess future training and clearances to maintain career growth As a Network Engineer, you will: * Integrate compute, storage, security, and cloud access into network architectures
Work hand-in-hand with customers to refine and finalize designs
Mentor junior staff in skill development in network engineering and design
Work with company management developing solutions for future customer engagements, including meeting with potential customers to understand requirements and develop solutions
Assist with the development of proposals and white papers describing potential solutions
Troubleshoot complex network issues and assist with the development of solutions
Perform incident analysis to determine possible cause and potential fix Are You: * Bringing 6+ years of experience in Networking, able to offer both a strong knowledge of networking as well as practical application?
Experienced in customer communications, engaging key stakeholders and identifying critical information?
Certified in any of Cisco's certification programs, such as CCNP?
Eager for new opportunity and willing to put in the time and effort take advantage of it?
Self-motivated in pursuing new issues and driving them to resolution?
Familiar with ticketing systems and the value of good documentation?
Understanding essential networking concepts around LAN / WAN Optimization, IPV4/IPV6, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, Carrier Services, MPLS, Network monitoring tools, DNS, DHCP and Equipment vendors such as Cisco and Fortigate?
Able to train team members to support network issues?
Able to configure and manage Firewalls?
Able to configure data/voice VLANs, as well as supporting LAN/WAN cabling and connections?
Able to estimate level of effort, request quotes, and support Statement of Work documentation for potential clients?
Familiar with cloud networking through providers such as AWS or Azure?
A US Citizen who can obtain a public trust clearance? Successful Traits in this Role include:
Enjoys technology
Not satisfied with good enough
Likes to work with motivated and gifted team
Collaborates well
Engaging problem solver Minimum Essential Functions: * Occasional travel to customer sites, including overnight travel
Flexible schedule to support necessary off-hours maintenance and upgrades
Support on-call rotation
Ability to use necessary equipment to execute primary job functions (long term computer use, etc.)
Assessing risk of specific issues and escalating to management for support in a timely manner. Why 1901 Group is a Great Place to Work Benefits:
The health and happiness of our employees and their families is our top priority. That's why we offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package to help you and your loved ones feel secure. We strive to create the best experience for you, so you can continue doing the things you love. The following represents an overview of our offerings: Health & Wellness * 1901 Group offers above-industry standard, high-quality medical, pharmacy, dental and vision plans. A single carrier supports our offerings of two medical, two dental and a single, comprehensive vision plan.
Two Telehealth/Telemedicine services as part of the medical plan, allowing you to get the care you need - including most prescriptions - for a wide range of minor conditions. Flexible Payment Options via Pretax Deductions * Health Savings Account (HSA)
Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account
Limited Purpose Flexible Spending Account Paid Time Off * Generous leave options to include: vacation, sick leave, all major and federal holidays, jury duty, bereavement, military leave, maternity, and paternity leave. Retirement Savings * Pre-tax and Roth 401(k) Savings Programs with company match Coverage for the Unexpected or "Just in Case" Moments * Two Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs)
Company-paid Life and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
Company-paid Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance for Employees, Spouses, and Children Our Focus on Professional & Team Growth:
At 1901 Group we empower our employees with exponential career development and growth opportunities by utilizing a more modern form of employee assessment - quarterly reviews. We put our employees in the driver's seat of their evaluation process - and their development. Learning and development is offered through a variety of platforms, designed to satisfy different learners at different stages within their careers. Employee-Driven Performance Management & Learning
We support a philosophy and approach where "Everyone Learns". Whether it be via online training or domain specific classroom & instructor lead training - we anticipate our employees will constantly seek out new ways to improve themselves - personally and professionally. OTHER CONSIDERATIONS:
Selected applicants will be subject to a background investigation. Individual's primary workstation is located in an office area with overhead lighting. The noise level in this environment is low to moderate. Regularly required to sit for extended periods up to 80% of time; frequently required to move about to access file cabinets and use office equipment such as PC, copier, fax, telephone, cell phone, etc. Occasionally required to reach overhead, bend, and lift objects of up to 10 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include use of computer monitor screens up to 80% of time.
This position profile incorporates the core responsibilities of the job. It is recognized that other related duties not specifically mentioned may also be performed, and that not all responsibilities may be carried out depending on operational needs. Nothing in this profile restricts management's rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
1901 Group is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer
1901 Group is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. 1901 Group "Contingent" offers for employment may stipulate that one or more requirements be satisfied before final commitment between candidate and 1901 Group is established; namely, award of contract to the 1901 Group. Contingent requirements vary and may also include, but not be limited to additional factors (i.e., the position still being available after negotiations with the Government; final approval of your qualifications by the Government; or ability to successfully acquire and/or transfer a DoD security clearance) U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

text:
Description
Under general direction of the Technical Services Manager, install, administer and support the District's voice and data network infrastructure and related components. Provide supervision and technical leadership to Network engineer(s) in the day to day operational support and planning of changes/upgrades to the Lan/Wan network environment,
PLEASE NOTE: This position DOES NOT INCLUDE remote work. All positions, at MSD, are considered essential positions and required to be onsite. Safety protocols, related to the current COVID-19 pandemic, are being strictly followed in accordance with the most current guidelines from authorities.
Examples of Duties
Essential Functions:
Provide supervision of Network support staff in the day to day administration and support of the Lan/Wan network environment.
Coordinate and Interface with Network Managed Services providers for network projects.
Collaborate with IT Architect and IT Program managers and develop plans to ensure that the network infrastructure is available, reliable, and scalable to meet current and future business demands.
Prioritize and respond to new work requests related to projects, break fix, and new technology installations. Delegate to team members to meet established service levels.
Ensure and maintain network connectivity of all servers, workstations, voice equipment, and other network appliances and work with other IT personnel to troubleshoot and resolve incidents.
Develop and maintain processes and procedures required for network administration, configuration, usage, vulnerability, security, and recovery.
Maintain network assets per recommended maintenance patches and security updates and maintain network inventory with new and/or retired asset information.
Proactively monitor network performance to ensure performance results comply with established metrics.
Additional Responsibilities: Assist in preparation and critique of purchase requisitions of related communications and equipment from user departments; provide information and communications technology consulting and support to the IT staff and user departments; prepare yearly performance appraisals of assigned staff; and coordinate technical project assignment as needed.
Minimum Qualifications
Training and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology (or related field), or equivalent years of experience and education. Five or more years of experience in a network technical role supporting and configuring network technology. At least three years of this experience should be in a senior level support position. Professional certification ((e.g. Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE)) is also highly desirable.
Knowledge. Skills and Abilities: Knowledge and skills in Lan/Wan technologies, network security principles, and general network management best practices. Excellent knowledge of Cisco data and voice networks. Experience troubleshooting network performance issues and performing root cause analysis. Effective skills in the area of project management and working with network managed service providers to complete infrastructure projects. Ability to communicate effectively both in oral and written form. Ability to take initiative and perform job functions with minimal supervision.
Additional Information
Must possess a valid driver's license issued by the state in which the employee resides.
Pursuant to MSD's "Substance Abuse Policy and Procedures," this position has been designated as safety sensitive and candidate must pass a Non-D.O.T. Drug Test for this position. Employees occupying this position are not subject to Federal (D.O.T.) Drug and Alcohol Testing Regulations.
Employees of MSD must have a meets expectations.
title: Network Engineer Supervisor

name: Senior Network Engineer-2 ( Work at Home / Remote / Virtual eligible )
summary: **Description** The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and...
text:
**Description** The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to more complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. **Responsibilities** Humana is seeking a Senior Network Engineer who will deliver solutions for the future underlay fabric for the enterprise. This is an exciting opportunity for forward-looking technology leaders to make key contributions to the evolution and transformation of the company's networks toward next-generation technologies. This is a critical role within Humana's IT organization responsible for the engineering and design, planning, implementation, and establishment of operational and maintenance programs to deliver best-in-class next generation network infrastructure. This includes optimizing all aspects of network eco-system, including performance, resiliency, availability, resource utilization and innovation. This person will provide network design, engineering and administrative support of both physical and virtual networking devices within our SDI environments. This person will be responsible for leveraging state-of-the-art networking technologies, including virtualization and software-defined networking (SDN), to develop and deliver a robust, scalable, network eco-system. He/she will work with various leaders across the enterprise to coordinate network solutions to meet challenges of technology, regulatory, security, and competitive conditions. The scope will include the following areas of concentration: + Network fabric for the internal Data Centers / Private Cloud platforms supporting multiple software defined network overlay technologies; + Planning, designing, and deploying new LAN/WAN network infrastructure and connectivity for managed services environment. + Overseeing and performing administration, configuration, and monitoring of all network equipment (switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, VPN concentrators, etc.). + Remote Access VPN solutions (Aruba, Cisco AnyConnect and Aruba) + Support the elimination of existing datacenter dependencies to enable cloud/fastest-path access (i.e. VPN, Web Proxy, etc...) + End-User device connectivity architecture & implementations + Connectivity solutions for supporting a hybrid cloud strategy; + Remote site and campus network technology to support SDWAN and SD-LAN implementations; + Internal company wireless connectivity; + WAN circuit topology and telco/carrier technical integration; + Remote user network end-point technology. Engineering responsibilities for these areas of concentration include, but are not limited: + Design for new solutions; + Standard solution configuration; + Technology roadmap development, management, and maintenance; + Documenting and updating all network infrastructure and supported business processes. + Capacity and performance planning; + Integration with related infrastructure engineering efforts; + Alignment and integration with information security requirements; + Definition and development of operational KPIs and metrics; + Disaster recovery/business continuity integration; + Continuous knowledge and skills improvement + Assist in motivating and growing the Network Engineering team to its next level of maturity, agility (NetDevOps) and scalability. Help build foundation and help define capabilities and processes to address network needs in tactical and strategic terms. Required Qualifications: + BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field + Network engineering certification such as CCNA through CCIE or the equivalent + 8+ years of technical network engineering experience, and 3+ years of project leadership experience + 5+ years of Layer 2/ Layer 3 network architectural design (LAN/WAN/VPN) and engineering experience + 5+ years of experience working with MPLS, BGP, OSPF, and other LAN/WAN technologies + 5+ years of 802.11 wireless infrastructure and administration + 5+ years of experience architecting large-scale wireless network infrastructure, with advanced experience designing carrier-grade WiFi + Strong understanding and support of 4G, LTE, 5G network deployments across remote sites + Strong experience supporting large-scale datacenters and remote sites + Strong experience with end-user device connectivity architecture & implementations (i.e. IoT, iPads, etc...) + Experience with Cisco networking equipment + Experience in VPN technologies + Knowledge of QoS and network security functions (firewalls, VPN, IPS, etc) + Ability to manage complex multi-organizational projects + Experience with implementing and operating a software-defined network environment (VXLAN, EVPN, etc.) + Vendor management skills (hardware/software security vendors as well as third party vendors) Preferred Qualifications: + Programminging languages and frameworks knowledge and experience, in support of automation (Python, Ansible, etc.) + Familiarity with cloud architecture network designs, implementations, and support (AWS, Azure, GCP) + Data Center infrastructure solutions: Cisco (R&S), F5 (LTM, APM, ASM), Palo Alto (NGFW + IDS/IPS functions), Infoblox (DDI), Citrix Netscaler (VDI), Cisco ISE and ACS campus LAN and WLAN solutions, also implemented on Cisco products, network segmentation and access control in remote offices + Experience with Arista, VMware NSX-T, and other SDN technologies + Experience architecting and implementing large-scale SD-WAN solutions + Demonstrated experience with DevOps, ITIL, and platform process & technology + Master's Degree in a Technical Field **Required Qualifications** + Bachelor's degree + 5 or more years of technical experience + Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences **Preferred Qualifications** **Additional Information** **\#Cloud** **\#LI-remote** **Scheduled Weekly Hours** 40 <>

name: IT Senior Network Engineer
summary:
Position title: IT Senior Network Engineer
Position #: 126160
Provides network design, research, im...
text:
Position title: IT Senior Network Engineer
Position #: 126160
Provides network design, research, implementation, and escalation support to the optical/switched/routed layers of the MAX regional network and enhanced services. Functions include engineering and operations planning, design, costing, procuring, and implementation of current and next-generation infrastructures including hands-on maintenance and support for DWDM optical equipment, dark fiber, routers, switches and physical plant. Additionally, the position will involve architecture of the MAX ScienceDMZ facility and integrating forward looking technologies of the MAX research infrastructure into production offerings. This position also provides network design, guidance, and implementation assistance for the Internet’s “D” Root Server with 221 nodes in over 59 countries. The position requires national and international collaborations which includes travel.
Minimum qualifications
Education:
Bachelor of Science degree required, preferably in Telecommunications, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or closely related field.
Experience:
At least 10-15 years experience supporting large high performance networks.
Experience in commercial or research/academic environments is desirable.
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
-Deep understanding of core networking design and implementation over the WAN.
-Experience designing scalable networks that can sustain growth over time in both quantity of links and link capacity at speeds up to and including 100 Gbps.
-Experience operating and troubleshooting WAN circuits and IP routing/BGP networks.
-Experience with comparing different vendor products to analyze and select next generation platforms for
research and deployment.
-Experience in specifying and characterizing dark fiber characteristics for WAN links over DWDM.
-Experience in migrating production networks to new equipment with minimal disruption to services.
-Excellent verbal and written English skills to communicate on technical issues.
-IP routing protocols to include: OSPF, BGP4, multicast (PIM & SSM), MPLS (L2 and L3 VPNs).
-IPv4 and IPv6 experience.
Preferences
Desired Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
-Equipment used: Juniper MX960 routers. DWDM optical equipment from Fujitsu. Optical test equipment from EXFO and Digital Lightwave. Fiber fusion splicer, fiber microscope, and light meter.
-Experience with -48VDC power systems
Additional information: this position does not provide sponsorship for visas.
Physical demands: handling heavy equipment: Must be able to lift 60 pounds. Working with equipment using laser technology
Best consideration date: 03/29/2021 or open until filled
Please apply at:
EOE/AA

text:
Overview/ Job Responsibilities
The Mobility Network Engineer II will work in a Customs & Border Protection’s (CBP) Enterprise Network Architecture & Engineering support services contract (ENAESS) on client site in Springfield VA.
Success in this position requires experience with Mobile Device Management (MDM) user support and issue resolution with working experience in supporting Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) on large scale Enterprise customers with proven delivery in supporting, maintaining, and troubleshooting “complex” Airwatch or equivalent MDM systems.
Job Responsibilities:
Working on a team consisting of Network Architects & Engineers supporting the CBP network, the Mobility Network Engineer II must have the ability to:
Resolve customer’s issues via the telephone, email or Webex session
Reproducing issues in-house and responding back in a timely manner.
Regular follow ups with customers with recommendations, updates and action plans.
Escalate issues in a timely manner according to Standard Operating Procedures.
Leverage internal technical expertise, including peers, mentors, knowledge base, community forums and other internal tools, to provide the most effective solutions to customer issues.
Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions.
Support, maintain and troubleshoot Airwatch systems
Support the design and implementation of complex MDM solutions
Address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues
Support of all updates to all documents when there is change in the transport design and/or technologies and collaborating with all stakeholders to test all related systems and processes to verify that the systems meet requirements and can host applications with no degradation to performance or security
Provide network administration support: firewalls, general network infrastructure and security fundamentals, VPN, DNS
Follow and perform ITIL Incident, problem and requirements management
Develop and implement test strategies and documents results
Provides documentation, guidance and training to end-users as needed
Receive mentoring for MDM Airwatch solutions design and implementation by solutions architect
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related degree; Without a degree a H.S. Diploma required and 12-14 additional years of relevant work experience.
8-10 years’ work Experience as a System Administrator – supporting, maintaining, and troubleshooting MDM systems AND Smart Devices (Apple, Android devices like tablet and smart phone, Windows iOS, etc.
Strong understanding of servers & configuration & maintenance: Windows Server 2008 / 2003 / 2013, Exchange, 0365, Azure AD, Active Directory, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache), Linux Forms (Ubuntu, Fedora, Red Hat, Photon, Open Suse), other mail systems, web certifications such as SSL and IIS
Strong knowledge of ITIL and Security Administration experience: Authentication, Certificate system, etc.
Technical Certifications or demonstrable experience in in one or more MDM Products (AirWatch, MobileIron, XenMobile, Symantec MDM, Good Tech)
MS-SQL, Mail Server – Added Advantage
Wireless hardware, networks and respective components
Client Server architecture
Experience with server configuration a plus: Windows Server 2008 / 2003, Linux Forms, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache)
Exchange 2010/2013/O365 or Google apps for business
Seeking candidate who can mentor, teach and grow a small team from within to support growing customer requirements
Must have great communication and documentation skills
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and be a self-starter
Eligibility/Clearance Requirements: Must be able to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship
Desired Qualifications
Microsoft Intune a plus
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st preference
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret or Secret - 2nd preference
DoD Secret or Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd preference (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated)
About Sev1Tech LLC
Founded in 2010, Sev1Tech provides IT, engineering, and program management solutions delivery. Sev1Tech focuses on providing program and IT support services to critical missions across Federal and Commercial Clients. Our Mission is to Build better companies. Enable better government. Protect our nation. Build better humans across the country.
Join the Sev1Tech family where you can achieve great accomplishments while fostering a satisfying and rewarding career progression. Please apply directly through the website at: #joinSev1tech

name: Tier 3 Network Engineer - Senior (Government)
requirements: Advanced networking qualifications including MPLS, BGP, OSPF, LAMBDA. LAN/MAN/WAN/Optical specialization
summary: AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutio...
tasks: Provide Tier 3 support to the Network Operations Center (NOC),Supports an organization's local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), customer networks, Intranet and Internet and other data communications systems or a segment of a network system,Monitor network to ensure network availability to all system users and perform necessary maintenance to support network availability,Maintain network hardware and software,Proactively identify risks in the network and develop a plan to mitigate them
text:
AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Intelligence Community. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers mission
Our National Security Team supports the intelligence community, providing, operating and assuring critical voice, video and collaboration services for the full spectrum of operations.
AT&T has an opening for a Tier 3 Network Engineer - To support the 24x7 Network Operations Center in providing Tier 3 network service and superior troubleshooting expertise.
Description of Job Duties/Responsibilities:
Provide Tier 3 support to the Network Operations Center (NOC)
Supports an organization's local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), customer networks, Intranet and Internet and other data communications systems or a segment of a network system
Monitor network to ensure network availability to all system users and perform necessary maintenance to support network availability
Maintain network hardware and software
Proactively identify risks in the network and develop a plan to mitigate them
Supports numerous business requirements for telecommunications (e.g., LAN, MAN, WAN, Voice and Video)
Required Clearance: TSSCI with Polygraph. (#polygraph)
This position requires ability to satisfy a government administered high risk screening.
Required Qualifications/Certifications: Candidate must have a total of 10 years of applicable experience. The experience can be a combination of degree and work history. This can be a High School degree and 10 years of work history OR an Associates and 8 years, a Bachelors and 6 years, a Masters and 4 years or a PhD and 0 years of work history.
Advanced networking qualifications including MPLS, BGP, OSPF, LAMBDA. LAN/MAN/WAN/Optical specialization
Utilization of common ticket systems (Remedy, ServiceNow) and common network management tools (HPOV, HPNA, Solarwinds, MNS, Netcool, etc)
Must have hands on troubleshooting and fault isolation of IT business systems
Must have a strong understanding of the OSI model and configuration of routing protocols such as EIGRP, OSPF, MPLS, BGP, LDP
Desired Qualifications/Certifications: Cisco CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, Juniper JNCIA, JNCIS, or JNCIE, ITIL Foundations, and/or CISSP
AT&T will consider for employment qualified applicants in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state and local laws.
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

System Integration Engineer
Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?
Do you like working in collaborative teams and solving critical issues?
Baker Hughes Bently Nevada offers a plant-wide, holistic suite of machine condition monitoring and protection hardware, software and services that help achieve the highest level of asset reliability possible. Our solutions for pre-commissioning, commissioning, and maintenance shutdowns include specialized services for Oil & Gas, power generation and other process industries.
Partner with the best
You will be responsible for all resources, and logistics required to perform services and maintenance activities on customers' site/property. These activities contribute to, maintain, repair and refurbish sold or existing products. Includes all types of maintenance service (preventive and remedial), manage maintenance facilities and field services engineering. Contributes to the development of an operational year plan for own department activities of the team. Suggests improvements in products, processes, and procedures.
As a Services Specialist - Commissioning, you will be responsible for:
Installing, configuring, troubleshooting client application solutions
Designing and implementing secure integration solutions that meet customers' expectations
Analyzing, quantifying, and reporting security vulnerability risks
Measuring integration solutions' effectiveness and performance from customers' perspective
Staying abreast of new technologies and best practices and translate these factors into product solutions and services
Providing system integration and digital security support to regional service teams (for applications such as Fleet, SmartSignal, Meridium, and future Predix solutions)
Providing commercial and technical support to regional ITO and OTR teams
Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will:
5+ years' experience working with industrial automation systems
Bachelor's Degree or Associates Degree in Technology, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
Strong understanding of DCS, ICSS, SCADA systems communications.
Strong understanding of TCP/IP network security and design
Strong understanding of the systems development lifecycle
Ability to travel up to 80% time
Availability to travel on short notice
Work in a way that works for you

Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

summary:
Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?
Smart, driven and want to make a difference ...
tasks: Work with a geographically diverse set of technical teams to design and implement telecommunications solutions for Commercial client network connectivity for Visa’s issuers/banks and merchants/acquirers,Serve as liaison between Visa’s Global Network Engineering team and Visa’s Client Services (account and implementation teams) regarding technical design requirements and circuit delivery status,Manage end-to-end circuit deployment process with the telecommunications carriers, including the project management of service delivery,Responsible for assuring quality, timeliness, best-cost, and path diversity for all sites
text:
Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?
Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world?
You’ll fit right in.
Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.
Think you know us?
Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.
Individuality fuels our brand and our global team – we’re proud that we are a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Therefore, we understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office, whether it’s taking advantage of agile work schedules or our wellness programs, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone. In addition, we offer market leading salary and have a fantastic benefits offering.
So, if you’re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness.
If you think you could support Visa as a Lead Network Engineer, we want to hear from you – together, let’s make Visa a great place to work.
What’s it all about?
In the role of Network Support Senior Manager – Commercial WAN, deploying global carrier services and supports requests for Merchant Acquirer and Issuer Processing Clients for lifecycle (MACD) WAN connectivity support of Europe Commercial Network. This role requires supporting availability and service improvement projects. Also, required are reliability by design diversity to assure optimal redundancy in the local access and carrier networks.
What we expect of you, day to day.
Work with a geographically diverse set of technical teams to design and implement telecommunications solutions for Commercial client network connectivity for Visa’s issuers/banks and merchants/acquirers
Serve as liaison between Visa’s Global Network Engineering team and Visa’s Client Services (account and implementation teams) regarding technical design requirements and circuit delivery status
Manage end-to-end circuit deployment process with the telecommunications carriers, including the project management of service delivery
Responsible for assuring quality, timeliness, best-cost, and path diversity for all sites
Serve as an internal consultant within the Network Engineering and Operations organisation to collaborate with engineers and architects to analyse opportunities to improve network availability, service delivery timelines, and cost across the WAN
This is an opportunity to serve in a key role within a fast-paced, dynamic technology organisation and collaborate with world-class engineers across multiple disciplines. You will be part of an extraordinarily talented engineering team that is passionate about the technology they use and the products that they deliver. If you are a talented technical mind with a keen ability to see and implement innovative solutions, then Visa is everywhere you want to be.
What we’re after…
Extensive experience in infrastructure/network environments and designing, planning, documenting, and implementing networks using latest technology
Bachelor's degree (required) and preferably in Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Systems is preferred
Solid understanding of network WAN technologies (MPLS, Ethernet, Single and Multi- mode fiber) and have experience with the telco circuit provisioning process and service delivery life-cycle
Preference to extensive experience working for/with telecommunications carriers in a circuit design/delivery role
Strong project management skills (PMP is a plus)
Solid engineering knowledge of network hardware, specifically Cisco routers and switches
Understanding of TCP/IP and BGP network protocols, including common application protocols
Experience in high-availability networks in load-balanced, n-tier application environments
Self-sufficient with the ability to make engineering decisions within the documented configuration requirements and control processes
Must be able to communicate and work effectively with implementation teams, customer relations, and internal/external customers to engineer solutions to meet the needs of all stakeholders
Advanced process orientation and exhibited planning, organizational, and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal, facilitation, and leadership skills along with effective communication (both written and verbal in English) skills
Expert level vendor network certification
Network Security experience
The Following are not required but considered a plus:
PCCNA or CCNP Routing and Switching certification
Think you have what it takes?
If you are interested in a career that will challenge and inspire you – we’d love to hear from you!
Diversity & Inclusion
Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back.
By leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our worldwide teams, Visa is a better place to work and a better business partner to our clients.

text:
Requisition ID: 20026100
Category: Information Technology
Location: Dulles
US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes
Clearance Type: Top Secret
Telecommute: No –Teleworking not available for this position
Shift: 1st Shift
Travel Required: Yes, 10 % of the Time
Positions Available: 1
Embark on a career putting innovative, reliable, and agile products and ideas into orbit, and beyond. Northrop Grumman has opportunities waiting for you that play a vital role in human space exploration, national defense, and scientific discovery, supporting multiple programs across the universe. With us, you’ll discover a culture of curiosity and collaboration that will have you Defining Possible from the day you start. Our space systems connect and protect millions of people on earth every day, now and for the future. Explore your future and launch your career today.
Northrop Grumman Space designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation-related systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and related propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures.
The Tactical Space Systems Group is seeking a mid to senior Network Engineer with an in-depth understanding of systems and network operations centers. Successful candidates are schedule driven and data driven with the ability to simultaneously focus on short term objectives and long term imperatives. The have a “can-do” attitude, are solutions oriented, high energy, problem solvers, information and team integrators, decisive, and closure-drivers.
Responsibilities May Include:
Design and plans network communications systems.
Provide specifications and detailed schematics for network architecture.
Provide specific detailed information for hardware and software selection, implementation techniques and tools for the most efficient solution to meet business needs, including present and future capacity requirements.
Conduct testing of network design.
Maintain System configuration control over SW/HW
Version/configurations (network/computing/applications, automated environment creation.
Maintain technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, multiplexers, firewalls, hubs, bridges, gateways, etc.
Evaluate and reports on new communications technologies to enhance capabilities of the network.
Writing program specific ground ICDs per program.
System monitoring configuration/sustainment (Nagios).
Utilize sound engineering practices to develop, implement, and maintain end-to-end ground systems.
Manage the requirements, design, and implementation for networks and End-to-End systems to Support Mission Operations, existing ground systems and upgrades - technology refresh, and reliability / maintainability.
Contribute to system PDR/CDR/FAT/SAT activities.
Product Deliveries include: ICDs, Emulator/Simulator baseline control, test plans, network diagrams, integration/deployment work instructions, production and test system hardware (e.g. networks).
Must work collaboratively in a team environment across engineering disciplines to accomplish mission goals.
Coordinating end-to-end system testing during the I&T phase
Segment end-to-end architecture design, requirements, management and development.
Must excel in a fast-paced mission focused environment.
NoVASpace
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineer, Math or related area) and 9+ years of experience, Master’s Degree and 7+ years; 4 Years with PhD; 4 years of additional experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
Active or current Top Secret SSBI clearance with SCI eligibility.
Must have experience designing, developing, building, testing and maintaining network and computing infrastructure.
Must have experience identifying systems anomalies and troubleshooting (network/custom applications/COTS software/server infrastructure).
Must have knowledge of virtualization sustainment/maintenance.
Must have hands-on experience with Networks to include technology such as: switches/routers/firewalls; RF appliances: modems, spectrum analyzers; computing infrastructure: Servers / workstations, Linux, MS.
Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications: CompTIA Security + or equivalent Linux experience (user level) Networking (Cisco) Virtualization (vSphere ESXi)DoD Satcom Security Experience:
-Cybersecurity and IA/IS OpSec – 5205.02
-Risk Management Framework – 8510.01
Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

text:
Description - Do you thrive on working on the cutting edge? Striving to enhance platforms to improve overall performance and build best in class Networking Solutions. Work with the engineering teams during early stages of ideas, products, or platforms? Do you want to transform an industry? Work on transitions to the Cloud? Crave new challenges and solving hard customer problems using the latest in hardware and software technology? As a Sr. Network Engineering at Humana, you will use the latest technologies from proactive software solutions, automation toolsets, statistical trends providing support structure to our infrastructure and remote access base. Come help us re-imagine our solutions to provide world-class, best of breed solutions to delight our customers. Make a major impact on the future of Networking and Remote Access experience. Responsibilities The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence departments strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. Required Qualifications + 5+ years networking experience + Strong Remote Access Technology with emphasis on Aruba and Cisco AnyConnect + Overall data center networking support and strong troubleshooting in an enterprise environment Preferred Qualifications + Array Technologies desired. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and thats why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first. name: Wireless Network Engineer III
summary:
Position Summary
The Wireless Network Engineer III leads complex projects involving the planning, d...
text:
Position Summary
The Wireless Network Engineer III leads complex projects involving the planning, design, installation, and level 3 technical support of LAN/WAN data, voice and video information technology solutions with a focus on but not limited to Wireless strategies and compliance. The Wireless Network Engineer III makes decisions independently on Information Systems solutions, problems and methods. The knowledge and expertise required at this level of work usually results from progressive work experience in large enterprise or retail environments.
Responsibility Statements
Leads the planning, evaluation, testing, selection, implementation and level 3 support of:
- Wireless, Diagnostic tool and infrastructure
- Device configuration and automation
- Compliance and security validation
The Wireless Network Engineer III mentors- junior engineers on Wireless technologies, standards, methodologies, and procedures. Leads development, implementation, and maintenance of standards and documentation. Participates in developing long-term strategic, capacity and performance planning objectives and goals. Participates in network infrastructure audit activities and provides evidence as required. Leads network infrastructure compliance and security remediation activities. Coordinates efforts to isolate and resolve network and security related issues. Participates in IT and corporate-lead initiatives. Researches new technology and evaluates viability to meet or exceed business requirements and goals.
Qualifications
Required Minimum Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent work experience.
- Seven years of planning, design, and implementation experience in wireless technologies in a large enterprise retail environment.
- Implementation and troubleshooting of 802.11a/b/g/n/ac technologies in indoor and outdoor environments, including mesh
- Multi-vendor implementation, testing, and troubleshooting experience with Extreme WiNG, Aruba, and Cisco wireless infrastructures across campus and distributed environments
- Experience with RF principles, design, and troubleshooting including antenna patterns, signal propagation, and RF calculations
Working knowledge of the following:
- Strong understanding of enterprise routing/switching.
- Strong understanding of general network security. Clear understanding of RADIUS and TACACS.
- Experience with network diagnostic and performance management tools and software.
- Knowledge of IPv4 and IPv6 network transport, routing, naming, addressing, and management protocols.
- Experience supporting the on-boarding and mobility in challenging environments of end devices, including VOIP using various 802.1x EAP types
Preferred Qualifications:
Cisco Certifications (CCNP/CCDP Wireless)
Lowe's Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE- 50 home improvement company serving more than 18 million customers a week in the United States, Canada and Mexico. With fiscal year 2017 sales of $68.6 billion, Lowe's and its related businesses operate or service more than 2,390 home improvement and hardware stores and employ over 310,000 people. Founded in 1946 and based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe's supports the communities it serves through programs that focus on K-12 public education and community improvement projects. For more information, visit Lowes.com.

summary: Description The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and mea...
text:
Description The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence departments strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to more complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. Responsibilities Humana is seeking a Senior Network Engineer who will deliver solutions for the future underlay fabric for the enterprise. This is an exciting opportunity for forward-looking technology leaders to make key contributions to the evolution and transformation of the companys networks toward next-generation technologies. This is a critical role within Humanas IT organization responsible for the engineering and design, planning, implementation, and establishment of operational and maintenance programs to deliver best-in-class next generation network infrastructure. This includes optimizing all aspects of network eco-system, including performance, resiliency, availability, resource utilization and innovation. This person will provide network design, engineering and administrative support of both physical and virtual networking devices within our SDI environments. This person will be responsible for leveraging state-of-the-art networking technologies, including virtualization and software-defined networking (SDN), to develop and deliver a robust, scalable, network eco-system. He/she will work with various leaders across the enterprise to coordinate network solutions to meet challenges of technology, regulatory, security, and competitive conditions. The scope will include the following areas of concentration: + Network fabric for the internal Data Centers / Private Cloud platforms supporting multiple software defined network overlay technologies; + Planning, designing, and deploying new LAN/WAN network infrastructure and connectivity for managed services environment. + Overseeing and performing administration, configuration, and monitoring of all network equipment (switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, VPN concentrators, etc.). + Remote Access VPN solutions (Aruba, Cisco AnyConnect and Aruba) + Support the elimination of existing datacenter dependencies to enable cloud/fastest-path access (i.e. VPN, Web Proxy, etc...) + End-User device connectivity architecture & implementations + Connectivity solutions for supporting a hybrid cloud strategy; + Remote site and campus network technology to support SDWAN and SD-LAN implementations; + Internal company wireless connectivity; + WAN circuit topology and telco/carrier technical integration; + Remote user network end-point technology. Engineering responsibilities for these areas of concentration include, but are not limited: + Design for new solutions; + Standard solution configuration; + Technology roadmap development, management, and maintenance; + Documenting and updating all network infrastructure and supported business processes. + Capacity and performance planning; + Integration with related infrastructure engineering efforts; + Alignment and integration with information security requirements; + Definition and development of operational KPIs and metrics; + Disaster recovery/business continuity integration; + Continuous knowledge and skills improvement + Assist in motivating and growing the Network Engineering team to its next level of maturity, agility (NetDevOps) and scalability. Help build foundation and help define capabilities and processes to address network needs in tactical and strategic terms. Required Qualifications: + BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field + Network engineering certification such as CCNA through CCIE or the equivalent + 8+ years of technical network engineering experience, and 3+ years of project leadership experience + 5+ years of Layer 2/ Layer 3 network architectural design (LAN/WAN/VPN) and engineering experience + 5+ years of experience working with MPLS, BGP, OSPF, and other LAN/WAN technologies + 5+ years of 802.11 wireless infrastructure and administration + 5+ years of experience architecting large-scale wireless network infrastructure, with advanced experience designing carrier-grade WiFi + Strong understanding and support of 4G, LTE, 5G network deployments across remote sites + Strong experience supporting large-scale datacenters and remote sites + Strong experience with end-user device connectivity architecture & implementations (i.e. IoT, iPads, etc...) + Experience with Cisco networking equipment + Experience in VPN technologies + Knowledge of QoS and network security functions (firewalls, VPN, IPS, etc) + Ability to manage complex multi-organizational projects + Experience with implementing and operating a software-defined network environment (VXLAN, EVPN, etc.) + Vendor management skills (hardware/software security vendors as well as third party vendors) Preferred Qualifications: + Programminging languages and frameworks knowledge and experience, in support of automation (Python, Ansible, etc.) + Familiarity with cloud architecture network designs, implementations, and support (AWS, Azure, GCP) + Data Center infrastructure solutions: Cisco (R&S), F5 (LTM, APM, ASM), Palo Alto (NGFW + IDS/IPS functions), Infoblox (DDI), Citrix Netscaler (VDI), Cisco ISE and ACS campus LAN and WLAN solutions, also implemented on Cisco products, network segmentation and access control in remote offices + Experience with Arista, VMware NSX-T, and other SDN technologies + Experience architecting and implementing large-scale SD-WAN solutions + Demonstrated experience with DevOps, ITIL, and platform process & technology + Master's Degree in a Technical Field Required Qualifications + Bachelor's degree + 5 or more years of technical experience + Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences Preferred Qualifications Additional Information #cloud #LI-remote Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 About Us Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and thats why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first. text:
Description
SAIC has an immediate need for a Market title to support the NASA Integrated Communications Services (NICS) contract at NASA's Stennis Space Center in Mississippi. The NICS contract provides high quality integrated communications services for secure voice, video and data solutions and services to NASA customers worldwide. Consider adding a sentence about your group's roll on the contract or the task the candidate will be supporting.
Job Responsibilities:
Provide Tier 3 support for trouble calls related to Cisco network (wired and wireless) products
Perform wireless site surveys including use of a spectrum analyzer
Meet with customers to gather specialized networking requirements, especially related to wired and wireless networks
Develop detailed implementation plans related to network projects
Present proposals for implementation of network projects
Participation in peer reviews of implementation plans and architecture
Develop operational training for designed services
Communicate and collaborate in cross-functional teams with Network Engineering teams supporting other NASA locations
Participate in Agency working groups
Qualifications
Education and Experience:
Bachelors and nine (9) years or more experience; Masters and seven (7) years or more experience ; PhD or JD and four (4) years or more experience. Additional related experience may be considered in lieu of the Degree.
4 years of experience accepted in lieu of degree
In-depth knowledge of Cisco networking products (Cisco 3700 and 3800 series switches, Cisco 6500 series routers, 9000 series switches, Wireless LAN Controllers) and VOIP/UCS
Working knowledge of Cisco Prime, Solarwinds, CA Spectrum, StruxureWare, EXXI
Knowledge of routing protocols (OSPF, BGP)
Experience with general LAN technologies (CDP, 802.1q, 802.1x, 802.11, 802.1d, LLDP, port-security, etc.)
Excellent communication and writing skills, including developing and presenting training materials, implementation plans, and diagrams
Familiarity with the Microsoft Office Suite, including Visio and Project
Knowledge of and experience using Cisco Nexus switches (2K/5K/7K/9K) in NXOS or ACI-mode.
Knowledge of data center network design
Clearance:
Candidate must be able to obtain a Secret Clearance
Certifications / Training:
CCNA
Desired Certifications / Training:
CCNP preferred
Travel (if any):
May require < 10% travel
Overview
SAIC is a premier technology integrator solving our nation's most complex modernization and readiness challenges. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes high-end solutions in engineering, IT, and mission solutions. Using our expertise in existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions. We are 25,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has pro forma annual revenues of nearly $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For ongoing news, please visit our newsroom. For SAIC benefits information, see Working at SAIC. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

text:
Senior Network Engineer (Contractor)
Hillsboro
Oregon, United States of America
The Position
Network Engineers are responsible for project deployment and 24x7 project support of Genentech/Roche’s enterprise wired and wireless networks, Firewalls, VPNs, Enterprise Network Security, DNS/DHCP, and Load Balancers. Responsibilities include: testing, installation, configurations and proactive maintenance of a diverse set of hardware platforms (Cisco, Arista, BlueCat, Juniper, F5, Riverbed, Palo Alto). Monitors the performance of networks and their components. Analyzes equipment performance to determine the need for repair or replacement. Creates and maintains up‐to‐date documentation of network design, operation and procedures. Works with vendors in order to resolve complex network issues and ensure that system SLAs are met. Other responsibilities include installation of new network systems, project technical leadership, service management, and providing leadership and mentoring to other team members.
Responsibilities:
Design, install and configure network hardware and equipment, including routers, switches in support of NA Network services. The network engineer must configure the network infrastructure upon installation. This means the network engineer must have a working knowledge of Cisco IOS, EIGRP, BGP, OSPF and MPLS environments and they must understand how the network is currently configured in order to successfully introduce another piece of infrastructure. The network engineer must partner with Engineering on all new technology installations. The network engineer is required to review and optimize any hardware designs, specifications and configurations of any network hardware to ensure they meet customer needs and will maintain operational stability.
Additional Responsibilities include:
Plans and supports network infrastructure.
Perform troubleshooting analysis of networks and associated systems.
Monitor system capacity to determine its effect on performance and recommend enhancements to meet new or changing network demands.
Monitors system performance and implements performance tuning.
Suggests and provides network solutions to business and management problems. Ability to decipher complex network infrastructure configurations to determine if performance is optimized.
Diagnoses, troubleshoots and resolves hardware, software, or other network and system problems, and replaces defective components when necessary. Documents all networks for future reference to assist with future troubleshooting
Requirements:
Minimum of 5 years of experience working in a high availability operational environment.
Requires BA or BS or entry‐level industry certification such as CCNA or equivalent experience.
Expert knowledge of the TCP/IP protocol suite.
Working knowledge of security devices such as firewalls, proxies, and VPNs in addition to a strong understanding of authentication and data encryption.
Strong knowledge in routing theory and protocols especially with BGP and OSPF configuration.
Preferences:
Strong working knowledge of DHCP and DNS
Strong knowledge of troubleshooting methodologies as they apply to resolving complex technical network problems. Must have experience using packet capture devices for network troubleshooting.
Knowledge of wireless technologies including 802.11a/b/g/n/ac protocols, Lightweight Access Point Protocol (LWAPP), and Cisco Wireless Services Modules (WiSM).
Working knowledge of Voice‐over‐IP and IP Telephony services as well as Quality of Service (QoS) and Power over Ethernet (PoE).
Strong knowledge of Cisco Catalyst switches (6500, 4500, and 3700) and various routers in a high speed, redundant, complex, large enterprise.
Who We Are
A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.
The next step is yours. To apply today, click on the "Apply online" button.
Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page.

text:
Adaptive Solutions Group is a premier provider of information technology personnel. We provide a variety of technical professionals available for contract, contract to hire, or direct placement positions to companies in and around the St. Louis, Kansas City, and Denver Areas.
We are currently looking for an IP Network Engineer III to join our team.
Responsibilities
Provides and applies technical strategies in the design, configuration and maintenance of LAN, WAN and wireless networks to ensure the stability, integrity and operational effectiveness and efficiency of network services.
Participate with the design, purchase, installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all network hardware, software, and communication links.
Analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion and provide end user training where required.
Expected to work independently with minimal guidance and assistance with the technology supported.
Participate in the design and configuration of internal and/or external networks as required for assigned projects, assuring that requirements are met.
Translates business/customer requirements into network or process designs.
Supports network technology and configuration activities to ensure integration and alignment with other IT technology, systems, applications, and environment.
Assist in development, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network administration, usage, and disaster recovery.
Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget.
Conduct research on software and systems products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.
Identifies innovative approaches to accomplish departmental goals, while maintaining alignment and compliance with business goals, corporate IT standards, strategy, and Service Level Agreements.
Interact and negotiate with vendors, outsourcers, and contractors to secure network products and services.
Coordinates network technology and configuration activities to ensure integration and alignment with other IT technology, systems, applications, and environment.
Provides technical support and guidance (Level 3) in troubleshooting network performance issues.
Researches problems that cannot be resolved by routine procedures.
Creates troubleshooting procedures, designing resolution scripts, workflows or flowcharts.
Ensures timely resolution of problems
Practice network asset management, including maintenance of network component inventory and related documentation and technical specifications information.
Monitor and test network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports.
Participate in managing all network security solutions.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’ s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field
4 years network engineering experience.
Knowledge and ability to perform advanced administration on multiple company standard network technologies or similar platforms:
Cisco enterprise LAN/WAN gear, F5 load balancing, Aruba wireless networking, and Checkpoint/Palo Alto security platforms.
Understands and considers business goals, corporate IT standards, department strategy, service level agreements, and budgetary implications.
Understands and considers and applies standard concepts, best practices and procedures related to LAN, WAN, and wireless networks.
Knowledge of established configuration management, network architecture development and project methodologies.
Communicates effectively with all levels of employees, both technical and non-technical.
Establishes and maintains cooperative relationships with other departments.
Effective project team member, at times assuming leadership roles for projects as required.
Monitors emerging trends and evolving technologies, evaluating, and understanding the implications for inclusion in department strategy.
Takes the initiative to search for and identify alternative and/or innovative solutions to architecture problems.
Uses planning skills to manage and complete projects on time and on budget.
Quickly adapts to the demands inherent in managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications
CCNP or similar certification highly desired and CCIE certification desired.
Adaptive Solutions Group is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and veteran or disability status.
Adaptive Solutions Group offers a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes medical, dental, STD/LTD, life insurance coverage, 401k, paid vacation and holidays.

text:
Are you a vibrant and energetic individual looking to boost your career within a technical environment? GO's Technical Team is looking for an energetic individual to join the team in the role of Junior Network Engineer - IP Core.
It would be essential for you to have:
A first degree in Engineering with a focus on Telecommunications
Basic technical knowledge ( we will also train you ) on IP and Internet related technologies to be able to operate and maintain network infrastructure, such as:
ISP services such as email, dns, web services, databases
Systems: Linux
Networking and Transport infrastructure
Scripting: Shell, perl, PHP,phyton
Computer skills and IP knowledge
Willingness to learn and the ability to work on own initiative
Have problem Solving and communication skills
We would prefer if you also have:
Cisco certification to at least the CCNA level; training will be provided to achieve this certification.
If this describes you that this is a glimpse of what you will be doing:
Together with the Core IP team, you will be responsible to maintain and operate the company's IP and transport network. You shall take prime interest in researching technologies related to IP Service Provider Network since this role is critical in providing the knowledge required to create a competitive edge and improve efficiency.
Operate, manage and maintain the company’s
Core IP Network
Metro Ethernet Network
Mobile Backhaul Network
Data Center Network
Broadband Network Gateway
Review the network performance to ensure the appropriate forecasting, dimensioning and sizing of the various Network elements so as to meet the demand for Service Provisioning as well as maintain the required Service Levels;
Implement appropriate operational procedures in accordance with international norms and standards in order to ensure that system downtime is minimised and a high-level quality of service is guaranteed;
Provide on the job training when necessary;
Assist and liaise with other sections in the design, build and operation of customers’ networks;
Provide 3rd level support and liaise directly with third parties, including clients and suppliers for technical problem resolution on a 24x7 basis.
*Dear Candidate, kindly note that this role is not managed by Castille. The client, in this case, is responsible to manage the application process. In case of any difficulties, feel free to contact brand@castilleresources.com, and we will direct your query to the relevant contact at this company.

text:
Class Description
THIS IS A NON CIVIL SERVICE POSITION
NETWORK ENGINEER
The Baltimore City Office of Information and Technology (BCIT) is seeking a CONTRACTUAL Network Engineer to responsible for analyzing, designing, installing, configuring, maintaining and repairing of network infrastructure and application components. A Network Engineer performs a wide variety of network services ranging from evaluation, maintenance, installation and training tasks to ensure the computer network performance meets BCIT client and stakeholder satisfaction. A Network Engineer also provides direction, information, and recommendations regarding network configurations and installations. Candidates should have an equivalent to a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline with four years of network engineering experience.
The Contractual Network Engineer will:
Maintain network devices security through proper configuration Cisco switches and routers
Establish networking environment by designing system configuration, direct installation, define, document, and enforce network standards
The design and implementation of new solutions and improving the resilience of the current networking environment
Maximize network performance by monitoring performance, troubleshoot network problems and outages, schedule upgrades and collaborate with network architects on network optimization
Undertake data network fault investigations in local and wide area environments, using information from multiple sources
Secure network system by establishing and enforcing policies, and define and monitor access
Provide support and administration of firewall environments in line with IT security policy
Report network operational status by gathering, prioritizing information and managing customer projects
Support the network Lead Architect with the design of the core network
Upgrade data network equipment to latest stable firmware releases
The configuration of routing and switching equipment
The configuration of hosted IP voice services and Wi-Fi access points
The basic configuration of firewall ACL rule and policies. Understand VLANS and subnetting
Remote support of onsite engineers and end users/customers during installation
Remote troubleshooting and fault finding if issues occur
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Four (4) year college degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related discipline from an accredited college or university or equivalent.
Four (7) years of network engineering work experience.
Current CCNA and/or CCDA certification or higher.
Knowledge of VoIP implementation and support.
Knowledge of Mitel IP systems configuration for Voice VLANs
Knowledge of Windows Server 2008 & 2012 and 2016 DNS, DHCP experience is a plus.
Must consistently demonstrate the ability to follow instructions.
Must consistently demonstrate excellent communications skills – both verbal and written.
Must consistently demonstrate the ability to be/remain self-motivated, pay attention to detail, and meet deadlines.
Must consistently demonstrate the ability to maintain effective working relationships with personnel from various City Agencies, other BCIT staff, and vendors.
Must consistently demonstrate the ability to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously, while working independently at times.
Salary is commensurate with education and experience. Benefits are NOT offered – as this a Contract position. Interested candidates should submit a cover letter that specifies a preferred hourly rate, and a current resume that specifically details relevant experience to: BCIT.Careers@baltimorecity.gov. Telephone calls will NOT be accepted. While we appreciate every applicant's interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. Resumes will be accepted until filled.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
In compliance with federal law, the incumbent will be required to (1) pass a criminal background and drug screen; (2) verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States, and (3) complete the required employment eligibility verification document upon hire.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
