experienced Sr. Consulting Network Engineer - ACI. This role will be a member
of the Data Center & Core Network Architecture team supporting TIAAs
expanding Global network. This role will design, deploy and support our Data
Center Networks utilizing best practices and Cisco Application Centric
Infrastructure and Nexus 9k platforms.
You'll help us build upon our
heritage of trust to grow and transform our network environment to help improve
customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our more than 100 Years of
TIAA culture, values, inclusion and diversity to help drive your successes.
Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you
never thought possible and you'll have fun doing it. This role can be
located in the following locations: Broomfield, CO, Denver, CO, Charlotte, NC,
Iselin, NJ, Raleigh/Durham, NC or Chicago, IL. Come and join our team!
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design, deploy and support Data Center Networks utilizing industrybest practices and Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure and Nexus 9kplatforms.
Contribute to the development and performance of an automated migrationplan from Traditional Datacenter Network designs to Cisco ACI.
Integrate services and appliances with Cisco ACI deployments toinclude Load Balancers, Firewalls and Application Deployment Orchestrationtools.
Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans,and debug the hardest problems, live, on some of the largest and complexnetworks and systems in the world
Collaboration with other technical teams to create automatedmigration solutions
Collaboration with Application SMEs to approve ACI Contracts
Collaboration with Business Information Security Officers (BISOs)on protocol risk
Lead overall technical implementation for large and complex DataCenter engagements
Deliver technical briefings, Architectural Design sessions andProofs-of-Concepts to all levels of stakeholders
Identify the causes of networking problems, using diagnostictesting software and equipment
Research and evaluate infrastructure strategies,hardware/software, security and networking products
Advise management of options, risk vs. cost, benefits and otherimpacts of infrastructure solutions
Set technical standards for network infrastructure, securitybaselines, policies and procedures
Work with outsource vendor to drive sound architectures,engineering designs, and configuration templates
Engage in complex production impacting technical issues and workto troubleshoot and restore service
QUALIFICATIONS
Required
Experience:
7 years'experience of solid Cisco networking that is focused in Routing and Switching
2+ yearssupporting/troubleshooting Cisco ACI constructs, policy and contracts
2+ years ofPython programming experience, with emphasis on one or more of; InfrastructureAutomation & Scripting, API Scripting & Development, Data Analysis& Visualization, Version Control Software & Workflows
Experiencewith Ansible
Experiencewith migrations of critical network infrastructure
Ability totranslate business requirements into creditable, high quality and resilientdesigns based upon the organization's roadmaps and standards
Abilityto share an on-call rotation with your Engineering Team and be anescalation contact for service incidents
Preferred:
BS or MS inComputer Science or Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline orequivalent experience
Certificationssuch as CCNP, CCIE R&S, CCIE Datacenter, CCDE, CISSP, GSEC, GIAC or AWSNetworking Specialist are desirable.
Cisco partnerrelationship experience
Abilityto communicate to all levels ofinternal & external stakeholders
Ability tocollaborate with other team members
Progressive designor deployment experience with any of the following:
Cisco's Tetration Analytics platform
F5 Load Balancer and Web Application Firewall
Security platforms such as Palo Altofirewalls, Blue Coat Proxys
Linux/Unix or Microsoft Windows Server administrator
Network Virtualization with VMWare
Datacenter Storage platforms

text:
Job Description
Company Description
Symbotic’s talented and diverse workforce develops disruptive robotic solutions for warehouse automation and supply chain transformation, drives results and focuses on customer satisfaction. Our modular and scalable solutions utilize existing space and high-speed robotics combined with proprietary software and technology. Since forming in 2007, Symbotic has grown to over 700 employees in North America and supports an impressive, high-profile customer base. We seek candidates who are passionate about our solution and approach problem solving with a creative mind and a commitment to excellence. If you seek a challenge and want to impact the way the world distributes product from manufacturers to store shelves, we invite you to join our team.
Job Description
Symbotic currently has an opening for a Sr. Network Engineer. The qualified candidates will play a hands-on role supporting, designing and maintaining the corporate networking infrastructure. Symbotic is looking for people who thrive in a fast paced and creative environment.
Responsibilities
Review, design, and support of wired and wireless network infrastructure (LAN/WAN), Firewalls and Cabling
Work with other IT functions (Unified Communications, End User Services) to design and support systems for internal needs.
Research new technologies and overlay possible use of new technologies for both internal IT needs, and external customer needs
Occasional interaction with customers for implementation activities
Manage projects from initial scoping to deployment
Troubleshoot system outages, and work with other technical staffs to resolve technical issues
Solves problems relating to mission critical services to prevent problem recurrence, with the goal of automating response to all non-exceptional service conditions
Qualifications
5 years’ minimum of network experience of local and wide area networks
Experience with HP Aruba wireless technology including implementing 802.1x, Airwave and Clearpass
Experience in wired networking with a focus strong knowledge of Layer 2 and Layer 3 communications
Experience with SD-WAN technologies
Experience setting up a high availability data center environment
Experience with Cisco ASA Firewalls, Cisco ISR’s and VPN connectivity
Experience with Cisco AnyConnect configuration and best practices
Knowledge of Linux and Windows servers, with an emphasis on Linux, virtualization technologies and network monitoring tools
Experience working with data center technologies such as server designs and configurations for different computing scenarios, Hyperconverged/SAN/NAS
Experience working with Networking technologies and topologies (EIGRP, BGP, OSPF, etc.), Cisco/HP switches and routers, Security Information Management, IPS/IDS, Firewalls, DLP, and behavioral/risk based security frameworks
Experience with Microsoft Azure networking
Knowledge of Deployment technologies including Kickstart, RPM creation and automation tools such as Ansible
Scripting language knowledge
Experience with Active Directory, and Windows/Linux integration and two factor OS authentication
Experience working in a multi-tenant high up time production environment
Experienced with Solarwinds, Scrutinizer and Rancid tools
Cisco certifications are not required, but will be helpful
Works well as an independent contributor, a team lead, and a Customer Service agent (for client interactions)
Willingness and openness to try new technologies, methods, and processes
The IT team is an open, collaborative, and high integrity environment. We seek candidates who fit into our team culture
Ability to provide Tier 3 on-call support coverage for customers
Ability to travel in North America up to 20%
All Symbotic employees are expected to make safety their top priority
Additional Information
Compensation and Benefits:
Symbotic offers competitive compensation and a dynamic, growing company environment. Benefits include very comprehensive coverage for medical, dental, life, disability, flexible spending accounts, and more.
Please… No Agencies, Contractors or Consultants.
Please visit our careers page at www.symbotic.com/careers/
Symbotic is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, gender, physical or mental disability, nation of origin, veteran status, religious beliefs, sexual identity or expression. Symbotic supports a diverse workforce and we are committed to a work environment free of discrimination and harassment, where all are treated with dignity and respect.

OzarksGo offe...
text:
Network Engineer
Company: Ozarks Electric Cooperative
Updated: 8/22/2016
Description:
OzarksGo offers a competitive salary and generous benefits. Please visit www.ozarksgo.net for more information. GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF POSITION Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of network systems including the hardware and software, optical equipment, and data, video, and voice communications. To implement best practices in networking to provide optimum data, voice, and video services to subscribers ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Oversees the day-to-day operations of the network required to provide data, voice, and video service to subscribers as well as back office integration required for administrative support. Responsible for day-to-day security of networks infrastructure and service provider applications. Designs and implements network connectivity for layer 2 and 3 LAN and WAN connections, including documentation of network connections. Provides support to subscribers to access the network successfully. Maintains all network devices with all firmware and software updates and security patches and features. Develops special programs and scripts in coordination with end-users to allow for more effective and efficient utilization of all systems including integration. Receives and evaluates requests for additional network applications and makes recommendations on required hardware and software to assist in determining whether or not these requests will meet the user's needs and function in coordination with our existing hardware and software. Assists in training and provides technical assistance to users and subscribers as requested or directed to help users become more proficient in the use of the network. Maintains a safe working environment by adhering to policies, procedures and regulations. Perform any other related duties as required or assigned. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE Technical degree required in such disciplines as Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, Network Administration, etc, plus 5 years related experience and/or training, and 2 years related management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. COMMUNICATION SKILLS Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and policy/procedure manuals; Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Advanced knowledge in network administration and engineering required. Knowledge in fiber optics including high capacity networks including DWDM, 10gbps, 40gbps, and 100gbps interfaces. Extensive high-level understanding of the following skills and their application in a network environment are necessary: TCP/IP Fiber optic cabling IPv4 and IPv6 Network address translation Ring topologies Routers VoIP Multicast VLAN Server operating systems For more information, or to apply now, you must go to the website below. Please DO NOT email your resume to us as we only accept applications through our website. https://www.applicantpro.com/j/450107-126768

text:
Job Description
Ongoing efforts to improve and enhance Client’s network infrastructure. Our client is a 24x7 operation with staff that is required to be available to meet the requirements of operations. The normal onsite hours of operation are from 7a – 7p. The Candidate must have flexibility to work non-standard ours and/or over-time, including evenings, overnight, and weekends, to respond to IT emergency situations, perform planned enhancements, changes, upgrades, and deployments in addition to core business-day hours. Normal hours must be Once the Engineers has demonstrated an understanding of the infrastructure, the candidate will also be required to participate in a rotating emergency on-call schedule, providing non-business hours support. Typically, the on-call rotation is 24 hours a day for a 1 week (7 days), every four to five weeks. Primary work location is Baltimore. No teleworking.
Duties include but are not limited to:
Design, test, plan, and implement network changes and new infrastructure. Work with vendors, telecommunications carriers, and network engineering staff. Perform network modeling and capacity planning.
Troubleshooting to isolate and diagnose complex network problems, analyze outages and/or degradation of service, etc
Upgrade network hardware and software components as required. Evaluate network for performance, scalability, manageability and security improvement opportunities.
Configure, test, install and support infrastructure hardware and software. This includes, but is not limited to routers, switches, firewalls, cabling, wireless access points, intrusion detection systems, load balancing, Cisco Internetwork Operating System (IOS), Terminal Access Controller Access-Control System (TACACS), Orion Solarwinds, Logrythm, Aerohive, PaloAlto, Forescout, etc.
Lead, respond, and mitigate network vulnerabilities in accordance to NIST and IRS Safeguards.
Develop configuration and implementation instructions for routine deployments and daily tasks.
Create and maintain network diagrams, project plans, and other documents.
Assist with planning, deploying, and maintaining branch offices network infrastructure statewide. This will require travel to DHS locations as necessary.
Minimum Qualifications
Network Engineer must have or have held at least once Cisco Professional level certification such as CCDP, CCNP, or better within the last 6 years.
At least five (5) years hands on experience configuring, installing, maintaining, and supporting Cisco networks
At least three (3) years experience working with/supporting end users
Company Description
Preferred Technology Solutions (PTS) Inc., is a Maryland-based Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) firm providing Information Technology, Management Consulting and on-demand Staffing services to state and local government agencies. PTS is a Maryland Department Of Transportation (MDOT) certified women-owned MBE (Certification No: 05-494) and a certified Small Business Reserve (SBR) firm.

text:
Description
Network Engineer Position Description
The Network Engineer Deliverables:
Perform day to day support and administration, including: installation, configuration, monitoring, documentation, and automation of network infrastructure and corporate systems.
Participate in meetings, gather network requirements, develop a plan, and review the plan with network engineers
Network routing and access layer configurations within the WAN, LAN, and Datacenter.
Analyze and troubleshoot network connectivity.
Gigamon is a global company and participation in an on-call is required.
Network Engineer - Education/Experience and Skills:
Education:
Possession of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, or a closely related field.
Experience:
Three (3) years of recent Network Engineer and experience analyzing, installing, configuring, enhancing, and/or maintaining the components of an enterprise network.
Knowledge of:
The basic and advanced functions for the core hardware and software components that comprise complex large systems or enterprise networks.
Analysis and evaluation techniques to plan, design, integrate, implement, maintain and troubleshoot large complex systems or networks across similar and dissimilar technology platforms.
Dynamic routing experience (internal and external protocols)
Experience with High Availability network requirements
Experience and ability to work in multivendor/multi-platform environment
Wireless deployment and performance management
Palo Alto Networks (PAN) NGFWs and Security Policy generation.
Network Access Control (Forescout, Clearpass, Cisco ISE etc.)
SD-WAN knowledge and experience a plus
Ability and Skill to:
Determine the systems or networking requirements to plan for or enhance the core data processing needs for the Enterprise system or network.
Solve problems with minimal disruption or impact to the system or network.
Exercise judgement, decisiveness and creativity in designing, planning, troubleshooting and integration of large complex systems or networks based on the potential benefits and/or consequences.
Develop alternative solutions within established guidelines and standards.
Communicate effectively; establish good working relationships with other IS professionals, vendors, management and departments.
Read and understand professional journals, manuals and literature.
Prioritize competing requests for service.
Additional desired certifications and/or experience:
Cisco CCNA Routing and Switching.
Must be self-motivated with time management skills.
Hands-on Experience with hardware - not afraid to get hands dirty in debugging and fixing network problems.
Strong technical aptitude and ability to research and solve complex issues independently.
Ability to effectively communicate updates, issues and resolutions to all levels of the organization.
Excellent technical and layman's written and verbal communication skills
Recent experience with the design and/or deployment and implementation of these technologies:
Design, install, configure and document Enterprise level networks and devices according to Business requirements. Network devices include but are not limited to: CISCO 9XXX Catalyst, 38XX Switches, CISCO NEXUS, CISCO 65XX, CISCO 45XX, ASA55XX, CISCO VPN Appliances and Palo Alto NGFW.
Design and implement networks using various routing protocols including OSPF, EIGRP and Enterprise level BGP.
Analyze, plan, implement, monitor, patch, upgrade and troubleshoot complex network configurations.
Demonstrable knowledge of all layers of the Open Systems Interconnect Layers (OSI).
Experience with Fluke network analyzers and other network analysis tools.
Plan, implement and provide primary support of disaster recovery and backup of network infrastructure, implementation of network security policies and network performance.
Validate network specifications and network equipment configurations based upon business requirements.
Engineer solutions for complex networking challenges through detail analysis.
Provide strong customer service and facilitate collaboration between project teams and clients.
Ensure that all documentation on process and procedures are available and updated regularly.
Establish network policies, procedures and standards. Develop alternative solutions to problems within established guidelines and standards.
Work closely with our other Systems and Network Engineers and Network Operations Staff to ensure network connectivity requirements are fulfilled in a timely manner.
Attend planning meetings and work closely with application development teams.

name: Cisco Wireless Senior Network Engineer (remote virtual work at home eligible)
summary:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components su...
text:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Senior Network Engineer work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Responsibilities
The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
Required Qualifications
+ 5 or more years of experience Cisco Wireless Network Engineering
+ Experienced with monitoring tools such as Solar Winds/Orion, Lancope, LiveAction or similar required
+ Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences
+ Must be a highly effective communicator with the ability to lead and influence
Desired Qualifications:
+ CCNA/CCNP Highly preferred
+ Experienced with SDWA(Viptela etc )
+ MPLS
+ Metro-E
+ DWDM
+ 5g Wireless
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40
About Us
Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms -when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and that's why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first.
Equal Opportunity Employer

The Lead, Network Engineer works on problems of diverse scope and complexity ranging from moderate to substantial.ResponsibilitiesThe Lead, Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling.
Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections.

text:
Overview
OneNeck IT Solutions is seeking top talent for an experienced and talented Wireless Network Engineer II/III to provide advanced network implementation, support and troubleshooting services related to Cisco Wireless technologies in our Plano,TX location.
The Wireless Network Engineer II/III position provides network implementation, support and troubleshooting services. Maintain constant contact with customer staff to ensure that services conform to customer requirements. Provide a broad range of services in the assessment of customer's data network infrastructure requirements; including Cisco's Data Center products. Engage with other divisional engineer resources to provide the appropriate resolution for our customers. Services include in-depth knowledge of the customer’s infrastructure and configurations.
Note: This position may be hired at the Wireless Network Engineer II or Wireless Network Engineer III level given the skills/experience of the candidate and business need.
OneNeck IT Solutions LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of Telephone and Data Systems, Inc., employs nearly 550 people throughout the U.S. The company offers hybrid IT solutions including cloud and hosting solutions, managed services, enterprise application management, advanced IT services, hardware and local connectivity via top-tier data centers in Arizona, Colorado, Iowa, Minnesota, New Jersey, Oregon and Wisconsin. OneNeck's team of technology professionals manage secure, world-class, hybrid IT infrastructures and applications for businesses around the country. Visit oneneck.com.
Responsibilities
Implementation and support of Cisco voice technologies, including UCM, Unity, Unity Connections, UCCX, MeetingPlace, and Webex
Research and engineer technology based upon capacity or functionality requirements. Implement tactical plans to meet the timelines and to ensure minimal disruption to the Customer environment. Assist with development of documentation for standards requirements within the department.
Provide accurate, clear, concise documentation and assistance to others within the department when required.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
Associates degree or higher or 2+ years of professional work experience.
2 years supporting complex Cisco wireless network
Cisco Certification: CCNA within 1 year of employment.
Valid Driver’s License, insurance and reliable transportation required.
Availability to consult, assist and/or perform after-hours support and participate in on-call rotations.
Other Qualifications:
Other Cisco Certifications: CCDP, CCVP, CSSIP, CCNP – preferred.
Routing and Switching Background.
End-to-end QOS knowledge across a Cisco LAN/WAN infrastructure.
Security technologies.
IPT WAN design experiences a plus.
Skilled in using Visio and other network documentation software.
Strong communication skills (oral and written).
Complex network concepts and implementations
Ability to work on assignments that are complex in nature and where considerable judgment and initiative are required in implementation and problem resolution.
Project Coordination experience is a benefit.
Ability to provide technical direction in a timely fashion, utilizing standard.
Benefits:
As a part of your total compensation, #TDS provides a comprehensive, competitive benefit package. The benefit plans address both the immediate and long term needs that you and your family may have. For an overview of what we have to offer for full-time employees including vacation, health benefits and retirement options please click here.

Job Description
Network Engineer / Architect
This position level is responsible for diverse activit...
tasks: Bachelors degree,Minimum 9 years experience working with Information technologies required.,Minimum 6 years network/infrastructure environment experience required.,CompTIA Network+ Certification,VMware Certified Professional – Network Virtualization,Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician (CCENT),Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) – Routing and Switching,Cisco Certified Network Professional Level (CCNP) – Routing and Switching
text:
Job Description
Network Engineer / Architect
This position level is responsible for diverse activities related to the design, configuration and performance of the network. Competent to plan, engineer and support the most complex aspects of organizations WAN/LAN. Works on extremely complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an evaluation of intangible variance factors. Exercises independent judgment in developing methods, techniques and evaluation criterion for obtaining results. Ensures long-term requirements of network operations are included in the overall information systems planning of the organization. Designs network topology and supports network security through router and server firewalls.
Education and Experience:
Bachelors degree
Minimum 9 years experience working with Information technologies required.
Minimum 6 years network/infrastructure environment experience required.
Minimum 4 years working in a network engineer capacity required.
Certifications
CompTIA Network+ Certification
VMware Certified Professional – Network Virtualization
Cisco Certified Entry Networking Technician (CCENT)
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) – Routing and Switching
Cisco Certified Network Professional Level (CCNP) – Routing and Switching
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE)
Required Qualifications and Job Description:
Design, Develop and Implement Diverse Wide Area Networking Environments
Develop and implement QoS for a voice / video / data network environment.
Deploy diverse WAN environments using multi-carrier solutions
Develops and generates conceptual, logical, and physical network architectures, resulting documents and drawings, testing analyses, test plans, and risk assessments to ensure sound architecture.
Provide operational support services for various WAN technologies.
Plans network layouts and configures systems to user environments.
Analyzes network topologies and traffic and capacity requirements.
Work with internal and external customers to fill information gaps and communicate architecture and technical solutions.
Support the acquisition of hardware and software. Develop, Design, and Support 10-Gigabit Ethernet Switching/Routing (EIGRP & BGP), IPv4/6.
Develop, Design, and Support Enterprise WIFI solutions. (Meraki, Aruba, Cisco) Perform Network Engineering and Architecture Duties for a distributed Wide Area Networking environment (IWAN).
Takes a lead role in formulating project plans and implementing management strategies. May develop disaster recovery plans.
Desired Qualifications:
Architect level, carrier based experience in designing and implementing enterprise level networks, and data center network environments.
Expert level knowledge of BGP routing, QOS and other WAN based technologies.
Cisco switching and routing both customer and data center class (Nexus, ASR, ISRs) etc. CCIE level routing/switching.
Experience with LAN to include wireless as well as centralized content delivery services would be an added benefit.
9+ years of Network Integration Experience.
Advanced knowledge and experience with EIGRP and BGP routing protocols.
Advanced knowledge of Data Center architecture. (Nexus, SDN, High Availability, Security)
Knowledge of Security products and HW/SW based Firewalls.
Leadership:
Acts in a self-directed manner; takes action before being directed by others or forced by events. Seizes opportunities and is proactive in avoiding potential problems. Leads by example. Takes personal responsibility, and acts as an integrated member of the team. Excellent communication and customer skills a must.
Company Description
Effortless Office partners with innovative organizations to make IT effortless -- so they can focus on their business. As an innovative cloud-solutions provider, we are revolutionizing how companies leverage technology to do work. Since this is a growing industry, and we are committed to providing an excellent customer experience for our clients, this is a great place to learn, grow and prosper.

We are passionate about what we do, we work hard to be excellent, and we promote based on merit.

Network Engineer
Rhodes Location
6 Month Contract Opportunity
Work for a large government client
Leading global IT Services company seek a Network Engineer with design, implementation & support experience within a large enterprise environment.
Sydney
As a Network Engineer you will be involved in the design, implementation and support phases within a large enterprise environment.
The Key responsibilities of this role include:
Build and configure network switches to customer specification
Patch and connect outlets
Integrate switches into existing environment
Create new technical documentation such as proposal documents and technical implementation instructions
Attend client meetings to discuss requirements and provide technical advise to ensure client's expectations are delivered
Provide support to PMO office and technical input to project management plans
Follow prescribed change process
Maintain internal document storage (objective, sharepoint)
The ideal candidate will possess:
Experience with hardware and software configuration of encrypted router and switch networks
Experience with network design of local and wide area networks
Minimum 3+ years' experience in networking (LAN, WAN) design and implementation for a large organisation
Knowledge of adjacent technologies, holding Cisco Certifications (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, JNCIS ) or industry recognized certifications is a plus
Knowledge of PABX and VOIP technologies and Audio/Visual product knowledge and Network integration highly advantageous

text:
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network

Canberra

To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network and ensure end to end operational availability of network systems within service levels and / or service expectations.

General Attributes:
  • Network level: WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security.
  • Internal systems, and Data centre network infrastructure.
  • Act as point of contact between customer and engineers.
  • Resolve all incidents in line with required service level agreements.
  • Complete project activities as required on behalf of the customer.
  • Define and document requirements and provide design documentation as appropriate
  • Assist with and generate Design's, Solutions & execute new installations and upgrades as necessary complying with the change management process.
  • Maintain accurate records of all operational assets (hardware, software)
  • Work with Customers, Solutions Architects, Pre-Sales, NEC Management and the delivery team in providing the best and most cost effective solution
  • Liaise as required between the Delivery team, Professional services, Solution Architects and OEM's on the implementation & support issues that may arise

Skills Required:
  • Degree / Certificate in IT or equivalent
  • Cisco Associate and/Or Professional Level Certifications (CCNA,CCNP R&S and DC)
  • Experience with Cisco Firewalls and Data Centre switches.
  • Experience with Cisco LMS and Cisco Prime.
  • Experience with UCSD.
  • ITIL Foundations Certificate


To be eligible to apply, you must have an existing NV1 security clearance.

name: Network Engineer/Admin - wireless site surveys & installations
summary:
Job Description
We are growing and looking for great people to grow with us!
MMY Consulting is comm...
text:
Job Description
We are growing and looking for great people to grow with us!
MMY Consulting is committed to delivering the highest quality business and IT solutions to our clients. Our mission is to provide comprehensive consultation to public and private sector organizations seeking a true partner in their technology pursuits.
We are currently seeking a Network Engineer/Admin – wireless site surveys & installations to
join the MMY team. This is a travel position around the US. Local candidates need to be living approximately an hour away from any airport, please.
Role and Responsibilities:
TDD will provide resources for the GE project for US locations.
Ekahau site survey
Pre-install site and closet survey
Installations
Ekahau post-installation surveys
Service Description
Pre-install Site and closet survey
· Ekahau site survey
Perform onsite wireless surveys using the Ekahau software
Identify areas of concern for interference or low coverage
Determine placement of Access Points.
Suggest improvements for coverage.
· Site and Closet survey
Provide information in the Site Survey Blank document provided by WWT.
Follow the instructions in tab one to complete the site survey document accurately
Answer the survey questions
Insert a revised floor plan based on the findings for ceiling height, closet and AP locations, and areas of no access
Take and insert photos of each rack with full view anddetailed view showing port counts and available space.
Take and Insert photos of each AP
· Pre-install site and closet survey can be completed during normal business hours.
Installations
· Rack/stack and AP mounting
· Connection to existing cables for AP mounting
· Interconnect patch cables between networking equipment per provided diagrams
· Label both ends of patch cables
· Interconnect IDF patch panels and switch ports
· Take pictures of installed hardware
· Assist in testing and turn-up of new equipment
· Equipment:
o Viptela Routers
o Meraki Switches
Meraki Access Points
· Installations will be performed outside normal business hours
Post installation surveys
· Wireless engineers will perform a post install passive survey. The survey will provide a heat map of the coverage area post installation. Surveys will be performed during normal business hours.
Day one Support
· Eight (8) hours of on-site support during the first business day following completion of services
· Day one support will be performed during normal business hours
Deliverables
· Site survey document suggesting AP placement
· Site Survey Document
· Passive survey heatmaps – post installation
· Location
· Work will be performed at multiple US locations as identified by WWT
Job Requirements:
Ideally, we’d like people who can do both the surveys and the installations. But will consider people who can only do one.
Required for surveys
· Ekahau certified … or a lot of experience. Must have used it extensively.
· Must have own laptop to use.
· Must be extremely experienced in data collection for wireless surveys.
Required for installations
· CCNA level …certification not needed but an experience wireless network engineer
· Experience with Access Point installations
· Heavy wireless and wireless survey experience
· Meraki experience
Must be able to travel each week. Must have a credit card for hotel, car, and food. Air will be prepaid.
Company Description
The MMY Technology Solutions Group is committed to delivering the highest quality business and IT solutions to our clients. Our mission is to provide comprehensive consultation to public and private sector organizations seeking a true partner in their technology pursuits.
MMY Consulting
Why Work Here?
Awesome company - Great benefits - Room for growth
We specialize in creating a dynamic and creative environment where people can flourish. We believe quality, value, and client satisfaction can only be consistently delivered by highly skilled and experienced consultants that conduct themselves with the highest standards of integrity and transparency. MMY Consulting focuses on attracting and retaining these types of talented individuals. Individuals who respect the work our clients are doing and the importance of delivering high value projects on-time and within budget.

name: Most Popular Types of Junior Network Engineer Jobs
summary:
What Does a Junior Network Engineer Do?
As a junior network engineer, your job is to manage connect...
text:
What Does a Junior Network Engineer Do?
As a junior network engineer, your job is to manage connectivity and infrastructure in a company's network. This includes ensuring the company has internet access at all times, testing each new connection when you add hardware, and generally helping to maintain the network. This is a junior position, so you work under the direct supervision of a senior network engineer. Many people use this position to gain additional leadership and engineering skills, with the goal being a promotion to a senior engineering position. Despite not having leadership responsibilities, you may be asked to supervise a project from inception to completion.
More about Junior Network Engineer Jobs

summary: Network Engineer position is a unique opportunity to work with a team of IT professionals to mainta...
text:
Network Engineer position is a unique opportunity to work with a team of IT professionals to maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of a multi-discipline technology environment. The Network Engineering scope of work involves technologies consisting of LAN/WAN, route/switch, security (firewalls, IPS/IDS, content filtering), SD-WAN, cloud (PaaS, SaaS, IaaS), hybrid cloud integration, data center, wireless systems, Virtualization, IP Telephony, Collaboration tools, and Video conferencing.
This position is integral to the IT organization involving all aspect of information technology including working closely with various functional groups and interacting with internal clients to provide exceptional service in an efficient and effective manner. Day-to-day responsibilities include monitoring, maintaining, configuring, and upgrading or implementing new network infrastructure. As well as assisting with the design and participating in the implementation of new technologies, security controls, and network infrastructure application integration. Daily work also includes troubleshooting and resolution of customer and network organization domain issues.
Requirements
The network engineer must have 3 years of knowledge and hands-on experience in at least three of the following disciplines, Route/Switch both enterprise and data center, security controls and methodologies (VPN, IP Sec, FW, Application Content filtering, identity services), VoIP Telephony, Software define WAN/LAN, traffic engineering/shaping and capacity planning, Wireless systems (including controllers, APs), traffic prioritization and design, strong troubleshooting skills with capabilities to decode at packet level, public and cloud environments (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and hybrid integrations, scripting capabilities, and Windows and Linux environments.
Perform operation task related to the maintenance and security of the overall network infrastructure, as well as work with vendors, service providers, and other team members to support cross-functional business needs and align with best practices.
Research, recommend, configure, and implement information technology solutions to enhance its effectiveness, drive value, collaboration, relationships, and continuous improvement.
Maintain up-to-date baselines and operational reporting to identify technology and security gaps with a focus on providing improvements or remediation recommendations.
Demonstrate understanding of IP protocols at all layers of the OSI and IP standards
Experience with SNMP and Implementation telemetry system for monitoring hardware/software
Understanding and working knowledge of routing protocols; EIGRP, BGP & OSPF
Working knowledge of layer 2 switching technologies, VLAN, spanning tress protocol, switch hardening, port security, FHRP, and Cisco switching best practices and procedures
Hands on experience installing and configuring in a multi-vendor environment both physical and virtual including Cisco routing & switching, Meraki wireless, and firewall (Cisco, Meraki, or Palo Alto).
Service provider circuit management, activation, and trouble resolution.
New office activations including cabling, environmental, power, and rack design
Strong project management skills with acute attention to detail and ability to delivery as committed both content and timelines.
Demonstrate understanding of protocols, UDP, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, SIP, MPLS, RADIUS, TACACS, SNMP
Availability; evenings and weekends for issue resolution and scheduled change controls, provide 7x24 on-call support as scheduled, and occasional travel to remote offices/data centers
Active Certification in one of the following areas; (Cisco, Palo Alto, Azure, AWS, Linux, Microsoft)
Compose, update and maintain, Visio diagrams, engineering artifacts and compliance architecture
Education
AS or BA/BS in related field preferred, course studies in engineering, applied sciences, computer networking or demonstrated experience
#CB

text:
Description
A Network Engineer who is deeply passionate about networking hardware and software will find an exciting opportunity in Robert Half Technology's new job opening. Do you have a strong knowledge of Internet protocols, interfacing, security, server, and network infrastructure? Then we have the right Network Engineer position you will love. This Network Engineer role is a long-term temporary employment opportunity located in the Irvine, California area.
Your responsibilities
Provide high-level support and technical expertise in networking technology, including hardware, hubs, bridges and routers
Initiate and implement network test facilities
Collaborate closely with vendors, clients, carriers and technical staff on implementing, optimizing, and consistently managing of networks
Manage a secure transfer of data to multiple locations by way of internal and external networks
Utilize traditional and creative methods to develop enterprise data, voice, and video networks
Subject Matter Expert and in-house advisor on complex problems and issues
Coach and mentor all level I, II, and III staff
For immediate consideration please send resumes to joe.smith@rht.com
Requirements
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, related field
CCNP or CCIE Collaboration certifications
5 or more years in Collaboration space
5+ years experience in legacy TDM space
5+ years in Cisco Contact Center space (ideally focused on PCCE/UCEE)
3+ years dealing with Expressway or Collab Edge concepts and deployments
5+ years with Cisco Telepresence
5+ years experience dealing with telcos on both the local and national level
3+ years experience with WebEx (nice to have)
3+ years experience with route/switch in Cisco environment
3+ years with 802.11 (wireless) in a Cisco environment
Extensive knowledge and experience understanding industry best practices on network architecture and engineering and experience in robust network, product/service and system design and implementation strategies
Visio and Powerpoint abilities
Technology doesn't change the world. People do.
As a technology staffing firm, we can't think of a more fitting mantra. We're extreme believers in technology and the incredible things it can do. But we know that behind every smart piece of software, every powerful processor, and every brilliant line of code is an even more brilliant person.
Leader among IT staffing agencies
The intersection of technology and people - it's where we live. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.
We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.
Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888-490-4429 to learn more about this position.
All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

You will be a part of a cohesive and strong team of 6 experienced Network Engineers who meet weekly with our Service Coordinator, Sales Team and VP of Service Delivery. During our weekly meetings, we ...
What Does a Senior Network Engineer Do?
A senior network engineer builds and maintains data communication networks for a company or organization. As a senior network engineer, you have several years of industry experience and lead a team of junior network engineers and network administrators to ensure both the local area network (LAN) and wide area network (WAN) are functioning properly. Your job duties include installing software and hardware, creating a layout plan for cables, and troubleshooting and solving problems that arise with the networks for which you are responsible.

text:
AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Federal Government. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers' mission.
Our Civilian Team supports The US Department of State (DoS), providing, operating and assuring critical voice, video and collaboration services for the full spectrum of domestic/worldwide diplomatic operations.
AT&T has an opening for a Technician with a focus on Voice-IT/Maintenance requirements in a Team and individual work environment. We support the DoS IRM/TWD Organization in providing Technician support for critical State Department efforts.
Job Duties/Responsibilities:
Telecommunications, Wireless, and Data (TWD) Division provides its users with mission critical domestic LAN/WAN data services across multiple locations in the DC Metro Area and remote locations.
In support of these services, Technicians provide voice and data systems and engineering support, with a particular-focus on daily work-orders/troubles with a secondary focus on project and engineering initiatives.
Technicians support the Department of State (DoS) Vanguard Program, Service Management Office (SMO) which is responsible for administering, deploying and maintaining Avaya and Cisco products, as well as a working knowledge of encryption solutions, knowledge of local and wide-area networks in a Voice/Data converged infrastructure.
This hands-on position includes support for service interruptions, planned equipment installations, and infrastructure support. This position can also include planning, designing, installing, configuring, maintaining, deploying supporting and optimizing all network hardware and software. Technicians reports directly to the TWD Voice/Data Engineering Manager, while coordinating with TWD Project Management Office (PMO) project managers, and the PMO Director.
Although not a job duty requirement it is expected candidates have a working knowledge of Avaya/Cisco Voice services
Required Clearance:
Secret and clearable to Top Secret (#secret) (#topsecret)
Required Qualifications:
Promptly respond to support requests from the Implementation Manager, Special Projects Engineering Manager, PMO project managers, and/or PMO Director
Demonstrate an ability to support on multiple, concurrent projects
Supports change and configuration management for all voice and data assets Troubleshoot, respond to incidents/service requests and/or planned/unplanned outages
Supports Move, Add, and Change requests for the voice/data network to include day-to-day requests/orders and Projects
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve hardware and/or other service problems, and replace defective components associated with both voice and data and voice systems Interfaces with other IRM Support Teams on system/network infrastructure efforts and advises management on technical improvements and/or solutions to identified problems and/or gaps
Identifies and recommends solutions, products and services to support the enterprise initiatives, business goals and/or technical needs of the customer's organizational direction, technical context and State Department enterprise needs Contributes to the creation of new policies and procedures for Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and follows established SOPs and process guides
Works extensively with Cisco Layer 2 and Layer 3 solutions and products Strong interpersonal, written and oral skills
Ability to work in a team-oriented collaborative environment while being highly motivated while working on work orders and projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong sense of commitment to performing Technician level functions as scheduled, providing timely responses to required system support after normal business hours and on weekends. Additionally, the candidate should have an eye for detail, ability to multi-task, organize priorities, and work in a systematic style following Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and guides.
Desired Qualifications:
Cisco CCNA Certification (Cisco Certified Network Associate)
State Department experience a plus
Avaya Voice
AT&T will consider for employment qualified applicants in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state and local laws. AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

text:
Are you a problem solver that loves challenges daily? Then Insource is a fit for you. We are looking for people who "Do the right thing at the right time for the right reason."
Insource provides expertise to our clients in the areas of HR, Finance and IT. Our clients include a diverse mix of businesses ranging from small venture-backed startups to well-established nonprofit organizations. We work closely with our clients' staff, providing them access to the specialized knowledge they need to successfully operate and grow their businesses. We love solving problems and identifying opportunities for efficiency improvements for our clients. In fact, everything we do at Insource is focused on helping our clients achieve their mission and business goals.
We invest in our client relationships and passionately care about the service we deliver. Everything we do is centered on our core beliefs and we believe:
Understanding our clients' culture and vision make us a better partner
Our cross-content perspective adds unique value for our clients
HR, Finance and IT start with people
There is always more than one way to solve a problem
In doing the right things for the right reason
Being easy to work with is core to who we are
Communication needs to be direct and candid
Happy staff leads to happy clients
What You'll Do:
Working as part of a of a service delivery team, participate in client technology upgrades and projects varying in scope from Azure and AWS Migrations, Network stack upgrades and wireless implementations using Meraki cloud managed equipment, Google Apps and Office365 migrations/implementations and IDM/SSO and device management (MDM) implementations using Azure AD, Intune, JAMF, and JumpCloud.
On a monthly basis, actively participate in meetings with all network/server engineers and helpdesk technicians discussing new issues, latest technologies, case studies, roadblocks and outstanding incidents. Work closely with the Support Specialists and IT Managers to effectively communicate issues, project milestone and make recommendations to client management.
On an annual basis, assist with researching, testing and developing of solutions for both corporate IT and clients.
On an ongoing basis, participate in sales and strategy meetings with existing and potential clients, maintain knowledge portal on IT Intranet and develop Server Maintenance Policies for each client. Constantly monitor and react to alerts via automated network monitoring system.
Attend and actively participate in departmental meetings, resource deployment of other engineers and coordination of resources on specific tasks as well as work hand-in-hand with IT Managers to effectively drive innovation in an effective manner for end-users.
What We're Looking for:
Passion for discovering and learning new technologies
Unique ability to work with both business and technical-minded people to plan and execute against project timelines and deliverables
A strong understanding of related cloud platforms, Azure AD, Networking Protocols and Procedures, all relevant Microsoft Operating Systems, hypervisor technology,
Experience managing networks, servers, monitoring, and advanced application troubleshooting
A proven adeptness to detail work and can demonstrate analytical/research skills
Passion to constantly seek improvement in technology solutions
Ability to multi-task across clients, industries and technologies, while maintaining an appropriate level of professionalism and composure
Bachelor's Degree.
3 years in a customer-facing, technical support/management role
Benefits Include:
Challenging, exciting consulting work without the overnight or long distance travel
Competitive Salary
Health, Dental, Life, Short Term and Long Term Disability insurance
Generous paid time off
Company Holidays
Tuition Reimbursement
401K with company matching

At Insource we appreciate the value and richness of different perspectives and experiences. We constantly strive to be a more diverse and inclusive workplace. We work to make you feel welcomed and engaged as a valued member of the team. We provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Insource Services will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

summary: AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutio...
tasks: Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;,Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.,Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;,Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement approved course of action.,Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.,May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.,May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating current operational status of networks.,Perform data or voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance.,Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls.,Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters.
text:
AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Department of Defense. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers' mission.
RIS I is the delivery of regional IT services to the end user. We offer support of end user devices including desktop, workplace peripherals, and voice and video devices. We support local and campus area networks, including wireless and cable plant.
AT&T has an opening for a Network Engineer - Who performs services to enable all aspects of the network to include maintenance, sustainment of existing networks, and identification/correction of complex inter-network issues.
Responsibilities Include:
Maintain data, voice and/or video network hardware and systems;
Assess and update older networks as needed and in accordance with specified plans.
Provide escalated Tier-2 and Tier-3 technical support on data, voice or video networks;
Answer technical questions; recommend and Implement approved course of action.
Install network applications on network servers or voice equipment; Maintain, test, research and resolve problems.
May design, implement or maintain various networks such as LAN, CAN, and voice systems in accordance with specified requirements.
May prepare data or voice network diagrams and drawings to document and assist in communicating current operational status of networks.
Perform data or voice network configurations and configuration changes of various voice or data equipment such as routers, switches, intelligent hubs, multi-function switches, end offices, signaling transfer points, PBX, voice mail, call management systems, etc. to enhance performance.
Experience with installation, configuration, and maintenance of McAfee version 7 & 8 Sidewinder Firewalls.
Understand the operation of network protocols and Firewall packet and proxy filters.
May be responsible for the configuration, deployment, and management of our customer's next generation firewall solution.
Required Skills, Experience, and Education: Four (4) years of experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity are required. Associate's degree in engineering technology from an accredited college is required. Two (2) years of additional network engineering experience may be substituted for an Associate's degree.
Certifications: An IAT level II baseline certification as defined by DoD 8570.01-M is required. CCNA, or equivalent, certification or higher required. Both certifications are REQUIRED for this position.
Experience with installation and configuration of any levels of network devices, such as firewalls, switches, routers, cabling, Cisco, Brocade, or Juniper devices is a plus.
Required Clearance: Must be able to obtain clearance.
AT&T will consider for employment qualified applicants in a manner consistent with the requirements of federal, state and local laws.
AT&T is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V

summary: Description Job Description: The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for a Information...
text:
Description Job Description: The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for a Information Network Engineer at Fort Meade, MD. This position is part of a large program supporting Air Combat Commands (ACC) Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission. Job Summary The Network Engineer candidate will be responsible for maintaining computer infrastructures with emphasis on networking. Responsibilities • On-site servers, software-network interactions as well as network integrity/resilience are the key areas of focus. • Plan, implement and oversee the computer networks that support in-house voice, data, video and wireless network services. • Facilitate planning, design and identify technical specifications for all equipment. Basic Qualifications • TS/SCI Cleared with current C/I Polygraph • Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology Related Field. • 10+ years of related experience. • CompTIA Security+ certification • CompTIA Network+ certification • CompTIA A+ certifcation Preferred Qualifications • Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) • Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) • Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE) External Referral Bonus: Eligible Potential for Telework: No Clearance Level Required: Top Secret/SCI with Polygraph Travel: Yes, 10% of the time Scheduled Weekly Hours: 40 Shift: Day Requisition Category: Professional Job Family: Network Administration and Ops Leidos is a Fortune 500 information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world''s toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company''s 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers.
Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That''s why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers.
Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here. Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address.
If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws. Job Requirements: by Jobble

text:
Job Description
JOB DESCRIPTION FORM
Position Title: 7750 IP Integration Engineer
Entity: GLOW NETWORKS INC
Classification: EXEMPT
Grade: JL3A / Individual Contributor
Reports To: PROJECT MANAGER
Working Hours: 40 HOURS in normal condition
Work Location: Remote / Must be Green Card or US Citizen.
Date: As required
Summary/Objective Provide support in the areas of network integration and router software upgrades for integration into wireless / IP networks.
Essential Functions:
Perform data integrity verification of ALU 7750, 7705 nodes in preparation for software upgrades.
Report all discrepancies, through chain management, to customers.
Perform software upgrades following approved Method of Procedures documents.
Use substantial experience and discretion to provide validation of Method of Procedures (MOPs) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for supporting ALU 7750, 7705 1677 or 1678 equipment for software integration.
Update/revise MOPs, SOPs, and data templates as needed to support ALU 7750, 7705 1677 or 1678 integration and deployment.
Prepare MOP’s to safely upgrade software on customer equipment; resolve scripting problems as well as support internal teams with maintenance activities.
Resolve issues with software to upgrade network equipment and correct faults using Command Line Interface (CLI) and GUI
Actively apply ALU QOS standards, to network performance analysis
Use substantial experience and discretion to provide validation of Method of Procedures (MOPs) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for supporting ALU 7750, 7705 equipment for software integration.
Ability to read, write and review Method of Procedures and implement MOPs in Maintenance Window
Perform software upgrades following approved Method of Procedures documents.
Other Functions:
Support, understand and resolve the customer network elements, primarily 7750 and 7705 routers and 1677 and 1678 optical network elements.
Perform software design, implementation, and integration maintenance support to customers
Provide IPv6 telecommunications traffic migration services for customers
Execute procedures and use proprietary software tools to support deliverables
Create and execute work orders to make parameter changes when needed
Escalate quality issues to improve products and services delivered to the customer
Develop written technical documentation such as Method or Procedure (MOP) for Field Technicians to use
Exercise strong analytical skills to debug, and resolve complex software problems
Work Environment/Physical Demands:
Work will be performed in a home office environment
Extensive and intricate work with a computer to resolve complex network issues
Extensive use of computerized software tools and programs, scripting and de-bugging
Maintenance Window working for executing software upgrades.
Maintenance Window / Late night working as per customer requirements.
Required Education/Experience and Competencies:
Higher education in Engineering, Computer Science, Telecom or related fields, or, minimum of 7-10 years’ experience in telecommunications systems network integration and field integration is required. Prior Alcatel-Lucent and Nokia Experience is a must / great advantage.
Minimum or 5 years’ experience as a routing & switching SME with a carrier or service provider
Minimum of three years’ experience with Nokia / ALU 7750, 7705 Routers
NRS2 / CCIE / CCNP Certification or more – A must require certification / qualification
Expert level knowledge in IP Networking:
Strong knowledge of MPLS, BGP, OSPF and other R&S technologies
Ability to analyze and suggest improvements to both IP and legacy based networks
In-depth knowledge of Network Design to include complex routing and switching solutions
In-depth knowledge of the transport network including Nokia 7750, 7705 routers
Knowledge in QOS and/or SAM / NSP and worked on all Alcatel-Lucent / Nokia tools.
Understand provisioning scripts, configuration files, and the like to support the upgrades to customer equipment
Knowledge of IP addressing, sub netting, routing protocols, VLAN, MPLS, SONET, DWDM
Must have worked in UMTS, 4G, LTE and 5G networks on Nokia Networks
Nokia Small Cell Design and troubleshooting experienced.
Direct telecommunications industry experience with hands on experience
Proven strong troubleshooting skills in a remote technical support role
Ability to read MOP and work on the same
Strong team work, good communication and documentation skills;
Good inter-personal skills required
Teaming with other Nokia service delivery teams is necessary
Availability for shift work and weekend on call activity is required
Strong technical, organizational and interpersonal skills.
Result oriented with the focus on product quality and customer satisfaction.
Team player, open communication and ability to work in an international team with Excellent Communication skills.
Manager: Ramesh Nagarajan
HR: Ann McCook

name: Lead, Network Engineer
requirements: Bachelors degree required,5+ years network design experience for large complex enterprises,Deep knowledge and understanding of DevOps Culture
summary:
Description
The Lead, Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components sup...
text:
Description
The Lead, Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Lead, Network Engineer works on problems of diverse scope and complexity ranging from moderate to substantial.
Responsibilities
The Lead, Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Advises executives to develop functional strategies (often segment specific) on matters of significance. Exercises independent judgment and decision making on complex issues regarding job duties and related tasks, and works under minimal supervision, Uses independent judgment requiring analysis of variable factors and determining the best course of action.
Required Qualifications
Bachelors degree required
8 + years of technical experience
2 + years of project leadership experience
Preferred Qualifications
5+ years network design experience for large complex enterprises
Experience with network integration mergers and acquisitions
IGP/BGP configuration and troubleshooting
Equinix Cloud exchange design and configuration
Data Center networking design and configuration including Arista an Cisco Nexus platforms
Network security stack design and configuration including Palo Alto and Cisco
WAN design and configuration
SD-WAN design including Cisco Viptela and Meraki platforms
Cloud inter-networking design including AWS, GCP and Azure
Experience with O365 network design
Deep knowledge and understanding of DevOps Culture
Infrastructure automation design and deployment through Ansible and Python
ServiceNow integration
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40
About Us
Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and thats why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first.
Equal Opportunity Employer
It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or veteran status, except where age, sex, or physical status is a bona fide occupational qualification. View the EEO is the Law poster.

If you become aware of any instances where you as a candidate are asked to provide information and do not believe it is a legitimate request from Humana or affiliate, please contact mailboxtasrecruit@humana.com to validate the request.

tasks: Partner with engineers in multiple teams responsible for maintaining network standards, security compliance, deployment and network operational support for 14West IT.,Communicates with customers and peer organizations regarding maintenance needs, platform capabilities and service degradations.,Strive to constantly improve the performance and security network environment,Provide visibility and reporting around network security monitoring.,Guide innovation and evolution of current network Infrastructure both on premise and global remote offices as the business needs change and evolve.,Follow industry best practices as it relates to change management and agile project planning,Implement and provide ongoing project level reporting through Agile project management methodologies including stand up meetings and sprint planning.
text:
In 2016 and 2017, 14 West was voted one of Baltimore’s Top Workplaces by The Baltimore Sun. Every day roughly 1200 people work as part of the organization. Set in Baltimore City’s historic and cultural hub called Mount Vernon, there is no shortage of opportunities to feed your imagination there. The neighborhood is also home to institutions such as the Walters Art Museum, the Peabody Library, and Baltimore School for the Arts. The Mount Vernon campus is also rich in diversity and offers access to an abundance of unique restaurants, retailers, galleries, and nightlife destination.
14 West Information Technology is looking for a Network Engineer
that will provide strategic technology support for datacenter and corporate network technologies. This role will be focused on project implementation, sustaining engineering and operational support for the 14 West IT network infrastructure. This role is a technical role that will help define and implement operational requirements to meet the company’s goals for maintaining reliability and availability.
Responsibilities
Partner with engineers in multiple teams responsible for maintaining network standards, security compliance, deployment and network operational support for 14West IT.
Communicates with customers and peer organizations regarding maintenance needs, platform capabilities and service degradations.
Strive to constantly improve the performance and security network environment
Provide visibility and reporting around network security monitoring.
Guide innovation and evolution of current network Infrastructure both on premise and global remote offices as the business needs change and evolve.
Follow industry best practices as it relates to change management and agile project planning
Implement and provide ongoing project level reporting through Agile project management methodologies including stand up meetings and sprint planning.
Maintain 24/7 uptime and support status utilizing on call rotations and the automation of monitoring and alerting of the network infrastructure.
Qualifications
5+ years performing Network Architecture/Engineering roles for large mission-critical data center and corporate environments.
3+ years of experience with WAN, Data Circuits, Security and Public Cloud Connectivity
3+ years of experience with site to site and client VPN setup and administration
3+ years of experience with firewall administration in a multi-vendor environment
Experience with security auditing of network devices
Able to compose and manage OKR personal goals and ensure they align with team OKR goals
Excellent interpersonal skills and a strong belief in a communicative and collaborative environment.
Preferred
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering or related technical field or equivalent work experience
Well versed with modern routing architectures, including BGP, EIGRP, DWDM, VxLAN, GRE tunneling and VPN technologies.
Familiarity network device inventory and management
Experience with load balancers and WAF
Regulatory compliance experience (PCI, NIST, HITRUST, etc)

text:
We are currently recruiting for Senior Network Engineers to join a multinational System Integrator to work on multiple high profile government projects.
As a Senior Network Engineer, you will be required to:
Build and test Wide Area Network (WAN), Base Area Network (BAN) and Wireless Network infrastructure before deployment to client sites
Develop design guidelines, test plans and templates for BAN, WAN and Wireless Networks
Develop security documentation such as a System Overview Document (SOD) for the deployment of new network infrastructure
Review and approve Detailed Technical Proposals (DTP) and Technical Implementation Instructions (TII) for changes to the Defence Information Environment (DIE)
Provide advice to project teams for wireless and fixed network infrastructure
The successful candidate must have:
Demonstrated experience in the design, delivery and/or implementation of large scale Wide, Metropolitan and Local Area Networks in a high security framework
Demonstrated experience in working in technical teams to deliver assigned outcomes
Demonstrated experience in the translation of business requirements to functional performance requirements to ensure user requirements are clearly understood and delivered in-line with project expectations
NV2 security clearance
Apply now for immediate consideration or for a full job description of this role, contact dan Carn on 02 6245 1724
Due to security clearance requirements for this role, candidates must be Australian Citizens who currently hold or are able to gain an Australian Government security clearance
Please note: only candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in the position.
