• Responsible for engaging Cisco TAC and working through router related problems
• Responsible for engaging Sprint, AT&T, Verizon IXC's and LEC/CLECs support groups to aid in trouble diagnosis and repair
• Responsible for sending text pages to personnel with outage information and updates
• Responsible for running outage teleconference bridges effectively and professionally
• Responsible for completing daily / nightly NOC check lists and turn over documents
• Responsible for taking customer calls and working with them to understand technical related issues
Minimum Qualifications:
Advanced knowledge of telecommunications technologies including: TCP-IP, Packet Voice, WAN, Frame-Relay, TDM, and LAN technologies, and the inter-working of these technologies. These would encompass voice, data, broadband, VoIP, IPT, and Internet services, and the deployment and implementation of these services. Good knowledge and experience with the Internet Protocol (IP) suite is essential, including protocols such as OSPF and EIGRP, and their relationships and integrations in large-scale networks
A first-hand working knowledge of network monitoring tools. General understanding of the overall industry direction with regard to telecommunication technologies and the applications they will support. Knowledge of Cisco router products (2600, 2800, 3600, 3700, 3900, 5300, 7200, 7500, ASR). Ability to effectively document network outages and activities performed to restore outages. Previous networking experience in NOC / NCC environment CCNA and / or CCNP Cisco certifications that is in good standing.
The successful candidate will be flexible with work hours, as position may be required to work an off-shift or on-call. Candidate must have excellent communications skills and be able to deliver results under pressure. The applicant will be required to complete a written skill assessment. The position will work directly with the customers, and therefore must have strong customer service skills and the ability to interface successfully with both the customer’s technical and non-technical contacts, VZ Account teams and various other groups involved in the delivery of service to the end customer.
About Harman Connected Services:
Harman Connected Services, part of the Harman group is a global player in the Product Engineering and offer services in the high end Technology areas like Cloud, IoT, Mobile, Analytics, design and Software Services. We have a strong team of more than 35000+ employees associated with us and operate globally in about 30+ countries.

text:
Be responsible for the management and day to day support of the clients network along with the delivery and configuration on integration technologies.
Sydney
Fantastic opportunity now available for a skilled Network Engineer to be responsible for the build, support and support of the clients network.
Provide a second level escalation point for other members of the team and take an active role in providing technical leadership and mentoring junior staff.
Responsibilities
Perform research, analysis and design of technical solutions to meet business requirements
Work as part of a support team and provide 24x7 after hours support on a rotating roster
Provide technical leadership on different projects
Ensure that existing technology investments are optimized if applicable
Project responsibilities within project planning, work plan development and resourcing.
Provide a 2nd level escalation point for the service desk
Skills & Requirements
Cisco networking expertise (more than 3 years)
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Strong organization and planning skills.
Demonstrated ability to take ownership, work under pressure and meet agreed deadlines.
Demonstrated 3rd level problem solving skills.
Experience in control processes and procedures.
Demonstrated experience in technical and project leadership.
Strong background in results collating and reporting for measurements.
Min 3 years in a Senior Server\Network support role.
Proven working knowledge of network, routers & switches.
Proven working knowledge of Microsoft technologies.
Extensive knowledge and deployment of SANs and virtualized environments, including VMware, Microsoft etc.
Knowledge of and experience in documenting business requirements & developing technical solutions to meet those requirements.
Candidates who are available immediately are preferred

Job Description
Our global client is seeking a Sr Network Engineer – Remote Job to join their team immediately. If you are looking to work with a team of excellent IT professionals to further grow your skills and career, this could be the opportunity for you.
Job Title: Sr Network Engineer - Remote Job
Location: Raleigh/Richmond/Detroit/Remote
Duration: 3+ Months and then Perm Conversion (Contract to hire)
Seeking a hands-on Senior Network Engineer who is not only capable of troubleshooting network problems, but also building and maintaining a complex hybrid data center / multi-cloud environment. We are a DevOps-driven network team, and are willing to skill up senior network engineering resources into devops, infrastructure-as-code experts.
Required Skills
Strong Cisco route/switch experience
- Troubleshooting BGP and routing
- BGP metric and routing manipulation
- Troubleshooting ACLs and layered filtering access operations and whitelisting
- Preference is given to Cisco route/switch or Cisco security certifications
Cisco ASA experience
- Strong AnyConnect management and troubleshooting experience
- VPN troubleshooting experience
- Packet monitoring and multi-layer filtering experience
- Designing secure networks and troubleshooting access
Strong desire to learn new skills and adapt to cloud-first network operations and architecture.
Strong troubleshooting and root-cause analysis skills
Strong network foundational knowledge
Desired Skills:
Cisco Router/Switch and Security experience
- CCIE or required experience
- Cisco route/switch experience
- Cisco ASA experience including DAP posturing and AnyConnect management.
DevOps experience
- Terraform
- CloudFormation
- Git
- Ansible
Cloud Experience
- AWS or Azure Cloud (highly desired)
- Maintaining routing, security, load balancing, front door, and other standing cloud-based network services
- Cloud Architecture
Linux experience including maintaining open-source monitoring tools
If your skills fit this role, please apply for immediate consideration!
-Sorry no third parties.

name: Telecom Network Engineer
summary:
Build IT that develops financial futures
At Vanguard, technology is integral to helping our clients...
tasks: Develop your skills by supporting everything from new large-scale installations to upgrades, maintenance and fixes,Provide expert level telecommunications network services, including designing, installing, configuring, and integrating new network technologies.,Evaluate and recommend new network technologies and designs for building sites in the United States as well as international locations.,Provide design, installation, configuration, and integration of new network technologies.,Obtain project approval and funding. (Certification Desirable),Knowledge of Linux, Virtual Servers, VoIP, IP and SIP protocols, Wireshark, tcpdump.,Understand the Unified Communications industry environment (SBC, Application Servers, Media Gateways...).,Knowledge of Ribbon SBCs installation and maintenance. (Certification Desirable),Experience with Cisco voice technologies. (Certification Desirable),Knowledge of design, planning and execution of core voice initiatives (TDM and IP Telephony, SIP, SBC, Session Routing, ACD, Contact Center, Voice-mail, legacy PBX migrations, IP Telephony platform upgrades, etc)
text:
Build IT that develops financial futures
At Vanguard, technology is integral to helping our clients reach their personal goals. We depend on IT 24/7 to run our investors' assets. That puts your expertise in telecommunications at the heart of our business. As a Telecom Network Engineer, we'll rely on you to keep our networks running smoothly and, in return, you can rely on us to help you develop your career. The central role of technology in Vanguard's business not only provides extraordinary learning opportunities for you, it sets new standards for the wider IT industry. Make it count.
In this role, you will:
Develop your skills by supporting everything from new large-scale installations to upgrades, maintenance and fixes
Provide expert level telecommunications network services, including designing, installing, configuring, and integrating new network technologies.
Evaluate and recommend new network technologies and designs for building sites in the United States as well as international locations.
Provide design, installation, configuration, and integration of new network technologies.
Obtain project approval and funding. Identify stake holders and form project teams. Conduct pilot and recommends go/no go decision. Verify network installations meet production acceptance standards.
Test and evaluate IT vendor products. Recommend vendor selections and new network architecture for building sites in the United States as well as international locations.
Provide expert level telecom network services for the most complex issues elevated from the Support Center and Technical Services groups. Troubleshoot and resolve chronic and catastrophic problems.
Identify performance issues and interpret trends, like network traffic, to ensure continuous communications improvement
Write documentation, including policies and procedures.
Facilitate network traffic, security, systems monitoring and related discussions with IT and business managers.
Provide design and debugging services to development teams. Work closely with project managers and developers to implement reliable, manageable, and secure solutions for external connections.
Train and mentor staff. Conduct formal training sessions, one-on-one sessions, and recommend training vendors.
Complete network capacity planning activities, including monitoring the network and establishing network capacity metrics. Initiates actions to prevent network degradation caused by capacity issues.
Identify opportunities to automate manual system tasks.
Thoroughly understands and complies with IT policies and procedures, especially those for quality and productivity standards that enable the team to meet established client service levels. Thoroughly understands and complies with Information Security policies and procedures.
Participates in special projects and performs other related duties as assigned.
What it takes:
Undergraduate degree in a related field (or equivalent training and experience)
At least two years' network administration experience, one year of which will ideally have been spent as a network technician
Strong written and spoken communication, project leadership, and group facilitation skills
Expert knowledge of the following telecom network practices and concepts: network security, network architecture design, technical standards and deliverables, troubleshooting tools (e.g., protocol analyzers, load generators, and network traces), software and hardware installation and configuration, network hardware, protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, DLC, OSPF, and BGP).
VoIP software design and implementation experience
Expert understanding of Avaya Aura products, CM, SM, System Manager CMS, AES, CES Media Servers and Gateways. (Certification Desirable)
Knowledge of Linux, Virtual Servers, VoIP, IP and SIP protocols, Wireshark, tcpdump.
Understand the Unified Communications industry environment (SBC, Application Servers, Media Gateways...).
Knowledge of Ribbon SBCs installation and maintenance. (Certification Desirable)
Experience with Cisco voice technologies. (Certification Desirable)
Knowledge of design, planning and execution of core voice initiatives (TDM and IP Telephony, SIP, SBC, Session Routing, ACD, Contact Center, Voice-mail, legacy PBX migrations, IP Telephony platform upgrades, etc)
Experience with Teams Telephony and Direct Routing for Teams.
Special Factors:
Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position
About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we're changing the way the world invests.
For us, investing doesn't just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose - and that's how we've become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let's make it count.
Inclusion Statement
Vanguard's continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: "Do the right thing."
We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard's core purpose through our values.
When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Company Information
Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with 2014 pro forma annual revenue of circa ï¿½ 11 billion and 93,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.
Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, and Worldline. Our ability to deliver Operational Excellence means that we are always ready and able to help our clients address whatever challenges they face, wherever they are in the world. We also place great emphasis on understanding and meeting the needs and priorities of our clients, including their sustainability objectives.
Atos values the individual and strives to deliver an appropriate work-life balance because a motivated and happy person can add untold value to our clients and colleagues around the world. For more information, please see the Atos corporate web site: www.atos.net. Job Description This position will occasionally interact with Supervisors/Managers, customers, and/or functional peer group Engineers, normally involving matters between functional areas, or other company divisions or units. Often must participate in cross functional support teams. Must have a demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and communicate in English effectively through voice and email. This position must possess good network troubleshooting and impact assessment skills. Must have experience in configuration and troubleshooting of the following equipment/systems:- Cisco routers and switches - Cisco Firewalls- Cisco Load Balancers- Experience with other vendor Load Balancers and Firewalls is desired as well. (F5, ACE)- Experience with WAN Optimization devices is desired (Cisco.)- Experince with Solarwins & Cisco Prime - Bluesocket- Cisco Secure ACS - Cisco ASA FW - Cisco IDS/IPS - Cisco ISE- Cisco Switch/Router- Cisco VPN - Cisco WLC- Citrix Netscaler - Citrix Secure Gateways - Citrix XenMobile- CriticalWatch- FireEye EX ï¿½HX - NX- Snort IDS- Solarwinds Orion Config Manager- Websense Data Security - Email Security Websense Web Security May perform or participate with a Sr Network Engineer on one or more of the following:- Manage the installation, maintenance, and monitoring of the organizationï¿½s local area network systems- Manages the installation, maintenance, and monitoring of the organizations wide area network systems- Assist in the development and evaluation of network performance criteria and measurement methods- Participate in the testing and analysis of all components of network facilities to ensure operational status- Identify network problems and work to resolution of the problem- Participate in an On-Call Rotation for the client- Any other duties as assigned This position requires at least 10yrs of experience.- CCNA Certification is required.- CCNP Certification is required.- CCSP Certification is required.*LI-POST Job Requirements Position Requirements- A minimum of 10 years working as network engineer- Excel Reporting - Experience with wireless- Experience with Cisco, firewalls,F5- Prefered certifications - Cisco- CCNA, CCDA, CCNP, CCDP, (CCIE is a plus)

text:
Senior Network Engineer - Cisco, LAN, WAN, AWS
A global organisation in a period of exponential growth have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Network Engineer.
The ideal candidate will have experience supporting global networks, a high level of technical skills for troubleshooting and problem analysis, along with the ability to clearly communicate the results of problem analysis to business stakeholders, IT support teams, and network providers to quickly and effectively resolve operational issues.
Key duties and responsibilities:
Resolve support trouble tickets.
Provide 2nd & 3rd Level support.
Provide guidance as required to network providers.
Provide detailed network performance analysis for application traffic.
Provide Wide Area Network reliability, availability, and performance reporting as necessary.
Work with network vendors and global/regional IT groups to resolve problems compliant with SLAs.
Provide network support and configuration assistance to application teams deploying at public Cloud providers (AWS, Azure, etc).
Support for firewalls and the remote access environment, including client VPN.
Support for identify management technologies including active directory, two factor authentication, Radius and PEAP.
You must have the following experience:
Established and proven experience of providing WAN & LAN support in diverse environments.
Cisco Certification (CCNP or higher or equivalent).
Demonstrate a working knowledge, understanding, and experience with the following:
Network infrastructure (WAN, MAN, LAN, Wifi, QoS for Data, Voice, and Video)
Network protocols (IP, OSPF, BGP, RIP, IPSec, etc)
MPLS / VPN / Hybrid WAN / Metro Networks / leased lines
Network Hardware (Cisco routers and switches, cabling, Palo Alto firewalls)
VOIP and Collaboration Systems (Skype for Business, Avaya)
Network connections to Cloud Providers (AWS, Azure, etc)
Network performance analysis and reporting
Incident, Change and Problem Management processes within an ITIL based framework.
Identity Management (Active Directory, ADFS, Azure AD, 2 Factor Auth, TACACS, Radius, PEAP)
Wireshark, Netflow, Riverbed ATX, MRTG, Nagios
Operating systems: Microsoft (Server and Desktop), Mac OS X, Linux
Microsoft Office 365 & Visio Professional
Ability and motivation to learn new technologies.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, with an ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.
To apply please send a CV detailing the above required skills and experience.
title: Senior Network Engineer - Cisco, LAN, WAN, AWS

name: Senior Network Engineer jobs in London, UK
summary:
Full Time Job
About the Opportunity
The Senior Network Engineer will provide technical expertise ac...
text:
Full Time Job
About the Opportunity
The Senior Network Engineer will provide technical expertise across the Routing, Switching and Security layers within our data centres and offices whilst working closely with the London based teams as well as global members of Deluxe. They will ensure solutions are delivered according to designs, technical standards and specifications. They will work in collaboration with the other Infrastructure team members as well as the Operations, Development, Broadcast, Creative and Media teams to create detailed designs, implement solutions, document best practices, and provide business as usual (BAU) maintenance and support for the Deluxe Infrastructure (including out-of-hours work).
Overview of responsibilities:
• Manage the day to day operation of network infrastructure, provide BAU maintenance and support, including out-of-hours / on-call support.
• Work collaboratively with the Infrastructure, Development, Broadcast, Creative and Media teams to troubleshoot problems and provide solutions.
• Participate in project work and implement technical solutions including data centre builds, hardware and software upgrades and device configuration.
• Ensure solutions chosen fit within the overall Infrastructure Architecture, management systems framework, and security standards.
• Document standards, best practices, and installation guides; add to the networking knowledge base.
• Intimate involvement with configuration, management and troubleshooting of all network equipment, going above and beyond the call of duty when required.
• Capable of independent decision making based on broad managerial direction.
• Demonstrates problem-solving skills to resolve issues that span technology and culture.
Core competencies:
• 5 years' experience as a Network engineer using Cisco and Juniper based devices.
• Strong confidence with routing and WAN technologies such as BGP, VRF's, and OSPF
• Knowledge on with Juniper QFX switches with EVPN and VXLAN
• Confidence using Cisco switches with VSS, Stacking, EVPC, VLAN, FEX and LACP technologies
• Experience with security devices such as Fortinet Fortigates, Cisco ASA's and Juniper SRX's. This will require experience with policy design and changes, offloading, SSL and IPSEC VPN, NAT with DOS and IPS policies.
• Confidence with Juniper EX switches with Virtual Chassis switches
• Have thorough knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, flags and be able to troubleshoot connectivity issues using tools such as Wireshark, Iperf, Netflow to analyse and fix faults.
• Configuration and optimisation of QOS
• Experience with multicast technology such as IGMP, PIM and MSDP
• Knowledge on fibre installations, connectors and optics.
• CCNP, equivalent or higher
• Strong troubleshooting experience in a fast-paced working environment.
• Demonstrable use of access control and monitoring skills with AAA, Radius and TACACAS with ACS, and SNMP.
• Ability to work in a challenging and demanding environment.
• Some knowledge of ITIL best practice would be beneficial.
Additional Information
About the Company
Deluxe, a subsidiary of Platinum Equity, is a global leader in media and entertainment services for film, video and online content. Since 1915, Deluxe has been the trusted partner for the world's most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, TV networks, exhibitors, advertisers and others, offering best-in-class solutions in post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and cloud-based technologies.
With headquarters in Los Angeles and offices around the globe, the company employs over 3,500 of the most talented individuals, developers, and industry veterans worldwide.

Canberra

ITIL Foundations Certificate

summary:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components su...
text:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Senior Network Engineer work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Responsibilities
The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
Required Qualifications
+ 5 or more years of experience Cisco Wireless Network Engineering
+ Experienced with monitoring tools such as Solar Winds/Orion, Lancope, LiveAction or similar required
+ Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences
+ Must be a highly effective communicator with the ability to lead and influence
Desired Qualifications:
+ CCNA/CCNP Highly preferred
+ Experienced with SDWA(Viptela etc )
+ MPLS
+ Metro-E
+ DWDM
+ 5g Wireless
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40

text:
WHO WE ARE:
EOS IT Solutions is a leading IT and global video collaboration company. We specialize in innovative IT and video conferencing solutions, which empower businesses and organizations throughout the world. With teams of qualified IT support engineers, EOS IT Solutions offers a fast and reliable service to our clients.
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Devise, plan, deploy, and improve wireless networks from the beginning to implementation by collaborating with vendors, managers, and network engineers.
Understand client requirements to be able to cater to their appropriate needs.
Manage firewalls, such as Palo Alto, Juniper or Cisco ASA.
Handhold other in-house engineers to train them on wireless technologies, besides guiding other non-technical people.
Use tools to evaluate to test and tweak wireless products, such as routers, switches, hubs, bridges, virtual private networks (VPNs), and network amplifiers, among others.
Design and validate the performance, quality, and reliability of the RF link.
Design and implement WLANs and other wireless networks.
Write manuals and document current network procedures.
Have extensive knowledge of routing protocols (OSPF, EIGRP, and BGP).
Make use of enterprise monitoring tools (SolarWinds and Splunk).
Optimize network performance by supervising performance, addressing network problems and breakdowns, and partnering with Network Engineers to optimize the network.
Develop and implement policies and classify and oversee access to protect network systems.
Make sure that all equipment, including servers and the other network products, are well-connected.
Devise and support radio frequencies (RF) link performance, reliability, and quality.
Enable data and system protection by developing and maintaining mechanisms for backing up and retrieval.
Collaborate with different teams to ensure the optimized performance of VoIP and other wireless telecommunication devices.
Work with security team to evaluate threats, troubleshoot issues, and comply with appropriate security configuration standards of their organizations.
Design and deploy changes to the configurations of clients as per the applicable change management process.
Proactively handle all network security solutions.
Make use of testing and diagnostic tools to assess and modify equipment.
WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:
Wireless Network Engineers, aspirants need to be well-versed in wireless equipment, wireless LAN (WLAN) standards, design, and protocols.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving skills and strong attention to detail
Have good communication skills as they will work alongside vendors, network technicians, and customers
Ability to diagnose basic technical problems and find the root cause
Ability to work in fast paced dynamic environment
Must be available to work outside of normal business hours to support mission-critical applications
Have strong customer service skills.
Must be available to travel to various customer sites within the US 40-60% of the time, and globally if required

text:
Job Description
We are looking for a Network Engineer to implement and configure tactical network communications systems to support innovative solutions for complex network architectures. This team is currently developing and implementing secure communications networks that require all levels of engineering support. This includes input for network architecture, optimization schemes, implementing security protocols, configuring network systems, and writing supporting software applications. In this role, you will support design, development, and test efforts for an airborne tactical networking system and be responsible for ensuring the integrity and security of this system. Must have in-depth experience with Linux security protocols as well as virtualized systems.
Your Day to Day:
Create modules, install software on target nodes, and deploy configuration files
Understand and implement router protocols including OSPF, EIGRP, RIP, BGP, PPOE, MANET
Develop network security architectures with HAIPE, IPSEC, TLS and other protocols
Support test and evaluation of network architecture
Develop system interfaces
Configure switch port and router settings
WAN, LAN, WLAN, VOIP setup and troubleshooting
Configure, install, and maintain network security posture
Implement IA controls
Understand and ensure compliance with DoD RMF
Implement high-level designs in robust, maintainable software
Work closely with the operational Project Management team to maintain successful development sprints and stay on schedule
Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in Information System, Engineering, Scientific or related Technical Field from an accredited college or 5 years equivalent experience
Understanding of networking fundamentals including VLANs, subnets, protocols, and standards
Experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting wired and wireless networks
Hand’s on experience with firewall applications, set up, maintenance and troubleshooting
Experience working WPA Enterprise encryption standards
Experience with FIPS level encryption standard over networks
Experience with implementing and managing a certificate authority for PKI
Ability to integrate networks to other enterprise systems
Understanding of various wireless client tools to detect and resolve issues
Experience installing and maintaining network security protocols
Experience with Linux System Administration, firewalls and settings
Experience with virtualized systems applications and administration (VMWare, Esxi)
Advanced knowledge of routing protocols (OSPF, EIGRP, RIP, BGP, PPOE, MANET)
Knowledge/experience configuring and troubleshooting communications applications (email, chat, VOIP, etc.)
Current US SECRET Clearance
Desired:
CISSP
Network Operating Systems Certificate
CCNA Security
CompTia Security +
Hand’s experience designing, developing and implementing successful end-to-end network architectures
Knowledge of wireless controllers (CISCO, Juniper), wireless access points and the ability to deploy and configure them
Knowledge or experience with IP or RF networks (UHF and HF)
Experience with US Navy Communications Networks such as ADNS/ISNS/CANES
Knowledge of Navy Command, Control, Communications, Computers and Information Systems (C4IR)

summary: We're not your traditional tech company and we don't aim to be. Going against the grain is in our D...
tasks: Execute on technical user stories and feature requests provided by the Product Management team in a fast-paced, agile environment,Research cutting edge networking hardware/technologies and tools to continue evolving our product and service offerings,Monitor all customer deployed network devices and controllers using existing dashboards and monitoring tools,Deploy hardware, software and firmware upgrades to network devices as needed,Train internal enablement teams on the proper use of networking hardware and software as needed, and communicate upcoming changes to key internal stakeholders,Hand-on experience with configuration, design, provisioning, maintenance and troubleshooting of networks with nationwide deployments using the following technologies::,Cisco/Meraki (Full Stack),Ubiquiti Unifi (Controller/Devices),Minimum one year experience working with network operating systems, network diagnostics, monitoring and analysis tools,Experience with wireless networking fundamentals including site survey activities and high density planning/deployment/troubleshooting,Respectful, empathetic, and humble
text:
We're not your traditional tech company and we don't aim to be. Going against the grain is in our DNA. Building a revolutionary product begins with revolutionary thinking. That's why we value diversity background and lived experience. Together, we empower restaurants of all sizes to build great teams, increase revenue, improve operations, and delight their guests. We pair our deep understanding of the restaurant industry with powerful cloud based software and restaurant-grade hardware to deliver an intuitive all-in-one platform. Join us on our mission to empower the restaurant community to delight guests, do what they love, and thrive.
Are you bready* for a change?
As a Network Engineer II, you will be a critical part of the Network Engineering team within the Engineering organization. You will be assisting with initiatives that will help support and scale Toast's networking services and product offerings to remain ahead of the explosive customer growth we are experiencing. You will also have the opportunity to interface with our internal and external customers as well as vendors to research and test product enhancements and troubleshoot product issues in order to inspire and inform how Toast continues to iterate and grow.
We are looking for a passionate network engineer that can operate as a subject matter expert for the Toast networking domain, help execute Toast's long-term networking strategy as a part of individual and group projects, and work closely with a world-class product management team to build out a highly scalable, high-performance networking platform.
About this roll*:
Execute on technical user stories and feature requests provided by the Product Management team in a fast-paced, agile environment
Research cutting edge networking hardware/technologies and tools to continue evolving our product and service offerings
Monitor all customer deployed network devices and controllers using existing dashboards and monitoring tools
Deploy hardware, software and firmware upgrades to network devices as needed
Train internal enablement teams on the proper use of networking hardware and software as needed, and communicate upcoming changes to key internal stakeholders
Do you have the right ingredients*?
Hand-on experience with configuration, design, provisioning, maintenance and troubleshooting of networks with nationwide deployments using the following technologies::
Cisco/Meraki (Full Stack)
Ubiquiti Unifi (Controller/Devices)
Minimum one year experience working with network operating systems, network diagnostics, monitoring and analysis tools
Experience with wireless networking fundamentals including site survey activities and high density planning/deployment/troubleshooting
Respectful, empathetic, and humble
Integrity to achieve results the right way
*Bread puns encouraged but not required

name: Sr Wireless Network Engineer (will sponsor clearance!)
summary:
Job Description
BAE has recently been awarded an Operations and Maintenance Infrastructure contract...
tasks: Industry Certification: CCNA Preferred,8+ years of Enterprises WLAN experience and high density deployments
text:
Job Description
BAE has recently been awarded an Operations and Maintenance Infrastructure contract with our Federal Customer and we are seeking a Sr Wireless Network Engineer Ideal candidate will possess expertise on multiple complex work assignments which are broad in nature, requiring originality and innovation in determining how to accomplish tasks. The Operations and Management (O&M) contract focuses on providing customer with IT Operations and Maintenance including system sustainment, modernizing its infrastructure, and controlling and managing the lifecycle of all changes with minimum disruption to end users.
Job Summary
Provides support in the translation of business requirements into telecommunications (e.g., Wireless LAN, WAN, Voice and Video) requirements, designs and orders. Also, provides in-depth engineering analysis of telecommunications alternatives for government agencies in support of their strategic modernization efforts and telecommunications enhancement design for medium and large-scale telecommunication infrastructures. Provides interface support to telecommunications end users, telecommunications operations personnel, and telecommunications strategic program management.
Responsibilities
Work in support of small to large strategic or tactical wireless projects.
Support planning and execution of large wireless refresh projects to completion.
Conduct and or coordinate site surveys, develop site plans to gain total coverage of facility.
Build BOM, track site upgrade execution, and validate deployment/upgraded equipment/site.
Performing site installs, maintenance, upgrades or software enhancements to support the network infrastructure needs.
Function as a point of escalation for operational entities regarding regular or complex issues.
Monitor system for trouble areas and proactively resolve and document root cause.
Work on daily service tickets while engaged on enterprise wireless deployments.
Required Skills and Education Master's Degree or higher; with 10 years of experience and applicable advance/expert certifications for the specified areas.
OR
Bachelors Degree with 15 years related experience
Strong experience with both centralized and local Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers
Strong experience with Cisco Lightweight Access Points
Strong understanding of WLAN technologies, network management, 802.11 b/g/n/ac standards
Strong troubleshooting skills and experience with analysis tools such as Ekahau, Air Magnet, Wireshark, etc.
Design, test and implement new Wi-Fi deployments and upgrades to existing infrastructure
Engage with manufacturer technical support centers to quickly resolve issues as they arise as necessary
Preferred Skills and Education
Industry Certification: CCNA Preferred
8+ years of Enterprises WLAN experience and high density deployments
3+ years of Cisco devices configuration experience
Desired Certifications: Cisco Certified Network Associate, Cisco Certified Network Professional, Cisco Certified Voice Professional, CompTIA Network+, Certified Wireless Network AdministratorAbout BAE Systems Intelligence & Security BAE Systems Intelligence & Security, based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do-from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels. That's BAE Systems. That's Inspired Work. Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Gender Expression. To see Inspired Work in action, visit www.baesystems.com and follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/baesystemsintel. Employment Type: Full-Time

text:
Senior Network Engineer
Charlotte Douglas International Airport (CLT)
Join Our Team :
ServiceTec International Inc., specializes exclusively in the provision of Managed IT Services to the world's airport and airline industries, and have been doing so since 1989. We operate globally with headquarters in the UK and the USA, and offices in Canada, The Netherlands and Norway. We partner with airports and airlines of all sizes to manage, maintain, monitor and support business and mission critical. For further information, please visit www.servicetec.com.
Position Overview :
ServiceTec International, the world's leading provider of Managed IS Services, is currently seeking applicants for highly-qualified Sr. Network Engineer Support Technician in Charlotte, NC. The Individual selected for this role will be responsible for configuring and installing various network devices and services for software and/or hardware, and performing network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations. He/she also monitors performance and ensures system availability and reliability, monitors system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning, and provides support and troubleshooting to resolve issues. Other key responsibilities include working within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure, selecting and implementing security tools, policies, and procedures in conjunction with the City staff, and working with other IT personnel for problem resolution.
The individual providing Sr. Network Engineer Support will be working 40 hrs/week, covering different shifts . The individual we are currently seeking must be highly skilled, motivated, professional, knowledgeable and customer-centric.
Position Responsibilities:
Plan, and manage Avaya SPB network implementations
Provide support for ERS, VSP infrastructure
Provide Tier 2/3 Support for network issues as necessary
Responsible for implementing monitoring of the enterprise infrastructure
Research innovative technologies in the areas of SPB, L2VSNs, L3VSNs, Inter-VSN Routing
Contribute to the development and management of the network strategy
Responsible for creating and maintaining network documentation
Ensure all systems are fully backed up in accordance with company standard and industry best practice
Apply knowledge of computer network infrastructures, technologies and protocols
Provide escalated levels of troubleshooting and support the network infrastructure
Use ticketing system to full extent as all issues and activity are fully documented from initial opening, progress notations, and resolution are chronicled
Assist in the diagnosis and resolution of network operating problems with technical assistance from vendors and/or senior staff/management
Routine preventative maintenance, deployment and integration of hardware, software and network infrastructure equipment and services
Experience in deploying network systems and services in large high availability, multi-site environment
Complete and Verify backups of Network Equipment
Rack and installation of network equipment including ERS 4900, VSP 7K, VSP 8K, Nortel 8610
Documentation and Inventory of all equipment using COM+ application
Systems integration between all Avaya Gear
Design and Implementation of new systems and equipment
Perform Capacity Planning
Maintain Avaya Licensing
Engage with clients and vendors for scoping of new projects
Ensure functionality of all aspects of the network infrastructure
All other duties as assigned
Minimum requirements include:
5+ Years of Experience with Windows Server 2008 R2, 2012, 2016, Windows 7,8,10 and server applications (i.e. SQL Server/IIS/Exchange/SharePoint) is required
3+ Years of Experience with current Hewlett-Packard servers and enterprise SAN equipment, ArcServe UDP,System Center 2012+ or other system management software, is highly desirable
Strong ability to manage difficult and/or stressful work-related issues
Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships and communication with executives, decision makers, stakeholders, and end-users regarding pertinent network activities
A strong general background in all IT functions and Microsoft technologies and computer hardware
Extreme / Avaya data networks management to include design, implementation, maintenance, and security hardening
XMC configuration and administration.
Extreme VSP configuration or equivalent experience on a different vendor platform may be considered, Extreme platform preferred
Education and Certification:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related experience
A+, Network+, MCSE and/or MCSA Certifications preferred
Personal Attributes:
Demonstrated interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
Ability to prioritize and execute tasks on time
Self-motivated and self-directed
Keen attention to detail
Able to work successfully in a collaborative team environment
Strong customer service orientation
Friendly and personable
For more information on ServiceTec, please visit: www.servicetec.com.
ServiceTec International, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will comply with all applicable local, state and federal statutes concerning equal employment opportunity with regard to all employees whether full time, part time, casual, temporary and seasonal or contract.
ServiceTec will not discriminate on grounds of sex, trans-gender status, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, civil partnership status, age, race, ethnic origin, color, nationality, national origin, disability or on other grounds not prohibited by legislation. This policy applies to the process of recruitment and selection (both internal and external), promotion, training, conditions of work, pay and benefits and to every other aspect of employment, including general treatment at work and the processes involved in the termination of employment.
We are thankful to receive any applications; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
All applications will be on file with ServiceTec indefinitely. Should you wish to have your personal data removed, please follow the instructions in the application acknowledgement email that you will receive after applying.

summary:
Job Description
SUMMARY:

text:
Job Description
SUMMARY:
Immediate need for a Network Engineer to support the company’s on-premises network infrastructure, store network, and hybrid cloud datacenter model. Qualifications include, but not limited to:
Cisco CCNA certification strongly desired; CCNP, CCDP preferred
5-8 years of IT experience supporting, installing, configuring and troubleshooting enterprise network environments
3+ years of recent experience in a Cisco environment with wireless engineering competency
Fortinet, Palo Alto, Aruba experience
Experience across various enterprise identity authentication technologies ranging from AAA (RADIUS/TACACS), 802.1X technologies (Wired/Wireless), RSA and token-based systems
Experience with Aruba ClearPass Policy Server, and/or Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) and Cisco Access Control System (ACS) is preferred
Must have industry standard knowledge in LANs, WANs, and WLAN technologies and protocols
Working knowledge of hardware should include common router, switch, firewall, VPN, and management platforms such as Cisco, Juniper, Palo Alto, and Fortinet
Experience supporting public cloud deployments (e.g. AWS, Azure, Softlayer), preferred
Retail, hospitality, e-Commerce or related experience – a plus
Position will be Contract-to-Hire

text:
Job Description
Enterprise Network & Security Infrastructure
Portland, OR
OVERVIEW:
As a Network Engineer, you will own an Enterprise network and security infrastructure by designing, implementing and administrating a high performing 24x7 environment. Ideal candidates will have a strong understanding of both networking and security fundamentals in a multi-site hybrid cloud environment.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:
Manage, maintain and evolve the LAN/WAN/WLAN network environment in a footprint containing Palo Alto, Cisco and Aruba products.
Manage, maintain and evolve the security framework across all layers within and outside the network.
Manage, maintain and evolve the telecom infrastructure including VOIP.
Perform all networking and security related troubleshooting.
Participate in production deployments during business and non-business hours.
Design and administer enterprise monitoring for network performance and security.
Proactively monitor and remediate network performance and security events.
Report on performance metrics and security states.
Contribute to strategic planning and provide operational support for business continuity.
Participate in cloud strategy and support of both AWS and AZURE.
Maintain relevant documentation, policies and procedures.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITES & BEHAVIORS:
Bachelor’s degree or 4+ years of work experience.
6+ years of relevant networking and/or security work experience.
Experience designing, deploying, upgrading and supporting LAN/WAN/WLAN in an enterprise environment.
Experience designing, deploying, upgrading and supporting Security frameworks in an enterprise environment.
Familiarity with Active Directory and identity management systems.
High-level certification in a major technology area preferred (CISSP, SSCP, CCSP, etc.)
Must conduct oneself in accordance with Company's Core Values.
Strong written, communication and presentation skills.
Pre-Employment Requirement: All employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment screening that may include drug testing, background/criminal check, and if applicable, must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
About APR Staffing:
APR Staffing was born from the merger of two well-respected technical staffing firms in Portland. ieSolutions, founded in 2002, enjoyed an impressive reputation as one of the largest locally-owned and most respected technical staffing companies. Professional Resource Group, aka Data Resource Group, founded in 2009, also earned regional acclaim for being a fast-growing and highly-motivated professional staffing agency. Both companies have been recent award winners for the Portland Business Journal's Fastest-Growing Private Companies. The two firms, now as APR Staffing, make for one of the fastest-growing and most-respected professional and technical staffing companies in Oregon and Southwest Washington.
Collaborating with our customers, we augment their workforce with technical and administrative professionals. We provide only high-caliber, professional-grade resources throughout the Pacific Northwest.
APR Staffing is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Company Description
APR Staffing was born from the merging of two well-respected staffing firms in Portland. ieSolutions, founded in 2002, has a long history as one of the largest locally owned technical staffing companies. Professional Resource Group, aka Data Resource Group, founded in 2009, also earned wide-spread acclaim for being a fast-growing and highly motivated professional staffing agency. Both companies have been recent award winners for the Portland Business Journal's Fastest Growing Private Companies. The two firms, now as APR Staffing, make for one of the fastest growing and most respected professional staffing companies in Oregon and Southwest Washington.
Collaborating with our customers, we augment their workforce with technical and administrative talent. We provide information technology, engineering, operation, technician, analyst, project management and administrative talent to our clients through out the Pacific Northwest.
APR Staffing is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

text:
If you need to find the perfect network engineer, then Monster’s network engineer job description template will help you get started. Build your own description by following the template’s design and adding your own words that apply to the job at hand. Browse our computer job listings for more helpful tips.
Network Engineer
[Intro Paragraph] The best way to get your network engineer job description off to a good start is by explaining to candidates why they would want to work for your company. Describe an appealing company culture that is different from other employers. Give job seekers a good sense of the employee brand and how the strength of the brand is what makes it an ideal workplace.
Network Engineer Job Responsibilities:
Establishes and maintains network performance.
Builds net configurations and connections.
Troubleshoots network problems.
IP address auditing.
Establishes networking environment by designing system configuration and directing system installation.
Defines, documents, and enforces system standards.
Maximizes performance by troubleshooting network problems and outages and scheduling upgrades.
Configures router.
Updates data servers and network equipment.
Collaborates with network architects on network optimization.
Secures network system by establishing and enforcing policies and defining and monitoring access.
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, and participating in professional organizations.
Accomplishes information systems and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
[Work Hours & Benefits] This location for the discussion of work hours and benefits will help encourage job seekers to continue to read your posting. When they get to this point in the job description, they will want to know everything about what their workday will consist of and what benefits they will get by working there. Be sure to give candidates incentives (mention benefits such as tuition reimbursement, generous PTO, and parental leave) and include any special perks (like snacks in the cupboards or a dog-friendly office) that they could receive by becoming a new employee with your company.
Network Engineer Qualifications/Skills:
Network knowledge
Network design and implementation
Network troubleshooting
Tracking budget expenses
Project management
Problem solving and analytical skills
Time-management skills
Strong documentation skills
LAN knowledge
Network hardware configuration
Network performance tuning
People management
Education and Experience Requirements:
BA in computer science, information technology, engineering, or a related field
Five to 10 years of experience in network administration
A graduate and voluntary certification may also be preferable
[Call to Action] At the close your network engineer job description, be sure to add a call to action to increase your chances of getting responses. Tell job seekers exactly how you want them to apply. For instance, by clicking on the apply button at the top of the job listing, or by filling out an application on the company’s website.
Make finding candidates easier with help from top hiring experts
Getting a handle on your job descriptions is just one way to find your ideal candidates. Expand your searches for the best hires with help from Monster. Monster’s plans will give you access to a massive resume database and can offer you much more recruiting opportunities. Get in touch today for more information.

text:
Position: Network Engineer - Network Services
The Network Engineer is responsible for planning, designing, implementing and maintaining a network architecture. The Network Engineer will also implement, maintain, and support network systems on a day-to-day operational level. In addition, day-to-day duties will include establishing standards within the network infrastructure, mentoring of junior network services staff and supporting them as a Tier 3 member for resolving break-fixes.
Responsibilities
Performs complex network management design and integration.
Strong working knowledge installing, configuring and supporting CISCO Wireless LAN hardware products.
Plans, forecasts, implements, and identifies resource and bandwidth requirements for network devices and connections.
Participates in design reviews of network supporting IT systems.
Conducts quality assurance reviews of system installations performed by junior technicians.
Provides technical expertise on projects for voice and data systems, including but not limited to LANs, and WLANs with awareness of converged networks.
Identifies, evaluates, and assists staff in the selection of hardware, software, and services to meet specifications and requirements.
Monitors and controls all network infrastructure, including local and wide area networks.
Maintains local area network (LAN), wireless local area network (WLAN), wide area network (WAN),
to include installation, configuration, and ongoing field service.
Consults on scope and specification requirements for bids and contracts.
Conducts site surveys and on-site assessments and prepares schematic diagrams for recommended and efficient installations. Develops and maintains network documentation.
Assist in resolving escalated incidents and participate in problem management activities.
Maintain awareness of industry trends and their advantages so as to recommend technological improvements.
Monitors protocol compatibility, performs system tuning, and makes recommendations for improvement.
Assists in developing architectures and planning for enterprise-wide tactical and strategic requirements, systems definition, and feasibility determination within a complex system environment.
Plans and oversees the implementation of network components of system installations and ensures network connectivity.
Occasional travel throughout the local Las Vegas area.
Knowledge of:
Design principles for local area networks
Switching and routing protocols
Wi-Fi Design and Best Practices
Network testing tools
IP addressing and subnet schemes
Voice over IP
Dynamic IP Routing
Industry standard network engineering specifications
Cisco, Brocade/Ruckus, Extreme Networks, Meru, and Transition switches
TCP/IP Protocol
Copper and fiber cable topologies and installation
Microsoft Visio for Network Documentation
Methods, materials, tools, equipment and procedures used in the installation, maintenance, testing and repair of networks, communication links and peripheral equipment
Interpersonal skills using tact, patience, problem resolution and courtesy
Ability to:
Design, implement and integrate enterprise grade wireless networks
Perform and document wireless site surveys
Install and troubleshoot local area networks and wide area networks using ...

Operations Network Engineer-6 Month Contract Position-Extension Possible-Local Candidates Only Please
Our large corporate client is looking for an Operations Network Engineer with general experience in LAN / WAN network engineering, installation, configuration, and maintenance of various network equipment (routers, switches, and associated technologies).
The role of a Network Engineer is to evaluate aspects of ongoing operations including device monitoring and documentation. A successful engagement is one that meets the customer's requirements, is delivered on time, and has a positive impact on the business.
The Operations Network Engineer is responsible for information in the monitoring systems used by Field Connectivity Services (FCS). These systems will be used to remote on availability, uptime, capacity, and other aspects of operations. The position will also maintain documentation on how to use the systems to produce the required reports. The Ops Network Engineer will work with the asset management team to maintain information in the official Configuration Management Database.
This position is located in Houston, TX.
Primary Technology Areas:
LAN, MAN, and WAN devices
Cisco Routing and Switching - CCNA level knowledge
Palo Alto Firewalls
SolarWinds
Eigrp and BGP Routing Protocols
Wi-Fi
VSAT Technologies
Responsibilities:
Gather requirements to complete active projects
Assist in the completion of documentation, testing, and communications of said projects
Maintain operational systems related to FCS equipment and monitoring requirements
Suggest changes to operational systems to better help manage FCS workloads
Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications: Security+, GSEC, SSCP
Cisco: CCNA, CCNP
Palo Alto: PCNSA / PCNSE

What Does a Cisco Network Engineer Do?
A Cisco network engineer oversees hardware and software used...
text:
What Does a Cisco Network Engineer Do?
A Cisco network engineer oversees hardware and software used to run an organization’s data network using the Cisco suite of products. As a Cisco network engineer, your responsibilities and duties include developing and building new data networks, monitoring and troubleshooting the system for issues, and providing technical support for users. Cisco network engineers usually serve on a team of information technology professionals and coordinate with various departments to discern the current and future needs of the company regarding data networks. They analyze how the system is working to ensure it is meeting, and will continue to meet, the needs of the business.

name: Senior Network Engineer
summary:
Meet our professionals
CGI: A place to build an IT career
Position Description
CGI Federal is seeki...
text:
Meet our professionals
CGI: A place to build an IT career
Position Description
CGI Federal is seeking an experienced Network Engineer to provide technical expertise for federal agency network and security requirements for WAN and security services. In this role, you will work closely with other team members to set the strategy direction across the enterprise, and ensuring that project and program architecture aligns to this vision by working with stakeholders to build a holistic view of the organization's strategy, processes, information, and information technology assets with a focus on telecommunications. You will develop a detailed knowledge of the underlying data and data products and become the subject matter expert on content, current and potential future uses of data, and the quality and interrelationship between core elements of various government networks.
Your future duties and responsibilities
• Responsible for understanding the technical configuration of agencies network and leading the Agency integration into a cloud-based shared services platform.
• Implement and configure security products for each agency, including vulnerability scanners, endpoint protection tools, firewall, VPN and network access control.
• Support and enhance the agency’s integration goals by deploying and maintaining security tools and capabilities.
• Assist in the maintenance of technical documentation of the agency’s architecture and configurations.
• Assist the agencies in understanding and implementing continuous monitoring.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role
• Lead efforts for network technology evaluations, which involves identifying a weighted feature matrix for a specific need and evaluating and scoring products against the desired features.
• 10+ years of experience with architecting and designing IP networks
• Experience with routing, switching, and security technologies
• Experience with DoD and Civilian LAN networks
• Knowledge of multi-domain architectures, including data center, WAN, and LAN, and cloud
• Experience with US-CERT (Computer Emergency Readiness Team) as well as TIC architecture and design
• Lead research focused on identifying emerging technology solutions that reduce costs, increase efficiencies, provide more value, provide more capabilities, reduce risks, and increase security.
• Familiarity with Software defined networking (SDN) Network Disaggregation technologies and methodologies along with open source solutions.
• 10+ years of experience with enterprise/telecom packet capture and analysis along with the ability to use tools and techniques to identify anomalous traffic that indicates potential malicious activity from advanced persistent threats.
• Ability to brief complex information to senior leadership.
Desired qualifications
Experience managing complex WAN communication environments for Federal agencies
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE) and Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) professional certifications.
Demonstrated experience operating and designing a network using routing protocols MPLS and MTIPS, IPSEC VPN.
Demonstrated experience performing compliance and vulnerability testing. Demonstrated experience making recommendations for leveraging network installations and reducing operation costs.
5+ years of experience in working with IPv6 and associated technologies
Minimum Years of directly related experience Required: 12
Minimum Education Required: Bachelors Degree
#CgiFederalJobs
What you can expect from us
Build your career with us.
It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.
At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.
Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.
Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.
No unsolicited agency referrals please.
CGI is an equal opportunity employer.
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.
CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.
We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.
All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.
CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

summary:
We are growing and looking for great people to grow with us!
MMY Consulting is committed to deliver...
text:
We are growing and looking for great people to grow with us!
MMY Consulting is committed to delivering the highest quality business and IT solutions to our clients. Our mission is to provide comprehensive consultation to public and private sector organizations seeking a true partner in their technology pursuits.
We are currently seeking a Network Engineer/Admin – wireless site surveys & installations to
join the MMY team. This is a travel position around the US. Local candidates need to be living approximately an hour away from any airport, please.
Role and Responsibilities:
TDD will provide resources for the GE project for US locations.
Ekahau site survey
Pre-install site and closet survey
Installations
Ekahau post-installation surveys
Service Description
Pre-install Site and closet survey
· Ekahau site survey
Perform onsite wireless surveys using the Ekahau software
Identify areas of concern for interference or low coverage
Determine placement of Access Points.
Suggest improvements for coverage.
· Site and Closet survey
Provide information in the Site Survey Blank document provided by WWT.
Follow the instructions in tab one to complete the site survey document accurately
Answer the survey questions
Insert a revised floor plan based on the findings for ceiling height, closet and AP locations, and areas of no access
Take and insert photos of each rack with full view anddetailed view showing port counts and available space.
Take and Insert photos of each AP
· Pre-install site and closet survey can be completed during normal business hours.
Installations
· Rack/stack and AP mounting
· Connection to existing cables for AP mounting
· Interconnect patch cables between networking equipment per provided diagrams
· Label both ends of patch cables
· Interconnect IDF patch panels and switch ports
· Take pictures of installed hardware
· Assist in testing and turn-up of new equipment
· Equipment:
o Viptela Routers
o Meraki Switches
Meraki Access Points
· Installations will be performed outside normal business hours
Post installation surveys
· Wireless engineers will perform a post install passive survey. The survey will provide a heat map of the coverage area post installation. Surveys will be performed during normal business hours.
Day one Support
· Eight (8) hours of on-site support during the first business day following completion of services
· Day one support will be performed during normal business hours
Deliverables
· Site survey document suggesting AP placement
· Site Survey Document
· Passive survey heatmaps – post installation
· Location
· Work will be performed at multiple US locations as identified by WWT
Job Requirements:
Ideally, we’d like people who can do both the surveys and the installations. But will consider people who can only do one.
Required for surveys
· Ekahau certified … or a lot of experience. Must have used it extensively.
· Must have own laptop to use.
· Must be extremely experienced in data collection for wireless surveys.
Required for installations
· CCNA level …certification not needed but an experience wireless network engineer
· Experience with Access Point installations
· Heavy wireless and wireless survey experience
· Meraki experience
Must be able to travel each week. Must have a credit card for hotel, car, and food. Air will be prepaid.

Needed - Network Engineer with strong IT and Cyber Security background. Strong background in layer two technologies and remote access technologies
Melbourne
I am looking for a Network Engineer to provide services and support of Infrastructure Systems for a leading provider of integrated facilities services with clients spanning across Australia and New Zealand.
The role requires you to plan, organise, and prioritise your work in order to meet targets and strict deadlines. You will have excellent communication skills to provide timely and accurate information to all stakeholders. You will be in charge of developing effective working relationships with internal customers and external partners.
EXPERIENCE
6+ years relevant IT experience in a large corporate environment
Worked with 1000+ user base, with different business units and unique requirements
Experience in design, installation and support of small, medium and large networks
Proven network troubleshooting skills
Established skills in supporting Cisco hybrid environments (HP, IBM, DELL, Juniper, Checkpoint, Meraki)
Good project management/co-ordination skills
Experience working in Skype for Business or other VoiP environment
Network Monitoring and Management tools such as Solarwinds (or Manage Engine, etc)
Worked in a team environment
Network Design Documentation skills
Follow documented Change, Release, Incident and Problem management processes

Strong understanding of Cyber Security, including but not limited to Antivirus, Mail protection, firewalls, etc.
Excellent understanding of networking technologies, hardware and security
Network routing protocols: EIGRP, OSPF and BGP
Layer two technologies: VLANs, FHRP (HSRP/VRRP), 802.1Q, 802.1X, Etherchannel / Port-Channel, VPC, LACP/PAgP, STP, VTP, SPAN
Excellent understanding of remote access technologies, VPN, SSL and IPsec, (including site to site VPN in a hybrid environment (Cisco / Check Point, etc))
Excellent understanding of TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, AAA, QoS, and Certifcates
Strong configuration and management of network hardware (Switches, Routers, Access Points, Firewalls)
Good understanding of virtualization and cloud environments
Cisco Routers, Switches, Wireless and Firewalls
Check Point Security Appliances
Cisco Meraki Security, Switching, and Wireless Appliances
Load Balancers and Proxies
3G/4G Provisioning
QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS
Tertiary qualifications in Information Services or related course
Industry certifications with Cisco
Microsoft, Citrix, VMWare, and ITIL certifications
Shows initiative and is proactive
Proven ability to learn quickly and take ownership of jobs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent customer service skills
Understanding of ITIL principles
Participation in after hours on-call roster

summary: " RESPONSIBILITIES The Telecom Network Engineer acts as the technical lead supporting the client or...
text:
" RESPONSIBILITIES The Telecom Network Engineer acts as the technical lead supporting the client organizationu2019s planning, transition, management, and modernization of an agencyu2019s voice and data telecommunications services under the agencyu2019s recently awarded GSA EIS contract. Candidate will play a technical advisory role and engage with other subject matter experts, vendor, sub-contractors and other client groups to ensure services are implemented in a technically-sound, timely and cost-effective manner. Requires excellent inter-personal, writing and oral communications skills. The position assists the office in identifying telecom and network infrastructure service priorities.
Duties are varied and include defining processes, providing cost-analysis, preparing briefings, service order scheduling, technology road-maps and plans, etc. The objective is to provide technical and business assistance to seamlessly transitioning current locations and telecom services to the new vendor and contract. The position requires candidate to be full-time on-site at customer work site in Washington, DC.
The work location is convenient to metro. CLIENT ENGAGEMENT u2022 Begin developing relationships one level up and two levels down. Identify and support opportunities to expand project scope beyond current deliverable and actively share information about clientsu2019 emerging support needs and trends with team members and management. Participate on proposals QUALIFICATIONS Required * 3-5 years network engineering or technical service support in the areas of PBX, VOIP, Voice Mail or wireless communications.
* At least 2 years experience with contact center technologies and operational environments. * Experience implementing Unified Voice Communications services. * Demonstrable experience with VOIP technologies and components. Education * Bachelors in Computer Science, Math, or similar degree. Desired * Understanding of current and emerging communications technologies such as SD-WAN, SIP Trunking, VPN, WAN/LAN environments and internet technologies. * Understanding of developing and implementing Access Control lists OVERVIEW Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiary, Noblis ESI, are solving difficult problems that help our government and our country.
We bring the best of scientific thought, management, and engineering expertise with a reputation for independence and objectivity. We support a wide range of government and industry clients in the areas of national security, intelligence, transportation, healthcare, environmental sustainability, and enterprise engineering. Learn more at Noblis -About Us Why work at a Noblis company* Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them.
Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public. Noblis has won numerous workplace awards. Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace and is an equal opportunity employer.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
