text:
Phoenix Logistics, Inc is now accepting applications for a JLCCTC(Joint Land Component Constructive Training Capability) Network Engineer I - V. Please note there are multiple positions available within this job category.
Phoenix Logistics, Inc. (PLI), recognized on the 2019 Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America, is looking for talent that can easily integrate into a success-oriented team environment where the focus is on positive customer engagement and outcomes in the form of superior quality and on time delivery permeates our culture.
Phoenix Logistics Incorporated (PLI) is an agile provider of engineering, manufacturing, information technology, Modeling & Simulation and logistics services to the defense, aerospace, and critical infrastructure markets. The company is made up of talented experts, with years of defense and commercial industry experience, who reliably solve technical and programmatic challenges related to aerospace design and manufacturing, as well as complex logistical challenges related to delivery of critical infrastructure (Medical, Energy, IT and Transportation).
PLI recognizes great talent through empowering employees to succeed while offering top tier PTO, Holiday, 401(k) medical, dental, vision, LTD and other optional benefits.
SUMMARY:
The Network Engineer reports up through the JLCCTC Engineering Management team and will design and analyze complex data networks and their characteristics. This role will work to provide rapid transmission communication of data to users. Additionally, this position will be assigned other projects or tasks in alignment with the level and scope of the position.
This is a contingent position based on funding from the customer.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze, study, and design complex data networks.
Analyze network characteristics (e.g., traffic, connect time, transmission speeds, packet sizes, and throughput) and recommend procurement, removals, and modifications to network components.
Design and optimize network topologies and site configurations.
Plan installations, transitions, and cutover of network components and capabilities.
Coordinate requirements with users and suppliers.
Manage network software development support requirements using formal specifications, data flow diagrams, and other accepted design techniques.
Create complex blueprints for communication networks and ensure the systems will work together.
Estimate network hardware and software development and implementation costs and schedules.
Provide analysis of where communications are going to be needed, create plans for the network, present it to program leadership and teams.
Maintain connectivity of the user community to the Major Shared Resource Center (MSRC) network.
Review existing network designs and capabilities, and assists in making refinements, reducing operating overhead, enhancing network throughput, and improving of current network topologies.
Interface with and provide support to program leadership, external customers, security professionals, and senior levels of security working groups.
Work with inter-disciplinary teams to craft IT solutions.
Position Requirements:
Associate to Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems Security or a related technical field. (dependent on level of position)
Minimum of One (1) to Nine (9) years of experience (dependent on level of position) supporting IT projects/programs, networking, integration and/or systems engineering.
Microsoft, Cisco, Linux or similar certification is a plus.
Experience with firewall applications, set up, maintenance and troubleshooting.
Understanding of networking fundamentals including VLANs, subnets, protocols, and standards
Experience in IT protocols, IT systems, and wired/wireless networking infrastructures.
Highly proficient written and oral communication skills.
Holds (or has the ability to obtain) a DoD TS security clearance.
Due to the nature of work performed within this facility, U.S. citizenship is required.
Domestic and International travel to Military Installations in support of JLCCTC Program activities is required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
This position is be operated in an office and/or computer lab type or potential field environments. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision while performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.
Phoenix Logistics, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

text:
Job Description
Company Overview:
Forward Air (NASDAQ: FWRD) is a leading asset-light freight and logistics company, providing less-than-truckload (“LTL”), truckload, intermodal and pool distribution services across the United States and in Canada. We are a highly respected transportation and logistics Company with revenues in excess of $1B annually. As an industry leader, we are dedicated to finding and developing the best people. We want individuals who share our core values and demonstrate a true passion for what we do. Forward Air offers excellent compensation and benefits packages to our employees, as well as tremendous growth opportunities for top performers.
Position: Senior Network Engineer
Job Description:
Forward Air, Inc. is seeking a Sr. Data Network Engineer who will ensure the stability and integrity of in-house data and wireless network services. This is achieved by planning, designing, and developing local area networks (LANs) and wide area networks (WANs) across the organization. In addition, the Network Engineer will be responsible for service and support of local area networks, wide area network, routers, switches, firewalls, wireless solutions, etc. within the infrastructure of multiple locations. The candidate will work with other staff to assist with coordination of LAN/WAN related issues and activities. The candidate will monitor performance and troubleshoot the overall network. The candidate will participate as a local technical resource in systems projects involving data center / network activities and will be responsible to assist in the support of the end user community. The ideal candidate has a very strong understanding of core networking concepts, network monitoring, troubleshooting, and experience with meeting deadlines.
Core Duties & Responsibilities:
Strategy & Planning:
Create and maintain documentation as it relates to network configuration, network mapping, processes, and service records
Perform network maintenance, configuration, and capacity planning
Develop, implement and maintain policies, procedures, and associated training plans for network resource administration, appropriate use, and disaster recovery
Acquisition & Deployment:
Design and deploy company LANs, WANs, and wireless networks, including servers, routers, switches, Access Points, UPSs, and other hardware
Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards to remain abreast of developments in the networking industry
Oversee new and existing equipment, hardware, and software upgrades
Interact and negotiate with vendors and contractors to secure network products and services
Operational Management:
Ensure that LAN/WAN configurations are compatible and consistent with the global standards of the company.
Install, configure, and manage all network hardware and equipment, including routers, switches, wireless, and UPSs
Manage security solutions, including firewall, anti-virus, and intrusion detection systems
Investigate and troubleshoot network problems and perform LAN/WAN communication repair during and after hours
Monitor and test network performance
Recommend, schedule, and perform network improvements, upgrades, security patches and repairs
Act as a point of contact and resource for management, staff, and vendors in assigned areas related to network and IS services
Assist other IT staff in implementing and designing network solutions
Assist with systems backup/restore/and offsite media storage and retention activities
Other Duties as assigned
Qualifications:
College diploma or university degree in the field of Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience is required
5 plus years’ experience in network administration/engineering
Strong understandings of Cisco's Network implementation in VMWare environment using a Cisco UCS, FlexPod and Cisco Nexus switches
Design and implement security processes and procedures and perform cost benefit analysis on all recommended strategies
Collaborate with external auditors to conduct in-depth compliance audits and penetration testing, presenting results to senior management
Perform network security assessments and compliance reviews
Ensure timely resolution and remediation of network security risks
Coordinate and conduct application and network vulnerability scans
Assess and implement new security toolsets and related procedures
Experience with large-scale global network environments conducting Internet facing e-Commerce -BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, Multicast, LAN/WAN network design, configuration, and troubleshooting
Network solutions, standards and protocols WAN Acceleration
TCP/IP and various Internet Protocols DNS, NAT, IPSec, HTTP/HTTPS, SSH, SSL, SNMP, NFS, IPv4, Digital Certificates, Web Security architecture
L2 technologies-VLANs/VLAN tagging, VTP, Spanning Tree, Etherchannel, portchannel , Gigabit/10Gigabit switched networks
L3 technologies-IP Sub-netting, IP routing, BGP, OSPF, VRRP, HSRP, VRF
WAN technologies, T1, DSL, DS3, MPLS, VPN, WAN Optimization
Firewalls, router ACLs, IPSec VPNs, RADIUS, and TACACS
Network hardware platforms and their specifications
Ability to deploy, configure and work on PC’s to install software or troubleshoot issues
Microsoft Office, O365
Experience with implementing and using Cisco ISE Network Software and VeloCloud SDWAN hardware and software
Experience with F5 Viprion LTM and CTM is a plus
Skills:
Experience in designing networks from layer 1 to layer 3
Experience configuring and maintaining Layer2/3 Switches and Routers and building switch stacks
Experience with configuring and maintaining Cisco ASA firewalls
Experience with routing protocols (BGP, EIGRP, OSPF)
Experience with architecting and implementing cloud network infrastructure
Knowledge of network configurations for virtual platforms
Experience in IP Address management
Experience in designing and implementing Network Security
Expertise in troubleshooting tools (tcpdump, wireshark, etc.)
Working knowledge of Solarwinds NPM, NCM, and NTA
Demonstrated understanding of TCP/IP networking concepts
Experience working with Third Party Vendors such as ISP’s
Experience with Change Management Processes
Good time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
Good analytical, logical thinking and problem-solving skills
Ability to motivate and direct staff members and subordinates
Strong understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with a focus on listening and questioning skills
Strong documentation skills
Ability to conduct research into a wide range of computing issues as required
Ability to absorb and retain information quickly
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language to non-technical staff and end users
Keen attention to detail
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Exceptional customer service orientation
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Forward Air is an Equal Opportunity employer.

text:
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network
Canberra
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network and ensure end to end operational availability of network systems within service levels and / or service expectations.
General Attributes:
Network level: WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security.
Internal systems, and Data centre network infrastructure.
Act as point of contact between customer and engineers.
Resolve all incidents in line with required service level agreements.
Complete project activities as required on behalf of the customer.
Define and document requirements and provide design documentation as appropriate
Assist with and generate Design's, Solutions & execute new installations and upgrades as necessary complying with the change management process.
Maintain accurate records of all operational assets (hardware, software)
Work with Customers, Solutions Architects, Pre-Sales, NEC Management and the delivery team in providing the best and most cost effective solution
Liaise as required between the Delivery team, Professional services, Solution Architects and OEM's on the implementation & support issues that may arise
Skills Required:
Degree / Certificate in IT or equivalent
Cisco Associate and/Or Professional Level Certifications (CCNA,CCNP R&S and DC)
Experience with Cisco Firewalls and Data Centre switches.
Experience with Cisco LMS and Cisco Prime.
Experience with UCSD.
ITIL Foundations Certificate
To be eligible to apply, you must have an existing NV1 security clearance.

Job Description
Network Engineer Fortinet, Switching, Wireless
Orange County, CA
Direct Hire
Salary Target: $100K - $130k
Our client is looking for a motivated Network Solutions Architect with 3-5 years experience. The ideal candidate will have experience working with mid-sized to enterprise organizations as well as IT consulting and/or migration/upgrade experience. Fortinet experience a plus but they are willing and able to train.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
3-5 years experience in IT Infrastructure and Security in Mid-Sized/Enterprise Organizations
Bachelor's Degree, computer engineering or related field Qualifications
CCNA required
Experience with Brocade, Cisco, and Aruba/Client Switches
Experience with Aruba, Cisco/Meraki, Fortinet, and Ruckus.

CCNP a plus
Work closely with sales to provide recommendations to clients.

Training will be provided for Network Switch/Router/WiFi Education
IT Consulting Experience
Collaborate with team members to achieve project success
Be a part of the ConsultNet difference. As a leading national provider of IT staffing and solutions, ConsultNet delivers exceptional services to startup, midmarket and Fortune 1000 companies across North America. Since 1996, we've partnered with clients to create rewarding opportunities for our consultants, successfully building teams that have surefire results.
In the past two years alone, we have placed more than 1,500 consultants in contract, contract-to-hire, or direct placement opportunities. We understand communication is key to finding the right job that matches your skills and career goals. For us, it's not just the work that we do; it's how we do the work. Our breadth of offerings extends to multiple IT positions in major markets throughout the country, see more at www.consultnet.com

text:
JOB SCOPE
Spectrum is proud to have a network that provides service to millions of users across the country. Under limited supervision, the NE II assists in the planning, forecasting, implementation and identification of resource requirements for network systems of varying (moderate to high) complexity. As a member of the team, the NEII will develop and implement network enhancements while following corporate standards. This role will be sought after for recommendations for improvement and assists in staff development efforts.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the implementation of approved network architecture and designs
Hands on involvement in network planning, network architecture design and engineering.
Integrates communication architectures, topologies, hardware, software, transmission and signaling links and protocols into complete network configurations.
Evaluates new products, performs network problem resolution.
Assists in the development and documentation of technical standards and implements approved methods of procedure.
Contributes in designing corporate standards and develops network enhancements
Works on projects/systems/issues of varying complexity surrounding network planning, configuration and optimization.
Provides tier support across organizations.
Leading project teams that maintain and improve network operations.
Acts as a mentor to junior staff
Knows, understands and follows company policy.'
Proactively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.
Adheres to industry specific local, state, and federal regulations, as applicable.
Performs other duties as requested by manager.
BASIC / MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field, and / or related work experience
Minimum three (3) years of network engineering experience
Minimum two (2) years experience with Cisco and/or Juniper
Minimum two (2) years of Data network experience
Must be able to work the following schedule: Wednesday 1:00 PM to Saturday 11:00 PM
ADDITIONAL JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Ability to use ticketing and software tools to support the current operations
Knowledge of basic network devices, basic network appliances and network designing software; such as Visio
Intermediate knowledge of related industry specifications and standards IEEE, ANSI, Physical Media (Multimode Fiber, Singlemode Fiber, UTP, etc.), bridging, switching, routing, ethernet and transport technologies and protocols
Basic knowledge in network design, network architecture, protocols and network topology
Knowledge in TCP/IP and the OSI Model
Ability to work in a team environment
Knowledge of Microsoft Office
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP or CCIP)
Industry and vendor specific certifications and training (Cisco, Juniper, Alcatel-Lucent, etc)
Knowledge of industry products and services
Employment Type: Full Time

title: Network Engineer

name: Trainee Network Engineer
summary:
Trainee Network Engineer - No Experience Required
Are you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?...
text:
Trainee Network Engineer - No Experience Required
Are you looking to kick-start a new career in IT?
We are recruiting for companies who are looking to employ our Network Engineer Traineeship graduates to keep up with their growth. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as full training will be provided. You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (18K-£35K) upon completion.
Whether you are working full time, part time or unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you.
The traineeship is completed in 4 easy steps, you can be placed into your first role in as little as 6-8 weeks:
Step 1 - Online Training
The first step is completing a selection of professional, accredited and industry recognised IT Support courses by CompTIA, Microsoft and Cisco. The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study from home. You will also be assigned an expert tutor to help you throughout your training.
Step 2 - Practical Training
You will gain the practical experience by using our cutting edge Livelabs. Gaining hands-on experience is essential in today’s IT industry for both certifications and keeping up to date with new technologies. Theory is often not enough these days, companies require hands on practical experience to make sure you're job ready.
Step 3 - Official exams
You will then go on to sit the CompTIA A+ exams to give you the official certifications which will be recognised worldwide. The CompTIA A+ is the most commonly asked for certificate in entry level IT roles.
Step 4 - IT Technician placement (£18-£25K)
You will be placed into your first role as an IT Technician, with a starting salary of anywhere between £18K-25K. You will need to gain two years experience in this role before you can progress into a cyber security analyst role. While working as an IT Technician, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to move into the networking field. This will consist of online training, practical training and an official exam.
Network Engineer Role
Once you have completed all of the mandatory training in step four and have the required two years experience in the IT industry, you will be ready to move into your Network Engineer role. We have partnered with a number of large IT companies who have a massive shortage of qualified Network Engineers. In this role the average starting salary is £35K.
At a one off cost of £895, or 8 monthly payments of £124.83, this represents a great opportunity to start a rewarding career in IT and have a real career ladder to start climbing. If you are not offered a role at the end of the training we will refund 100% of your course fees.
Read through the information? Passionate about starting a career in IT? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch.
Keywords:
IT Security, Cyber Security IT Support, IT Technician, Support Engineer, 1st Line Support, and 2nd Line Support, First Line Support, Second Line Support, Trainee, Training Course, Support, Network Engineer, IT Network Technician, IT Network Support, Trainee Network Engineer, Networking, Junior Network

text:
Want to work for a small, very well established, secure company where everyone knows your name? Do you want to stay in a VERY hands on technical role for the foreseeable future? If so, this full-time employee spot could be for you! Our client is anxious to find the right professional ASAP!
All reasonable resumes will be responded to and our client's employees are well aware of this opening!
Job purpose
The Network Engineer works as part of the team responsible for deployment, support, administration, and maintenance of servers, networking, storage devices, and applications across all firm datacenters and offices. The Network Engineer is expected to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues with application configuration, connectivity, and processing throughout the firm. This position will requires 5+ years of experience in Microsoft back office systems within a VMware environment and 3-5 years of experience configuring and troubleshooting Cisco network equipments.

Assist with triaging network and systems related issues escalated from external/internal users
Provide assistance to the networking team on projects and system architecture

Provide assistance on VoIP / VTC and other mixed use network applications
Assist the security officer and review indicators of compromise and other network events for anomalies

Proven analytical and problem solving abilities
Ability to work autonomously or with limited supervision
Excellent organization and communication skills
Experience with Cisco IOS, ASA Firewalls, Routers
Core networking concepts, VLANs, Subnets, BGP, Multicast
Strong knowledge of VMWare/vSphere on NetApp environment
SolarWinds LEM/Network Monitoring

DHCP, DNS and AD Sites and Services

text:
Description:
Make your mark in Broadcasting and Digital Media. Sinclair Broadcast Group and Sinclair Digital Solutions are dedicated to making Sinclair a communications powerhouse! We are the largest and most diversified television broadcasting company in the country. Sinclair owns and operates, programs or provides services to more television stations than anyone and has affiliations with all major networks. Sinclair Digital group is focused on bringing the most engaging content to web, mobile and over-the-top broadcasting to audiences all over the country! Our success is the result of extraordinary employees and an exemplary management team who believe in a vision and are dedicated ensuring a great future for our employees. Whether you are an industry veteran or a just starting out, you can find it at Sinclair! We are advancing the world of Broadcasting and we want YOU to join our winning team!
Sinclair Broadcast Group is seeking a Network Engineer for our corporate IT Department.
Responsibilities:
Effectively manage daily WAN / LAN operations for 166 stations in 80 US markets, including MPLS, VPN, BGP, EIGRP, Cisco routers and switches
Manage Internet connections / subnets using BGP between multiple peers
Manage FortiGate firewall rules, NAT, and site-2-site VPN connections using OSPF
Manage Fortinet wireless deployments, using controllers and AD authentication
SNMP management for monitoring network devices and services
Deploy / configure network equipment / settings for our TV stations
Help implement and improve continuous integration and deployment processes
Respond / resolve WAN outages in a timely manner
Provide tier 1 support to Support Desk and stations as required
Participate in 24x7 on call rotation
Required Skills:
Certifications desired: Cisco - CCNA, CCNP / Fortinet - FCNSA, FCNSP
3+ years in an Enterprise Environment as a Network engineer
Security - Firewalls: FortiGate, Cisco PIX / ASA, Site-2-Site VPN tunnels, NAT, Rule Management, understanding of TCP / UDP source and destination ports, DMZ services.
LAN / WAN - Cisco Routers 3900, 4000, and ASR series, Cisco Switch, 2900, 3560, 3750, 3850, 4500, 6500, Nexus Series.
Wireless - FortiGate controllers and AP's, FortiAuthenticator for AD Integration
Routing Protocols - BGP - EIGRP - OSPF - IP SLA / floating static
QoS - LAN - VOIP Traffic / WAN - CBWFQ
Area Networks - MPLS - EVPL - EPL - Internet
Monitoring - SolarWinds NPM & IPAM, NetFlow using Scrutinizer
Sinclair Broadcast Group, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace!

name: Network Engineer - II
summary:
Job Description
USARC – Network Engineer Job Description
This position is responsible for Tier II/I...
text:
Job Description
USARC – Network Engineer Job Description
This position is responsible for Tier II/III monitoring and initial triage in a WAN/LAN network environment that typically links to numerous computer platforms, operating systems and network topologies (Full managed servicers to wallplate). Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for customer support of complex and diverse systems in a 7 X 24 environment. Work will be required on all shifts (1st, 2nd and 3rd), weekday, weekends, evenings and Holidays as needed.
Engineer will be responsible for the following tasks:
Proactive Monitoring of customer networks management tools to identify network anomalies and faults within the USARC network.
Responding and perform Tier II and Tier III triage of the network alarms utilizing the available network tools and systems.
Full ownership and management of Network hardware including WAN Routers and LAN Switches
Configuration and change management of all network hardware
Create customer trouble tickets on outages identified via network management systems and tools
Test and isolate physical level circuit issues using *** tools
Telco Local Loop and customer in-house wiring
Test and repair hardware issues in the customer WAN/LAN environment
Coordinate multiple vendor dispatches for repair at customer premise
Provide customer status of ongoing issues; communicate via phone/email/ticket notes with customer POCs
Understanding of ITIL terminology – ITIL Certification preferred
Experience with VoIP – Cisco Call Manager and Call Manager Express required
Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for customer support of complex and diverse systems in a 7 X 24 environment. The successful candidate will work to ensure network and network management environment is reliable to meet predefined service levels. The candidate will perform testing and diagnostic procedures on various vendor equipment and circuit testing according to published standards and will assemble and/or tests transmission equipment and monitor housekeeping alarms per specifications. The candidate must have previous experience, possess excellent communication skills both written and verbal. Telecommunications/Electronics Certificate; Cisco Certification required
Hands on experience with Cisco routers and switches required
Cable/Wire Certification; knowledge of the following tools:
Computer Associates (CA) Service Desk
CA Spectrum
E-Health
Work with LECs on loop acceptance. Test and troubleshoot supported products, perform customer facing hot cuts. Handle calls from internal/external customers in an ACD environment. The candidate must pass multiple drug tests in addition pass a security clearance and background investigations. The ideal candidate should also demonstrate, as it would apply to network transport and multiplexing, a general working / in-depth knowledge of Cisco equipment. The candidate must possess a minimum of 5-7 years experience.
Requirement:
5 to 7 years WAN/LAN Networking experience or Network Security preferably in a network operations management center
Must have valid and current DoD SECRET security clearance
Must be flexible to work in a 7 X 24 environment across all shifts including weekends and holidays.
Experience with Cisco and Juniper routers and switches is required
DOD 8570.01 Compliance required
CCNA/CCENT certification
Security+ Certification required
Technical Certifications required

name: Network Engineer, Corp
summary:
**Intro:**
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world cl...
text:
**Intro:**
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
**Summary:**
How do you scale to billions of users? From the networks that connect our offices and data centers to our wired and wireless networks in offices around the world to custom WIFI in employee's houses used in place of VPN, there is a lot behind internal engineering. In honoring our hacker roots and challenging regular convention we help build the technical foundation of Facebook.Facebook is looking to expand its existing team focused on internal network engineering. A Network Engineer will have responsibility to design, deploy and manage the global enterprise network on a variety of cutting-edge platforms. Network Engineers will leverage existing automation tooling, and work with internal teams to enhance tooling. A successful candidate will help gather requirements from internal customers and develop technical solutions to improve productivity of services. A candidate must have a strong technical background, be innovative and agile, collaborate well in a global team environment, and have very strong communication skills - a visionary who challenges the status quo and believes that technologies can level-up productivity.
**Required Skills:**
1. Contribute to the design, implementation and ongoing management of the corporate network
2. Design, implement and maintain new and existing systems, such as monitoring and analysis, management and alerting, for a complex enterprise network environment that is growing at an unprecedented pace
3. Interface with information security and automation teams to design and continuously deliver security-related enhancements
4. Collaborate with other engineering teams to automate various processes, aid in capacity planning and changes to network architecture
5. Develop automated methods to mitigate and remediate network events and minimize operational complexity
6. Work in a heterogeneous environment containing diverse systems and applications, and optimize them to work well together
**Minimum Qualifications:**
7. History of designing large-scale networks
8. 3+ years experience with Layer 2 protocols and associated enhancements such as LACP, L2 ECMP, 802.1d/w/s, or 802.1x
9. 3+ years of in-depth experience with Layer 3 protocols such as IP[v4|v6], TCP or UDP
10. 3+ years of experience with stateful firewalls, non-stateful filtering and packet inspection
11. 1+ years experience in programming or scripting to automate/build
12. Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: VPN (DVMRP, GRE, IPSec/SSL VPNs,), Wireless (802.1a/b/g/n), Global and Local Server Load-Balancing (GLB/SLB)
13. Experience of implementing/maintaining monitoring and alerting for production systems
14. Communication skills
**Preferred Qualifications:**
15. BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline, or equivalent experience
16. Experience operating independently in a fast-paced environment with limited supervision
17. Knowledge/experience in any of the following areas: Overlay networks, Openflow/OVSDB, Network management via SNMP/XML/Netconf, Steaming Telemetry, Cloud management and orchestration systems
**Industry:** Internet
**Equal Opportunity:** Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

name: Network Engineer
summary: The IS Network Engineer role is responsible for the global computing environment by identifying req...
text:
The IS Network Engineer role is responsible for the global computing environment by identifying requirements; installing upgrades; and monitoring performance. Additionally, this role will assist with projects, as assigned. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Oversees day-to-day operation of the network, including the administration, monitoring and troubleshooting of LAN/WLAN/WAN, Telecommunication and Collaboration systems. Administration, research, analysis, monitoring and troubleshooting of server or data network problems, user accounts and network shares. • Administration of Internet filtering systems and Next Generation Firewall functionality. • Provide secondary support for Windows Active Directory, and Mobile Device Management Server administration. • To receive calls for assistance from staff by phone, email or in person and to log, resolve or distribute those calls to the appropriate IS staff. • Special projects related to network as dictated by need. • Other duties as assigned. • Carries out duties in compliance with established business and department policies, in conjunction with applicable regulatory requirements.
Requirements
Education/Experience • BS/BA in a computer related field or equivalent experience • CCNP, CCNA, N+ or higher is desired • 6+ years’ experience Routers, Switches, Firewalls & Wireless • 3+ years’ experience with Video Collaboration Solutions • 3+ years’ experience with Windows Active Directory Knowledge/Skills • In depth knowledge of various LAN/WAN technologies to include: IPV4, IPV6, MPLS, TCP/IP, QoS, DNS, SMTP, VoIP, Routing Protocols (OSPF, EIGRP, BGP, etc.). • Extensive knowledge of Palo Alto Firewalls and its associated technologies is highly desired. • In depth knowledge of VoIP Telecommunication Systems • In depth knowledge of LAN/WAN administration with Cisco equipment, to include Switches, Routers & Firewalls • In depth knowledge of wireless administration with Aruba Networks - Wireless Controllers, ClearPass, & Aps is highly desired. • Knowledge of Video Collaboration infrastructure and codecs • Strong knowledge of Backup Technologies and Methodology • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Server Operating Systems (2003, 2008, 2012) • Understanding of Change Management Controls and Processes (ITIL knowledge a plus) • Ability to conform to standard ticket entry processes regarding the problem management system • Ability to effectively communicate, both orally and written • Excellent organization and follow-up skills with strong attention to detail • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills • Strong analytical and problems solving skills • Ability to multi-task and work under pressure This position will work under minimal supervision with wide latitude for independent judgment. A high degree of attention to detail and technical ability is required to resolve issues and complex technical problems as they are associated with the network and its end users. Ability to maintain a high level of customer service, while accurately identifying and troubleshooting issues in collaboration with internal resources as required, is also essential the success of this position.

text:
Job Description
Lark has a client looking to hire a Arista Network Engineer. The role will be 1/2 remote, 1/2 on-site in Raleigh, NC.
Key is strong Arista knowledge and layer 3 routing within an enterprise scale network.
Candidates will ideally be local to Raleigh-Durham, NC, or can relocate to Raleigh, or can travel with no T&E.
Job Summary:
Reporting to the Data Center Network IT Manager, the qualified candidate will provide corporate computing professionals with Data Center Network support, including advanced connectivity solutions and high performance access to business applications.
The candidate should be familiar with data center networking fundamentals.
The engineer will provide suitable and cost-effective solutions to corporate data communications requirements.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Assist with design, development, implementation and maintenance of global data centers including monitoring and management
Design and implement data center network infrastructure and strategies to include Core/Distribution/Access as well as Spine Leaf (Arista switching technologies)
Build robust and redundant load balancing solutions for data center applications using network load balancer technologies (F5 LTM and ASM is a plus)
Troubleshooting as Tier 3+ for data center network support, including all layers of OSI network using common network trouble shooting tools and methods.
Assist with the evaluation, development, testing and installation of network data center communications servicing software
Effectively communicate and engage with teams in technical discussions
Assist with the evaluation, development, testing, and installation of network data communications servicing software
Produce documentation and procedures for installed designs
Provide support for corporate data communications equipment configuration and installation needs, including fault localization and remediation for distance communication failures.
Provide support to remote corporate installations for transmission performance concerns.
Additional Responsibilities:
Maintain a working knowledge of current industry technology and Information Systems trends by self-study and with participation in related courses, seminars, and conferences
Participate in duty rotation of 7-day by 24-hour on-call support
Perform other related duties as assigned
Skills
Experience working with enterprise scale data center networks
Strong knowledge of Route / Switch technologies especially BGP
Working knowledge of ‘spine/leaf’ architecture
Working knowledge of VXLAN and MP-BGP EVPN
Working knowledge of Arista switching with Linux scripting
Working knowledge of Arista CloudVision
Working Knowledge of private cloud deployments
Education Requirements:
Minimum of CCNA Certification with 3 years of experience or at least 4 years of experience with Data Center Networks or an equivalent combination of education and related experience.
Qualified candidates will have work experience with Data Communications tools, Packet Sniffers, and Network Management tools.
Job Dimensions:
The candidate must have a strong interest and working knowledge in contemporary Data Center Networking components, design, and connectivity solutions, and in data network performance modeling and monitoring; exceptional interpersonal skills, both written and oral communication skills. The individual must be timely, dependable and cooperative within a team environment.
Rate: $50.00 to $70.00/hour
This is a 6+ month contract, with the possibility for extension. We can do C2C.
Company Description
We are a small IT shop in the Santa Fe Arts District with a DEVOPS consulting practice. We support local clients with managed services support and we also help our enterprise clients with their DEVOPS/Technology staffing needs.
We are not a recruiting firm but we do specialize in technology contractor job placement.
We pride ourselves on our professionalism, commitment to our clients and our ability to learn and grow as new technologies become available. We love to provide end-user support for our local Denver clients and we equally love hosting on-site consulting sessions on the topics of Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.

text:
Senior Network Engineer
South San Francisco
California,
United States of America
Job ID: 201912-135718
Download PDF
Apply For This Job
Return to Search Results
The Position
As Senior Network Engineer you will be part of the Global Network Engineering Team. Formed by 20+ professionals, distributed around the globe, with a variety of backgrounds and expertise within the Network area (LAN/WLAN, WAN, SLB, DDI, Video Conference, Teleconference, IP phone, etc. ), we are faced with complex issues and needs, where analysis of situations and/or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors, including technology dependencies, inter-organizational impact and systems thinking approaches.
You will contribute and technically lead challenging projects which require deep technical knowledge and infrastructure engineering skills. You will be accountable and responsible for decision making in technical design, and building and testing new solutions, in the context of the projects/activities to which you will be assigned.
Your main responsibilities will be:
+ To provide technical leadership/mentorship to stakeholders and to colleagues on networking topics.
+ To architect (as a solution architect), design, build, test and implement (first-time deployments) integrated, resilient and reliable network solutions.
+ To evaluate promising networking solutions/technologies and their feasibility in meeting Roche's business needs.
+ To provide technical leadership within project teams, mentor/lead individuals in a workgroup, and provide guidance to less experienced personnel.
+ To ensure network designs and solutions align and adhere to the organization's Enterprise Architecture policies, standards, and direction.
+ To provide technical recommendations and contribute to "position papers", "white papers" and "best practices" for infrastructure solutions and the use cases for their respective solution areas.
+ To stay aware of operational challenges and opportunities; work with support team staff to provide internal escalation support as needed.
+ To ensure solutions and components implemented comply with Quality/Regulatory standards, as applicable.
+ To produce and maintain sufficient documentation for the designs, design patterns, and related component standards created or maintained.
You will bring:
+ 7+ years experience of working in one or more multinational work environment (Healthcare Industry experience a plus) as a network Engineer/Technical team member, with the ability to function independently with little supervision.
+ Fully fluent oral and written communication skills in English.
+ A service-oriented mindset with a focus on creating value for our internal customers and business partners.
+ Creative problem solving and analysis skills with an ability to identify develop and implement solutions to gaps to meet the needs of the business.
+ In-depth experience in:
+ Routing and Switching technologies (Cisco or Arista) and Wireless (Cisco). CCNP R&S is a must, CCNA Wireless/CWNA is desirable.
+ Network automation/scripting knowledge.
+ Demonstrated experience in designing, testing and standardizing wireless solutions in a global multinational environment.
+ Knowledge in any of the following technologies:
+ DDI
+ Routing protocols: OSPF, BGP, ISIS
+ Cloud Networking: AWS, Azure, NSX
+ SLB, F5 iRules
+ Network Access Control, Device profiling
+ Ability to work effectively with team members and virtual teams from different locations and different cultural background
+ Moderate Travel required and ability to work across multiple time zones
+ Able to troubleshoot complex multi-vendor network issues in networking technologies and work with multiple teams to identify bottlenecks and other network issues.
What we offer:
+ Exposure to all aspects of network related technologies used within large-scale multinational deployments.
+ Work with the latest network technologies and renowned networking vendors
+ Development as a Network Automation Engineer
+ Time work flexibility
At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have a special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!
#LI-CGPK1
Who We Are
A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry
for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and
life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious
illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees
are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.
The next step is yours. To apply today, click on the "Apply online" button.
Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page.

text:
Business Runs on IT. IT Runs on BMC Software.
Business runs better when IT runs at its best. That's why more than 20,000 IT organizations – from the Global 100 to the smallest businesses – in over 120 countries rely on BMC Software to manage their business services and applications across distributed, mainframe, virtual and cloud environments. With the leading Business Service Management platform, Cloud Management, and the industry’s broadest choice of IT management solutions, BMC helps customers cut costs, reduce risk and achieve business objectives.
Position Description
We are seeking a Sr. Network Systems Engineer to join our On-Demand team, to help build and maintain BMC’s cloud platform and solutions.
About the On-Demand Team
The BMC On-Demand team is a critical group in the design, architecture, configuration, maintenance and availability of our On-Demand product portfolio. We work closely with our product teams, architecture and customers to provide the highest levels of availability, service and customer success. Being nice is a requirement and you will be working in a high-speed and collaborative team.
About the Job
Focused on the implementation, configuration and administration of our network services across the globe
Build, Deploy and Troubleshoot Amazon Web Services network items including security groups, VPC and load balancers
Administration, Configuration and Troubleshooting of F5 products including Local Traffic Manager, Global Traffic Manager and Application Firewall Manager
Administration, Configuration and Troubleshooting of Cisco products including Nexus switches and routers
Administration, Configuration and Troubleshooting of Network Security products including Cisco ASA and Palo Alto firewalls
Work with your peers on datacenter projects and new initiatives
Work with customers to build out and troubleshoot IPsec site to site vpn tunnels
Utilize network tools to troubleshoot application and infrastructure issues
Take part in 24/7 on-call rotations
Position Requirements
About You
Ability to pass and obtain a US Security Clearance
Experienced knowledge of TCP/IP
Good understanding of network designs including firewall and security designs, routing and configuration
Experience with load balancer configuration, deployment and administration
Understanding of incident handling and change control process
Ability to articulate and document changes for someone else to implement
Good understanding of security and security practices
Good troubleshooting skills
Calm under pressure
If you know about the following it’s a plus
Amazon Web Services scripting
BMC Products including Remedy, BPPM (Patrol), Bladelogic, End User Experience Manager (Coradiant)
Knowledge of monitoring technologies including agent, agentless, synthetic and real user
ITIL Practices & Agile methodologies
*LI-PM1

text:
We're looking for a talented Network Engineer, who is customer serviced focused with excellent communication skills, to join our growing Information Technology Operations Team.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:
As a Network Engineer, you will own an enterprise network and security infrastructure by designing, implementing and administrating a high performing 24x7 environment. Ideal candidates will have a strong understanding of both networking and security fundamentals in a multi-site hybrid cloud environment.
Manage, maintain and evolve the LAN/WAN/WLAN network environment in a footprint containing Palo Alto, Cisco and Aruba products.
Manage, maintain and evolve the security framework across all layers within and outside the network.
Manage, maintain and evolve the telecom infrastructure including VOIP.
Perform all networking and security related troubleshooting.
Participate in production deployments during business and non-business hours.
Design and administer enterprise monitoring for network performance and security.
Proactively monitor and remediate network performance and security events.
Report on performance metrics and security states.
Contribute to strategic planning and provide operational support for business continuity.
Participate in cloud strategy and support of both AWS and AZURE.
Maintain relevant documentation, policies and procedures.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITES & BEHAVIORS:
Bachelor's degree or 4+ years of work experience.
6+ years of relevant networking and/or security work experience.
Experience designing, deploying, upgrading and supporting LAN/WAN/WLAN in an enterprise environment.
Experience designing, deploying, upgrading and supporting Security frameworks in an enterprise environment.
Familiarity with Active Directory and identity management systems.
High-level certification in a major technology area preferred (CISSP, SSCP, CCSP, etc.)
Must conduct oneself in accordance with Company's Core Values.
Strong written, communication and presentation skills.
REPORTING:
This position reports directly to the Director of IT

text:
Job Description
Hello,
My name is Alex and I represent The Fountain Group. We are a national staffing firm and are currently seeking a Senior Network Engineer position for a prominent client of ours. This position is located in Waltham, MA
Temp to Perm Opportunity:
Provides support for numerous IT domains including, Project Management Organization, Data Center Hosting (including Cloud Computing), Network, Telecom, Unified Communications, End User Computing and Information Security.
This individual contributor will be responsible for network design, implementation and service delivery for Company Network solutions, vendor, and operations management.
Duties:
Build, maintain, upgrade network systems and infrastructure in field offices and datacenters (including LAN/WAN devices, firewalls, load balancers, IPS / IDS, VPN, QoS, switches, wireless solutions and VOIP throughout the organization’s global network).
Manage network equipment and services refresh program to ensure current supported technology is utilized by coordinating with supplier and company Business Units.
Select and implement security tools, policies, and procedures in conjunction with the company’s security team.
Manage VPN, WebSSLVPN, and VPN site to site tunnels on ASA firewalls.
Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations.
Monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability.
Monitor metrics around utilization and capacity and recommend changes for improvement.
Provide Level – 2/3 support and troubleshooting to resolve network issues and requests.
Work within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure.
Determine network hardware requirements based on system requirements.
Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution.
Develop technical transformation plans and business cases as needed to foster adoption of new network technologies.
Develop new network transport services to support emerging company application requirements such as IP Video implementation, Connectivity to Cloud hosting providers, Unified Communications Integration, QoS, etc.
Ensure global standards are met and that global projects are designed, implemented and supported consistently.
Ability to participate in on-call rotation.
Qualifications:
8+ years of experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science OR extensive relevant experience will be considered
Cisco Certification preferred (CCNP or higher)
Working knowledge of TCP/IP protocols, concepts and application in production environments (DNS, DHCP, FTP, NTP, etc.)
Working knowledge of LAN / WAN protocols and technologies (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, VPLS, IPsec, VPN/DMVPN/GETVPN, QOS, etc.)
Working knowledge of the following hardware, software, and protocol includes but is not limited to; Cisco Nexus Series, Cisco Routers, Cisco Catalyst switches, Cisco ASA firewalls, Cisco WLC controllers, Cisco Access Points, Cisco ACS, WCS
If you are interested in hearing more about the position please respond to this posting
Company Description
The Fountain Group is a professional staffing firm specializing in providing contingent workforce solutions for a wide array of industries. The Fountain Group has been identifying and matching top talent with Fortune 100 – Fortune 500 companies throughout the United States and Canada since 2001, and has received numerous awards throughout the nation for our success within the MSP space.
Looking for a new career, or a change from your current work environment?
The Fountain Group gives you access to more opportunities in your area of expertise and allows you to gain advice and skills training that will help you advance in your chosen career field

text:
Permanent opportunity for a Network Architect / Lead Network Engineer to to design, implement and optimize infrastructure systems
Canberra
Paxus is working alongside our large enterprise information technology client to source an experienced Network Architect / Lead Network Engineer for a permanent opportunity.
This is a client facing role and the successful candidate will be required to design, implement and optimize infrastructure systems to enable and support a diversified client base. The role will include participating in the implementation of integrated network, hardware and software solutions and physical and logical communications networks for the customer and our client.
Main Responsibilities:
Drives network infrastructure strategy and overall network design, defines scope and deliverables for projects. Establishes and maintains security, integrity and business continuity controls and documents. Identifies develops updates and enforces standards and procedures that are aligned to current 'best practice'.
Able to apply specialized knowledge in a systems infrastructure discipline to conceptualize, design, construct, test, implement and optimize infrastructure systems that enable and support business and/or engineering functions.
Apply deep and broad technical background and knowledge of industry trends to operate several critical or high risk technology areas/customer groups. Integrate technical knowledge and business understanding to create superior solutions for our client and for customers. Mentor/consult with team members, other organizations, customers, and vendors on complex issues.
Solution Design: When justified by business needs, customize or create solutions to meet highly complex customer and/or trade/IT infrastructure needs across technology areas. Provide feedback to create new solution sets.
Skills and Experience we are looking for:
8+ years of experience in Network design and support within enterprise Routing/Switching
Expertise in cloud based or integrated solutions
Expertise in 1 or more of the following technologies - Load Balancing, Proxy and Security/Firewall environments
Please note that only AUSTRALIAN CITIZENS are eligible to apply for this role and a security clearance is highly desirable.

text:
Network Engineer/Administrator to join a large Consulting organisation, working on their large Mining client site, based in Moranbah.
Regional QLD
This is an outstanding opportunity to move into an exciting role with a progressive, growing and dynamic organisation. The organisation has a track record of sustained growth is creating excellent career opportunities for their Network Support professionals.
This fantastic opportunity is currently available for a Network Engineer to join on a 6 month contract, based in in MORANBAH, which is situated in the Bowen Basin in Far North Queensland.
Ideally you will have experience working in an IT environment previously, and you will have a keen eye for customer service! You will be located within driving distance of Moranbah or will be willing to relocate to Moranbah for the duration of the contract.
The purpose of the role will be to be the point of contact for internal customers and providing troubleshooting of Network technical issues, or escalating issues accordingly. You will be part of a dynamic team in an ever changing environment that takes pride in providing exceptional customer service.
Responsibilities
Managing assigned tasks and ensuring completion within defined time frames
Installing/ configuring as well as executing recommended changes.
Ensuring all documentation is maintained and implemented appropriately.
Ensure that existing technology investments are optimized if applicable
Provide a 2nd level escalation point for the Field Services Engineers
Skills & Requirements
Cisco networking expertise (more than 3 years)
CCNA and CCNP certification is essential
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Proven working knowledge of network, routers & switches.
Proven working knowledge of Microsoft technologies.

text:
Network Engineer
We are an independent firm of designers, planners, engineers, consultants and technical specialists offering a broad range of professional services. Through our work, we make a positive difference in the world.
We have an exciting opportunity in Los Angeles, San Francisco, Seattle, Houston or Boston for a Network Engineer t to join our Digital Technology Group.
The Role
You will be responsible for the implementation, operation and maintenance of secure and highly available technical systems within the following service groups; Networks, Unified Communications, Workplace & Automation, Cloud and Compute & Storage.
The core responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Maintaining, monitoring, and supporting the technology platforms relevant to the Digital Technology services to which they are assigned e.g. Networks, Cloud, Unified Communications, Compute & Storage or Workplace & Automation.
Diagnose and resolve complex hardware, software, cloud service and connectivity problems.
Integrate solutions with other applications and technology platforms based on engineering requirements.
Develop scripted solutions and automation to drive continuous improvements.
Perform routine maintenance tasks for technology systems such as backups, patch management and hot fixes.
Maintaining structured cabling systems, WAN, LAN, Wireless Networks and local Internet, remote access, VPNs and connectivity protocols.
Establishing WAN, LAN, Wireless device profiles, device environments and security for networks being installed.
Analysing and resolving issues related to facilities bandwidth requirements and capacity planning.
Monitors facilities bandwidth requirements and schedules requests for additional bandwidth.
Monitoring installed network equipment.
Providing support for connectivity or related network/communication issues for the user community.
Coordinating installation and maintenance work with outside vendors as needed.
The Team
Digital Technology is a team of professionals collaborating globally to support and enable over 20,000 colleagues and clients.
Customer focused with a service mentality, we design and develop software, protect and run the firm's digital infrastructure, support and maintain applications and data platforms, deliver projects, manage risk, provide consultancy and partner with strategic vendors to help enable the Arup Strategy and Digital Vision.
We're committed to transforming our catalogue of technologies to provide secure, resilient services and innovative, digital tools which will enable our members to embrace new ways of working and deliver value for our firm and clients.
Skills/Experience required for the role
Experience working closely with 3rd party managed service & support providers (ISPs & Telcos)
Strong knowledge and experience of BGPand EIGRProuting protocoland WAN technologies
Attained or working towards CCNP or CCSP Certification
Experience of Cisco security technologies, including ISE, ASA,TrustSec, etc. Substantial experience of IT Networking systems and standards and Data Centre network architecture
Expert knowledge in operation and management of Cisco routers and switches
Familiar with cyber security best practices
Working knowledge of Windows, AD, DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP, SMB
Desirable Knowledge & Experience
Good working knowledge of Cisco Wireless portfolio
Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. Industry certifications preferred
Experience creating AWS and Azure network designs.
Good working knowledge of Riverbed Steelheads.
Good working knowledge of F5 Big-IP.
Experience of network audits, real-time monitoring, network troubleshooting.
Experience in network security best practices.
Networking aspects of VMWare

summary:
Our client, a multinational electronics company, is seeking a Network Engineer 4
Location: Plano, T...
text:
Our client, a multinational electronics company, is seeking a Network Engineer 4
Location: Plano, TX
Position Type: Contract
Job Summary:
Network Engineer with RF Background. The function of this role is to manage and troubleshoot the Proof of Concept process for complex mobility solutions. This position will be responsible for conducting highly complex network system administration along with design engineering and troubleshooting activities.
Job Responsibilities:
-Performs engineering functions related to interconnect equipment and facilities, signaling systems, switches and traffic.
-Responsibilities may include performing cost justification studies; planning, ordering and deploying network components; forecasting network/equipment needs and recommending appropriate configurations; resolving complex maintenance problems; monitoring traffic flows to ensure call delivery optimization; and providing technical leadership and expertise to less experienced engineers
-Create/Complete SCIP Approval, RFDS, NST, CIQ forms to support new and existing site designs and upgrades
-Perform site walks/drive tests for pre-construction SINR verification and recommend macro site changes if needed. Perform site walks/drive tests for post on-air stability, and prep to hand-off for optimization work
-Plan, organize, and prioritize multiple engineering support assignments and projects as directed by the manager of the group and/or other departmental officers
-Read, interpret and act on very high level of proper understanding of technical documents, engineering test materials and related documents based on corporate engineering standards and philosophy
-In customer service-related situations demonstrate high competency level in communication skills using both oral and written modes for internal and external personnel at all management and staff organizational levels for both persuasion in sales decision activities and/or the communication of technical information
Required Skills and Qualifications:
-Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering with 8 years related work experience in RF area
-Cisco CCNA or higher
-Experience in RF area
-Strong technical background and experience working with customers in Wireless products area
-Project/Program Management of software and hardware products is Plus.
-Windows Server administration
-Active Directory administration and configuration
-Active Directory Certificate Services and PKI infrastructure
-Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) Platforms
-Networking and IP administration/configuration
-Virtual Private network setup and configuration
-Knowledge of firewalls and related configurations
-Must be able to communicate in writing, through email and reports, or orally complex technical matters to an audience that may include less technically oriented listeners
Employment Type: Contract

summary: Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all while supporting a...
text:
Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all while supporting a mission that seeks to ensure the security of our nation and its allies? If so, then Northrop Grumman is the place for you. As a leading global security company, we provide innovative systems, products and solutions to our customers worldwide. We are comprised of diverse professionals that bring different perspectives and ideas, understanding that the more experiences we bring to our work the more innovative we can be. As we continue to build our workforce we look for people that exemplify our core values, leadership characteristics, and approach to innovation.
Northrop Grumman recruits top talent with traditional and non-traditional backgrounds in order to ensure our team is united, connected, skilled, focused and innovative. An inclusive workplace of people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives is the key to our performance. At Northrop Grumman, we want our employees to bring their whole self to work. All your different sides are welcome here, as we believe they make our team, our products and our services, that much better.
Northrop Grumman Defense Systems is seeking a WAN Network Engineer 3 who will support several projects a large federal agency. These positions will be located in Woodlawn, MD.
The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Health Systems Management operating unit, which focuses on Healthcare IT solutions for our Federal, State, and Local government clients. The qualified candidate should also have strong analytical, problem solving, and communication skills with a keen attention to detail.
Description of Work:
Provides technical analysis in data network planning, engineering, and design for large multi-data center enterprise network with over 1,700 remote locations.
Provides analysis for implementation techniques and tools for the most efficient solution to network problems.
Manage Cisco PRIME environment to perform configuration audit and compliant
Configure and maintain Ansible and Ansible Tower automation Platform.
Maintains technical expertise in all areas of network and computer hardware and software interconnection and interfacing, such as routers, multiplexes, hubs, bridges, gateways, etc.
Develop uniform operation procedures to maintain and update configuration and operating system of the networking equipment.
Develops advanced technological ideas and guides their development into a final product.
Qualifications:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology/Systems, Engineering or related STEM discipline and 5 years of relative experience OR Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology/Systems, Engineering or related discipline and 3 years of relative experience. An additional 4 years of applied of relevant experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree.
Minimum of 2 years of Python and PERL scripting experience on a Red Hat Enterprise Linux or UNIX platform
Minimum of 1 year of Cisco PRIME or SolarWind experience
Minimum of 1 year of commonly used automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef
A solid understanding of networking and core Internet protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP, and distributed networks).
US Citizenship or Permanent Residency (Green Card holder) required in order to obtain and maintain required Position of Public Trust clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification
Prior hands on experience with Cisco networks.
Knowledge of IP routing protocols and implementations.
Experience with version control (CVS, Subversion, Git, etc.)
Strong understanding of and compliance with IT development process (SDLC).
Experience with commonly used tools such as JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket
Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

summary:
Job Description
Position Description
The Network Engineer is responsible for the maintenance, avail...
text:
Job Description
Position Description
The Network Engineer is responsible for the maintenance, availability and security of network infrastructure and voice services. Working with other team members, the candidate will support networking, voice, and security services that are technically sound, resilient to failure and meet the requirements of the college.
This position will actively contribute to the architecture, design and implementation of the College LAN/WAN infrastructure, including network security and voice/collaboration services. This role requires collaboration with internal and external customers and service providers, ensuring projects are completed within scope and on-time.
Primary responsibilities include implementing and maintaining the College's data and voice network. The ideal candidate will have experience and direct knowledge of managing a Juniper- and Audiocodes- based infrastructure in large, complex multi-campus environment.
The ideal candidate will leverage a collaborative approach, anticipate needs, and be able to communicate and work effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders in a diverse and talented institution.
The Network Engineer is the senior technical point of escalation for network and voice service issues and provides Tier 3 support. Tasks may include working with vendors to resolve service problems, upgrade planning and coordination, capacity planning, technical roadmaps, health-checks and will be involved in any quality issues for the existing infrastructure.
Preferred and Required Qualifications
Qualifications
Certifications:
JNCIA-JUNOS required
JNCIP-ENT preferred
Security+ or other security-related certifications preferred
MCSA/MCSE preferred
Associates Degree required
Bachelor's Degree preferred
Job Related Experience:
5+ years of hands-on, progressive experience with
deploying and managing Juniper network switching and routing configuration and equipment.
VoIP configuration, administration, and troubleshooting of network-attached devices.
working in an IT operations group.
network LAN/WAN related technologies - network routing, switching, packet analysis.
Enterprise network infrastructure
security best practices and procedures
supporting Tier 1/Tier 2 technicians
Juniper experience required
Audiocodes VoIP phone experience preferred
ITIL knowledge preferred
Strong background in network security related technologies
Proven hands-on experience with IP networking and network security including DMZ, QoS, encryption, IPsec , VPNs, proxy services, and DNS
Ability to produce well-written operational reports and documentation, including Visio diagrams, as well as detailed instructions outlining the steps required to repeat the build-out and configuration of the infrastructure
Additional Skills/Knowledge:
Strong organizational and customer service skills with high level of professionalism
Ability to work with complex and ambiguous situations
Ability to simultaneously manage multiple projects or tasks
Strong planning, organization, communication, presentation skills
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to work with others in a collaborative environment
Ability to work productively without close supervision
Ability to communicate confidently, both verbally and in writing
Application Details
When inquiring or applying for this and other positions at Baltimore City Community College, please reference AcademicCareers.com
Applicants with dual-career considerations can find university jobs such as professor jobs, dean jobs, chair / department head jobs, and other faculty jobs and employment opportunities within Baltimore City Community College and at other institutions of higher education in the region on www.AcademicCareers.com

Job Description
We are seeking a Internet Services Network Engineer to join our team! You will hand...
tasks: Manage all aspects of the Internet networking platform,Troubleshoot network & system issues,Monitor active network and server infrastructure,Perform routine preventative maintenance on equipment,Administer network security measures to prevent system interruptions or breaches,Execute sensitive data backup and restoration procedures,Document all technical procedures and user guides,Complete oversight of installs, upgrades and maintenance,Meet Internet Services SLAs to clients,Network design,Implement best practices,Implement safety standards,Level 3 ISP technical oversight
text:
Job Description
We are seeking a Internet Services Network Engineer to join our team! You will handle a variety of projects to support and improve the organization's network systems.
Responsibilities:
Manage all aspects of the Internet networking platform
Troubleshoot network & system issues
Monitor active network and server infrastructure
Perform routine preventative maintenance on equipment
Administer network security measures to prevent system interruptions or breaches
Execute sensitive data backup and restoration procedures
Document all technical procedures and user guides
Complete oversight of installs, upgrades and maintenance
Meet Internet Services SLAs to clients
Network design
Implement best practices
Implement safety standards
Level 3 ISP technical oversight
FCC licensing coordination and reporting
​Qualifications:
Previous experience as a network administrator - specifically in the ISP industry
Knowledge of TCP/IP and data protocols
Ability to prioritize and multitask
Deadline and detail-oriented
Strong troubleshooting and critical thinking skills
Education
Although not required, a bachelor's or greater degree, industry certifications, such as CCNA, CCNP or CCIE would be helpful in selecting a candidate.
Company Description
Founded in 1995, Stimulus Technologies is the premier provider of turn-key technology solutions to businesses and consumers. We provide IT Managed Services, VoIP and Broadband Internet Access to businesses in all major industries and rural wireless Internet services. We have proven methods to assess a company's technology needs and then create a solution that best fits those requirements. Our goal is to offer the best and most stable technologies to our clients.
