text:
Network Engineer
An end-to-end IT solutions and services concern in Cape Town is looking for a network engineer to join the team.
Duties:
Reporting:
Advanced reports compiled.
Advanced identification, analysis and resolution of technical problems.
Info of management systems analysed, interpreted to identify areas of possible improvement or risk.
Monthly/ad-hoc reports compiled according to client requirements.
Testing:
Release note of all changes, new functions and bugs compiled.
Request ticket updated according to status.
All relevant code for specific patch/release/hotfix in respective directories.
System tested holistically.
Implement patch/release/hotfix to the client according to maintenance slot.
Audits:
Audits planned and performed based on customer requirements.
Feedback on findings provided to the client.
Data of findings analysed and interpreted.
Data presented to the client.
Special investigations:
Special investigations planned and performed based on customer requirements.
Feedback on findings provided to the client.
Data of findings analysed and interpreted.
Possible solutions proposed.
Operations:
All requests logged and assigned via the ticketing system and acted upon and updated.
Monitoring and configuration of business impact and other composite relationships.
Constant monitoring of client infrastructure ensured.
System administration tasks performed.
Database of monitored objects maintained.
Technical training and support of customers on management systems and/or areas of specialisation.
Provide consultation on the use of 'information about IT' to improve or optimise IT environments.
Independent completion of tasks, presentation of reports and making recommendations to clients.
Health check alerts actioned.
Requirements:
Knowledge and qualification:
A+
N+
Linux RedHat and Ubuntu
Windows Operating systems
CCNA is an advantage
Required skills
IT: Three to four years of experience
Network+: Two to three years of experience
Network monitoring tools
While we would really like to respond to every application, should you not be contacted for this position within 10 working days please consider your application unsuccessful.
When applying for jobs, ensure that you have the minimum job requirements. Only SA citizens will be considered for this role. If you are not in the mentioned location of any of the jobs, please note your relocation plans in all applications for jobs and correspondence. Please email a Word copy of your CV to julz@datafin.com and mention the reference numbers of the jobs.

text:
Be responsible for the management and day to day support of the clients network along with the delivery and configuration on integration technologies.
Sydney
Fantastic opportunity now available for a skilled Network Engineer to be responsible for the build, support and support of the clients network.
Provide a second level escalation point for other members of the team and take an active role in providing technical leadership and mentoring junior staff.
Responsibilities
Perform research, analysis and design of technical solutions to meet business requirements
Work as part of a support team and provide 24x7 after hours support on a rotating roster
Provide technical leadership on different projects
Ensure that existing technology investments are optimized if applicable
Project responsibilities within project planning, work plan development and resourcing.
Provide a 2nd level escalation point for the service desk
Skills & Requirements
Cisco networking expertise (more than 3 years)
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Strong organization and planning skills.
Demonstrated ability to take ownership, work under pressure and meet agreed deadlines.
Demonstrated 3rd level problem solving skills.
Experience in control processes and procedures.
Demonstrated experience in technical and project leadership.
Strong background in results collating and reporting for measurements.
Min 3 years in a Senior Server\Network support role.
Proven working knowledge of network, routers & switches.
Proven working knowledge of Microsoft technologies.
Extensive knowledge and deployment of SANs and virtualized environments, including VMware, Microsoft etc.
Knowledge of and experience in documenting business requirements & developing technical solutions to meet those requirements.
Immediate availability is preferable

tasks: Configuration and maintenance of the networking and communications infrastructure,Providing technical input regarding the company network design, proposing ideas and solutions for network service improvement,Network management and systems maintenance to ensure the integrity of the network,Direct regular audits of network components to ensure that all network devices are being constantly managed and monitored,Provide technical expertise in the area of data and network performance and upgrades, for both day to day activities and projects.,4-5 years' experience as an Engineer in a large complex organisation.,Must have strong Hands on Routing and Switching (CISCO),Managing/maintaining Citrix ADC products (MPX/SDX/VPX) and Bluecoat products (ProxySG, CAS, SSLv),Excellent communication skills and a desire to do a great job.,Provide timely and accurate support to the team,Excellent network troubleshooting skills,Expertise in design and support of modern Datacentre Network environment (Cisco Nexus)
text:
Financial Services organisation requires a Network Engineer to work within a large and busy infrastructure team
Sydney
The position comes with a diverse range of responsibilities and challenges, such as:
Configuration and maintenance of the networking and communications infrastructure
Providing technical input regarding the company network design, proposing ideas and solutions for network service improvement
Network management and systems maintenance to ensure the integrity of the network
Direct regular audits of network components to ensure that all network devices are being constantly managed and monitored
Provide technical expertise in the area of data and network performance and upgrades, for both day to day activities and projects.
To be successful for the role you must be able to demonstrate you have the following:
4-5 years' experience as an Engineer in a large complex organisation.
Must have strong Hands on Routing and Switching (CISCO)
Managing/maintaining Citrix ADC products (MPX/SDX/VPX) and Bluecoat products (ProxySG, CAS, SSLv)
Excellent communication skills and a desire to do a great job.
Provide timely and accurate support to the team
Excellent network troubleshooting skills
Expertise in design and support of modern Datacentre Network environment (Cisco Nexus)
Strong experience in managing/maintaining 55 LTM/GTM products

summary:
Job Description
Join our team of Network Engineers and work on dynamic long-term projects. The majo...
tasks: Bring your Cisco credentials/certifications, especially in the area of routing and switching.,Provide Cisco network design and implementation support to include all aspects of routing, switching, and security architecture.,Provide expertise for the client as Prime is fully implemented and rolled out, globally.,Provide support for Prime as new devices are added to the network.,Must be able to provide support for F5 load balancers and F5 VPN.,Experienced working with and providing support for Checkpoint and ASA firewalls.,Cisco DMVPN implementation and testing support.,Provide implementation support and testing for Cisco ISE network authentication.
text:
Job Description
Join our team of Network Engineers and work on dynamic long-term projects. The majority of our team members are long-term employees who enjoy consistent work and a collaborative team approach!
Bring your Cisco credentials/certifications, especially in the area of routing and switching.
Provide Cisco network design and implementation support to include all aspects of routing, switching, and security architecture.
Provide expertise for the client as Prime is fully implemented and rolled out, globally.
Provide support for Prime as new devices are added to the network.
Must be able to provide support for F5 load balancers and F5 VPN.
Experienced working with and providing support for Checkpoint and ASA firewalls.
Cisco DMVPN implementation and testing support.
Provide implementation support and testing for Cisco ISE network authentication.
Data Center network design, implementation, and testing support.
Requirements
A Bachelors Degree in technology related disciplines OR equivalent real-world experience.
5+ years of experience with Cisco routing/switching.
Juniper experience
5+ years of experience with F5, FTD, ASA firewalls.
HIDS (host-based intrusion detection system)
Benefits
For more than 20 years, Moser Consulting has been the go-to source for exceptional IT talent with the ability to self-manage. At Moser Consulting, our people are our #1 asset. We hire the best people, welcome them like family, connect them with opportunities, and let them do what they do best: produce innovative solutions to technology problems.
Our culture gives us a competitive advantage by keeping our employees happy, healthy, and by lowering stress levels in a very demanding industry. It is no accident that we are recognized as one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana. We focus on giving employees: an incredible work space; a fun, collaborative, and creative atmosphere; an extremely generous compensation package; and dozens of outstanding and unique perks usually not found at one company.
Equal Opportunity Employerminorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity.

text:
Financial Services organisation requires a Network Engineer to work within a large and busy infrastructure team
Sydney
This is a great opportunity for a Network Engineer for a 6 month contract based in Sydney CBD.
This position comes with a diverse range of responsibilities and challenges, such as; Configuration and maintenance of the networking and communications infrastructure. Providing technical input regarding the company network design, proposing ideas and solutions for network service improvement. Network management and systems maintenance to ensure the integrity of the network. Direct regular audits of network components to ensure that all network devices are being constantly managed and monitored. Provide technical expertise in the area of data and network performance and upgrades, for both day to day activities and projects.
To be successful for the role you must be able to demonstrate you have the following:
4-5 years' experience as an Engineer in a large complex organisation.
Must have strong Hands on Routing and Switching (CISCO)
Managing/maintaining Citrix ADC products (MPX/SDX/VPX) and Bluecoat products (ProxySG, CAS, SSLv)
Excellent communication skills and a desire to do a great job.
Provide timely and accurate support to the team
Excellent network troubleshooting skills
Expertise in design and support of modern Datacentre Network environment (Cisco Nexus)
Strong experience in managing/maintaining 55 LTM/GTM products
*Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

text:
Job Description
Network Engineer – Greenwich, CT
We are seeking a Network Engineer for our growing IT Company. This position would be full time and applicants should have 3-5 years of experience. We are looking to hire immediately.
The duties would consist of:
× Assist with firewall changes (internet access requests, adding IPs/URLs to the blacklists, etc.)
× Assist with moves – sticky port changes, cable tracing, port activation, and port VLAN assignments.
× New Hires/Exits – create and/or move accounts relating to Avaya phones/Turrets, fax, voicemail, instant messaging, etc.
× Perform server update checkouts on servers after the monthly patch updates.
× Monitor and react to emails from our security vendors.
× Maintain all networking equipment.
× Maintain all voice equipment.
o Ex: Avaya and Trader Voice equipment – assist with escalations to our support vendor.
× Maintain hardware/software inventory of the networking and voice equipment.
× Troubleshoot any network and phone issues.
× Creating an Infrastructure Daily Summary Report.
Our ideal applicant would be dynamic, driven and able to perform independently as well as work in partnership with a variety of our clientele. Aside from the day to day duties, we would need assistance with a few immediate projects, such as:
× Upgrading Palo Alto Firewalls.
× Confirm network failovers are working properly in datacenters and offices.
× Upgrade and decommission specific servers by their desired end date.
× Wipe and decommission old networking and voice equipment.
× Clean up/organize unused cabling in the Datacenters/Network Closets.
Experience with Palo Alto and Cisco Nexus required.
About our Company
We are a global managed services company that provides a complete and customized IT solution for our clients. Our business philosophy is to partner up with our clients, creating a trustworthy relationship and a recipe for success. We have an outstanding track record with our clients and were looking forward to forming more successful partnerships in the future.
Our company currently has offices in three states and are looking to expand our continuing success with additional talented IT Professionals.

An immediate opening for a full time Network Engineer position to support our feder...
text:
Job Description
An immediate opening for a full time Network Engineer position to support our federal client in Silver Spring, MD. The successful candidate will provide network engineering and support of the enterprise network to support the science mission of our federal client.
Primary Responsibilities
• Provide technical support on data and wireless network issues
• Support the LAN and WAN infrastructure, multiple remote sites and data centers.
• Troubleshoot network problems and coordinate with the various department administrators to facilitate connectivity issue resolution
• Participate in lab configuration and testing of new technologies
• Prepare network topology diagrams, write Standard Operating Procedures, maintenance plans and provide status reports as required, participate in data calls and other operational and maintenance tasks
Qualifications
• A minimum of 5 years of functional experience in a Network Engineering role
• Ability to communicate designs and network concepts to a variety of audiences, including peers and customers, verbally and in writing
• Working knowledge of Cisco/Juniper Routing and Switching technologies
• Experience configuring and running firewalls
• Strong knowledge of Layer 2 and Layer 3 networking protocol/technologies
• General understanding of project management processes and terminology
• Ability to multitask and set priorities
• Bachelor’s Degree in a related field is desirable
• Professional certification (e.g. CCNA, CCNP, JNCIA)
About Us
ANG SIGNAL is an IT consulting firm delivering mission critical solutions to the government. We strongly believe that a company is only as good as its team members; we strive to hire the most highly qualified applicants for a wide range of challenging and fulfilling positions. Our diverse team embraces challenges in an inclusive atmosphere that values work-life balance.
One of the keys to our success has been finding the right people for the job and putting them in a position to succeed so that we can deliver a consistently outstanding experience to every customer we serve. We hire engineers that are passionate about their work, have strong work ethics and a desire to learn and be challenged.
ANG SIGNAL offers a competitive benefits package including three weeks paid time off, paid holidays, medical, dental, vision and prescription drug coverage with company-paid deductible, matching 401K plan and tuition/training reimbursement.
Clearance
Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor applicants for work visas at this time.

text:
We are currently recruiting for Senior Network Engineers to join a multinational System Integrator to work on multiple high profile government projects.
As a Senior Network Engineer, you will be required to:
Build and test Wide Area Network (WAN), Base Area Network (BAN) and Wireless Network infrastructure before deployment to client sites
Develop design guidelines, test plans and templates for BAN, WAN and Wireless Networks
Develop security documentation such as a System Overview Document (SOD) for the deployment of new network infrastructure
Review and approve Detailed Technical Proposals (DTP) and Technical Implementation Instructions (TII) for changes to the Defence Information Environment (DIE)
Provide advice to project teams for wireless and fixed network infrastructure
The successful candidate must have:
Demonstrated experience in the design, delivery and/or implementation of large scale Wide, Metropolitan and Local Area Networks in a high security framework
Demonstrated experience in working in technical teams to deliver assigned outcomes
Demonstrated experience in the translation of business requirements to functional performance requirements to ensure user requirements are clearly understood and delivered in-line with project expectations
NV2 security clearance
Apply now for immediate consideration or for a full job description of this role, contact dan Carn on 02 6245 1724
Due to security clearance requirements for this role, candidates must be Australian Citizens who currently hold or are able to gain an Australian Government security clearance
Please note: only candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in the position.

name: Principal Network Engineer
summary: What you'll be doing... Work location can be any Verizon Wireless Network Office. The Network Inter...
text:
What you'll be doing... Work location can be any Verizon Wireless Network Office. The Network Interconnection organization is responsible for negotiating interconnection agreements with carriers throughout the United States.
These agreements facilitate the exchange of traffic between VZW's and the interconnecting carrier's customers. This position is responsible for facilitating negotiations for interconnection agreements with RBOCs, ILECs, RLECs, wireless carriers and CLECs pursuant to FCC orders and rules. In addition to negotiating interconnection agreements, this organization supports key company initiatives that involve traffic exchanged with other carriers.
Responsibilities: Negotiate Interconnection Agreements: + Lead business representative for Network in negotiating interconnection agreements subject to Sections 251 & 252 of the Telecommunications Act of 1996. + Understanding of telecommunications regulations, under both federal and state jurisdictions. + Partner with Legal staff to draft agreement terms.
+ Facilitate approval and execution of agreements. Contract Management: + Maintain documentation of Interconnection Agreements, including SIP Interconnection Plans related to IP Interconnection Agreements. Dispute Resolution: + Lead business representative for disputes related to interconnection agreements and inter-carrier billing under federal & state regulations (e.g.
tariffs). + Negotiate with business representatives of other carriers to achieve favorable outcomes for Verizon Wireless. + Negotiate Settlement Agreements as needed to memorialize resolution of disputes.
+ Support billing analysts in accounting for disputes and settlements. Financial Analysis: + Subject Matter Expert of inter-carrier charges related to the exchange of voice traffic. + Support Direct Tel billing analysts in validating invoices and team members in billing other carriers for usage under the terms of agreements.
+ Understanding of financial impact of usage charges to Direct Telecom expense budget. Traffic Engineering: + In depth understanding of traffic engineering concepts. + Understanding of Verizon Wireless call routing (e.g.
translations). + Understanding of switched access facilities engineering, local number portability, core network functions and architecture. Traffic Measurements: + Expert in using available tools to measure traffic and expenses for contract negotiations and enforcement, financial analysis, and other requests.
+ Current tools include MARS, NcPlus, BillTrakPro, NetGeoX. IP Interconnection: + Negotiate IP Interconnection Agreements with carriers (aka peers) to migrate traffic from TDM connection to IP connections. + Evaluate and implement solutions to move residual PSTN traffic being exchanged over TDM facilities to IP facilities (e.g.
TDM Replacement RFP) Represent Verizon at Industry meeting: + Represent Verizon at GSMA in its development of non-binding agreement templates for the exchange of traffic and other network evolutionary items. GSMA, a global consortium of mobile operators, promotes interoperability between carriers and facilitates information exchange across the industry to expedite and ease the evolution of mobile services from traditional voice roaming to 5G. + Represent Verizon at ATIS (Alliance for Telecommunications Industry Solutions) Represent Verizon in FCC/Regulatory matters + Rural Call Completion + Robocalls What we're looking for...
Must have: + Bachelor's degree in technical, mathematical or financial disciplines or related field or five or more years of work experience. Ideally, you'll also have: + Five or more years of telephony experience, with appropriate network knowledge + Prior negotiating experience + Contract Experience + Excellent written and oral communications skills + Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills + Excellent interpersonal and communications skills - this position requires frequent interaction with the executive staff as well as technical team members and peers. + Technical project leadership involving complex projects, multiple teams, requirements gathering timeline based deliverables, direct vendor management and experience providing direction to those team members + Demonstration of solid decision making + Proven ability to develop processes specific to RFP, contracts, awarding work, roles and responsibilities and workflow.
+ Candidate should have in depth hands on experience with: + Traffic engineering concepts, processes and terminology + Large scale capital and expense budgeting + Understanding VoLTE & VOIP technology, IMS core terminology/functionality and Experience with vendor management and coordination + Self-motivated, show initiative and be willing to lead in a dynamic work environment + Demonstrated ability to work independently, minimal direct management supervision including the ability to make critical decisions Responsive to meeting the ever-growing needs of the business When you join Verizon... You'll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America's fastest and most reliable network, we're leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment.
Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we're about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.
Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better. REQNUMBER: 501359-1I

text:
Job Title :Network Engineer
Location:Orlando, FL.
position will ensure delivery for incident recovery, network changes and adherence to configuration standards.
The Network Engineer needs to apply technical expertise in routing and switching (Cisco IOS and Nexus especially) and load-balancing to consult with Operations Engineering and/or suppliers.
The engineer will utilize their knowledge to review engineering standards and develop tactical plans to ensure Network Operations, partners and suppliers are meeting technical requirements.
The resource may also assist or oversee major incidents, major change or introduction of new technologies within the environment. primary
Job Functions:
Responsible for the technical success of network services within the environment.
This includes, but is not limited to:
Strategy Contributor into the development of the Network Operations Strategy and into supporting organizational strategies.
Contributor to the strategies of peer organizations ensuring that their strategic plans are in alignment with the technical direction of Network Operations and/or Strategy and Architecture.
Ensure that all new network services are designed to deliver the levels of availability required by the business, and validate the final service design to meet operational needs of the business to ensure excellent service delivery
Work with service providers to ensure the proper level of technical acumen and quality are executed within the contracted services
Process Contributor in developing and evolving operational procedures. Examine & document existing processes, evaluate them within the context of availability and maintainability of Network Services.
Education / Experience: Required:
Preferred to have a minimum of at least
1 professional level certification from a major technology supplier (CCNP, F5-CTS LTM, etc.)
3+ years' progressive data communications experience in WAN/MAN/LAN/Data Center operational support, configuration, evaluation, incident resolution, problem management, and project management experience in a 24x7x365 support environment.
3+ years' experience in day-to-day support of enterprise-scale, complex network environments
Working knowledge of load-balancers and other network technologies.
Knowledge of and experience with major routing protocols like RIP, IGRP, EIGRP, BGP, RMTP, OSPF, etc.
1+ years' experience in the utilization of data communications test equipment and network management systems (e.g., sniffers, Wireshark, OPNET, NetScout, ReliaTel, NAGIOS, and software based management systems such as OpenView, SevOne, Smarts, Riverbed CMC, NetBrain, NetCool, etc.) a plus.
Position Requirements:
Familiarity with the capabilities and problems of a broad spectrum of hardware and transmission technologies (e.g., cabling, optical fiber, WAN and transport, routing, firewalls, LAN/VLANs switches, SDN, etc.)
Ability to understand fairly complex network infrastructure quickly during major incidents and provide technical leadership appropriately
Exceptional communication skills are a must. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively at a variety of levels and to communicate intricate technical and procedural matters to both technical and non-technical personnel across diverse cultures
Ability to learn new technologies quickly
Good understanding of how IT technology supports the Enterprise and the Business Segments
Ability to communicate and multi-task under pressure
Interpersonal Skills:
Strong customer, quality and results orientation
Ability to be an effective team member and technical leader
Ability to recognize and embrace change as the external environment and organization evolves.
Due to the temp-hire nature of the role, US Citizenship or Green Card Holder required.

Newark, CA 94560.

summary:
Job Description
Avineon is seeking a Network Engineer to add to our team of IT professionals. The N...
tasks: Troubleshooting, installing, implementing, and administering network systems.,Conducts short- and long-term planning to meet network requirements.
text:
Job Description
Avineon is seeking a Network Engineer to add to our team of IT professionals. The Network Engineer will work for and under the general direction of the Project Manager to support operations and maintenance of our customer’s network infrastructure and enterprise network solutions.
Troubleshooting, installing, implementing, and administering network systems.
Providing Tier III support.
Analyzing capacity issues and developing capacity planning models as directed.
Ensuring planned testing activities are executed.
Developing network security guidelines. This includes administration, monitoring, change management, configuration, release management, provisioning, security, performance and capacity planning, and incident and disaster recovery functions.
Essential Functions
Conducts short- and long-term planning to meet network requirements.
Provides network system design and implementation support.
Provides support for network connectivity or related network issues for the user community.
Plans, monitors, and installs of network components including voice (VoIP), video, and data.
Analyzes network activity and network problems to discover and prevent systematic errors. Recommends network design changes/enhancements for improved systems availability and performance.
Troubleshoots, diagnoses, and resolves network problems.
Analyzes facilities bandwidth requirements and system interdependencies to develop capacity planning models.
Assesses network performance to ensure that it meets the present and future needs of the business. Provides network planning recommendations to management.
Ensures that the Disaster Recovery (DR) and Continuity of Operations (COOP) sites are maintained and ready for use at all times to include documented procedures.
Supports the COOP exercises by providing installation, setup, user support, and service desk support for the network switches, printers, faxes, and laptops before and during the exercises
Keeps equipment at the DR site current with the latest patches, versions of software and identified special user software, and operating procedures (user laptop signing on, configuring email, printing, and accessing applications).
Tests the DR site and all procedures periodically.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university. (Experience may be substituted for education.
Six years of relevant IT work experience.
Four years’ experience with Cisco enterprise grade products to include: Nexus 7000, 6500, 4500, ISR G2, ACE/GSS, ASA, IPS/IDS, TACACS+, TACLanes, CUCM, Meeting Place/WebEX, Anyconnect, VSOM/VSM, NAC.
Strong working familiarity with Cisco IOS with hands-on experience configuring Cisco routers, switches, and firewalls.
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP), or Voice Professional (CCVP), or Wireless (CCNP Wireless), or Network Security (CCSP). Candidates who do not currently possess the CCNP certification, but meet all other minimum requirements, may be considered for this position. If selected, the candidate will be required to obtain the required certification within a twelve (12) month time period.
Knowledge of enterprise system monitoring and management tools such as Netcordia NetMRI, Cisco MARS, Splunk, What’s Up Gold, Wireshark, Websense, MRTG, and NMAP.
Knowledge of commercial enterprise-level tools and products to provide network services, including: firewalls, IPS/IDS, DNS, DHCP, web security, TACACS+, VPN, and NAC.
Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must have the ability to provide a clear explanation of technology for nontechnical managers, directors, and above. Great people skills are a must.
Ability to act as Senior Network Engineering in the absence of the SNE.
Security Clearance Requirement:
Must hold a current Top Secret Clearance with SCI access.
Must be a US citizen, and all immediate family members and all members of household must be US citizens.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s Degree from an accredited college or university.
CCNP, or CCVP, or CCNP Wireless, or CCSP AND the Design Professional (CCDP) Certifications.
Knowledge of Cisco SRND/SAFE and industry best practices.
Knowledge of Linux/Unix and other open source software to include BIND and Nessus.
Familiarity with network, server, storage virtualization, i.e. MDS switching infrastructure, VSAN, VRF, VPN, and VMWare vSphere.
Extensive experience with Cisco VoIP, including Call Manager 6.X, Unity, and Contact Center. Knowledge of voice TDM technologies is also very useful.
Extensive experience with Cisco Unified Wireless networking to include: 802.11a, b, g, and n; LWAPP; CAPWAP; WCS; WLC; and APs.
Advanced knowledge of IOS, NX-OS, EIGRP, BGP, GRE, and OSPF.
Avineon, Inc.is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or genetic information.

text:
The following job is no longer available:
Data Centre IT Network Engineer - Level 3 - £50K
Do you have solid Level 3rd Line Data Centre / NOC Network Support experience with Cisco hardware, routing, switching and firewalls? If so we'd love to talk. A Managed Service background would be preferable.
Data Centre Network Engineer - CCNP, Firewall, Cisco Nexus , Data Centre
Up to £50,000 + Shift Allowance | Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire
Who we are:
As a Digital Transformation Partner, we accompany companies into the digital future. Our range of IT solutions includes consulting, implementation, services and the operation of IT systems. Our customers benefit from our extensive expertise and our innovative portfolio that covers the IT requirements necessary for a successful digital transformation.
Our headquarters are based in Munich and we employ over 3,000 employees worldwide with offices in Germany, Austria, Belgium, The UK and The U.S.A.
The Data Centre Network Engineer Role:
Our Managed Services team are based from our offices in St Ives and our data centre facilities in Huntingdon and provides a focused range of hosted and cloud services through our extensive portfolio, specifically designed to help customers align their IT functions to their core business requirements.
You will be working as part of a fantastic hand-picked team, you'll deal with the day to day management of our Data Centre and wide area networks both internally and on behalf of our customer base.
Ensuring our customers network and devices are operating and performing within acceptable boundaries and remaining compliant against relevant legislation.
You will be third tier support for our service desk responding to customer incidents and managing our monitoring software to identify potential issues in a proactive manner to reduce potential customer-related incidents.
This means working logically to understand the issue at hand, and then either taking care of it yourself or escalating it to the appropriate supplier, delivering a high standard of customer service to all customers in the process.
This role is based at our Huntingdon site and the cover that we provide is between the hours of 8am and 23:00.
Data Centre Network Engineer Key Responsibilities:
+ Working within the adopted ITIL framework for incident management and associated escalation processes
+ Providing a senior point of technical assurance within the team
+ The implementation of large and small-scale project deliverables
+ Maintaining stable customer and internal services
+ Ensuring that technical knowledge and documentation is shared amongst the Managed Services team members
+ Sharing information on new issues and call type trends with team leaders, in order to improve IT strategy across the business
About You:
+ A minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar field
+ Experience as a senior technical team member
+ Excellent spoken and written English with strong customer interaction skills and a good telephone manner
+ Data Centre Experience
+ Strong Cisco Nexus switch, router and ASA firewall hardware experience
+ A good understanding of networking protocols (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP etc.)
+ A methodical troubleshooting approach
+ A strong attention to detail
Desired Technical Skills:
+ Cisco ACI experience
+ HP switches experience
+ Exposure to Meraki devices
+ Experience in a multi-tenant architecture
+ Public cloud service integration
+ Certificate Services
+ Understanding of Load Balancers
Role Info:
+ Location: Based at our office in Huntingdon, Cambridgeshire.
+ Hours: Monday to Friday / shift pattern covering between the hours of 08.00 to 23.00 (37.5 hours per week) with a 1-hour unpaid lunch break per day
+ Salary: Up to £50,000 + Shift Allowance
+ Start Date: ASAP
Benefits & Perks:
Includes: 25 days annual leave, on-call allowance, life assurance, healthcare cash plan, employee assistance programme, on-line discounts & savings platform, spot bonus scheme, recruitment bounty scheme, dress down Friday, free fruit, fundraising, Sports & Social club.
Additional Information:
+ Must have the right to live and work in the UK
+ Must have driving license and access to own transport due to location and customer site
+ Full training and support will be given
Join us at the forefront.
Put your talent to the test. Make leaps in your field. We are a creative, collaborative place, delivering transformative results with remarkable technology for remarkable clients daily. Working here is challenging, rewarding and exciting. We welcome adaptable, enterprising professionals and invest heavily in their development.
Your Background / Previous Roles May Include:
3rd Line Network Engineer, Cisco Network Engineer, Network Support Engineer, Senior Network Engineer, Managed Services Network Engineer, NOC Engineer, Data Centre Operations Engineer, Senior NOC Engineer.

Melbourne

summary: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every ...
text:
McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.
Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.
We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.
Wherever you contribute here at McKesson, you will have the ability to make a real impact in the lives of others.
Current Need
We are seeking an experienced Network Engineer to join our IT team with in-depth knowledge of the planning, design, implementation and troubleshooting of networked systems to join our Remote Network Implementation Services team.
Position Description
Responsible for operations of a company's internal data communications systems, including LANs and/or WANs. Plans, designs, and implements networked systems, including configurations; supporting/troubleshooting network problems; coordinating with vendors for installation of such items as routers, switches and wireless networking hardware; project implementation; providing training and assisting with proposal writing. Responsible for project planning, cost analysis and vendor comparisons. May research and evaluate emerging network and communication technology.
Qualifications:
Minimum Requirements
6 years experience in the operations of a company's internal data communications systems, including LANs and/or WANs
Critical Skills
A minimum of six years experience deploying Cisco IOS based networking devices within a 24x7 environment. Experience to include routing, switching, wireless, WAN optimization.
LA N Switching - A minimum of six years of switching environments including Spanning Tree, 802.1q, etc. Cisco Catalyst 4500/3750/2960.
Excellent communication skills and experience working with internal and external customers as a service provider.
LAN Physical Connectivity - A minimum of four years experience with Ethernet connectivity.
Wireless - A minimum of four years experience with deploying wireless network in an Enterprise or Warehouse environment.
Equipment - have diverse IOS experience required in the design, implementation and troubleshooting on a wide range of datacenter level equipment to include - but not limited to:
Routers - ASR, 3900, 7300, ISR G3 Series Routers
Cisco Access Switches (3750, 4500, 4900)
Wireless - Cisco
Additional Knowledge & Skills
Experience SDWAN - Viptela (v100, v1000, v2000) and Netscout are strongly preferred.
Proficient project management skills displayed through successful implementations, completing assignments, meeting timelines, and keeping within budget
WAN Physical Connectivity - Experience with edge router WAN circuit (Ethernet, T3, Multilink,T1) provisioning, configuration and troubleshooting.
MPLS Topology and Connections - A minimum of four years experience with Telecom managed MPLS deployments. Preference for multi provider deployment experience.
Routing Protocols - must be proficient with all common routing protocols used in a network environment to include (BGP, OSPF, EIGRP)
Configuring and troubleshooting QOS for both WAN and LAN networks.
LAN Switching: HP 5500 series.
A minimum of four years experience with debug\trace option commands and their impact on the production environment.
Monitoring - strong familiarity with SNMP, Netflow, Syslog and packet captures.
Directly applicable professional certifications are preferred - CCNP, CCDP, CCIE RS
In depth knowledge of UNIX, Windows networking technologies and deployment methodologies preferred.
Education
4-year degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience
Certifications/Licensure
CCNP, CCDP, CCIE RS certifications viewed favorably
Physical Requirements
General Office Demands
Benefits & Company Statement
McKesson believes superior performance - individual and team - that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it's flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.
We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.
But we can't do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission-whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company-and of healthcare. At McKesson, you'll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that's vital to us all.
McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer - minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.
Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.
Agency Statement
No agencies please.

text:
Seeking a professional Network Engineer to work on a 12 month contract with extensions based in Carseldine in Brisbane's Northern Suburbs.
Brisbane
This is an outstanding opportunity to move into an exciting role with a progressive, growing and dynamic organisation. The organisation has a track record of sustained growth is creating excellent career opportunities for their Network Support professionals.
This fantastic opportunity is currently available for a Network Engineer to join on a 12 month contract, based in in CARSELDINE, which is situated in Brisbane's Northern Suburbs. Ideally you will have experience working in an IT environment previously, and you will have a keen eye for customer service!
The purpose of the role will be to be the point of contact for internal customers and providing troubleshooting of Network technical issues, or escalating issues accordingly. You will be part of a dynamic team in an ever changing environment that takes pride in providing exceptional customer service.
Responsibilities
Managing assigned tasks and ensuring completion within defined time frames
Installing/ configuring as well as executing recommended changes.
Ensuring all documentation is maintained and implemented appropriately.
Ensure that existing technology investments are optimized if applicable
Provide a 2nd level escalation point
Skills & Requirements
Cisco networking expertise (more than 3 years)
CCNA and CCNP certification is essential
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Proven working knowledge of network, routers & switches.
Proven working knowledge of Microsoft technologies.
To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Evelyn De Lange on 07 3339 5611. Please quote our job reference number: 200173291.
Reference Number: 200173291_1

name: Wireless Network Engineer
summary:
Job Description
Team CACI has an exciting and challenging opportunity available for a Wireless Netw...
text:
Job Description
Team CACI has an exciting and challenging opportunity available for a Wireless Network Engineer supporting a DHS customer's wide-area (WAN), local-area (LAN) and campus-area (CAN) networks across multiple security domains. CACI will provide a variety of IT services through including cyber security, identity and access management, capacity planning, cloud integration and engineering, field support services, Tier 3/4 support, application deployment and optimization, and operations center support services. CACI will support IT operational environments increasing availability and security for a variety of applications and systems.
What You'll Get to Do:
The Wireless Network Engineer is responsible for monitoring, troubleshooting, and analyzing wireless networks remotely for multiple locations. Provides leadership and management for day-to-day operations of a large-scale Data Center, while ensuring the highest levels of reliability and availability are maintained. Will be actively involved with all phases of security design, implementation, proactive monitoring, troubleshooting and analysis of firewalls, IDSs, VPNs, security controls and policies. Develops system specifications, architecture designs, integration and test plans, and all relevant documentation. Develops security assessment and mitigation strategies. Maintain compliance with DOD Information Assurance requirements as well as ensuring service performance indicators are met or exceeded.
More About the Role:
+ Ten years of facility engineering in a high reliability Data Center environment
+ Must be able to create consensus around new ideas and initiatives
+ Complete understanding of 802.11ac
+ Knowledge of WiFi 6 802.11ax
+ Experience with Cisco Access Points and controllers as well as Cisco Meraki Wireless Access Points
+ Experience with Cisco router hardware and network protocols
+ Experience with network diagnostic and performance management tools and software
+ Experience with industry standard network engineering principles
+ Wireless Architecture, Design and Implementation
+ Cisco and Meraki Wireless Access Points, Controllers and Management suite
+ Hands on experience using Cisco ISE, Cisco Prime and Cisco WLCs
+ Experience with Routing/Switching
+ Identify industry trends and articulate implications that will have an impact on the Data Center operation
+ Assists with designs, analyses, tests and implementation of state-of-the-art secure network architectures.
+ Experience working with enterprise vendors such as Infoblox, Equinix, NetApp, AWS, and Cisco
+ Duties include monitoring and reporting on network hardware operations to ensure compliant configuration options.
+ Generate log files/reports and provide analysis of the data collected for issue resolution and network performance metrics.
+ Configure and implement diagnostic tools to support network architectures.
+ Responsible attitude with strong work ethic; leading by example in attendance, attitude and technical work product
+ In depth knowledge of TCP/IP Protocols
+ Functional understanding of network Layer 2 /3 switching and routing protocols
+ Functional understanding of diverse set of networked applications and terms requiring application traffic management solutions, including HTTP, HTTPS, SSH, FTP, DHCP, DNS, NTP, ANYCAST services, NAT and others
+ DMZ Network infrastructure knowledge including topology, security policies, firewalls and the L2/L3 switch and router infrastructure is required
+ Manages software defined networking and ACI Fabric
+ Manages WAN, LAN, CAN, and remote network security as well as incident and problem management.
+ Oversee security infrastructure sustainment, maintenance, and advanced configuration. (firewalls, web gateways, mail gateways, IDS, intrusion detection systems, and management tools.
+ Inform management in a clear, concise, and timely manner of any customer or network related issues
You'll Bring These Qualifications:
+ US Citizenship required
+ An active Entrance on Duty (EOD) is required to begin employment and must be maintained as a requirement of continued employment
+ A minimum of seven (7) years of subject matter experience deploying WAN/LAN, Routing, Switching, Optimization and extensive exposure with Cloud Service Providers
+ At least 4 years hands-on in Wireless Design and Implementation
+ Required Certification(s): CCNP along with a BA/BS or equivalent experience and minimum 15 years of related work experience
+ Proven experience with Agile, sprints and DevOps concepts
+ Experience working with a Scrum Master, Daily Scrum meetings, sprints and written deliverables
+ Familiarity with the following technologies: Cisco 95xx and 6509-E, Cisco C7010/C5596 Nexus Switches, Cisco 55xx ASA Firewalls, DHS Compliance Checks, Software Defined Networking, SD WAN, and Network Monitoring Tools
+ Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills
+ Strong critical thinking, complex problem solving, appropriate judgment and decision-making skills
+ Proven communicator and leader. Must be able to work well in an environment facilitating a large group of government and other contractor personnel to achieve a common goal
+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
+ Flexible - The environment is highly dynamic. You will be expected to keep up with the changing environment while ensuring a high-level of operational effectiveness along with sprint work items and deliverables due the end of each sprint.
+ Detail oriented
+ Team Player - This role is part of a much larger team
These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
+ Relevant DHS focused experience
+ BS in Engineering or Information Technology
+ F5 Certified, CCNA/CCNP, or higher CISCO certifications preferred
+ SolarWinds, Infoblox, Splunk, and Cloud experience preferred
What We Can Offer You:- We've been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.- Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.- We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.- We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation's highest priorities.- For over 55 years, the principles of CACI's unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.
Job Location
US-National Harbor-MD-MARYLAND SUBURBAN
CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.
title: Wireless Network Engineer

name: Principal Network Engineer
summary:
Job Description
Job Summary:
The Network Engineer Principal oversees the complex installation, anal...
text:
Job Description
Job Summary:
The Network Engineer Principal oversees the complex installation, analysis, evaluation, and support of network communications including LAN/WAN, Load Balancing and VOIP systems.
Principal Accountabilities
• Ensures solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and reusability.
• Supports the Program operations in the provisioning, implementation, and monitoring, troubleshooting of Network communications.
• Provides oversight of communications projects, including the development of timetables, budgets, and status reports working with the project management team.
• Monitors LAN and WAN to ensure they are operating according to contractual service level agreements.
• Manages communication systems to ensure they support Program network architecture and operations.
• May consult with business unit contract operations and program management staff.
• Prepares detailed documentation of network systems including drawings, IP addressing plans, troubleshooting trees and training documents.
• Performs other duties as assigned.
Knowledge & Skills
• CISCO IOS network software.
• Cisco NXOS network software.
• Professional Certifications and industry certifications.
• Ability to remain current on CISCO platforms.
• Demonstrate independent problem-solving skills.
• Demonstrate good written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with internal and external customers, including various country Governments.
• Ability to uphold integrity and confidentiality with access to all information on the Company network.
• Skilled in creating Visio drawings and diagrams of new and existing network infrastructure.
• Wireless Implementation, troubleshooting and management
• DMVPN Deployments and troubleshooting
• WAN/MPLS configurations, installations and ISP coordination
• Layer 2 VLAN configuration, designing, segmenting and troubleshooting
• Palo Alto ACE certification
• VFR experience in creating, implementing and troubleshooting
• Generating BoM, quotes, parts lists for Cisco architecture
Experience & Education
• Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or related field; one (1) year of experience in related field can be substituted for each year of the four (4) years of college.
• Cisco CCNP Routing and Switching Certification strongly preferred.
• Preferred CCDP or CCNP Datacenter.
• Six (6) years of experience in network engineering.
Physical Requirements/Working Environment
• Generally, works in a normal office environment, but may be required to travel domestically and internationally on short notice, to austere environments, under harsh living conditions.
title: Principal Network Engineer

Overview
NSC Global is currently looking for a Network Engineer (LAN/WAN/Security) to join our grow...
tasks: Ensure support standards aligned to guidelines and Helpdesk ticket support at Level 2 and Level 3,Work with Cisco LAN switches (3750, 3750X, 4500, 6500 and Nexus 9000 Series),Work with Cisco WAN routers (2900, 3900, 4000 and other series of routers),Work with Cisco Meraki routers (Z1 and MX600 series),Support for Security devices from a troubleshooting perspective (encryption IPSEC, ACL's and FW rulesets) [Knowledge not expert],Configure and troubleshoot complex routing (GRE over IPSec, EIGRP, BGP, OSPF and Static routing),Cisco ACS,F5 Load Balancer,Maintain Cisco Wireless LAN controllers and troubleshoot wireless issues,Contribute to Team project Documentation/Templates,Assist Network Troubleshooting - Triage/solve problems with support teams independently of Tower lead.
text:
Overview
NSC Global is currently looking for a Network Engineer (LAN/WAN/Security) to join our growing company.
NSC Global is a multi-national technology services and infrastructure provider that helps international clients solve their challenges, with over 2,500 FTEs across the globe, a great achievement in just under 20 years. Our clients are larger organizations demanding a capable and trusted partner to solve challenging technical, process and cost concerns. Core service offerings are: Procurement & Logistics, Operational Support, Managed Resourcing, Transformation Services and Managed Infrastructure. This is an exciting opportunity to join an organization that is expecting to double in size within 3 years.
POSITION: Network Engineer (LAN/WAN/Security) - Junior to Mid level
JOB TYPE: Contract (1099) with NSC Global
START DATE: IMMEDIATELY
Responsibilities
Ensure support standards aligned to guidelines and Helpdesk ticket support at Level 2 and Level 3
Work with Cisco LAN switches (3750, 3750X, 4500, 6500 and Nexus 9000 Series)
Work with Cisco WAN routers (2900, 3900, 4000 and other series of routers)
Work with Cisco Meraki routers (Z1 and MX600 series)
Support for Security devices from a troubleshooting perspective (encryption IPSEC, ACL's and FW rulesets) [Knowledge not expert]
Configure and troubleshoot complex routing (GRE over IPSec, EIGRP, BGP, OSPF and Static routing)
Cisco ACS
F5 Load Balancer
Maintain Cisco Wireless LAN controllers and troubleshoot wireless issues
Contribute to Team project Documentation/Templates
Assist Network Troubleshooting - Triage/solve problems with support teams independently of Tower lead.
Remote skills = resources working remotely are possible if they have the necessary capability level to support the work requirements.

title: Senior Network Engineer Jobs

name: Senior Cisco Network Engineer
summary: POSITION IS LOCATED DOWNTOWN CHICAGO AND IS A 1 YEAR CONTRACT ENGAGEMENT (WITH ABILITY TO EXTEND FO...
text:
POSITION IS LOCATED DOWNTOWN CHICAGO AND IS A 1 YEAR CONTRACT ENGAGEMENT (WITH ABILITY TO EXTEND FOR AN ADDITIONAL YEAR). CANDIDATE SHOULD BE ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY PASS A TSA BACKGROUND CHECK.
THIS POSITION IS BEING COMPENSATED BETWEEN $60-$65/HR. Please forward your salary requirements with your submission.
Network Engineer Description: The ideal candidate would have a background in network architecture, maintenance and monitoring. The candidate will be added to an existing IT team which s/he will interact with on a daily basis. This position interacts with all IT functional areas (e.g. architecture, design, network engineering, Helpdesk/Desktop support, application development and support). The candidate will be someone who can troubleshoot technology related problems that might include multicast routing, datacenter design, troubleshooting intermittent packet loss, latency issues, trading system connectivity and equipment failure. The successful candidate must be self-motivated, excel at multitasking, and comfortable working in a demanding, state of the art environment.
Job Functions:
• Day to day support of network and security environments.
• Proactively suggest enhancements to existing configurations, technologies or procedures.
• Work closely with all IT functional areas to design and implement operational requirements for new and existing IT systems.
• Ability to follow and enhance existing IT policies and procedures.
• On-call support rotation.
• Support other key initiatives as the business dictates.
• Troubleshoot intricate network and systems issues down to the bit level and up to the application layer.
• Provide critical thinking to complex problems in a 24/7, mission critical network environment.
• Process, monitor and prioritize trouble tickets.
• Automate any and all tasks that can be automated.
• Provide support and administration of customer firewalls and security appliances
• Provide support and administration of customer network load balancing appliances
Job Qualities:
• Good understanding of the TCP/IP protocol.
• Knowledgeable of the OSI layers 1-4 and associated equipment.
• Understanding of network concepts and technologies such as QoS, CoS, IDS/IPS, VoIP, flow control,
• Knowledge of implementing and troubleshooting static and dynamic routing protocols such as EIGRP, BGP and OSPF.
• Familiar with packet sniffing applications (Snort, TCPDump, Wireshark, Netmon, etc).
• Familiar performance tuning networking/security and wireless infrastructures.
Job Requirements:
• 2+ years' experience in network administration/engineering in a senior or lead position.
• Certifications required: CCNA, CCIE
• Good written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to interact with management, vendors and external parties and should be able to effectively communicate complex issues in a clear and concise manner. Must be able to thoroughly document implementations, modifications and removals.
• Highly organized, self-motivated, able to multi-task, able to work independently as well as a team player.
• Analytical and detail orientated.
• Must be willing to work some weekend shifts in support of maintenance and participate in on-call rotation duties.
• Must have experience in 24x7 mission critical environments.
• Strong Cisco Routing and Switch / Data Networking and troubleshooting skills are required.
Extensive experience in Layer 2 & Layer 3 technologies
Experience in LAN, WAN, WLAN implementations
• Must have expertise in multiple platforms within the following category and product lines:
o Nexus
o IPsec, GRE Tunnels
o Frame Relay, Opteman circuits.
o OSPF
o Cisco 800, 1900, 3700, 4500 series routers
o Cisco 4505, 4506, 2960 switches
o WLC (5500 series)
o Experience with Infoblox implementation and administration
o Experience with Juniper SSL-VPN configuration, administration
o F5 Big IP implementation, configuration and administration
o Cisco - ACS administration
o IPsec and SSL VPN, Cisco routers and switches. VPN expertise must include both B-to-B and user based tunnel. Prospective engineer is expected to configure and troubleshoot the equipment using CLI
o Authentication, Authorization, and Auditing: RSA Authentication Manager, Juniper Steel-Belted RADIUS, LDAP, Juniper UAC and Cisco ACS.
o Network Traffic Management: SQUID, McAfee Web Gateway or similar product
o Firewall: Juniper ISG/SSG, including VSYS (ScreenOS), Check Point NGX, Cisco PIX and ASA a plus
title: Senior Cisco Network Engineer

name: Network Engineer
summary:
Overview
The Network Engineer is responsible for assisting with the design, planning, installation ...
text:
Overview
The Network Engineer is responsible for assisting with the design, planning, installation and troubleshooting of the enterprise network. This position will work in close collaboration with the Infrastructure and User Support teams to monitor the network by analyzing and isolating any problems that may arise. This position will also manage network security tools, e.g., firewall, anti-virus and intrusion detection systems. The Network Engineer will perform other duties as assigned.
Responsibilities
Essential Duties (at least 5 that are non-negotiable duties and are absolutely pertinent to successfully completing the job without accommodations):
The Network Engineer MUST:
• Primarily responsible for designing, developing and implementing enterprise level system strategies.
• Analyze network and infrastructure problems and develops solution-focused recommendations
• Performs vendor management and oversight as needed
• Partner with colleagues to serve as a Subject Matter Expert to effectively identify and communicate risks and assist with
implementation projects
• Provide hardware and software support on installed systems to include the configuration, maintenance, and updates for the
platforms
• Capacity planning, troubleshooting, and maintenance of a wireless enterprise environment
• Monitor and manage the system’s capabilities, availability, and performance against overall Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
criteria including reporting of capacity, utilization, trending and forecasting
• Conduct research and analysis of new tools and technologies for the enhancement of existing solutions and to fulfill new
system requirements
• Certify infrastructure adheres to established SLAs by analyzing current capabilities and forecasting organizational growth
demands Respond promptly to network problems by actively participating in maintenance and incident response functions
• Participate in maintenance and incident response functions and respond promptly to network and system problems
• Create and document processes and procedures.
• Provide regular status and project updates to leadership including regular trends and statistics related to systems and overall
health and metrics of the current network
• Proven capacity to perform with close attention to detail with accuracy.
• This position requires work outside of standard business hours, on occasion, the ability to work evenings, weekends and
holidays
• Strong customer service skills
• Attention to detail and accuracy
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
• Collaborate with other Joint Tech leaders and staff
• Resilient problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities
• Ability to work in a rapidly changing and expanding environment while keeping long-term goals in sight
• Critical thinking and decision-making
• Strong facilitation and communication skills
• Self-motivated and well organized
• Adaptable and responds willingly to change
• Strong troubleshooting and analytical abilities with detailed accuracy and the ability to solve problems under pressure with
tight deadlines.
• Established track record of delivering IT solutions and ability to be agile and work in a distributed environment
• Collect requirements, conduct briefings / presentations and ability to document policies and procedures, proposals, system
configuration and change information.
Qualifications
MINIMUM EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree in a technology-related field
MINIMUM EXPERIENCE:
• Minimum 5 years’ experience as a Network Administrator or Engineer in an enterprise environment.
• Experience in designing, developing and implementing enterprise level system strategies
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
• Experience working as a network administrator or engineer in a healthcare environment
• Advanced Wireless troubleshooting in densely populated enterprise environments
• Experience leading a team of network professionals in an enterprise environment
• Experience with Fortinet Firewalls
REQUIRED CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURE: Holds and maintains these certifications as a professional. Lapsing/expiration of these certifications/licensure will result in suspension of work:
• Cisco Certified Network Professional or Industry Equivalent
PREFERRED CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURE:
• CCNA Wireless or Equivalent

name: Cisco Level Senior Network Engineer - Start Immediately
summary:
Network Engineer, Palo Alto, CISCO Nexus, CISCO ISR CCIE
A global insurance company is looking for ...
text:
Network Engineer, Palo Alto, CISCO Nexus, CISCO ISR CCIE
A global insurance company is looking for a Network Engineer who can play a key role in supporting both a European network upgrade, the delivery of a new network at a greenfield iconic building in the Square Mile, as well as standard BAU support. The qualified candidate will be responsible for supporting data and voice network equipment as well as the planning & installation for location moves, phone services, cabling and patching, monitoring and trouble-shooting networking problems.
The candidate will be expected to support multiple companies across UK and Europe under a corporate banner and to support the projects/changes that these companies need. They will be expected to wear a support and change hat and have experience of prioritization between the two.
The ideal candidate is someone who is flexible enough to manage the day to day administration, be involved in change at a local level and who can see the broader picture and help implement best practice across UK/Europe to better support the companies.
There are high expectations on this role so being a high energy, delivery focused, quality minded self-starter are core requirements.
- Core: - Administration of the Palo Alto firewall
- Administration of the NetScaler load balancer
- Configuration and implementation of Cisco Nexus and Catalyst 4510/4500X switches
- Configuration and implementation of Cisco ISR and ASR routers.
- Expert in Cisco routing and switching
- Troubleshooting network issues
- Assist senior network engineer
- Nice to have: - Cisco ISE experience
- Cisco Call manager , Unity , CMS , Jabber experience
- Cisco iWAN or DMVPN and PFR experience
- VSS , VPC , Nexus experience
- Multicast experience
- Cisco 5508 Wireless and Prime experience
- Basic Assumption: - Excellent customer facing skills
- Team player skills
- BAU support
- Dealing with support issues and closing tickets
- Patching, racking and cabling of devices
- Creation of Visio diagrams and maintaining documentation
- Creation of documents and spreadsheets for inventory and data collection
- Second Level Help Desk support for networking problems.
- Handle circuit issues with telecom organizations
Required Experience - Include years of experience, necessary skills, etc - Min 7 years Network Engineering experience
- Experience managing a WAN using MPLS technology
- Experience with VOIP technology preferably Cisco Call Manager experience
- Nice to have - ISE (NAC), iWAN, DMVPN, PFR, CMS
Education/Skills - Include required degrees, PC skills, graphic skills, etc - Degree educated preferred
- Minimum CCNP?.CCDP or CCIE preferred
