text:
Job Description
Duration:6+ Months
Job description
As a Senior Network Engineer, you will be responsible for maintaining the design and integrity of the internal network, including customer-facing hosted and cloud environments.
The engineer will provide expert technical assistance to team members with high-level system and networking request.
This role will be responsible designing, implementing and testing complex infrastructure in support of our business customer needs.
As a member of the Network Team, the Senior Network Engineer will provide onsite and remote support on a 24x7 basis to our business customers who have critical response time requirements for their business technology systems. You will work independently and as part of a team to answer service desk calls, urgently analyze technical issues, address escalated issues, work with the project manager on team related projects, and troubleshoot over the phone/onsite/via remote access. This position will require flexible work hours for systems deployment and troubleshooting activities.
This engineer will successfully demonstrate the skills required to secure and manage network infrastructures to protect productivity, mitigate threats, and reduce costs.
Â
GENERAL STATEMENT OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
An experienced Network Engineer familiar with Cisco networking best practices.
An experienced Network Engineer familiar with Cisco and Fortigate firewall best practices.
An experienced Network Engineer familiar with Citrix Netscaler best practices.
Thorough knowledge of Networking and Infrastructure
Design, install and support of Routing, Switching and Security/VPN technologies in the WAN/LAN environment.
Ability to work effectively as part of the Network team
Willingness to participate and share in rotating on-call duties.
Ability to respond to on-call / on-site situations within required SLA parameters (2 hr max drive time).
Â
DETAILED STATEMENT OF DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work independently and with approved vendors and other state agencies to resolve network related issues.
Creates and updates all documentation as it pertains to the current state of network architecture and new installations
Functional knowledge on how to connect public and private networks while not compromising network stability.
Functional knowledge of cable standards, multi/single mode fiber, proprietary and standard serial communication protocols
Fundamental knowledge of PCI/PII requirements
Planning and implementing future installations of network equipment and capacity planning.
Engaging in high-level analysis and troubleshooting of network infrastructure.
Performs all work in a cooperative and professional manner with other Team members.
Provides technical expertise, direction and leadership to other team members.
Performs research and analysis on all requests for problem resolution.
Performs other related duties as requested by supervisor.
Travel between facilities to maintain and deploy networking equipment
Â
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED AT HIRE (List knowledge, skills, abilities)
Proven experience with designing, configuring and troubleshooting complex networks.
Expert knowledge of routing protocols (e.g. EIGRP, OSPF, RIP, and BGP) in a mixed environment.
Knowledge of VLAN technology, VTP and STP protocols.
Experience in Access Control Lists, Firewalls, Citrix Netscalers, VPN technologies, Wi-Fi technologies, Enterprise Wireless technologies and other security technologies.
Solid understanding of network routers and switches.
Knowledge of T1, T3, SONET, DWDM and OC technologies.
Experience with Metro-Ethernet technologies.
Experience in Network monitoring and management tools.
Experience in VOIP and QoS.
Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing
Ability to work independently or in a team setting.
Ability to adjust to changing situations to meet emergencies, program changes or production requirements.
Knowledge of the methods and techniques of statistics.
Undergraduate degree (BS) in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering (or related technical degree)
Relevant technical certification (current CCIE, CCNP)
Extensive knowledge and experience in creating and updating Network Visio Diagrams
Â
QUALIFICATIONS ACQUIRED ON JOB (List knowledge, skills, abilities)
Knowledge of the policies, procedures, specifications, standards and guidelines governing assigned unit activities.
Knowledge of the types and uses of agency forms.
Â
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
Applicants must have at least four years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in network design and engineering.

text:
Job Description
Strategic Business Systems, Inc is seeking an experienced Network Engineer to work in Beltsville, Maryland. Qualified candidates will possess an active DOD Top Secret Clearance.
Position Overview:
SBS has supported Department of State for over 15 years. Our team specifically focuses on the IT Network Engineering support for all of the embassies and consulates globally. This team is 24/7 but this particular role will support a schedule of 3:00pm - 11:00pm on Tuesday through Saturday each week.
Provide support for overseas Posts on configuration and Implementation of Core Network and Workgroup equipment to include Cisco 3550, 3750, 4506 and 6500 Routers and Switches.
Configure VPN tunnels, standard and tended access-list, and double and triple DES (Data Encryption Standard) on WAN interfaces of Cisco routers and SafeNet data encryptors for data encrypted connectivity.
Provide network support and configuration management using systems such as CiscoWorks 2000, as well as operation of fault isolation using diagnostics tools HP OpenView, and Tavve.
Install certificates on Nortel devices via PKI to allow tunneling access for encryption across the network.
Involved in the design, implementation and testing of upgrades and new technologies in customer's network architecture.
Analyze the customer's business requirement, proposing appropriate technologies, development of system architectures, hands-on testing and thorough documentation.
Additional focus on developing comprehensive deployment plans for upgrading the customer's network or integrating new technologies. This includes evaluation of various techniques and tools for efficient implementation
Requirements:
Minimum of 2 years of Network Engineering experience with Cisco technologies
Proven experience in an enterprise network environment (WAN)
Current Active Top Secret clearance
About SBS:
Strategic Business Systems, Inc. (SBS) is a National Information Technology Services company headquartered in the Washington D.C. Metro area. SBS provides IT infrastructure design, integration, and operation services. Our expertise encompasses the full spectrum of infrastructure technologies, including the latest network, server, data storage, disaster recovery, security, and Internet technologies.
If interested in learning more about this opportunity, please send your resume to recruiting@sbsplanet.com.
Strategic Business Systems, Inc. (SBS) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

summary:
Cyber Enterprise Network Engineer, Senior
The Challenge:
A well-designed network is critical to mov...
tasks: 7+ years of experience with network engineering and architecture,Experience with developing network design, test, and implementation documentation, including Concepts of Operations, Requirements Specification, Basis of Design, and Test Plans
text:
Cyber Enterprise Network Engineer, Senior
The Challenge:
A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable the Navy to achieve their mission, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and software, requires a combination of technical skill and careful planning. That's why we need you, a network engineer who knows how to craft the exact network the Navy and DoD needs.
As a network engineer on our team, you'll work with the Navy to design and implement a reliable network to support their most critical missions. You'll collaborate with our customers and subject matter experts to learn the strategic goals and operational needs that shape the network requirements. You'll then share your expertise during the planning of acquisition, installation, configuration, and maintenance of the network components. From resolving interoperability issues across platforms, to supporting the acquisition of hardware, you'll put your hardware and software talents to good use. This is your chance to share your experience with naval systems, virtualization technologies, or cybersecurity while broadening your network engineering work. Join us as we help the Navy protect our warfighters and execute critical missions for our country around the world.
Empower change with us.
You Have:
7+ years of experience with network engineering and architecture
Experience with developing network design, test, and implementation documentation, including Concepts of Operations, Requirements Specification, Basis of Design, and Test Plans
Experience with deploying, testing, managing, and assessing Local Area Networks (LAN) and Wide Area Networks (WAN)
Experience with Virtual Private Networks (VPN), firewalls, Access Control Lists (ACL) network switches, and cybersecurity or information assurance (IA)
Experience with Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) network products, including routers, switches, Network Time Protocol (NTP) servers, network management equipment, and cryptographic equipment
Experience with Agile software development projects
Knowledge of the NIST Special Publication 800-series information security management aligned to Enterprise telecommunications and networks
Active Secret clearance
BA or BS degree in a technical field or 10+ years of experience with network engineering and architecture in lieu of a degree
Ability to obtain Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification within 30 days of hire
Nice If You Have:
Experience with Navy or DoD enterprise or tactical networks
Experience in leading the development of an enterprise network with 10,000+ endpoints
Experience with developing the architecture and testing strategies and plans for LANs and WANs
Experience with developing detailed end-to-end network performance assessments
Experience with network tapping, including SPAN, physical tap, and virtual tap
Experience with in-line encryptors, including TACLANE and HAIPE
Experience with packet capture technology and analysis
Experience with evaluating services and products provided by COTS / GOTS and providing recommendations
Experience with routing protocols, including OSPF, BGP, and Multicast
TS/SCI clearance
CCNP certification
Cisco Certified Architect (CCAr) or similar commercial enterprise network architect certification
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE)
Citrix Certified Enterprise Engineer (CCEE)
IAT Level III certification, including CISSP
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.
Build Your Career:
When you join Booz Allen, you'll have the opportunity to connect with other professionals doing similar work across multiple markets. You'll share best practices and work through challenges as you gain experience and mentoring to develop your career. In addition, you will have access to a wealth of training resources through our Engineering & Science University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 tech courses, certifications and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site courses, vendor relationships, and a network of experts who can give you helpful tips. We'll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.
We're an EOE that empowers our people-no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic-to fearlessly drive change.

summary:
Wireless Network Engineer needed in Cambridge, MA.

text:
Wireless Network Engineer needed in Cambridge, MA.
The Network Engineer will report to the Director of Infrastructure Operations with the primary responsibility of helping plan and manage the implementation and migration of Client’s existing Cisco WiSM2 wireless infrastructure environment to Cisco’s 8540 wireless LAN controller infrastructure. The successful candidate will provide both technical and administrative support with experience managing and implementing large-scale wireless infrastructure deployments and renewals across an enterprise environment of thousands of users. The successful candidate will be the technical lead on this project and must have experience with Cisco’s wireless controller infrastructure. Other responsibilities may also include monitoring network activities; design, build, and maintenance of other network infrastructure components, and the integration of technologies from various virtualized server and storage vendors.
If you are interested, apply now.
Bachelor’s Degree or 4 years of relevant experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field.
•Minimum 10 years of relevant experience.
•Experience leading projects, programs or processes required.
•Demonstrated expertise in the design and implementation of enterprise network solutions.
•Strong experience managing Cisco wireless networks and large-scale (5000+ AP) deployments.
•Strong understanding of wireless networking protocols (802.11 [a,b,gn,ac], CAPWAP,WPA2).
•Strong understanding of network authZ/authN protocols/technologies (RADIUS, TACACS, MAB).
•Strong experience managing Cisco network technologies (ASR Routers, Catalyst/Nexus Switches).
•Strong experience with a wide variety of networking technologies required.
•Understanding of multicast protocols/technologies (IGMP, PIM, MLD, mDNS).
•Possess thorough understanding of network protocols (IPv4, IPv6, ICMP, TCP, UDP, DNS, DHCP).
•Possess thorough understanding of network switching protocols (802.3/Ethernet, 802.1Q/VLAN, LACP).
•Ability to synthesize from the big-picture into implementation.
•Ability to communicate with Institute’s senior leadership.
•Prior experience managing router ACLs and firewalls (Cisco ASA, Palo Alto, etc.).
•Prior experience with GNU/Linux operating system.
•Demonstrated experience managing load balancers (F5 Networks GTM/LTM).
•Understanding of Optical Networking (DWDM/CWDM).
Desired Qualifications & Technical Skills:
•Understanding of scripting languages (i.e., Bash, Perl, etc.) a plus.
Experience with a multi-site campus and multi-data center environments is a plus.

text:
Aspect employs a team of passionate individuals who are changing the face of customer engagement. Over our 40-year history we have empowered employees by creating an inspired community that values customer obsession, unlocked communications and relentless innovation. Our ability to think big has enabled us to continually evolve and lead the market, and to stay on the forefront with exciting technologies including cloud, mobile and artificial intelligence.
GENERAL SCOPE & SUMMARY
Are you passionate about networking and looking for a great place to learn, grow and be mentored? Looking for a great company to leverage your cloud networking skills? Ready to advance your career and work with real cloud networks? If you would enjoy working with carrier-grade and enterprise network environments, then we want to talk. Aspect is looking for a Network Engineer to join the Cloud Network team for the Operations Department In Orlando.
We are looking for the best candidates interested in working with a company offering top-tier employee benefits and those who want the opportunity to work with our cloud technologies. As a mid to senior level Network Engineer, you will be responsible for the daily operation of our traditional core networks and cloud networks around the world.
Duties and Responsibilities:
•Responsible for solving network connectivity issues, adding/modifying NAT entries and firewall rules to enable connectivity
•Provide network configuration support and document client requirements
•Coordinate required changes working alongside other network and firewall teams
•Support Cloud Architecture to provide Operations and Migration services
•Responsible for the configuration and support of backbone connections over DirectConnect(AWS), ExpressRoute(Azure)
•Learn from team members the effective use and operation of our Network Environments
•Perform capacity planning for the various network infrastructures
•Maintain performance metrics for the network infrastructure
•Work with and update Aspects' established best practices for the network infrastructure
•Utilize approved network tools to verify and take required actions on events alerted on from network monitoring tools
•Responsible for troubleshooting to ascertain root cause of issues
•Perform network system updates, patches and configuration changes
Qualifications
SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
•Passion for traditional and cloud networks
•Desire to work with, learn and be mentored in network administration
•Candidates are expected to exhibit good judgment in all cases
•Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
•Ability to work extra hours if needed
•Ability to quickly learn new technologies
•Strong communication skills
•Education: Bachelor's Degree or similar experience
Required:
•4-5 + years of Network Engineering/Administration in Juniper or Cisco environments.
•3-4 + years of Experience with major routing protocols, such as BGP and OSPF
•3-4 + years of Experience with Linux
•Excellent troubleshooting skills
•Experience setting up IPSec VPN tunnels
•Experience setting up Access Control Lists
•Experience with Ansible
•Experience with Scripting languages such as Python and Bash
•Strong oral and written communication skills
•Strong documentation skills
Preferred:
•Experience with VMWare, Hyper-V or another virtualization technology
•Experience with cloud computing environments, such as Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform
•Experience with large, multi-datacenter enterprise environments
•Experience troubleshooting and resolving network performance issues (LAN/VLAN connectivity)
•Knowledge of container environments, such as Kubernetes, Amazon EKS, Azure AKS, Google GKE
•Experience troubleshooting Internet carrier network related performance issues
•Education: Bachelor's Degree in relevant field of study (Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field)
•Experience with Change Management or PCI Compliance a plus
#LI-BF1
Aspect is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer with a strong commitment to diversity. In that spirit, we are particularly interested in receiving applications from a broad spectrum of people, including women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, veterans or any other legally protected group.

text:
Job Description
The Senior Network Engineer (contract) is responsible for configuring, monitoring and maintaining IP network related resources across Summit Midstream’ s nationwide network footprint. This position requires a high level of analytical skills and attention to detail to help ensure Summit Midstream’ s network operational resiliency. The Communications department relies heavily upon our reporting capabilities to help isolate and resolve network related issues. This position will be key in ensuring reporting accuracy through diligent documentation and M/A/C (Move, Add, Change) control management
Principle Duties & Responsibilities
Analyze, design, and install network systems ranging from LAN/WAN switch/firewall to 900Mhz Radios, VSAT, cellular modems, VOIP, IP cameras and IP security solutions.
Create, deploy and maintain Cisco ASA firewalls, Ciscot Catalyst Switches and Cisco Routers
Deploy and maintain Solarwinds for network monitoring
Create new and maintain existing network documentation utilizing Visio
Document work progress via ticketing system.
Supports field communications technicians in multiple geographical areas.
Assist in deploying/managing NMS, TACACS+, IPAM, etc.
Ensure communications installations are on schedule with construction.
Troubleshoot and resolve network related incidents.
Assist with managing a vast array of IP providers.
Assist in managing a wide variety of network hardware. Cisco, HP, Dell, etc.
Participate in after-hours projects related to network maintenance.
Participate in a weekly after-hours on-call rotation supporting 24 hour operations.
Education and Experience
Associate's degree and/or Bachelor’s degree preferred.
CCNP or higher certification preferred with experience.
5+ years’ experience in deploying networking technologies.
Technical Skills
Strong layer 3 and layer 2 skills
Familiarity with Cisco Firepower, AMP and ISE
Experience managing VOIP systems.
Experience working with high availability networks.
Experience with Solarwinds ORION (or other NMS).
Familiarity with BGP, OSPF, EIGRP dynamic routing solutions.
Packet capture, wireshark - Pcap experience.
Other network and/or Microsoft certifications are a plus.
Previous experience with Oil & Gas or SCADA technologies is a plus.
Ability to install cellular and vsat field communication equipment.
Experience with Outdoor Wireless Systems 2.4ghz, 5ghz, and 900mhz is a plus.
Exercise excellent face-to-face, phone, and email communication skills, rapport and etiquette.
Physical Requirements
Must be able to lift and carry up to 20 lbs.
Must be willing to work in harsh outdoor conditions when required
Must be willing and able to travel, at management discretion, to locations involving overnight stays frequently
About Summit Midstream
Summit Midstream Partners, LP (NYSE: SMLP) is a growth-oriented master limited partnership focused on developing, owning and operating midstream energy infrastructure assets that are strategically located in the core producing areas of unconventional resource basins, primarily shale formations, in the continental United States. Our assets comprise over 3,200 miles of pipeline which enable us to provide natural gas, crude oil and produced water gathering services pursuant to primarily long-term and fee-based gathering and processing agreements with our customers and counter parties across the continental United States.
Notice
Summit Midstream Partners will not pay a fee of any kind to any third party agency without a valid Summit Midstream Partners’ Master Service Agreement (MSA) authorized and signed by Human Resources. Any resume, application or other form of candidate submission to any employee of Summit Midstream Partners, without a valid MSA on file, will be considered property of Summit Midstream Partners and no fee will be paid.
Are you ready to join a fast-packed, growth oriented midstream company, then apply today!
Not yet ready to apply? That’s okay! Learn more about us on LinkedIn
***No phone calls or email, please.***
No Agency Calls and /or submissions will be accepted.

text:
Description
Job Description:
Leidos is seeking a Sr. Network Engineer to support EPA's Office of Air and Radiation (OAR), National Center for Radiation Field Operations (NCRFO), located in Las Vegas, NV. Leidos under contract with the EPA provides information technology (IT) personnel resources to maintain the technology resources by providing end-user support, maintain and monitor all servers, manage security issues, maintain the Tribal Air Training room and computers, and EPA’s local WAN. The network engineer acts as a point of contact with EPA enterprise network management.
Primary Responsibilities
CCNA Routing and Day to day management of Cisco routers and switches on EPA LAN and FieldOps networks, manages the configurations of routers and switches. Manage Cisco routers and switches for mobile network access via satellite.
Work with vendors to identify new technologies, to help shape decisions the EPA and/or management in the area of network design and administration
Manage wireless Internet access and work with OMS/EI on the installation and configuration for 802.11 Wi-Fi. Manage IP addressing and hosted devices within the local networks
Perform routine system maintenance, monitoring, troubleshooting, reporting, incident and problem management, and escalation as required
Develop, maintain, and implement SOPs and other documentation.
Understand security best practices and assist in responding to EPA data calls and the annual Continuous Monitoring Assessment (CMA)
Basic Qualifications:
Requires BS and 4 – 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 – 6 years of prior relevant experience.
Configuration, Management and Troubleshooting of Cisco Site-to-Site VPNs
Configuration and Management of Next Generation Firewall Appliances including Remote Access VPNs with dual factor authentication. (Fortinet management preferred)
Experience managing Solarwinds Network Performance Monitor or SNMP based applications
Experienced in virtualized server system and network services
Required Certifications
CCNA Routing and Switching – Cisco Certified Network Associate
CCNA Security - Cisco Certified Network Professional
Desired Certifications
MCSE-Microsoft Certified System Engineer
MCITP-Microsoft Certified IT Professional
CCNP Security-Cisco Certified Network Professional
External Referral Bonus:
Ineligible
Potential for Telework:
No
Clearance Level Required:
None
Travel:
No
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40
Shift:
Day
Requisition Category:
Professional
Job Family:
Systems Administration
Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

BGP, OSPF, IPsec VPN, DNS, CDN, NAT, FIrewall, IPTables, HTTP/1.0/1.1/2, gRPC, QUIC, points of presence (PoPs), load balancing, and TLS.,Prior experience in developing on public cloud platforms like AWS/Google Cloud/Azure is a must.,Good knowledge on TCP/IP,Scripting skills using Bash, Python and/or Go,Prior experience with basic SQL,Prior experience with Docker,Good working experience with version control systems and configuration management systems,Familiarity with modern CI-CD pipelines and development tools,Experience with maintaining debian/ubuntu systems and troubleshoot issues,Expert with network debugging tools (netstat, tcpdump, dig, traceroute etc),Experience with network troubleshooting and telemetry tools,Experience in supporting production environments with high availability requirements,Good presentation and communication skills,Experience with, or strong interest in Kubernetes,Experience with Go
text:
As the leading development platform for gaming, AR, VR, and real-time interactive 3D visualization, Unity is helping to bring creations of all kinds to life faster than ever before. Our network team provides foundational network services that powers many Unity services in a reliable, scalable and performant way.
We are looking for a talented infrastructure engineer who has a proven knowledge of networking but also broad knowledge in Linux, cloud infrastructure, container-based virtualization, and scripting. As a senior member of the team, you own and support a multi-region multi-cloud infrastructure with high capacity CDN edge components. You are highly technical and are viewed as a domain expert on many networking topics. Success in this role typically means you are a fast learner, a good communicator, and always have customer satisfaction in mind.
As a Senior Engineer, you will lead as an example and promote the following -
Being customer-focused
Everything should be measurable
Take an iterative approach
Alerts must be actionable
Processes must be sensible, valuable, & repeatable
Automate, automate, automate
Responsibilities
Design and create systems/services/solutions that are reliable, scalable, predictable, and secure.
Perform requirement gathering, investigation, and analysis to determine appropriate solutions.
Implement and maintain existing and new network services/systems.
Create and improve methods of proper testing and safe promotion of releases from development to staging and, eventually, to production.
Perform performance analysis, network incident troubleshooting and capacity planning.
Participate in on-call rotations to ensure service/system uptime.
Skills
Network knowledge in routing protocols (eg. BGP, OSPF, IPsec VPN, DNS, CDN, NAT, FIrewall, IPTables, HTTP/1.0/1.1/2, gRPC, QUIC, points of presence (PoPs), load balancing, and TLS.
Prior experience in developing on public cloud platforms like AWS/Google Cloud/Azure is a must.
Good knowledge on TCP/IP
Scripting skills using Bash, Python and/or Go
Prior experience with basic SQL
Prior experience with Docker
Good working experience with version control systems and configuration management systems
Familiarity with modern CI-CD pipelines and development tools
Experience with maintaining debian/ubuntu systems and troubleshoot issues
Expert with network debugging tools (netstat, tcpdump, dig, traceroute etc)
Experience with network troubleshooting and telemetry tools
Experience in supporting production environments with high availability requirements
Good presentation and communication skills
Bonus Points
Experience with, or strong interest in Kubernetes
Experience with Go
Contribution to open-source projects
Who we are
Unity is the creator of the world's leading real-time 3D development platform, giving users the most powerful and accessible tools to create, operate, and monetize experiences for the real-time world. Unity empowers anyone, regardless of skill level and industry, to create 3D visual content using world-class technology, operate using resources that maximize ease-of-use, and monetize, so that they can find success with their creations.
The company's 1,000 person development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners such as Google, Facebook, Oculus, Autodesk, and Microsoft to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Made with Unity experiences reach nearly 3 billion devices worldwide and have been installed more than 34 billion times in the last 12 months. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.
Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

text:
Network / Platform Engineers with hosting infrastructure experience, who are Brisbane based and available to start immediately, please apply now!
Brisbane
We currently have an opportunity for a Network / Platform Engineer to join our client's busy project in Brisbane assessing the hosting platforms (server room, FMS, IROC) capability and design requirements. You will be working with a team of RF Engineer, Solution Architect and Technology Lead full time for 2.5 months (June to August).
The key objectives of this work package are:
Review of current hosting infrastructure onsite and IROC
Detail hosting infrastructure requirements
Capture of previous key learning
Budget (-25% to +35%) and schedule for a class 4 estimate
Forward work plan for Selection and Definition phase
You will exhibit confidence and delivering objectives outlined above as well as experience with documentation (presentation and reports) for required for Identification Phase Study and scope the detailed design requirements hosting infrastructure.
Please note this role involves occasional travel to a mine site.
If you are currently in the market and would like to secure a well paid contract for the next 2 and a half months starting immediately please apply now!
To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Nik Stojanov on 08 61511702. Please quote our job reference number: 200168651.

text:
Wireless Network Engineer
Responsibilities:
Candidate will be responsible for the configuration, deployment, monitoring, troubleshooting, and analysis of Wide Area Networks (WAN), Local Area Networks (LAN), and Wireless infrastructure services to deliver voice, video and data applications to our client’s multiple locations.
Actively monitoring and reacting to real-time network conditions and leading improvement efforts in support of monitoring, performance, and reporting.
Cisco based routing and switching platforms in an Enterprise environment. Candidate should also be well versed in the theory of operation, deployment, and monitoring of network protocols such as VoIP, SNMP, NetFlow, HSRP, Spanning Tree, QoS/CoS, BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, NAT/PAT, NTP, RADIUS, DNS, DHCP. –
Various 802.11 wireless network standards, wireless security mechanisms, wireless design principles, RF technology, and wireless network control systems, with a primary focus on Aruba and Cisco.
The design and solutions deployment of resilient, high-speed, Enterprise network segments. Both, wired and wireless.
The use of wireless network planning and survey tools, such as AirMagnet, Ekahau, Tamograph Site Survey, etc.
The use of Wireshark packet analyzer to diagnose network performance problems.
WAN carrier technologies (MPLS, DMVPN, IPsec, T-1, OC-3, SONET, High Speed Internet) and standards
LAN technologies (GigabitEthernet, PoE, link aggregation, CDP, ARP, VLAN’s & trunking)
Working knowledge of ATM protocols including AAL1 and AAL2 technologies
(Preferred Knowledge of GDC product line including DV2 generation equipment
Knowledge of basic power distribution and protection systems
Experience in creating network staff training materials, network diagrams (Microsoft Visio), and general documentation
Hands on experience with Network Management Systems
Qualifications:
5+ years’ experience in enterprise level environment serving multiple locations
3+ years of experience with Aruba technology
Experience performing Wireless Site Surveys
LAN/WAN experience
5+ years’ experience in Switching/Routing
Ideal candidate will have Bachelors degree in relevant field
Skills in Order of Importance:
Wireless Experience
Aruba wireless Experience
Wireless Site Survey Experience
Switching and routing
Mobility in Montgomery county sites
Wireless Certification
Overall Network Engineering experience

summary: Northrop Grumman is seeking a Systems Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. ...
tasks: Design and define IT networks for new or existing computer systems supporting the command or enterprise.,Perform complex systems development and IT infrastructure design work that may include logic network design, physical network design, manufacturing and development cost projections, IT systems engineering.,Evaluate new network technologies and make recommendations to project managers regarding integration of these technologies into the existing network.
text:
Northrop Grumman is seeking a Systems Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Fort Meade, MD
BasicResponsibilities are:
Design and define IT networks for new or existing computer systems supporting the command or enterprise.
Perform complex systems development and IT infrastructure design work that may include logic network design, physical network design, manufacturing and development cost projections, IT systems engineering.
Evaluate new network technologies and make recommendations to project managers regarding integration of these technologies into the existing network.
Develop documentation on new or existing systems.
Basic Qualifications:
Minimum five (5) years of IT Network Engineer experience
Minimum of Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, Computer Engineering, or related discipline
One of following security certifications (active status): CASP+ CE, CISSP, CSSLP or higher (Minimum DOD 8140/DOD 8570 IASAE Level II Certification)
Active TS/SCI + CI Polygraph
Preferred Qualifications:
Expert user of MS Visio
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) or higher
Experience with network security products (firewalls, IDS, scanners, etc.)
Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

text:
TekSynap is a fast growing high-tech company that understands both the pace of technology today and the need to have a comprehensive well planned information management environment. "Technology moving at the speed of thought" embodies these principles - the need to nimbly utilize the best that information technology offers to meet the business needs of our Federal Government customers. We offer our full-time employees a competitive benefits package to include health, dental, vision, 401K, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability plans, vacation time and holidays.
Visit us at www.TekSynap.com.
Apply now to explore jobs with us!
We are searching for a Senior Network Engineer to join our government project with Defense Logistics Agency. The Senior Corporate Enterprise Network Engineer performs a variety of routine project tasks applied to network engineering.
RESPONSIBITLIES
Works under general supervision developing the requirements of a product from inception to conclusion
Develops required specifications for simple to moderately complex problems
Expertise with current and anticipated network equipment; COTS 10 Gigabit Ethernet LAN and associated software and hardware equipment
Collaboration with DLA J6, overseer of the corporate network and underground cable
Coordinates with the Task Order PM, COTRs and government user representatives to ensure accurate solutions and user satisfaction on technical matters
Planning, performing, and documenting laboratory assessments of hardware and software for both the classified and unclassified DISN Services to ensure proper connectivity and operations between the DLA WAN, the DLA's NOC, and DISA's NOCs
Coordinating with the government customer to create a Technology Assessment Plan (TAP) to include the objectives, scope, equipment and configurations, technical approach, procedures, schedules, and roles and responsibilities required to complete the DLA LAN technology refresh and upgrades. These assessments may include independent cost estimates
Preparing After Action Reports (AAR) that document the approach taken, results, recommendations and supporting rationale
Identifying new and emerging network capabilities as well as developing product evaluation and selection criteria
Developing system evaluations methods and procedures
Producing formal documentation of recommendations for executive briefings
Ensuring interoperability between DLA WAN (NIPR and SIPR) and DISN network equipment and services
Planning and tracking for implementation tasks
Creating necessary supporting configuration artifacts such as network maps, detailed designs, test plans, operations readiness test reports, device configurations, and maintenance processes and procedures
Providing Subject Matter Expert (SME) engineering services to the government customer
Wireless Technologies
DISN Video Teleconferencing over ETN/SoETN and DLA WAN
VOIP considering DISA Switched Network (DSN) efforts
Digital Streaming Video
Technology refreshes and upgrades to include all core DLA WAN systems and equipment
Identification and evaluation of emerging standards as they related to the DLA WAN and DLA/DOD mandates
The selected candidate will also review industry and government data relative to technology changes affecting the DISN and commercial telecommunications sector and provide preliminary design and implementation data to support the strategic planning process. At a minimum, the candidate will need to address the following areas with regard to design and implementation:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum five (5) years of progressive Information Technology (IT) experience including at least two projects in the following technical areas (at least one project must have occurred within the past three (3) years):
Deployment of separate LAN network to support Industrial Control Systems
Deployment of a separate Pulse Secure Remote Access infrastructure
Pulse secure engineering and tier II/III troubleshooting support for the Pulse Secure Remote Access VPN architecture
Support the design and DLA LAN/FW equipment installation
Working with the DISN SIPRNet, NIPRNET, IP Core, DRSN and DVS
Technology refreshes and upgrades
Tier III troubleshooting
Classified Network Support
Provide core network engineering services to support the full development lifecycle for the DLA LAN including design, implementation, installation, testing and transition to sustainment of DLA LAN equipment
Analysis of hardware, hardware configuration, security policy, network management, network protocols and security solutions in support of network functions related to the interoperability of the DLA LAN, ETN/SoETN and DISN
Must have Secret Clearance with IT-I eligibility
Must hold one of the following IAT Level III certifications
CASP+ CE
CCNP Security
CISA
CISSP (or Associate)
GCED
GCIH
Must have active or be willing to get CCNP and CCSE Certification
COMPETENCIES
Establish Focus
Change Management
Develop Others
Oral Communication
Written Communication
Interpersonal Awareness
Build Relationships
Analytical Thinking
Conceptual Thinking
Strategic Thinking
Technical Expertise
Initiative
Foster Innovation
Results Oriented
Teamwork
Customer Service
WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Location: Multiple locations
Type of environment: Remote
Noise level: Medium
Work schedule: Schedule is day shift Monday - Friday. May be requested to work evenings and weekends to meet program and contract needs.
Amount of Travel: 10% or less travel.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to handle, feel, touch; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is regularly required to lift up to 10 pounds. The employee is frequently required to lift up to 25 pounds; and up to 50 pounds. The vision requirements include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
WORK AUTHORIZATION/SECURITY CLEARANCE
US Citizen
Secret Clearance
OTHER DUTIES
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. TekSynap does not discriminate against any person because of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law (referred to as "protected status"). This nondiscrimination policy extends to all terms, conditions, and privileges of employment as well as the use of all company facilities, participation in all company-sponsored activities, and all employment actions such as promotions, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment.

requirements: Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment,Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS or MS degree in Telecommunications or Networking,Basic knowledge in routing and switching technologies,Proficient in UNIX/Linux and TCP/IP network fundamentals,Some understanding of fiber-optic technology including cable types, connector types, optic types, and optical transport technologies,In-depth experience with coding in Python and SQL,Ability to analyze situations and utilize troubleshooting skills, systems and tools, and problem solving abilities,Demonstrated initiative in developing solutions to identified improvement opportunities,Strong communications skills working in a team environment,Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op,Familiar with routing protocols such as IPv6, STP, VLAN, VRRP, LLDP, BGP, ISIS, OSPF, and MPLS

text:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.
Summary
Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.Facebook is looking for a Network Operations Engineer Intern to help provide network process improvement and automation support for the Facebook network.You'll work very closely with our partners in integrating new processes into our production network. We are big on automation here as well, so you will be using and developing internal tools and scripts to automate processes. You will also work on monitoring the incident queue, whether handling tickets yourself or escalating them to the team. Overall you will be providing support across our production network.You must be able to evaluate, deconstruct, document, and drive improvements for key operational processes. Creation of new best practices with a relentless drive for automation will be part of this technical leaders role. Partnering and collaborating with a variety of internal and external teams will be necessary for success. You will have to cultivate these relationships while developing cross functional processes. Being data driven with an ability to use metrics, KPI and SLOs will allow continuous maturity improvements.
Required Skills
Participate in troubleshooting network issues
Proactively contribute to documentation, automation, and processes as they evolve
Use internal tools and scripts to configure, monitor, and repair network events
Own small projects supporting internal process engineering efforts
Minimum Qualification
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a BS or MS degree in Telecommunications or Networking
Basic knowledge in routing and switching technologies
Proficient in UNIX/Linux and TCP/IP network fundamentals
Some understanding of fiber-optic technology including cable types, connector types, optic types, and optical transport technologies
In-depth experience with coding in Python and SQL
Ability to analyze situations and utilize troubleshooting skills, systems and tools, and problem solving abilities
Demonstrated initiative in developing solutions to identified improvement opportunities
Strong communications skills working in a team environment
Detail oriented analytical, organization, and time management skills
Preferred Qualification
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Familiar with routing protocols such as IPv6, STP, VLAN, VRRP, LLDP, BGP, ISIS, OSPF, and MPLS
Vendor certification such as CCNA/CCNP, JNCIA/JNCIS, RHCSA or equivalent academic course work or experience
EOE
Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

text:
Job Description
HEPCO, Inc., is seeking a Senior Network Engineer for one of most prestigious clients in the Baltimore area. The Senior Network Engineer will be responsible for the design, configuration, installation, operation, tuning, troubleshooting, and documentation of data communications equipment. Networking equipment consists of both on-premise and cloud infrastructure.
The candidate will also participate in other, particularly projects involving Amazon Web Services, Information Security, PCI compliance, and VoIP.
This position includes on-call duties and may require a small amount of travel.
Responsibilities
Direct the day to day operations of the network team
Manage on call schedules
Ensure the operational readiness of our IT server environment in terms of patching, security posture, availability, monitoring, and hardware availability
Provide Level-2/3 support and troubleshooting to resolve issues
Work with application owners and business customers to help diagnose any issues and address any break/fix problems
Manage carrier contracts and services
Configure and install various network devices and services (e.g., routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, VPN, QoS)
Perform network maintenance and system upgrades including service packs, patches, hot fixes and security configurations
Monitor performance and ensure system availability and reliability
Monitor system resource utilization, trending, and capacity planning
Work within established configuration and change management policies to ensure awareness, approval and success of changes made to the network infrastructure
Select and implement security tools, policies, and procedures in conjunction with the company’s security leader
Insure all network systems are documented, kept up to date, and stored in the appropriate document repository
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related field
Deep understanding of networking protocols (e.g., IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, QoS)
Experience with a cloud provider such as Amazon Web Services or M.S. Azure
8+ years of experience in selecting, design engineering, solution engineering, project engineering, integrating, and implementing Cisco network architecture and related technologies
Demonstrated effective decision making that had significant impact on technology direction and related business results
8+ years of experience in providing consulting to senior management on the use and selection of these technologies

summary:
Qualifications
Due to the nature of our work, US Citizenship is required for all positions.
+ Bache...
text:
Qualifications
Due to the nature of our work, US Citizenship is required for all positions.
+ Bachelor's degree in a computer related field and 5 years' of progressive related experience, or equivalent training and experience.
+ Advanced knowledge of technical principles, theories, standards, practices and procedures.
+ Experience in communications or related discipline in Telephony or Communications Networks in addition to the formal certifications.
+ Desired working knowledge of Standardized Network Design, Type 1 Encryption, Microsoft Active Directory, Network Security, QOS Theory and Implementation, Telephone switching, Fiber Optic Transmission systems. Routing and Switching products from a formal training institution or relevant experience.
+ Microsoft Windows to include system architecture, configuration, file system structures and system management techniques.
+ Must have working technical knowledge of Microsoft Windows environments including Microsoft Exchange Server, Microsoft Active Directory, Windows 2008 - 2016 Server, Windows 7, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office Suite.
+ Working knowledge of LAN/WAN infrastructure to include fast Carrier Ethernet and TCP/IP. Desired knowledge of the Emergency Communications Network (ECN) and RSL mission.
+ Basic understanding of Satellite Communications and Teleport Operations.
+ Basic understanding of LTE EPC and Cell Base Station operation.
+ Pre-placement physical examination, which includes a drug screen, is required. MSTS maintains a substance abuse policy that includes random drug testing.
+ Must have current driver's license.
Department of Energy Q Clearance (position will be cleared to this level). Reviews and tests for the absence of any illegal drug as defined in 10 CFR Part 707.4, "Workplace Substance Abuse Programs at DOE Sites," will be conducted. Applicant selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation, and subsequent reinvestigations, and must meet the eligibility requirements for access to classified matter. Successful completion of a counterintelligence evaluation, which may include a counterintelligence-scope polygraph examination, may also be required. Reference 10 CFR Part 709, "Counterintelligence Evaluation Program."
Eligibility Requirements - To obtain a clearance, an individual must be a U.S. citizen at least 18 years of age. Reference DOE Order 472.2, "Personnel Security."
MSTS is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. MSTS is a background screening, drug-free workplace.
Responsibilities
The Network Engineer is responsible for supporting ECN programs and projects. The Network Engineer will also manage and assist with the installation operation, and maintenance of the network infrastructure equipment including CISCO routers, switches and Communications Managers.
+ Serve as a Network Engineer for the Emergency Communications Network (ECN) Program at the Remote Sensing Laboratory, Nellis (RSLN) on Nellis Air Force Base in Nevada.
+ Write technical proposals, procedures and preparing network design documentation.
+ Provide Network and System diagnostics, troubleshooting, reconfiguration, service restoration and tracking as required.
+ Support national emergency response groups' emergency response drills, exercises, and real world events through on-call availability and travel via commercial and military aircraft when required.
+ Contribute in a team environment to evaluate new technologies provide technical troubleshooting support, and provide recommendations for the direction of future LAN/WAN Client Server environments.
+ Travel as part of an installation or restoration team when directed and participate as a deployed member of the National Emergency Response Groups when required.
+ Promote project management best practices and continuous improvement.
+ Perform related work as assigned by supervisor.
Overview
If you're looking for an interesting, fulfilling career, you've come to the right place!
At Mission Support and Test Services, LLC (MSTS), we're a dynamic team of employees who manage and operate the Nevada National Security Site (NNSS), formerly known as the Nevada Test Site. A premier outdoor, indoor and underground national laboratory for unique, high-level experiments, the NNSS has offices across the country, including Southern Nevada; Santa Barbara and Livermore, California; Washington, D.C.; and Albuquerque and Los Alamos, New Mexico. We're dedicated to working together as a team to keep our nation safe. Join us!
MSTS is a limited liability company consisting of Honeywell International Inc. (Honeywell), Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. (Jacobs), and Stoller Newport News Nuclear, Inc. (SN3).

Preferred Job Description
Experience: Minimum of five years in Cisco routers & switches, high availability design experience, wireless technology, cabling systems, firewalls, UPS power systems, SNMP.
Education: Bachelor's Degree or additional four years of equivalent experience in lieu of education.
Training: Network design, routers & switches. Cisco routers, switches, VPN concentrators, firewalls and wireless access points, IDS, CiscoWorks, WLSE and High Availability redundant designing.
Specialized Skills: Strong verbal and written communication, project implementation and troubleshooting skills.
Licensure: N/A
Job Duties – What We Do
Job Duties – What We Do
1. Core Competencies
1.1 Participates in the evaluation, purchase, testing, installation & maintenance of the hardware & software for the enterprise-wide network infrastructure: necessary to ensure optimal performance of Organization's integrated, state-of-the-art, multi-facility health system network of 4500+ users.
1.2 Exhibits technical knowledge & experience in other critical network infrastructure components as evidenced by successful use & maintenance of multiple firewalls, UPS power systems, wireless technologies, remote access services using management software and/or other network management tools. Demonstrates technical knowledge and/or experience with other current & emerging technologies that are network connected such as Remote Access Systems, VoIP, imaging & animation systems.
1.3 Participates in new network designs & implementations as evidenced by successful network design outcomes, including use of network components, closet/room design, cabling design (fiber & copper) & environmental design (such as A/C & electrical requirements).
1.4 Assist in supervision and monitoring assigned network infrastructure components as evidenced by proficient use of monitoring tools & submitted network performance reports. Completes regularly scheduled performance maintenance & upgrades (hardware & software) for assigned network infrastructure components as evidenced by successful completion of planned maintenance & minimal unplanned loss of network infrastructure availability & functionality.
1.5 Participates in monitoring & maintaining network security as evidenced by proficient use of intrusion detection systems, firewalls, access control lists & a definitive understanding of Organization's security policies & procedures. Also stays abreast of security/software bugs & expediently implements patches to fix the bugs.
2. Planning/Design
2.1 Assist in developing logical, detail-oriented project plans and estimates, including implementation timeframes, resource estimates, cost estimates and cost/benefit analyses as demonstrated in submitted project documents.
2.2 Develop and maintain proficient use of project management software and tools as demonstrated by use in project planning as well as problem resolution, change control and quality control.
2.3 Understands and adhere to system implementation and system problem resolution priorities set by the Technical Services Manager and/or IT management as evidenced by implementation and problem resolution outcomes.
2.4 Assist in the identification and evaluation of new application/database products and tools and makes recommendations for purchase. Recommendations submitted should ensure new hardware and software are adequate for projected application/system growth.
2.5 Participate as an active contributing lead of project teams as evidenced by project minutes, status reports and outcomes.
3. Documentation
3.1 Utilizes detailed technical knowledge and experience to effectively and efficiently analyze issues, diagnose problems and determine resolutions, working with the Technical Services Manager and/or IT Management, Operations, Application and PM teams as necessary and as evidenced by positive problem resolution outcomes.
3.2 Escalate problems is a timely manner to the Technical Services Manager and/or IT Management, other IS on-call/management staff and vendors as necessary and as evidenced by problem documentation, such as HEAT downtime and/or change control tickets, RCA Event Analysis Documents and timely problem resolution outcomes.
3.3 Documents all problem solving measures that properly allow for team members to resolve recurring problems effectively and efficiently.
3.4 Demonstrates preventive maintenance capabilities as evidenced by following sound implementation procedures such as (1) ensuring new hardware and/or software is installed, pre-configured and tested in the test bed and in pilot locations prior to a formal rollout in a production environment and (2) preventing and detecting intruder access into the network.
3.5 Provides on-call coverage, on an as needed basis, for the Technical Team. Provides Level Three troubleshooting support for other system related problems. Provides preventive maintenance and implementations at business appropriate date and times as required.
4. Communication
4.1 Communicate and follows up in a positive and meaningful manner with customers on (1) the status on problems and projects, (2) proper procedures for system evaluations, (3) current task and project priorities that may conflict with their service request, and (4) alternatives to requests for services that do not meet standards. All are evidenced by positive oral and written feedback from customers as well as positive service excellence survey results.
4.2 Communicate the status on project implementations and problem resolutions to the Technical Services Manager, other IT staff, IT management and users as necessary. Frequent communications with the escalating IT person is most critical during unplanned downtimes.
4.3 Communicates problems and resolution statuses to vendors in a timely and professional manner as evidenced by positive and successful client/vendor relationships and results.
4.4 Document policies, procedures, standards and methodologies as necessary for the proper maintenance of databases and systems as assigned as evidenced in regular reviews of online and hardcopy documentation.
4.5 Participates as an active, contributing member in regular Technical Services staff meetings and other assigned team/project meetings as evidenced by minutes, status reports and project outcomes. Takes minutes etc. as needed.
5. Teamwork
5.1 Provides technical guidance in areas of application/system designs, installs, migrations, conversions, synchronizations and archiving by participating in meetings and submission of supporting technical documentation and recommendations.
5.2 Participates in the recruitment of new employees by participating in applicant interviews and reporting recommendations to the Technical Services Manager.
5.3 Trains and mentors existing and new employees by assessing needs, preparing appropriate materials and conducting successful sessions.
5.4 Demonstrates, via verbal and written actions, adherence to and support of all HR and IS policies, procedures and standards such as PTO use, change control, confidentiality, security, and service excellence. Ensures all work done (design, distribution, modifications etc.) is also done in compliance with licensing requirements, legal requirements and industry standards. All evidenced by audit and survey results.
5.5 Participates in Business/Disaster Recovery planning and preparedness efforts by participating in meetings and developing plans for responsible application databases.
6. Other
6.1 Performs other duties as assigned.

name: Undergraduate Internship/Co-op Program - Network Engineer
summary:
Scholarship Description
Our student trainee program seeks motivated undergraduate students to serve...
text:
Scholarship Description
Our student trainee program seeks motivated undergraduate students to serve internships in a team environment working with customers and network engineers to design, develop, and implement new network architectures and enhancements to the Agency’s networks. These projects span technologies in local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), and video teleconferencing. Responsibilities include hardware and software integration, analysis, testing, documentation, problem resolution, requirements definition, and project documentation. Candidate will also participate in engineering reviews, staff meetings, and other activities, which will increase their network understanding and the issues and challenges facing a telecommunications service provider.
Students will work along side engineers and get to use or enhance their knowledge of a range of communications technologies, network systems and certifications, such as Wide Area Network (WAN) (DWDM, SONET, ATM, MSPP, etc), Local Area Network (LAN) (IP, Ethernet, etc.), Video, Satellite, Network Security, Encryption, Enterprise Systems.
Minimum requirements: Students should be pursuing undergraduate or graduate level degrees in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a similar IT Engineering discipline.
Students should have computer proficiency, good interpersonal and communication skills, some working knowledge of network topologies and protocols and the ability to work in a team environment. Interns generally are required to work either a combination of one semester and one summer internship or two 90-day summer internships. Co-Op Students work on an alternating semester or quarterly basis and are expected to spend a minimum of three semesters or four quarters (this can include a summer tour) on the job prior to graduation. A GPA of 3.0 or better is required.
All applicants must successfully complete a thorough medical and psychological examination, a polygraph interview, and an extensive background investigation. US citizenship is required.
Year of Need: College Sophomore, College Junior, College Senior, College 5th Year, 1st Year Grad, 2nd Year Grad,

tasks: Knowledge of network architecture, engineering, design, implementation, and testing.,Understanding of network communication protocols and network routing protocols and IP network troubleshooting.,Basic knowledge of network testing methodologies using routers, switches, and firewalls.,Knowledge of TCP/IP behavior, network communications and routing protocols, network traffic analysis and troubleshooting experience.,Advanced knowledge of network operating systems including Cisco, Palo Alto OS’s.,Proficiency with coding languages including Python and Perl.,Excellent leadership and mentoring skills,High level promblem-solving and communication skills,Ability to design, implementation, integration, and testing as well as support of the network development life cycle with peer reviews, documentation and configuration management adhering to the project level process plans.,Ideally this person will have experience performing engineering support on customer sites and have domain specific certifications meeting the programs expectations.,Day to day on-site interaction with our customers and become key member of customer program teams,Producing design documentation and as-built documentation with little or no assistance,Delivering technology-specific, on-site engineering services to our customers with little or no supervision on medium to high complexity projects,Delivering & Documenting strategic customer service engagements according to ZIVARO guidelines,Providing clear, concise, and timely communication of projects' status to customers, supervisor, and project managers,Operating under little supervision on large projects; operating independently on small projects,Achieving ZIVARO billing time goals while working toward continued training advancement
text:
ZIVARO provides industry-leading consulting and technology services to help clients achieve real business value from their technology investments. From deep foundations in Hybrid IT, Security, Collaboration and Analytics, we support clients across a broad spectrum of industries with IT strategy, planning, implementation and IT operations. ZIVARO’s Hybrid Services connect and accelerate practical business outcomes across all functions of the organization through our comprehensive practice areas.
The Senior Networking Engineer (RE III) will integrate with our overall Engineering team and be deployed to customer locations working on specific strategic engagements. This role will be deployed to customer locations working on specific Federal programs or Commercial contracts, supporting specific customer requirements or mission domains throughout the detailed design, development integration, test and deployment of critical IT systems. All customer projects must be completed with a sense of urgency and timeliness, exceeding customer expectations to ensure high quality work done by ZIVARO.
TECHNICIAL SKILL:
Knowledge of network architecture, engineering, design, implementation, and testing.
Understanding of network communication protocols and network routing protocols and IP network troubleshooting.
Basic knowledge of network testing methodologies using routers, switches, and firewalls.
Knowledge of TCP/IP behavior, network communications and routing protocols, network traffic analysis and troubleshooting experience.
Advanced knowledge of network operating systems including Cisco, Palo Alto OS’s.
Proficiency with coding languages including Python and Perl.
Familiarity with network analysis tools including SolarWind.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Excellent leadership and mentoring skills
High level promblem-solving and communication skills
Ability to design, implementation, integration, and testing as well as support of the network development life cycle with peer reviews, documentation and configuration management adhering to the project level process plans.
Ideally this person will have experience performing engineering support on customer sites and have domain specific certifications meeting the programs expectations.
Day to day on-site interaction with our customers and become key member of customer program teams
Producing design documentation and as-built documentation with little or no assistance
Delivering technology-specific, on-site engineering services to our customers with little or no supervision on medium to high complexity projects
Delivering & Documenting strategic customer service engagements according to ZIVARO guidelines
Providing clear, concise, and timely communication of projects' status to customers, supervisor, and project managers
Operating under little supervision on large projects; operating independently on small projects
Achieving ZIVARO billing time goals while working toward continued training advancement
Other duties as assigned and based on the needs of the organization.
EDUCATION:
Technical BA/BS (Engineering, Computer Science, or Math); or equivalent combination of education and experience.
title: Senior Network Engineer (Resident Engineer II)

text:
Job Description
View more Careers at EPSILON
Follow us on: LinkedIn | Twitter | google+
WLAN Network Engineer
Security Clearance required: Secret with Eligibility for Top Secret
US Citizenship Required
Location: Washington, DC
URL: www.epsilon-inc.com/careers
Position Summary: The Network Engineer is expected to be a business professional with experience in WiFi systems design and implementation. The engineer will work under the direction of the WiFi team. They will support the survey, design, logistics and implementation of a large WiFi network. The engineer will be responsible for the pre-deployment provisioning of switches and access points. They will coordinate with cable technicians for implementation and ensure clean quality installations. After installation, the engineer will perform on-site or in-house servicing, repairs and/or installations of network components. Must be a great team player with positive attitude, have very good Visio documentation skills, possess exceptionally high customer service skills, and a commitment to excellent customer support.
Position Responsibilities:
Lead the staging and pre-deployment of all network equipment.
Rack/ stack network equipment and provide connectivity using very detailed cable management and labeling techniques.
Lead WiFi deployments with cable technicians to ensure quality installations.
Assist in managing the WLAN infrastructure and device configurations using Cisco DNA and Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC)
Provide technical support to customers and serve as customer contact on technical and service-related problems.
Assist/lead the creation of technical manuals, operating procedures and other support documentation
Conduct site survey and plan network layouts and configures systems to user environments.
Hands-on experience with troubleshooting and site-survey tools such as Ekahau Site Survey
Participate in special projects as required
Experience with building out network, design/documentation
Essential Skills, Experience, and Certifications:
US Citizenship is a requirement of this position in accordance with 8 U.S.C. § 1324b(a)(2)(C)
3-5 years related WLAN engineering experience
Must be able to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance.
Must be able to travel.
Minimum Bachelor’s Degree and work experience in configuration, maintenance, troubleshooting and general network upkeep.
Fundamental knowledge of switching / routing protocols and authentication.
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification required
Knowledge of Cisco devices such as Identity Service Engine (ISE), CMX, Prime, DNA, and SD Access
Deep understanding of WLAN technologies, network management, and security, including IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac WLAN standards and industry best practices
Experience testing wireless products including access points, controllers and other WLAN infrastructure and client devices for evaluation.
Experience with installing and testing cable (fiber, copper etc)
Must have excellent time management, oral and written communication skills as well as the ability to quickly troubleshoot problems.
Experience with building out network, design/documentation
Physical Demands and Work Environment:
The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, this position requires the ability to sit for potentially long periods of time throughout the workday. Hearing sufficient to understand conversations, both in person and on the telephone. Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, power tools, and to handle other computer components for potentially long periods of time without experiencing abnormal hand, wrist, or eye strain. Occasional inspection of cables in floors and ceilings. Lifting and transporting moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds.
Work Environment: Includes a typical office environment, with minimal exposure to excessive noise or adverse environmental issues, including exposure to heat, cold, inclement weather conditions, and occasional environmental hazards. Local, regional, and national travel may be required.
Epsilon Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision Plan
AD&D and Life Insurance
Paid Federal Holidays
Paid Time Off
401(k) Retirement Plan
Education reimbursement
Referral Bonuses
