text:
Senior Network Engineer - Nexus 9k ACI
$700-$900 per day
Design, implement & support this enterprise transition to ACI for a tier 1 financial institution
7 month initial contract, with extnesions likely, due project size
Job Summary:
This position is for a customer facing Network Engineer/Consultant operating within a service provider in Sydney to expertise to a large APAC based Investment Bank. The primary responsibilities of the role will be to assist with the design process working alongside the assigned Senior Architect to perform the migration of a critical data center, complex MACD's and perform troubleshooting as part of the delivery of the project for the client. A successful candidate will also have a proven track record in network operations providing problem and incident management.
Key activities will include:
Implementation and testing of complex LAN, WAN and Data Centre network infrastructures, ensuring best practice and security. (Based on Cisco Nexus and ACI)
Implementing Complex MACD's.
Assisting in the development of comprehensive low level design and test plan documents
Work with the Senior Architects to develop low risk migration strategies and plans, to ensure smooth implementation.
Problem and Incident Management of Nexus 9K and ACI related issues.
Suggesting design improvements based on industry best practice
Providing input to Managers and Project Leads for project planning and regular status updates
Advanced network troubleshooting
Skills & Experience:
The successful Network Engineer will have 7-10 years' experience working within a pressured operational environment, have numerous network/security certifications, with at least CCIE completed successfully, ideally with 4-6 years within the financial sector. Experience of working in large global teams, delivering complex MACD's and small to medium projects.
The successful candidate MUST have demonstrable Data-Networking knowledge and experience to include Cisco Nexus/ACI and/or Nortel Routers, TCP/IP, Security and Circuit troubleshooting. This is an absolute requirement for this position.
Required skills:
Design and implementation of Cisco Nexus and ACI experience is essential
Working with a Network Operations Center (NOC) or as an oncall L2/3 Support Engineer
Extensive WAN and LAN implementation experience, troubleshooting/problem determination. (Frame Relay, ISDN, ATM, and Private Line, Ethernet, VTP, Token Ring, Wireless)
Advanced knowledge of Cisco and/or Nortel Router implementation and troubleshooting.
Excellent understanding of routing and routing protocols. (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, etc.)
Advanced understanding of TCP/IP. Unix user skills.
Advanced knowledge of L2/L3 routing and redundancy techniques (HSRP, VRRP and xSTP)
Experience of datacenter or campus LAN environments (Load balancing and resiliency)
Implementing advanced QoS in support of Cisco and Avaya VoIP solutions including over wireless.
Extremely strong English verbal and written communication skills are a must.
Required Certifications:
CCIE

Click here for more information about this job

text:
SMS is currently seeking an Senior Network Engineer to support the United States Capital Police. Duties and technical capabilities shall include extensive experience with networking equipment, software, programming, design and design documentation.
As a dynamic systems integrator, SMS offers proven solutions in engineering, operations, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. With expertise in modernizing and optimizing legacy infrastructure and systems, ensuring operational efficiency, and designing, implementing, and managing secure environments, SMS supports business and mission goals with proficiency, quality, and integrity.
SMS has been serving the advanced information technology needs of the federal government since 1976, delivering talented teams and innovative, cost-effective solutions and services to support our customers’ missions for more than 40 years. SMS is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with offices and on-site operations at customer locations throughout the United States. For additional information on SMS, visit www.sms.com.
Submit your resume today!
Network documentation inclusive of all switching and routing equipment, connected or to-be-connected IP-addressable devices, and all cabling interconnects.
Assistance with day to day network maintenance to include installation, configuration, operation, and troubleshooting.
Review and analyze current network processes and procedures.
Develop and recommend improvements to network processes and procedures.
Implement, manage, and maintain approved network process improvement recommendations.
Develop and implement quality assurance and quality control plans for maintenance of the network.
Review, analyze, document, and implement disaster recovery plans for the network.
Research, design, and implement security solutions for network infrastructure.
Monitor, review, analyze, performance tune, and make recommendations that will result in continued optimization of the network.
Administer and manage firewall security appliances.
Keep OIS abreast of emerging network technologies and the latest network standards.
Monitor, review, analyze, performance tune, and make recommendations that will result in continued optimization of the network.
Lead projects as an Engineering Lead and/or Project Manager to develop secure resilient systems.
Prepare and maintain conceptual designs, schedules, and cost estimates for new and modified systems.
Conduct design reviews.
Prepare conceptual designs, schedules, and cost estimates for new and modified systems.
Document, install, configure, operate, and troubleshoot switches, firewalls, routers, wireless systems, and ancillary support systems.
Possesses and applies a comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments. Plans and leads major technology assignments. Evaluates performance results and recommends major changes affecting short-term project growth and success. Functions as a technical expert across multiple project assignments. Possesses legislative branch experience. May supervise others.
Minimum education and/or certification:
Bachelor degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Systems, Business, or other relevant discipline or related field and at least 10 year of progressive work experience in a labor category. A minimum of 2 years of work experience may be substituted for degree requirements.
SMS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

text:
Job Description
Organization Overview
Tech Impact is a nonprofit whose mission is to empower communities and nonprofits to use technology to better serve our world. We provide affordable technology services, support, and training to hundreds of nonprofits across the nation. Additionally, we offer proven and award-winning technology training programs, which prepare participants for a career in technology. www.techimpact.org
Tech Impact is a nonprofit organization dedicated to its staff. Applicants should expect a fast-paced environment with frequent exposure to new and challenging problems. Tech Impact expects most employees to move over time into more technical and autonomous roles within the organization.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (Duties that occupy a major portion of time and importance in the job)
Under general supervision, the Network Engineer is responsible for providing multi-level support that includes diagnosing, troubleshooting and resolving user issues in a fast paced-dynamic environment. The engineer answers incoming support requests and issues escalated by other technical staff. They analyze problems/issues/inquiries, assigns severity levels to the appropriate technician and follows through to resolution. The engineer is also responsible for performing callbacks ensuring issues are resolved in a timely manner and that ticket information is accurate. The engineers will also be responsible for handling complex technical issues and project work.
Service Desk Support
Provide Tier 2 technical support to all clients
Serve as an escalation point for Tier 1 Engineers
Provide direct support on network communications issues
Provide proactive maintenance on client workstations and servers as directed
Available to handle inbound issues via email and phone queue
Available for scheduled on call support. (Will receive additional compensation)
Travel onsite to resolve issues that cannot be resolved remotely
Monitoring
Monitor the network management system (Kaseya) and respond to issues
Perform recurring network management tasks as required or directed
Develop scripts and other monitoring improvements as required or directed
Projects
Serve as the technical lead on projects as assigned
Provide technical support on projects as assigned
Customer Service
Maintain strong customer service skills when dealing with clients, vendors and other Tech Impact partners
Advise Account Management of client support or reoccurring technical issues
Deliver on agreed upon scopes of work as defined by approved projects
QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE SKILL REQUIRED (Minimum education and experience needed to perform the job adequately)
Minimum of 3+ years’ experience or Bachelor’s degree preferred
Knowledge of Cisco and SonicWALL networking equipment preferred
Working knowledge of network theory required
Excellent troubleshooting techniques
Strong server infrastructure support skills including Windows Server 2012, 2016, 2019 (on-premise and cloud)
Strong network infrastructure support and administration skills (both wired and wireless LAN)
Experience in a managed services and/or nonprofit environment preferred
Excellent communication, writing, analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Excellent customer service skills including ability to translate technical information to non-technical users
Experience in cloud-based technology such as Office 365 is a plus
Ability to work well in a team environment, to handle pressure and multiple projects simultaneously and to manage work under tight deadlines
Basic project management skills are a plus
Experience in the non-profit sector a plus
Must have access to a car at short notice depending on location
Sense of humor
This is a full-time position. Salary commensurate with experience. Tech Impact observes nine holidays.
How to Apply
All candidates must submit a cover letter, resume, and current writing sample.
Employment Policy
As an equal opportunity employer, Tech Impact embraces diversity and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of age, race, color, creed, sex, gender identity, religion, marital status, veteran's status, national origin, disability, or sexual orientation.
Location: Philadelphia, PA
Compensation: Competitive Salary and Generous Benefits Package
This is a non-profit organization
Company Description
Tech Impact is a nonprofit whose mission is to empower communities and nonprofits to use technology to better serve our world.

tasks: Be able to demonstrate experience supporting networking equipment including routers, switches and firewalls, Windows servers, Linux servers and other IT infrastructure in an enterprise environment.,Have experience resolving complex hardware and software problems.,Have outstanding written and oral communication skills.,Have excellent presentation skills,Ability to work independently and in a team environment (especially within third party teams).,Bachelor Degree in Engineering/Computer science or related discipline,Minimum CCNA Certified,Minimum 3 years experience working with Networks and Infrastructure in an enterprise environment.,Excellent communication skills, written and oral.,Excellent presentation skills
text:
Bluepoint Networks are a network services consultancy, based in N. Ireland, working with a diverse range of clients throughout UK and Ireland. Currently, we have a temporary employment position (3 – 6 months) for a network engineer to work within client offices based in England.
We are looking for highly motivated, technically capable individuals who have excellent customer interaction skills. This position offers a fantastic opportunity to work for a vibrant, growing and ambitious company.
The successful candidate will:
Be able to demonstrate experience supporting networking equipment including routers, switches and firewalls, Windows servers, Linux servers and other IT infrastructure in an enterprise environment.
Have experience resolving complex hardware and software problems.
Have outstanding written and oral communication skills.
Have excellent presentation skills
Ability to work independently and in a team environment (especially within third party teams).
The candidate will be embedded within client offices and must be comfortable working in a third party enterprise environment.
Required:
Bachelor Degree in Engineering/Computer science or related discipline
Minimum CCNA Certified
Minimum 3 years experience working with Networks and Infrastructure in an enterprise environment.
Excellent communication skills, written and oral.
Excellent presentation skills
Experience working with Active Directory, Microsoft Suite, and Web Editing technologies
Package
Salary to £30,000 p.a. pro rata + travel expenses
Apply
To be considered for this job apply directly to Bluepoint Networks at
careers @ bluepointnetworks.com
___________________________________________
Job Type: Temporary
Salary: £30,000.00 /year

Identifies and documents the root cause.,Proactively identify potential issues in the production environment and help recommend possible solutions.,Provide leadership and consultation on complex projects.,Be a top-level contributor and subject matter expert on all types of network infrastructure design and integration.,Continuously monitors and supports network and servers in a mission-critical data center.,BS degree or higher from an accredited college or university in Information Systems, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a similar technical discipline,Demonstrated ability to lead others and manage multiple assignments simultaneously,Network engineering experience; minimum 7-10 years of implementation/configuration in an enterprise environment,Extensive technical knowledge in IP networking and network architecture,Deep technical skills in key areas of infrastructure (networking, security, remote access, disaster recovery, etc.),Palo Alto and Cisco firewalls,WAN and LAN connectivity,OTV, MPLS technologies,Cisco IOS/ASR Routers,IOS/Nexus Switches,CUCM telephony,Cisco Wireless Infrastructure,VMware NSX and VPN technologies,Network tracing and troubleshooting (Wireshark, Fiddler),In-depth understanding of datacenter interconnectivity,Server technology- VMware, Cisco UCS, Dell,Disaster Recovery and replication technologies,Operating Systems-Windows 2012 R2, 2016 (Standard and Enterprise), Linux,Basic scripting skills,Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
text:
Treliant is hiring a Senior Network Engineer who will work independently as well as collaborate in a team environment. In this exciting role, you will be responsible for supporting a large enterprise network across multiple locations.
Acts as lead for the installation, configuration, administration, and maintenance of infrastructure as directed by IT Managers.
Responsible for planning and design of enterprise IP LAN/WAN network infrastructure, including routing and switching, wireless, telephone, and network security.
Responsible for the creation of project implementation plans (design, testing, documentation, and training).
Diagnosis, isolation, and resolution of network problems. Identifies and documents the root cause.
Proactively identify potential issues in the production environment and help recommend possible solutions.
Provide leadership and consultation on complex projects.
Be a top-level contributor and subject matter expert on all types of network infrastructure design and integration.
Continuously monitors and supports network and servers in a mission-critical data center.
Configure and install various network devices and services (routers, switches, firewalls, load balancers, VPN, QoS).
BS degree or higher from an accredited college or university in Information Systems, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a similar technical discipline
Demonstrated ability to lead others and manage multiple assignments simultaneously
Network engineering experience; minimum 7-10 years of implementation/configuration in an enterprise environment
Extensive technical knowledge in IP networking and network architecture
Deep technical skills in key areas of infrastructure (networking, security, remote access, disaster recovery, etc.)
Collaborate well with others with the ability to define, document, and clearly communicate overall engineering decisions and direction
Must have knowledge of the following technologies:
Palo Alto and Cisco firewalls
WAN and LAN connectivity
OTV, MPLS technologies
Cisco IOS/ASR Routers
IOS/Nexus Switches
CUCM telephony
Cisco Wireless Infrastructure
VMware NSX and VPN technologies
Network tracing and troubleshooting (Wireshark, Fiddler)
In-depth understanding of datacenter interconnectivity
Server technology- VMware, Cisco UCS, Dell
Disaster Recovery and replication technologies
Operating Systems-Windows 2012 R2, 2016 (Standard and Enterprise), Linux
Basic scripting skills
Monitoring Solutions including SolarWinds
Preferred/Desired Skills
Certified in one or more of the following:
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
Cisco Certified Network Administrator (CCNA
Treliant offers a comprehensive, total rewards package that includes competitive compensation and a flexible benefit package that reflects our commitment to creating a diverse and supportive workplace. In addition to a competitive base salary, candidate is eligible for incentive pay as well as a full range of health benefits, vacation plan, and 401k plan.
If you want to be part of a dynamic team of professionals join Treliant. We invest in people, and challenge you to advance your career while achieving your aspirations and goals. Here at Treliant, we pride ourselves on our collaborative team culture, where we embrace diversity of thought and innovation. If you strive for excellence and seek an inclusive environment apply on line www.treliant.com and follow us on LinkedIn.
Treliant LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, religion, age, disability, or military status in employment or provision of services. When contacted for an interview, an applicant who requires special accommodations due to a disability should notify the office so that proper arrangements can be made.

text:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Responsible for planning, installation, configuration and administration of Network Infrastructure
Ensure continued smooth operation of the global network infrastructure focusing on operational reliability and final point of escalation for the network
Lead and participate on projects that affect the global network, meeting massive scaling, reliability, and performance challenges
Work on improving processes and automation for networking infrastructure and supporting systems
R&D on new network and security technologies
Perform evaluation, proof of concept and provide recommendations
Write network related technical specifications for tenders
Manage daily network operations
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Master/Bachelor Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering or equivalent
Minimum 5 years of substantial experience in Network Engineer /Architecture position with an internet service provider or enterprise level network
CCNP certified
Experience in managing networking technologies (Structured Cabling, WAN, LAN, VPN, Network Security, Wireless)
Experience in either network deployment or IP networking
Solid knowledge of IP fundamentals including IP addressing and VLSM, VLAN, and routing configuration
Excellent knowledge and troubleshooting ability of TCP/IP, routing (BGP, IGPs and MPLS) and link layer protocols
Experience in implementing high speed network infrastructure of 40 Gbps or 100 Gbps, IPv6, Openflow, SDN and other leading networking technologies
Strong experience working in a Unix/Linux environment at systems administrator level and ability to analyze security logs and traffic pattern
Possesses strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills
Independent mature team player, with initiative, positive attitude and strong passion in networking technologies
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

text:
Job Description
Title: Senior Network Engineer
Location: Los Angeles, California
Duration: 18 months
Compensation: $77-$79 per hour
Work Requirements: Authorized to Work in the US
Overview:
TekPartners has some of the most sought after Information Technology positions available. As a reputable company in the IT staffing industry, you can trust us to place you in the right position. We currently have an opportunity for Senior Network Engineer in Los Angeles, California.
Job Description:
Local & Wide Area Network and Security Support (30% of time spent each day)
Responsible for the operation and maintenance of Fox’s data center and perimeter firewalls.
Oversees operational changes within the data center based on requests from our users and clients who host services in those data centers
Supports maintenance requirements such as code and hardware upgrades
Responds to incidents on equipment at the data center
Performs general network and security hardware and software maintenance and configuration
Support for hardware and code upgrades on equipment at our campus and branch offices
Incident response to problems with equipment at our offices
Interfaces with vendors and Fox partners to ensure security policies are followed when installing or changing equipment on the network
Works with our clients and customers to assist with a variety of service requests.
These may vary from basic VLAN changes on switches to new Application deployments where the engineer will build firewall and load balancer policies to support their requirements
These types of service requests represent the majority of non-project related work for the engineer.
Office Installs, Moves and Upgrades
This represents the majority of the project work that the engineer is responsible for.
The design component is covered below in both sections 2 and 3.
These projects involve either major office hardware upgrades of the network infrastructure or completely new office builds where Fox has purchased a new location or acquired another company.
Operationally the engineer will either be onsite to deploy the new hardware or will be on a call overseeing the work done by local IT staff.
These projects involve detailed planning of configuration and hardware changes as well as close work with our Project Management Organization.
Network Design (30% of time spent each day)
This section includes the design work for Office Installs, Moves and Upgrades
Consults with customers to identify data and network security requirements.
Prepares and updates network and security documentation.
Defines changes to the network design to accommodate requirements of the office
i.e. new wireless SSID’s or new VOIP phone systems
Details step by step implementation plans for upgrades in coordination with the PMO
Produces and interprets network and security analysis reports.
Maintains design requirements and standards documentation
Assesses new and relevant networking and security technologies.
This is in coordination with our architects to assist with determining what new technologies we will deploy and how they will be configured
Makes recommendations on existing projects to improve network security, performance, reliability, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.
Implementation
Design Reviews
Our benefits package includes:
Comprehensive Medical Benefits
Competitive Pay, 401K
Retirement Plan
And Much More

We are a premier provider of highly qualified IT talent, Workforce Solutions and Business Intelligence Solutions to many enterprise organizations across the nation. As experts in the industry, our team continues to match proven talent to the right job opportunity every day.
TekPartners is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As an information technology partner we offer our clients proven talent through professional staffing, managed services, and IT project solutions. We understand and value the unique needs of the industry and always strive to stay above the curve. The company was founded on the following core values: Be the Best, Understand the Urgency, Never Ever Give Up, Have the Courage to Excel, and Make a Contribution. We take pride in our business model and strive to create a positive workplace environment through an exemplary culture. TekPartners continues to grow and expand with office locations in Fort Lauderdale, Miami, Orlando, Charlotte, and Milwaukee. Learn more at www.tekpartners.com.

text:
Job description
VirtualComms, a well-established company is looking for a network engineer to join their team in the Kosh area (Klerksdorp/Orkney/Stilfontein/Hartebeesfontein).
The applicant must be dynamic and able to execute orders.
Company Description
VirtualComms is focused on delivering you fast, reliable communication and connectivity services. Our aim is to take the hassle out of connectivity struggles by providing the best solution tailored to exact needs.
Requirements
Requirements: (Not limited)
At least two years of network setup and maintenance related experience
A good understanding of TCP/UDP protocol and subnet masking
A good understanding of VLAN setup and topography
A good understanding of VOIP, SIP trunks, Tunnelling, Bridging and Switching
A good understanding of Windows Server and Linux
A good understanding of Mikrotik, Ubiquiti and Cisco products will be an added advantage
Strong IT background with strong planning skills
Good communication skills
Must be well organized with attention to detail
Work well under pressure and good time management skills
Must be able to meet deadlines
Must be able to work alone and together with a team
Must have the ability to use own initiative
Must have a valid driver’s license
If you meet the above requirements and wish to apply, please respond to this advertisement by emailing your resume and a picture of yourself to:
fm@virtualcomms.co.za

text:
Exciting opportunity for a Level 2 - Network Engineer to provide technical support and maintenance for the Datacentre Communications support services
Canberra
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Network Engineer - Level 2 to provide technical support and maintenance for the Datacentre Communications support services by resolving incidents, work orders and change requests within the committed timeframes.
Key Responsibilities
Reporting to the Midrange Team Lead, you will have the following key responsibilities:
Monitor systems in line with pre-defined operational controls, processes and requirements
Actively contribute to collaboration and communication within your team
Implement system changes as requested
Run and distribute defined system management reports
Prepare and distribute ad-hoc system management reports as requested
Support the Incident, Event, Problem and Change Management structure
Identify and escalate any identified need for improvement to the Team Leader
To be successful in the role, you will be an experienced Technical Support Engineer, specifically with exposure to hardware diagnostics and troubleshooting in an enterprise environment.
Additionally, you will have the following:
A 'can-do' attitude and ability to provide a level of subject matter leadership and technical support to the team
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Experience working in a Datacentre Communications Technical Support/Engineer role (highly desirable)
Working knowledge of virtualised environments and Microsoft technologies
Relevant Tertiary qualifications in IT, business (highly desirable)
Must have existing NV1 security clearance
To be considered for the role click the 'Apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Tori Bull on (02) 6151 9214. Please quote our job reference number: 200167931.
Reference Number: 200167931_2

text:
The Information Technology (IT) department for the San Manuel Band of Mission Indians (the Tribe) provides and supports a leading edge technology infrastructure to the organization in support of ever changing technological advances in the Gaming industry and the Tribe’s business enterprises. The ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment is key to the success of the IT staff to meet the demands of this technically proficient and high demand department.
The Wireless Network Engineer II plays a critical role in the design, installation, testing, implementation, and maintenance of the wireless network infrastructure of the entire organization. Under the direction of the Manager, IT Infrastructure, the Wireless Network Engineer II is responsible for the design, implementation, operation and maintenance of a large, multisite, high density wireless infrastructure.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Design, install, test, implement, and maintain highly available wireless networks for optimal performance.
Design, install, test, implement, and maintain highly available, high speed wireless backhaul for remote site connectivity.
Design, install, test, implement, and maintain industry leading security across the Wireless infrastructure.
Design, install, test, implement, and maintain high-density guest wireless networks.
Design, install, test, implement, and maintain cellular DAS and small cell systems.
Oversee all outside consultants/vendors while working on wireless projects; provide technical assessment of requirements and definition from conception to launch.
Optimize existing wireless networks by adjusting radio network parameters, adding/deleting of neighbors and recommending possible solutions to hardware problems.
Work with internal staff and outside vendors to design future wireless networks; study and evaluate new wireless technologies and their potential application benefits to our network and suggest enhancements as appropriate.
Serve as a backup to the Senior Network Engineer in the administration and troubleshooting of the network.
Configure, install, and troubleshoot centralized network infrastructure such as routers, hubs, switches, etc.
Design and validate RF link performance, quality and reliability.
Monitor and analyze statistical and drive test data to improve system performance indicators.
Recommend site upgrades.
Engineer solutions to integrate wireless LAN coverage into new facilities.
Train and mentor other network engineers.
Create manuals and support documentation.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Education/Experience/Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, preferably with an emphasis in Information Technology or a minimum of 3 advanced level certifications specific to wireless networking required.
Minimum of five (5) years of overall data network experience, including two (2) years of experience in the design of wireless networks required.
Equivalent combination of education and progressive, relevant and direct experience may be considered in lieu of minimum educational/experience requirements indicated above.
Expert level knowledge of all ratified wireless network standards derived from experience with wireless spectrum analyzers, network/protocol/packet analyzer, wireless surveying and performance tools, WiFi security standards.
Expert level knowledge and understanding of policy based authentication using Clearpass required
Experience developing and implementing high density wireless networks in all of enterprise, hospitality and guest environments required.
Detailed theoretical and practical knowledge of IP protocols, firewalls, switches and routers is essential.
Experience configuring, installing, and troubleshooting centralized network infrastructure such as routers, hubs, switches, etc. is mandatory. HPe experience is required Cisco experience is desirable
Hands on experience with Aruba AirWave and IDS/IPS Controls required.
Keen knowledge working with Wireless Mesh Technologies required.
Expert level working knowledge of 802.1x, NPS, Certificate Authority.
Experience with FCC licensed spectrum wireless preferred
Working knowledge of SIAE Microelettronica high capacity microwave systems advantageous
Working knowledge of PAN’s desirable
Hospitality wifi experience desirable
Experience with femtocell or similar low power cellular base station systems desirable
2+ years working experience with high speed, wireless backhaul technologies. Ubiquiti experience preferred. Federal spectrum compliance experience preferred.
2+ years working experience with cellular technologies.
Proven, demonstrable knowledge of the OSI model.
Demonstrated expert ability capturing, analyzing, and interpreting raw network traffic. Extensive experience with packet/protocol fault analysis for common IP and Ethernet protocols and troubleshooting wired and wireless connections using wireless traffic analyzers.
Knowledge of WIDS/WIPS technologies, VPNs, firewall theory, and packet analysis principles and techniques applied in securing operating systems and LAN/WAN networks.
Certificates/Licenses/Registrations
At the discretion of the San Manuel Tribal Gaming Commission you may be required to obtain and maintain a gaming license.
MCSE, ACMA, ACMP, ACMX, ACDX, ACCA, ACCP, ACSP and/or CCNA preferred.
CCENT, CWNA and WDP certification highly preferred.
San Manuel Band of Mission Indians and San Manuel Casino will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990.

Mission to Our Employees:
Teladoc Health is the global virtual care leader, offering the only compr...
tasks: Support network and various other Infrastructure at remote offices and data centers.,Manage, maintain, troubleshoot and support our networks, equipment, and other related services.,Identify problems while working within a structured problem management and resolution process to remediate them.,Design and implement solutions based off business requirements and best practices.,Work closely with our Information Security Team on remediation and implementing new technologies.,Daily troubleshooting and support with some off hours when required in a global 24x7 environment.,Mentor and train more junior team members.
text:
Mission to Our Employees:
Teladoc Health is the global virtual care leader, offering the only comprehensive virtual care solution spanning telehealth, expert medical, and licensed platform services. Teladoc Health serves the world's leading insurers, employers, and health systems and helps millions of people around the world resolve their healthcare needs with confidence. We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Teladoc Health. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, values and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share with our clients.
What we are looking for:
Based in our Quincy Massachusetts office, the Senior Network Engineer role is responsible for supporting both local and global core network related infrastructure.
What you will do:
Support network and various other Infrastructure at remote offices and data centers.
Manage, maintain, troubleshoot and support our networks, equipment, and other related services.
Identify problems while working within a structured problem management and resolution process to remediate them.
Design and implement solutions based off business requirements and best practices.
Work closely with our Information Security Team on remediation and implementing new technologies.
Daily troubleshooting and support with some off hours when required in a global 24x7 environment.
Mentor and train more junior team members.
Requirements:
Associates degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Technology, related field of study, or equivalent work experience.
Minimum 5 years hands on experience with core networking and related technologies.
Cisco CCNA or CCNP or additional vendor certifications. Security certifications a plus.
Cisco IOS and related experience with TAC support procedures.
Must be proficient with Switching, Routing, and Wireless and related services.
Cisco switches, routers, ASA firewalls, SourceFire, AnyConnect, wireless controllers.
Experience supporting VoIP related network environments and technologies.
Excellent understanding of VLAN’s, LAN, WAN, BGP, EIGRP, STP, NAT, 801.1x, RADIUS, TACACS+
Network Security technologies including; Firewall, IPS, NAC, VPN, Port Security, Segmentation.
Must have experience working in a collocated Data Center environment.
Experience with VMWare, DNS, Active Directory, and related services a plus.
Self-motivated, positive attitude, professional demeanor, works well in a team environment.
Exhibits a high level of technical knowledge and is able to apply to technical issues and problems.
Company Benefits:
Very competitive salary & equity compensation.
Excellent health, dental, vision coverage.
401k benefits with employer matching contribution; immediately vested.
Awesome people to work with.
Becoming a part of a movement in telemedicine and building something that matters.
For a more detailed look at our company and values, visit our website at https://teladochealth.com/en/about/
At Teladoc Health we thrive on difference and individuality. Teladoc Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

requirements: 5 or more years of experience Cisco Wireless Network Engineering,Experienced with monitoring tools such as Solar Winds/Orion, Lancope, LiveAction or similar required,Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences,CCNA/CCNP Highly preferred,Experienced with SDWA(Viptela etc ),Metro-E,DWDM
summary:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components su...
text:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Senior Network Engineer work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Responsibilities
The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
Required Qualifications
5 or more years of experience Cisco Wireless Network Engineering
Experienced with monitoring tools such as Solar Winds/Orion, Lancope, LiveAction or similar required
Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences
Must be a highly effective communicator with the ability to lead and influence
Desired Qualifications:
CCNA/CCNP Highly preferred
Experienced with SDWA(Viptela etc )
MPLS
Metro-E
DWDM
5g Wireless
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40

Job Description
Title: Network Engineer

Job Purpose:
Implement...
tasks: Work together with other team members to complete network related projects (For example: QoS, new routing design, IPv6, new office/Data Center network build, office/DC expansion, hardware refresh, software upgrade),Perform network optimization (device security hardening, routing changes, graceful WAN circuit upgrade/refresh)
text:
Job Description
Job Description
Title: Network Engineer
Duration: 06+ months
Job Purpose:
Implement and support corporate global IT network
Key responsibilities and accountabilities:
Work together with other team members to complete network related projects (For example: QoS, new routing design, IPv6, new office/Data Center network build, office/DC expansion, hardware refresh, software upgrade)
Perform network optimization (device security hardening, routing changes, graceful WAN circuit upgrade/refresh)
Troubleshoot and fix network related issues
Requirements:
Good communication and documentation skills in English
Self-sufficient, team player
CCNP, JNCIP or equivalent knowledge level
Good troubleshooting skill for LAN and WAN network, including methodical TCPIP or OSI based troubleshooting
In-depth network knowledge or experience in:
TCP/IP
LAN Switching (e.g. STP, VTP, UDLD, PAgP, LACP)
HSRP, VRRP, OSPF, BGP
QoS
Packet Capture and Analysis
Knowledge or experience in below areas will be a big plus
Experience with multi-vendor device network environment (including Cisco, Juniper, Arista and etc.)
Ability to troubleshoot end to end from L1 to L7
Cisco ISE
802.1x, MAB, Profiling, policy and conditions
Cisco Catalyst Integrated Security Features (CISF) including DHCP snooping and DAI
802.11 Wireless Network for Enterprise Network (Experience with Aruba’s solution preferred)
Unix/FreeBSD/Linux
IPv6
Experience with network automation (ansible, python, shell scripting, or something else)
Experience with multi-vendor environment (including Cisco, Juniper, Arista and etc.)
Experience with managing the virtual network for public cloud environment (Microsoft Azure environment preferred)
Notes :
Candidates must have CISCO ISE experience AND Juniper experience. Also Knowledge is what is most important here, not years of experience.
title: Network Engineer

name: Sr. Network Engineer
summary:
Description
Job Responsibilities:
• Perform duties as a Sr. Network Engineer
• Designing, implementi...
text:
Description
Job Responsibilities:
• Perform duties as a Sr. Network Engineer
• Designing, implementing and managing Cisco-based solutions
• Facilitate both short and long-term projects, representing NE in meetings
• Work production issues like circuit outages, device failures and performance degradation
• Communicate between all stakeholders to provide project updates, coordinate scheduling and document work performed.
• Regularly update team on project status, create and update AS-Builts, diagram using VISIO, etc.
• Work closely with Customer and Team to maintain service levels and high customer satisfaction
• Some local travel may be required.
• Some duties will be performed outside of core hours so flexibility is essential.
Knowledge/Skills:
• 10+ years’ experience
• Experience and expertise designing, implementing and managing Cisco based solutions; specially experience configuring VTP, STP, Ether-channe,l and OSPF on CAT4500, CAT6500, CAT3850s, Nexus SK, 4000 series routers and 2900 series routers. Experience must also include working on production issues such as performance degradation, device failures, WAN (T1, DS3) copper Ethernet and fiber circuit outages; collaborating with provider and the Customer NOC and working on APC UPS.
• Experience leading both long and short-term network engineering projects by meeting with customers, deploying a system security solutions. Manage projects by meeting with customer, gathering requirements, designing solutions, scheduling tasks, implementing solutions, and documenting work. Demonstrate expert skill with designing and deploying a system security solutions. Demonstrate expert skill with creating and updating project plans and Visio-based diagrams. .
• Possess strong writing and verbal communications skills as related to gathering of information from customers and relaying information to customers, IT staff, service providers, and relaying information to customers, IT staff, service providers, and management.
Education/Certifications:
• BS Degree
• Appropriate certifications (CCIE, CCNP, Network+) required

text:
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network
Canberra
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network and ensure end to end operational availability of network systems within service levels and / or service expectations.
General Attributes:
Network level: WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security.
Internal systems, and Data centre network infrastructure.
Act as point of contact between customer and engineers.
Resolve all incidents in line with required service level agreements.
Complete project activities as required on behalf of the customer.
Define and document requirements and provide design documentation as appropriate
Assist with and generate Design's, Solutions & execute new installations and upgrades as necessary complying with the change management process.
Maintain accurate records of all operational assets (hardware, software)
Work with Customers, Solutions Architects, Pre-Sales, NEC Management and the delivery team in providing the best and most cost effective solution
Liaise as required between the Delivery team, Professional services, Solution Architects and OEM's on the implementation & support issues that may arise
Skills Required:
Degree / Certificate in IT or equivalent
Cisco Associate and/Or Professional Level Certifications (CCNA,CCNP R&S and DC)
Experience with Cisco Firewalls and Data Centre switches.
Experience with Cisco LMS and Cisco Prime.
Experience with UCSD.
ITIL Foundations Certificate
To be eligible to apply, you must have an existing NV1 security clearance.

text:
Be responsible for the management and day to day support of the clients network along with the delivery and configuration on integration technologies.
Sydney
Fantastic opportunity now available for a skilled Network Engineer to be responsible for the build, support and support of the clients network.
Provide a second level escalation point for other members of the team and take an active role in providing technical leadership and mentoring junior staff.
Responsibilities
Perform research, analysis and design of technical solutions to meet business requirements
Work as part of a support team and provide 24x7 after hours support on a rotating roster
Provide technical leadership on different projects
Ensure that existing technology investments are optimized if applicable
Project responsibilities within project planning, work plan development and resourcing.
Provide a 2nd level escalation point for the service desk
Skills & Requirements
Cisco networking expertise (more than 3 years)
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Strong organization and planning skills.
Demonstrated ability to take ownership, work under pressure and meet agreed deadlines.
Demonstrated 3rd level problem solving skills.
Experience in control processes and procedures.
Demonstrated experience in technical and project leadership.
Strong background in results collating and reporting for measurements.
Min 3 years in a Senior Server\Network support role.
Proven working knowledge of network, routers & switches.
Proven working knowledge of Microsoft technologies.
Extensive knowledge and deployment of SANs and virtualized environments, including VMware, Microsoft etc.
Knowledge of and experience in documenting business requirements & developing technical solutions to meet those requirements.
Candidates who are available immediately are preferred

text:
Job Description
The Good Seeks an experienced OpenBSD engineer.
This is a contract position.
Candidate must have minimum 5 years experience in OpenBSD and networking.
Company Description
The Good Seed is a non-profit organization that helps youth live and thrive. In response to the pervasive crisis of youth homelessness, The Good Seed specializes in providing comprehensive services to youth experiencing or at-risk of experiencing homelessness. We strive to create a holistic health focused environment, that supports a permanent transition from experiencing homelessness into experiencing “health-fullness”.
At The Good Seed, we actualize our mission by providing nurturing housing, health, and supportive services to youth ages 16 to 25 throughout Los Angeles County. Our services include rapid re-housing and permanent supportive housing services, mental health services, physical health services, case management, education support, employment services, and peer support services. We offer services at multiple youth drop-in centers and emergency supportive housing shelters. In an effort to fulfill our mission and values, it is our guiding principal to serve any youth in need.
The Good Seed
Why Work Here?
Helping Youth Grow and Thrive!
The Good Seed is a non-profit organization that helps youth grow and thrive.

text:
Description
Tokio Marine HCC is a leading specialty insurance group with offices in the United States, the United Kingdom and Continental Europe, transacting business in approximately 180 countries and underwriting more than 100 classes of specialty insurance. Tokio Marine HCC products and capabilities set the standard for the industry, and many of the Company's almost 3,000 employees are industry-leading experts.
Are you looking to work in an environment which has a focus on technology and innovation? Then we have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Network Engineer in our corporate office in Houston, TX. This individual will be responsible for design, build, implement, monitor, and maintain moderately complex to complex network systems that are global in scale. You will get the opportunity to work independently in an operational and design environment, exercising sound judgement and collaborating with cross-discipline workgroups. You will get to develop scalable network solutions that are deployable across the enterprise.
Performance Objectives:
Design and Configure:Effectively design and configure Local and Software Defined Wide Area Networks (LAN/WAN/SDWAN) and infrastructure to meet current industry technology standards. Use knowledge of server operating systems to help design and install internal and external networks.
Test:Test and evaluate network systems to ensure stability, eliminate problems and make improvements. Periodically test and evaluate network performance and adjust and redesign network where applicable.
Support:Monitor, maintain, support, and optimize all network infrastructure to include multiple Data Centers and cloud environments. Perform troubleshooting to correct issues.
Business Partnership:Collaborate with IT Risk Management and Security to reduce business risk. Work with the Network Engineering Manager and other leadership to align business and organizational goals.
Qualifications:
The successful candidate ideally will have a minimum of five years of relevant and progressive professional experience in a Senior Network Engineer role designing and configuring Cisco technology (switches, routers etc.).
Working experience with Cisco, Citrix NetScaler, SAN, Windows/Linux servers, and Microsoft technologies.
Knowledge of Internet/Intranet technologies including security features.
Sound working knowledge of systems infrastructure and operations, including switching, routing, Ethernet, TCP/IP.
Competence with routers, networking protocols, and configurations.
Sound working knowledge of remote access technology.
Flexibility and a willingness to learn.
Sound analytical skills, as well as strong decision-making and problem-solving aptitude.
Must be an exceptional communicator and able to make connections across the organization at multiple locations.
Educational requirements: the ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related field, or the equivalent education and/or experience.
Active Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) designation or higher or related certification(s) required.
Experience in Cisco Digital Network Architecture (DNA Center) and Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) preferred.
Will require some travel outside normal work location including international travel.
The Tokio Marine HCC Group of Companies offers a competitive salary and employee benefit package. We are a successful, dynamic organization experiencing rapid growth and are seeking energetic and confident individuals to join our team of professionals. The Tokio Marine HCC Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. Please visit www.tmhcc.com for more information about our companies.

text:
Lead Network Engineer
Job ID: 2020-24765
Location:
Tyler, TX 75701
Due to COVID-19, we are prioritizing Internal AUSA candidates for the first 10 business days.
Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We're building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve. We're not the only ones who have seen it; we've recently been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers as well as by the Human Rights Campaign, DiversityInc Magazine, and Cablefax for our diversity & inclusion program.
Altice USA is seeking a Lead Network Engineer with extensive experience designing and building diverse and complex multi-vendor networks. The candidate will play a key role in the design and implementation of processes, procedures, policies, and standards related to the enterprise network and is responsible for the technical "success" of these projects. The candidate must be capable of leading project-related technical meetings and multitasking across many diverse project activities, ultimately ensuring that cost-effective and efficient infrastructure environments are built to satisfy project requirements and business objectives.
Responsibilities
Research/analyze/define/propose/design/document/implement network solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment to achieve business objectives.
Clearly and concisely communicate both written and verbally with peers, management and business stakeholders.
Develop documentation including operations manuals and procedural documents
Generate and validate ROI and budget calculations for network solutions.
Generate technical presentations based on results of design/sand-box testing and present to upper management.
Appropriately respond to and successfully deliver any and all ad hoc requests made by the management team.
Participate in advanced problem resolution.
Develop automation routines
Qualifications / Requirements
Expert level technical knowledge and 8+ years experience in the design and implementation of Cisco route/switch/VPN/firewall in large 1000+ node Enterprise environments
Expert level knowledge of routed protocols - BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, VXLAN/EVPN
Experience in the design and deployment of virtualized Data Center networks utilizing Cisco Application-Centric
Infrastructure on Nexus 9k/5k/2k platforms and VMWare NSX
Experience migrating from traditional tiered data center designs to Cisco ACI and other SDN methods
Excellent understanding of VPN technologies (site-to-site, remote access client, IPSec, IKE, tunnel modes, SSL/clientless/AnyConnect, tunnels between firewalls, routers)
Experience with cloud delivery models including Openstack, AWS, and GCS
Extensive experience with packet sniffing and Protocol Analysis Software
Deep understanding of VRF
Proficiency with F5 load balancing platforms
Experience with Cisco VoIP Platforms
Cisco and Aruba WiFi knowledge, both autonomous and controller-based
Experience with NAC solutions from Cisco or Aruba for integration with wireless and wired infrastructure
Experience with Cisco next-gen ASA/FTD/Firepower platforms and associated management systems
Experience working with Checkpoint appliance platforms and all associated management systems
Development of automation solutions to integrate with existing route, switch, load balancing, and firewall technologies a plus
Experience with Python scripting a plus
BS,BA, EE or Equivalent, relevant network certifications (CCNP, CCIE) and/or equivalent work experience
Industry Certifications across several disciplines a plus
Superior documentation skills
Must be able to work in a fast-paced team environment and self-manage tasks
Moderate travel with little or no notice
Required to participate in an on-call rotation (includes evenings, weekends and occasional holidays
Altice USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, color, creed, national origin, religion, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.
Altice USA, Inc. collects personal information about its applicants for employment that may include personal identifiers, professional or employment related information, photos, education information and/or protected classifications under federal and state law. This information is collected for employment purposes, including identification, work authorization, FCRA-compliant background screening, human resource administration and compliance with federal, state and local law.

text:
Senior Network Engineer
Charlotte, NC, US
Requisition Number:74990
Sr. Network Engineer/Consultant
As a Sr. Networking Consultant, you will enter a high-energy and tech savvy world. We are looking for someone who has exceptional interpersonal skills, is client focused, and has a proven track record of delivering best in class networking solutions. Successful consultants will adapt quickly to changing technical and professional environments.
Insight is looking for talented individuals who are passionate about emerging technologies and excited about the opportunity to work for industry-leading organizations, providing best in class NextGen solutions.
What you will do at Insight
+ Design, implement, test and document Cisco network solutions to include routing and switching
+ Maintain accurate diagrams and configurations for all network devices and power equipment
+ Prepare engineering job packages consisting of detailed parts / equipment lists, and appropriate documentation (drawings, network diagrams, configurations, etc.).
+ Utilize IPAM and DNS as required.
+ Support the migration and turn-up of both private and public WAN circuits to a new architecture.
+ Ability to assist and support field staff remotely to implement Network changes
What you will need to be successful at Insight
+ 5+ years implementing and troubleshooting Networking and Data Center technologies, with at least 2 years of design and support of Cisco Systems' products.
+ Experience in the following technology areas: TCP/IP, Cisco IOS, Layer 3 Switching, OSPF, HSRP, IPSEC, SSL, AAA, SNMP QOS/class of services, VoIP, Incident Response, and Network Management Practices.
+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Visio and terminal emulation.
+ Understanding of communication technology and fundamentals.
+ Ability to take direction and follow documented standards and procedures.
+ Effective verbal & written communication.
+ Demonstrated ability to work productively with little direct supervision.
+ Demonstrated organizational and time management skills.
+ Ability to effectively prioritize multiple tasks.
+ Strong interpersonal skills to support successful performance in a team environment.
+ Growth in technical skills through certifications (CCNA/CCNP) or other similar achievements is desired.
The position described above provides a summary of some the job duties required and what it would be like to work at Insight. For a comprehensive list of physical demands and work environment for this position, click here.
Today, every business is a technology business. Insight Enterprises, Inc. empowers organizations of all sizes with Insight Intelligent Technology Solutions and services to maximize the business value of IT. As a Fortune 500-ranked global provider of digital innovation, cloud/data center transformation, connected workforce, and supply chain optimization solutions and services, we help clients successfully manage their IT today while transforming for tomorrow. From IT strategy and design to implementation and management, our 6,800 employees help clients innovate and optimize their operations to run smarter. Discover more atinsight.com.
+ Founded in 1988 in Tempe, Arizona
+ 7,400+ teammates in 19 countries providing Intelligent Technology Solutions for organizations across the globe
+ $7.1 billion in revenue in 2018
+ Ranked #417 on the 2018 Fortune 500, #12 on the 2018 CRN Solution Provider 500
+ 2018 Dell EMC Server Partner of the Year, 2018 Intel Retail Solution Partner of the Year, 2018 Microsoft Worldwide Artificial Intelligence Partner of the Year
+ Ranked #23 on the 2019 Fortune 50 Best Workplaces in Technology and #5 on the Phoenix Business Journal 2018 list of Best Places to Work (Extra Large Business)
+ Signatory of the United Nations (UN) Global Compact and Affiliate Member of the Responsible Business Alliance
Today's talent leads tomorrow's success. Learn about careers at Insight: jobs.insight.com.
Insight is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

text:
7900 Westpark Drive (12131), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
DevOps Network Engineer
Job Description
Capital One Network Services has an opening for a DevOps Network Engineer in our Edge Network Organization. As a DevOps Network Engineer, you will be responsible for leading and ensuring that Capital One best practices and methodologies are applied to the design, deployment and operations of SD-WAN, SD-ACCESS and edge network projects. In addition to Cisco IOS experience, you must possess strong to advanced knowledge of routing and switching, carrier services, data center services, and network automation. Candidate will primarily act in a DevOps role for the enterprise data network platforms with full product ownership. You will be responsible to provide technical guidance and leadership to partner teams to drive solutions. You will be the technical point of contact for the customer and provide design, migration and deployment guidance. Your operations activities include troubleshooting performance issues and performing break-fix network changes. You should have experience with and a strong knowledge of Incident, Problem and Change management processes. You will drive technical resolution of High-Severity & Low Severity Incidents. You will provide direct support of Problem Management process, including Post-Mortem participation and presentations. You will help govern device remediation and Operational Resiliency activities.
Responsibilities
Create Low Level Design, High Level Design, Implementation Plan, and Acceptance Test Plan documents in accordance with Capital One standards.
Create, update and publish Capital One standards to ensure network meets business and compliance needs
Perform installation, configuration, maintenance and troubleshooting of Capital One managed hardware, software and peripheral devices.
Oversee and perform new and existing equipment, hardware and software upgrades.
Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed.
Provide Technical leadership and guidance to junior personnel.
Manage and Govern relationships with technology vendors utilized in the enterprise network.
Ensure compliance with departmental and enterprise security configuration standards.
Provide direct support of audit and ad hoc consulting engagements
Assess vulnerabilities, identify and implement mitigation plans
Design, deploy and support Edge Networks utilizing industry best practices Cisco IOS, Cisco Nexus and Versa SD-WAN platforms.
Contribute to the development and performance of a migration plan from traditional branch and campus designs to SD-WAN and SD-ACCESS
Own platform life-cycle management
Ongoing, on the job training.
Operations Tier 3 escalation resource for incident resolution
Successful candidates will possess
Exceptional interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to document solutions, present ideas to cross-functional teams, and explain operational issue background and root cause to vendors and senior leaders
Strong knowledge of incident management, problem management, and change management best-practices
Meticulous attention to detail
A solid understanding of what comprises a scalable, robust, supportable design
A belief that standardization and automation is the path to happiness
A bias toward action, along with an internal drive for continuous improvement
Curiosity. You ask why, you explore, you’re not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea. It didn’t really kill the cat.
No fear. Big, undefined problems and operational issues don’t frighten you. You can work at a tiny crack until you’ve broken open the whole nut and then clearly explain the issue in a manner that people who aren’t as knowledgeable in your area of expertise can understand.
A passion for teamwork
Automation skills. You know how to script and automate.
Ability to work in a flexible work environment that embraces rapid change, emphasizes continuous learning, and attacks new challenges
Ability to adequately discuss technical issues with technicians, engineers, architects and vendors.
Experience working in a large geographically dispersed network environment.
Ability to work as part of an integrated team that is geographically dispersed, as well as work independently as required.
Experience with Linux
Familiarity with Puppet, Chef, Ansible or Salt
Familiarity utilizing REST APIs on network devices and management platforms
Proficient Python programming skills with object-oriented design principles desired.
This position is a DevOps role. As such, periodic late night maintenance work and participation in an on-call rotation will be required.
Basic Qualifications
High school diploma, GED or equivalent certification.
At least 3 years of experience in an enterprise network.
At least 3 years of experience in L2 and L3 switching architecture design.
At least 5 years of experience in implementing routers and switches.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
CCNA, CCNP and or CCIE Datacenter Routing and Switching certification.
1+ year of SD-WAN experience.
1+ year of SD-ACCESS experience.
1+ years of programming or scripting experience related to networking utilizing Python or Ansible.
1+ year of Lantronix Out of Band or equivalent experience in all technical aspects of Out of Band implementation.
3+ years of experience in BGP, OSPF, vPC, VXLAN, and ECMP.
3+ years of experience configuring and managing Cisco Catalyst Switches and Cisco ASR and ISR Routers in an enterprise-class network.
10+ years of experience of people leadership experience.
10+ years of experience in all technical aspects of Routing implementation.
10+ years of experience in all technical aspects of Switching implementation.
10+ years of experience in IT infrastructure.
At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.
No agencies please. Capital One is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries.
If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.
For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com
Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.
Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).
Who We Are
At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.
Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

text:
Telecom Engineer
Do you have experience leading VoIP call center operations? Have you been at the forefront of customer transformation initiatives by combining strategy, technology, data, and design?
If so, Deloitte is the place for you! Help bring the power of Customer Strategy and Applied Design to our Government and Public Service clients and transform how they engage with their users. A career within our growing practice will offer you unique exposure to consulting capabilities, industry expertise and trusted methodologies, as well as cutting-edge creative prowess.
Work you ll do
As a Telecom Network Engineer you will:
Manage the design, build and implementation of tasks for Avaya or Genesys enterprisesolutions as well as provide on-going support for related systems
Provide Level 3 support and any other duties as assigned. You will be supporting VoIP telephony systems for Federal Civilian and DoD contact centers and back office business units
Provide expertise in the plan, design, build, implementation and operations of tasks for complex converged networks
Support VoIP telephony systems as well as integrated network environments for DoD, Civilian and State & Local contact centers and back office business units
Partner with outside service providers in support of VoIP environment, as well as manage VoIP devices in accordance with best practices and Federal security standards, approved methods, and procedures
Work in large enterprise-class network environments, supporting converged technologies
Lead discovery-related conversations, workshops, and associated deliverables for stakeholders
Anticipate client needs and formulate solutions to client issues
Manage, mentor, coach and train junior staff on an ongoing basis
The team
Our Customer Strategy & Applied Design team focuses on helping clientsdiscover, design, and prototype customer growth strategies and innovationportfolios to create and drive change in a digital world. We bring knowledgeand offerings to uncover the behaviors, motivations and preferences of ourclients customers and develop new experiences for them. Our team ofprofessionals has deep capabilities in strategy, customer experience, digitalstrategy and innovation.
We deliver set of customer focused work:
Customer Strategy | Help clients build capabilities to better understand customer value drivers and make choices about the markets and segments they serve through digital, social, and mobile channels; optimize pricing decisions and shape the most strategic issues on the CMO agenda
Customer Experience | Help clients improve the quality, nature and power of interactions between the customer and the organization across the lifecycle of sales, marketing and service at each touch point.
Applied Innovation | Help clients rapidly design, prototype and launch new businesses and experiences, translating insights on human behavior from design-led methods into offerings and technologies that delight customers and drive growth
Digital Strategy | Help clients understand, envision and articulate digital as a business strategy aligned with their CEO s agenda and then craft a plan to embed everything they do with the latest technology solutions and business models to compete in the marketplace for customers and talent
Qualifications
Bachelor s degree in Engineering,Communications or relevant discipline
Eligible to obtain and/or maintain a DoD securityclearance
8years contact center technology and operationsexperience required
4years within a technology leadership role
Strong client service and consulting skills
Experience with United Voice Communications
Abilityto travel 75% or more as needed
Howyou ll grow
AtDeloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at everylevel of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best workevery day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there salways room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in additionto hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. Fromon-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs at DeloitteUniversity, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue togrow throughout their career. ExploreDeloitte University, The Leadership Center. at https://zoomforth.com/s/deloitte/du#home
Benefits
AtDeloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value ourpeople and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you. at http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/life-at-deloitte-benefits-and-rewards.html
Deloitte s culture
Ourpositive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best workevery day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness andoffering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them tobe healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs andare continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our peopleexcel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.
Corporate citizenship
Deloitteis led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines whowe are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and ourcommunities. We believe that business has the power to inspire andtransform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, andleadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte s impact on the world. at http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/about-deloitte/articles/deloitte-corporate-citizenship.html
Recruiter tips
We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feelprepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you doyour research: know some background about the organization and the businessarea you re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals. at http://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/topics/recruiting-tips.html
