text:
Overview
Tyto Athene is a full-service integrator focused on helping clients accelerate their ability to make decisions by providing ubiquitous and secure access to enterprise information throughout their operating environment. Tyto Athene uses a myriad of technologies, innovative thinking, and proven processes to deliver successful outcomes for its clients worldwide.
The Wireless Sales Engineer provides:
Pre- and post-sale engineering expertise inclusive of design, integration, and support for the implementation, installation, configuration, test, activation, and ongoing change support for Wireless solutions
Work in partnership within operations and across various levels and departments of the organization to assist in planning, designing, migrating and troubleshooting client installation activities
Work collaboratively with clients to meet contractual obligations in a subject matter expert support role and manage client expectations to ensure that product and service deployments are successfully completed on time and meet technical, business and operational expectations
Monitor and drive throughout the project lifecycle to established implementation milestones, and participate in client status calls to ensure that projects remain on schedule
Ensure deployment engineering activities meet corporate client satisfaction objectives as well as internal and external SLAs
Responsibilities:
Provide pre-sales engineering services for developing of turnkey wireless solutions in response to identified opportunities to include opportunity technical assessment, requirements definition, statement of work/bill of material development, and technical writing
Provide post-sales engineering services for developing turnkey executable wireless solutions to include specification books, drawing inputs, implementation plans, test plans, and cutover plans
Proactively assess solution specifications in light of changing customer requirements, and recommend solution changes that optimize value for both the client and Tyto Athene organization.
Prepare documentation for internal and external clients detailing system designs and configuration of deployed solutions
Develop and maintain professional and productive relationships with clients, wireless vendors, such as Aruba, Ruckus, and Cisco as well as any related key contributors to ensure stable and quality product & service delivery consistent with company objectives and client expectations.
Provide technical overview of product architecture, functionality, system / data requirements, service delivery and integration with enterprise applications.
Continuously expand, research and leverage knowledge of market and industry trends and benchmarking to identify, recommend and implement best practices, methodologies and relevant analytics.
Continuously develop and enhance knowledge, skills and abilities through various learning channels to expand technical and non-technical capabilities. Ensure further expansion of skill-set in the operating systems, networking infrastructure and products & services that Tyto Athene supports.
Meet all financial performance objectives for area of responsibility and take corrective action as needed.
Implement and make recommendations to improve methodologies, core competencies and processes for deployment engineering to ensure stable and quality product & service delivery consistent with company objectives and client expectations.
Maintain and enhance a strong client service-oriented environment focused on problem prediction, detection and resolution. Proactively identify and remove barriers to meeting client expectations. Provide timely documentation of issues, action plan and outcome. Achieve all client satisfaction objectives and internal and external SLAs.
Actively and consistently recommend and support all efforts to improve, simplify, automate and enhance day to day service delivery operations and the client experience.
Foster and contribute toward collaborative working relationships within NACS operations and across all levels and departments of the organization to execute deployment engineering functions and company priorities.
Utilize escalation and exception paths, processes and systems to report current performance and make recommendations for improvement of performance.
Achieve performance targets established by leadership for applicable Key Performance Indicators.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Science or related field, or equivalent, relevant experience.
Minimum of 5 years with of engineering deployment responsibilities involving complex client requirements assessment, solutions design and implementation within the technology services industry. Experience with Managed Service Provider environment preferred.
Previous pre- and post-sales engineering experience with wireless solutions including requirement definitions and implementation plans, end to end system designs, equipment staging, configuration creation and testing, and solution deployment of varying types of software and/or hardware network solution deployments spanning geographical separation. Familiarity with major wireless OEM topologies, including Aruba, Rukus, and Cisco
Excellent Layer 2 & 3 networking skills including strong knowledge and proficiency in industry-standard networking technologies and infrastructures including cabling, LAN, WAN, and various telecommunication access methods as well as legacy networking technologies and system interdependencies. Cloud & Virtualization technologies preferred
End-to-end process thinker, with proven experience in business processes and workflow design.
Ability to conceptualize high-level turn-key wireless designs and transition to more detail-oriented design aspects
Excellent problem solving and systems analysis skills with demonstrated success in root cause analysis, effectiveness measurements and related documentation.
Demonstrated experience of continuously expanding and leveraging knowledge of technology, market and industry trends with success in identifying, recommending and implementing best practices and methodologies.
Ability to work effectively across all functional groups to optimize product & service offerings, fostering a seamless internal and external client experience and track record of timely and accurate issue resolution.
Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Outlook, SharePoint, ERP, AutoCAD, service delivery management tools and related cloud based technology systems.

text:
System/Network Engineer
Job description
We are looking for a System and Network Engineer.
Key Performance Areas ( Duties & Responsibilities):
Research hardware and software solutions and create plans, including layouts and product specifications, for all data communication networks resulting from meetings
Present findings in report format to appropriate personnel and explain how the new communications network will address current issues
Secure all hardware and software required for network solutions or supervise network administrator tasked with securing all hardware and software
Plan out network installation and/or upgrade project, assign milestone tasks to support personnel and meet company deadlines for full implementation, including network and user station set-ups and permissions, installation of all software and end-user security
Assign and supervise network support staff in their daily activities and during special projects
Write and implement networking protocols company-wide and department policies and procedures
Research and analyse new network technologies and present suggestions for upgrades to improve existing communications network
Design and develop global networking solutions, emphasizing usability, performance, reliability and support ability
Provide operational support assistance throughout corporate networking infrastructure and services
Manage vendor relationships
Implement network management and monitoring solutions
Troubleshoot and resolve operational issues, such as switches, routers and wireless, in a multi-routing infrastructure
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field or equivalent career expertise Experience with enterprise business and large-scale LAN/WAN environments, network security principles, network capacity planning and general network management best practices Expert at Cisco and IOS Expert in VMWare configuration and troubleshooting Knowledgeable in various network technologies, services and protocols Excellent written and verbal communications skills, including presentation skills Analytical and organizational skills
Planning, procurement, designing, developing, configuring and commissioning networks and associated systems for network monitoring and incident management.
Network documentation and policy design/compliance.
Analysing, evaluating and monitoring network infrastructure to ensure networks are configured to operate at optimal performance.
Troubleshooting and diagnosing network problems and determining the most appropriate means of resolving problems and issues to improve network performance.
Monitoring the overall performance of systems to assess the need for updates, upgrades, enhancements, preventive maintenance and new systems, and recommending options for upgrading and improving the performance of systems.
Scheduling and conducting quality audit inspections.
Liaising with network carriers and external resources for these organisations; defining and monitoring contractual obligations, performance delivery and service level agreements.
Management and reconciliation of network supplier costs.
Design and implementation of the processes, procedures and operational management associated with high levels of network availability and risk management.
Capacity planning.
24 x 7 Support of Network Services
Required Advanced Technical Skills:
VMWare, SQL, and Terminal Services
Exchange Server 2003 – 2016
Office 365
Windows Server 2003 – 2016
WAN Technology (MPLS, VPLS, VPN)
SonicWALL: CSSA/CSSP
Manage Engine
Labtech Certified Professional
MCSA Server 2016
MCSE Server Infrastructure
OSX troubleshooting
VPN connectivity troubleshooting and configuration (Cisco, SonicWall, OpenVPN, IPSec).
Security software such as Anti-virus, Anti-SPAM, Anti-Spyware, and other security related technologies

title: System/Network Engineer

name: Network Engineer
summary: The Network Engineer is a dynamic role with multiple critical IT functions. This person’s primary r...
text:
The Network Engineer is a dynamic role with multiple critical IT functions. This person’s primary responsibility is to insure the functionality and operability of core and secondary systems; servers and end points, during all hours of business operations. Additionally, the Network Engineer will manage the day-to-day relationship between El Cap and its designated managed services provider to ensure that end user support needs are always being met. This individual will perform a wide variety of evaluation, maintenance, installation and training tasks to ensure the computer network performance meets company and user expectations. Most activity will be performed at El Cap’s Denver offices, with occasional travel to gym locations as needed.
Network Engineer is focused on:
· Delivering service that meets internal SLA and delights the customer (KPI: SLA achieved & high customer satisfaction)
· Project work in a virtual team environment.
· Managing IT Network/Telephony/Azure cloud infrastructure.
· IT asset management.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
· Maintain a thorough understanding of the basics behind the Internet and its workings. (DNS, Security, IP Routing, HTTP, VPN, Email Routing, SPAM, etc.)
· Manages IT telephony and ISP accounts and vendor relationships.
· Configure switching environments between inter-state sites.
· Design, setup and configure complex wireless networking that supports open or secured access.
· Managing assigned projects and program components to deliver services in accordance with established objectives.
· Responding to inquiries from staff, administrators, service providers, site personnel and outside vendors, etc. to provide 2nd level technical assistance and support.
· Monitor network activity for usage and potential security risks.
· Operates and manages the IT asset tracking system.
· Administer the enterprise wide VOIP telephony system.
· Engage front line end users via phone/e-mail for level 1 and/or 2 support.
· Works within the process to insure SLA goals are met.
· Ships and receives IT equipment to and from remote sites.
· May travel up to 10% for rollouts, closures, organic openings, etc.
· Installs and removes equipment as needed.
· Supports Office365, Windows 10, Chrome, POS peripherals, and other third-party applications.
· Manages the Active Directory environment; ADUC, ADFS, Office365, and Azure.
· Must be able to carry up to 30lbs.
· Additional duties as assigned by management.
Job Qualifications:
· 4-year degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or the equivalent in professional experience.
· Advanced technical, analytical, and interpersonal skills are required.
· Windows Server 2012 and 2016; SQL experience a plus.
· Knowledge of VoIP implementation and support
· Previous enterprise VOIP telephony management required.
· Experienced within Microsoft Azure and/or AWS administration.
· Previous IT asset tracking experience.
· Must have experience working with network traffic inspection technologies.
· Must be a subject matter expert on Office365.
· Thorough understanding of Active Directory and its use for systems administration.
· Previous enterprise level anti-virus suite management experience.
· PowerShell scripting knowledge.

text:
Description
Job Description:
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for a Information Network Engineer at Fort Meade, MD. This position is part of a large program supporting Air Combat Command’s (ACC) Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission.
Job Summary
The Network Engineer candidate will be responsible for maintaining computer infrastructures with emphasis on networking.
Responsibilities
On-site servers, software-network interactions as well as network integrity/resilience are the key areas of focus.
Plan, implement and oversee the computer networks that support in-house voice, data, video and wireless network services.
Facilitate planning, design and identify technical specifications for all equipment.
The Defense Group at Leidos currently has an opening for a Information Network Engineer at Fort Meade, MD. This position is part of a large program supporting Air Combat Command’s (ACC) Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission.
Job Summary
The Network Engineer candidate will be responsible for maintaining computer infrastructures with emphasis on networking.
Primary Responsibilities
Responsibilities may include on-site servers, software-network interactions as well as network integrity/resilience are the key areas of focus. A network engineer is a technology professional who has the necessary skills to plan, implement and oversee the computer networks that support in-house voice, data, video and wireless network services. The candidate will be expected to facilitate planning, design and identify technical specifications for all equipment.
Basic Qualifications
TS/SCI Cleared with current C/I Polygraph
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology and 10+ years of experience.
5+ years of experience with networking
5+ years of experience with Cisco, including switching and routing
4+ years of experience with fiber optic capabilities and usage and network management applications
1+ years of experience with Juniper, including switching and routing
CompTIA Security+
CompTIA Network+
CompTIA A+
?
Preferred Qualifications
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP)
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE)
Experience supporting the ACC ISR enterprise.
External Referral Bonus:
Eligible
Potential for Telework:
No
Clearance Level Required:
Top Secret/SCI with Polygraph
Travel:
Yes, 10% of the time
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40
Shift:
Day
Requisition Category:
Professional
Job Family:
Network Administration and Ops
Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com.
Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here.
Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

summary: Looking for more than just another assignment? We're looking for you! This isn't just another assig...
text:
Looking for more than just another assignment? We're looking for you! This isn't just another assignment, but a real opportunity and a challenge for the right person. LRS Consulting Services needs an experienced Network Engineer for a contract opportunity in Greenwood Village, CO.
LRS Consulting Services has been delivering the highest quality consultants to our clients since 1979. We've built a solid reputation for dealing with our clients and our consultants with honesty, integrity, and respect. We work hard every day to maintain that reputation, and we're very interested in candidates who can help us. If you're that candidate, this opportunity is made for you!
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience.
Participates in network planning, network architecture design and engineering.
Integrates and schematically depicts communication architectures, topologies, hardware, software,
transmission and signaling links and protocols into complete network configurations.
Evaluates new products, performs network problem resolution.
Assists in the development and documentation of technical standards.
Develops and implements approved methods of procedure.
Designs and establishes protocol compatibility standards, develops and implements network
enhancements and makes recommendations for improvement.
Works on projects/ systems/issues of medium to high complexity surrounding network planning, configuration and optimization.
Provides escalated tier support across organizations and to third party vendors.
Works on one or more projects as a project team member, occasionally as a project team lead.
Coaches less experienced staff.
Adhere to industry specific local, state, and federal regulations, as applicable.
Knows, understands and follows company policy.
Performs other duties as requested by supervisor.
QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
Requires a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent demonstrated work experience in an engineering related field
Requires a minimum of 5+ years working experience in data network services and network architectures
CCNA, JNCIS, or equivalent industry certification required, CCNP or JNCIP preferred
Knowledge of company products and services preferred
Current industry and vendor specific certifications and training is preferred
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES:
Ability to read, write and speak the English language to communicate with employees, customers, suppliers, in person, on the phone, and by written communications in a clear, straight-forward, and professional manner
Ability to use personal computer and software applications
Advanced data networking knowledge (OSI Model, TCP/IP, Optical Transport)
Ability to work in a team environment
Advanced knowledge of related industry specifications and standards IEEE, ANSI, Fiber (Multimode, Single mode, UTP, etc.), Bridging, Switching, Routing, Ethernet and Transport technologies and protocols
Advanced Knowledge in network design, network architecture, protocols and network topology
Advanced knowledge in using ticketing and software tools to support the current operations.
Advanced Knowledge of basic network devices and basic network appliances
Advanced knowledge of network designing software, such as Visio
Ability to perform duties in a very fast pace environment and ability to learn new technology quickly
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office
LRS is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for employment will receive consideration without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, gender identity, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, citizenship status or protected veteran status.

summary:
You
As a Network Engineer, youll work with the network engineering team, in support of a federal he...
text:
You
As a Network Engineer, youll work with the network engineering team, in support of a federal healthcare enterprise environment, including medical research and administration. The engineer will apply standardized and consistent engineering methods to ensure reliability, availability, performance, and security of the enterprise network infrastructure and services.
Key responsibilities to include design, deploy and maintain network infrastructure and services to utilize best practices to include ITIL, Agile, Engineering Life Cycle, and Lean IT principles; monitor, evaluate, analyze and tune network performance including availability, utilization, throughput, and latency; plan and execute the selection, installation, configuration, and testing of equipment, software, and tools; and participate in defining network standards and procedures.
Youll also provide second level support for network service related issue/items across the entire enterprise; serve as an escalation point in troubleshooting network problems; escalate problems to vendor when necessary; promote IT security throughout the network including through the development of network access control, firewalls, etc.; create and maintain documentation including reference architectures, diagrams, SOPs, etc; develop, test, evaluate and execute upgrades, enhancements, and new solutions for network services; and act as a subject matter expert for network infrastructure and services.
Us
We were founded as a fresh alternative in the Government Consulting Community and are dedicated to the belief that results are a product of analytical thinking, agile design principles and that solutions are built in collaboration with, not for, our customers. This mantra drives us to succeed and act as true partners in advancing our clients missions.
Program Mission
This engagement provides a full range of infrastructure support to a federal agency including server architecture design & maintenance, application hosting and administration, providing fixes & upgrade patches, and ensuring cyber security compliance protections. Youll join a team balancing process-driven IT operations and Lean engineering with an integrated culture of continuous improvement, coupled with innovation and high-quality support services.
Requirements
Working knowledge of basic network fundamentals, including but not limited to switching, routing, DNS, DHCP, IPv4, IPv6, subnetting, network segmentation, VLANs, QoS, NAT, firewalls and load balancers.
Experience in all phases of the engineering lifecycle including conceptualization, planning, requirements gathering, design, development, testing, implementation, operations and maintenance.
Ability to drive projects to successful completion in coordination with stakeholders and peers.
Expertise in identifying new networking solutions or improvements to existing network infrastructure and solutions.
Focus on customer service over technology.
Ability and willingness to communicate effectively and appropriately.
Desired Skills
Experience engineering network solutions for cloud environments such as AWS, GCP, Azure.
Experience with automation, scripting, and the design of workflows.
Experience engineering and administering:
network switches and routers, preferably Extreme Networks.
enterprise wireless networks, preferably Extreme Networks.
firewalls, preferably Palo Alto.
load balancers, preferably F5.
DHCP/DNS/IPAM, preferably Infoblox.
network monitoring and management tools such as Extreme Networks XMC, SolarWinds, Cacti, syslog.
Expertise in the physical infrastructure and environmental considerations of data center and LAN closet facilities, including power, cooling, racks, cable plant and cable management.
Experience in planning and deploying network infrastructure to newly constructed or renovated buildings, including the construction of standards-based LAN closets.
Experience in second-level problem identification, diagnosis, and resolution of network problems.
Ability to provide technical guidance to team members and lower level technicians.
Working knowledge of endpoints on the network, including workstations (Windows, OS X, Linux), scientific equipment, printers, phones, servers, IoT devices, etc.
Experience in network monitoring and management.
Understanding and ability to follow industry-proven methodologies, preferably ITIL, Agile, and/or Lean IT.
Network Professional certifications, preferably Extreme Networks or Cisco.
Years of Experience: 6+ years of experience.
Education: Bachelors or equivalent experience.
Clearance: Must be able to obtain and maintain a federal Public Trust/Suitability.
Requirements
Working knowledge of basic network fundamentals, including but not limited to switching, routing, DNS, DHCP, IPv4, IPv6, subnetting, network segmentation, VLANs, QoS, NAT, firewalls and load balancers.
Experience in all phases of the engineering lifecycle including conceptualization, planning, requirements gathering, design, development, testing, implementation, operations and maintenance.
Ability to drive projects to successful completion in coordination with stakeholders and peers.
Expertise in identifying new networking solutions or improvements to existing network infrastructure and solutions.
Focus on customer service over technology.
Ability and willingness to communicate effectively and appropriately.
Desired Skills
Experience engineering network solutions for cloud environments such as AWS, GCP, Azure.
Experience with automation, scripting, and the design of workflows.
Experience engineering and administering:
network switches and routers, preferably Extreme Networks.
enterprise wireless networks, preferably Extreme Networks.
firewalls, preferably Palo Alto.
load balancers, preferably F5.
DHCP/DNS/IPAM, preferably Infoblox.
network monitoring and management tools such as Extreme Networks XMC, SolarWinds, Cacti, syslog.
Expertise in the physical infrastructure and environmental considerations of data center and LAN closet facilities, including power, cooling, racks, cable plant and cable management.
Experience in planning and deploying network infrastructure to newly constructed or renovated buildings, including the construction of standards-based LAN closets.
Experience in second-level problem identification, diagnosis, and resolution of network problems.
Ability to provide technical guidance to team members and lower level technicians.
Working knowledge of endpoints on the network, including workstations (Windows, OS X, Linux), scientific equipment, printers, phones, servers, IoT devices, etc.
Experience in network monitoring and management.
Understanding and ability to follow industry-proven methodologies, preferably ITIL, Agile, and/or Lean IT.
Network Professional certifications, preferably Extreme Networks or Cisco.
Years of Experience: 6+ years of experience.
Education: Bachelors or equivalent experience.
Clearance: Must be able to obtain and maintain a federal Public Trust/Suitability.

text:
Financial Services organisation requires a Network Engineer to work within a large and busy infrastructure team
Sydney
The position comes with a diverse range of responsibilities and challenges, such as:
Configuration and maintenance of the networking and communications infrastructure
Providing technical input regarding the company network design, proposing ideas and solutions for network service improvement
Network management and systems maintenance to ensure the integrity of the network
Direct regular audits of network components to ensure that all network devices are being constantly managed and monitored
Provide technical expertise in the area of data and network performance and upgrades, for both day to day activities and projects.
To be successful for the role you must be able to demonstrate you have the following:
5 years' experience as an Engineer in a large complex organisation.
Hands on Routing and Switching (CISCO)
Managing/maintaining Citrix ADC products (MPX/SDX) and Bluecoat products (ProxySG, CAS)
Excellent communication skills and a desire to do a great job.
Provide timely and accurate support to the team

text:
Looking for a skilled Network Engineer with Telco experience, initial 6-month contract, potential to extend
Sydney
Looking for a skilled Network Engineer to join this leading Telco on an initial 6-month contract, with potential to extend.
Roles and Responsibilities include:
Managing the on-boarding of network elements onto the SIEM (Security Incident Event Management). Platforms supported include - UNIX/Linux servers,
Liaising with other groups within the NMC, Tier2, Engineering and vendors.
Liaising with Trustwave to ensure all required element types are successfully on-boarded and relevant use cases are tested.
Continuous process review, improvements and implementation.
Adhering to local area procedures such as WH&S and security policy.
Skills & Experience required:
2-3 years' experience in telecommunications.
Extensive experience in a technical role in one or more of the following areas: Unix and Linux operating systems,
Knowledge of Log collection and analysis tools
RSYSLOG and SYSLOG versions on Linux/UNIX systems and understanding how to process flatfiles, log files and syslog events onto LOG management tools
SIEM use case testing/verification
Development and implementation of standards and procedures.
Understanding of network architecture and elements
Please do not hesitate to apply.
If you need more information please contact araghotham@paxus.com.au

text:
Lead Network Engineer
Job ID: 2020-24767
Location:
Hicksville, NY 11801
Due to COVID-19, we are prioritizing Internal AUSA candidates for the first 10 business days.
Altice USA is a cutting-edge communications, media, and tech company. We connect people to what matters most to them; texting with friends, advertising that resonates, or binge watching their favorite show. Our differentiated approach centers around technologies that push the envelope and deliver the ultimate customer experience. We're building a workforce that attracts and retains the best talent, not only to meet the needs of our customers, but that also reflects the diverse communities we serve. We're not the only ones who have seen it; we've recently been recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers as well as by the Human Rights Campaign, DiversityInc Magazine, and Cablefax for our diversity & inclusion program.
Altice USA is seeking a Lead Network Engineer with extensive experience designing and building diverse and complex multi-vendor networks. The candidate will play a key role in the design and implementation of processes, procedures, policies, and standards related to the enterprise network and is responsible for the technical "success" of these projects. The candidate must be capable of leading project-related technical meetings and multitasking across many diverse project activities, ultimately ensuring that cost-effective and efficient infrastructure environments are built to satisfy project requirements and business objectives.
Responsibilities
Research/analyze/define/propose/design/document/implement network solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment to achieve business objectives.
Clearly and concisely communicate both written and verbally with peers, management and business stakeholders.
Develop documentation including operations manuals and procedural documents
Generate and validate ROI and budget calculations for network solutions.
Generate technical presentations based on results of design/sand-box testing and present to upper management.
Appropriately respond to and successfully deliver any and all ad hoc requests made by the management team.
Participate in advanced problem resolution.
Develop automation routines
Qualifications / Requirements
Expert level technical knowledge and 8+ years experience in the design and implementation of Cisco route/switch/VPN/firewall in large 1000+ node Enterprise environments
Expert level knowledge of routed protocols - BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, VXLAN/EVPN
Experience in the design and deployment of virtualized Data Center networks utilizing Cisco Application-Centric
Infrastructure on Nexus 9k/5k/2k platforms and VMWare NSX
Experience migrating from traditional tiered data center designs to Cisco ACI and other SDN methods
Excellent understanding of VPN technologies (site-to-site, remote access client, IPSec, IKE, tunnel modes, SSL/clientless/AnyConnect, tunnels between firewalls, routers)
Experience with cloud delivery models including Openstack, AWS, and GCS
Extensive experience with packet sniffing and Protocol Analysis Software
Deep understanding of VRF
Proficiency with F5 load balancing platforms
Experience with Cisco VoIP Platforms
Cisco and Aruba WiFi knowledge, both autonomous and controller-based
Experience with NAC solutions from Cisco or Aruba for integration with wireless and wired infrastructure
Experience with Cisco next-gen ASA/FTD/Firepower platforms and associated management systems
Experience working with Checkpoint appliance platforms and all associated management systems
Development of automation solutions to integrate with existing route, switch, load balancing, and firewall technologies a plus
Experience with Python scripting a plus
BS,BA, EE or Equivalent, relevant network certifications (CCNP, CCIE) and/or equivalent work experience
Industry Certifications across several disciplines a plus
Superior documentation skills
Must be able to work in a fast-paced team environment and self-manage tasks
Moderate travel with little or no notice
Required to participate in an on-call rotation (includes evenings, weekends and occasional holidays
Altice USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, color, creed, national origin, religion, age, marital status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.
Altice USA, Inc. collects personal information about its applicants for employment that may include personal identifiers, professional or employment related information, photos, education information and/or protected classifications under federal and state law. This information is collected for employment purposes, including identification, work authorization, FCRA-compliant background screening, human resource administration and compliance with federal, state and local law.

text:
Sep 22, 2016, 12:19 PM
Company Information
Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with 2014 pro forma annual revenue of circa ï¿½ 11 billion and 93,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.
Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, and Worldline. Our ability to deliver Operational Excellence means that we are always ready and able to help our clients address whatever challenges they face, wherever they are in the world. We also place great emphasis on understanding and meeting the needs and priorities of our clients, including their sustainability objectives.
Atos values the individual and strives to deliver an appropriate work-life balance because a motivated and happy person can add untold value to our clients and colleagues around the world. For more information, please see the Atos corporate web site: www.atos.net. Job Description This position will occasionally interact with Supervisors/Managers, customers, and/or functional peer group Engineers, normally involving matters between functional areas, or other company divisions or units. Often must participate in cross functional support teams. Must have a demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks and communicate in English effectively through voice and email. This position must possess good network troubleshooting and impact assessment skills. Must have experience in configuration and troubleshooting of the following equipment/systems:- Cisco routers and switches - Cisco Firewalls- Cisco Load Balancers- Experience with other vendor Load Balancers and Firewalls is desired as well. (F5, ACE)- Experience with WAN Optimization devices is desired (Cisco.)- Experince with Solarwins & Cisco Prime - Bluesocket- Cisco Secure ACS - Cisco ASA FW - Cisco IDS/IPS - Cisco ISE- Cisco Switch/Router- Cisco VPN - Cisco WLC- Citrix Netscaler - Citrix Secure Gateways - Citrix XenMobile- CriticalWatch- FireEye EX ï¿½HX - NX- Snort IDS- Solarwinds Orion Config Manager- Websense Data Security - Email Security Websense Web Security May perform or participate with a Sr Network Engineer on one or more of the following:- Manage the installation, maintenance, and monitoring of the organizationï¿½s local area network systems- Manages the installation, maintenance, and monitoring of the organizations wide area network systems- Assist in the development and evaluation of network performance criteria and measurement methods- Participate in the testing and analysis of all components of network facilities to ensure operational status- Identify network problems and work to resolution of the problem- Participate in an On-Call Rotation for the client- Any other duties as assigned This position requires at least 10yrs of experience.- CCNA Certification is required.- CCNP Certification is required.- CCSP Certification is required.*LI-POST Job Requirements Position Requirements- A minimum of 10 years working as network engineer- Excel Reporting - Experience with wireless- Experience with Cisco, firewalls,F5- Prefered certifications - Cisco- CCNA, CCDA, CCNP, CCDP, (CCIE is a plus)

name: Cisco Wireless Senior Network Engineer (remote virtual work at home eligible)
summary:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components su...
text:
Description
The Senior Network Engineer designs, analyzes, plans and modifies network components supporting customer communication implementation activities. The Senior Network Engineer work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
Responsibilities
The Senior Network Engineer develops and evaluates network performance criteria and measurement methods. Prepares the analysis of the short-term or long-term capacity needs for switching, routing transmission and signaling. Conducts network architecture design, feasibility and cost studies. Develops alternative routing scenarios and changes in required sequence of network activities. Conducts economic and population growth studies to determine impact on network capacity and development plan projections. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
Required Qualifications
+ 5 or more years of experience Cisco Wireless Network Engineering
+ Experienced with monitoring tools such as Solar Winds/Orion, Lancope, LiveAction or similar required
+ Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences
+ Must be a highly effective communicator with the ability to lead and influence
Desired Qualifications:
+ CCNA/CCNP Highly preferred
+ Experienced with SDWA(Viptela etc )
+ MPLS
+ Metro-E
+ DWDM
+ 5g Wireless
Scheduled Weekly Hours
40
About Us
Mission: At Humana, our cultural foundation is aligned to helping members achieve their best health by delivering personalized, simplified, whole-person healthcare experiences. Recognizing healthcare needs continue to evolve for each person, for each family and for each community, Humana continuously creates innovative solutions and resources that help people live their healthiest lives on their terms -when and where they need it. Our employees are at the heart of making this happen and that's why we are dedicated to building an organization of dynamic talent whose experience and passion center on putting the customer first.
Equal Opportunity Employer
It is our policy to recruit, hire, train, and promote people without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or veteran status, except where age, sex, or physical status is a bona fide occupational qualification. View the EEO is the Law poster.
If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact mailbox_tas_recruit@humana.com for assistance.
Humana Safety and Security
Humana will never ask, nor require a candidate provide money for work equipment and network access during the application process. If you become aware of any instances where you as a candidate are asked to provide information and do not believe it is a legitimate request from Humana or affiliate, please contact mailbox_tas_recruit@humana.com to validate the request.

summary: Holtec International, a rapidly growing company, is looking for a Network Administrator/Engineer. T...
text:
Holtec International, a rapidly growing company, is looking for a Network Administrator/Engineer. This will be a full time position on-site in Camden, NJ. This is a 24/7/365 company that needs an individual who is up to working in a challenging but exciting environment.
Job Description:
The Network Administrator/Engineer responsibilities will include:
? Establishes networking environment by designing system configuration; directing system installation; defining, documenting, and enforcing system standards.
? Maximizes network performance by monitoring performance; troubleshooting network problems and outages; scheduling upgrades; collaborating with network architects on network optimization.
? Secures network system by establishing and enforcing policies; defining and monitoring access.
? Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
? Accomplishes information systems and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
? Reporting network operational status by gathering, prioritizing information; managing projects.
? Manage LAN/WAN network (firewall, routers, switches, VPN)
? Monitor network performance; troubleshoot network problems and outages; scheduling upgrades
? Manage vendor relationship for equipment, outside monitoring, and Internet carriers.
? Prepare and maintains appropriate written documentation for systems, infrastructure, maintenance logs, and procedures.
Tech used:
Windows server 2003-2016
Windows desktop xp-10
Active directory/windows dhcp/windows dns
Vmware 5.5-6.5
DellOS switches (N1500 & N4000)
HP Procurve switches
HP 5700 flexfiber switches
Dell equallogics
EMC VNXe
Linux (ubuntu required, centos/redhat nice to have)
PRTG
Watchguard firewalls
Cisco SG300 switches
Aerohive and HP wireless
Avaya phones
MSTP, RSTP, OSPF, Static routing, Vlans, QoS
LTO6 tapes and HP Tape library
Veeam backup software
DFS/DFSr
SFP+/fiber for switches
Symantec AV
Windows Deployment Server
Windows update server (WSUS)
Gitlab/docker
Rancid/ansible
Sql server 2005-2014
Starwind
Hardware/software raid/SAN tech
Windows AD trusts/cross forest trusts
Office 365
Powershell/bat scripting
Windows GPO/policies for AD
Qualifications:
Cisco certification (CCNA, CCNP, etc.) or equivalent knowledge and proven work experience.
SitetoSite IPSec VPNs, Client IPSec VPN SSL VPN
Cisco switches (sg300) ? IOS, HP Procurve and flexfabric switches, Dell N series switches, SFP+/fiber/gbic knowledge
Network software (RANCID, Ansible, SNMP)
Spiceworks, PRTG, Syslog,
Storage Area Networks/NetApp
Equallogic PS6000, PS4000 ? Equallogic SAN groups, Synology
VLAN, QoS, TCP/IP, OSPF, TP, RSTP, SNMP, OSPF, VRRP, MSTP
Wireless networks
VMware ESXi (version 4, 5, 5.5-6.5) ? VMware vCenter vSphere ?
After hours on a rotating basis will be required. Minimal travel (20%) may be required between sites.

name: RCIT DATA NETWORK ENGINEER III
summary:
THE COUNTY OF RIVERSIDE HAS
AN EXCITING OPPORTUNITY FOR
RCIT DATA NETWORK ENGINEER III
The Riversid...
text:
THE COUNTY OF RIVERSIDE HAS
AN EXCITING OPPORTUNITY FOR
RCIT DATA NETWORK ENGINEER III
The Riverside County Information Technology Department (RCIT) has an opportunity for an RCIT Data Network Engineer III who will be assigned to the Converged Communications Bureau (CCB) located in Riverside. The selected candidate will be tasked with researching, designing and implementing wireless technologies, data networks and firewalls.
RCIT seeks applicants who hold Cisco Certified Network Associate certification and are experienced in; network architecting, Cisco controller based wireless networks, routing and switching; and firewalls. Additionally, incumbents must possess the ability to communicate and articulate ideas clearly and concisely in both written and verbal form.
Competitive candidates will be those with; extensive experience with Data Network Centers, Cisco Certified Network Profession (CCNP) certification; Palo Alto Fire firewalls; and experience with Python, Java, PHP, Javascript, C++ and other scripting languages.
Mentor, advise, and train subordinate engineering staff; may participate in the employee selection process; monitor and review the work of engineering staff.
Oversee the design, analyze, and define enterprise WAN, ISP, and data center network infrastructure based on customer requirements, available and emerging technologies, and cost analysis.
Provide lead engineering support and troubleshooting of networks and networked environments for Data Operations.
Lead the enhancement of enterprise data network operations and performance through proactive monitoring, analysis, and configuration of the network for all County departments.
Implement various networks for multi-faceted applications ranging from financials, network security, data center connectivity, network monitoring, wireless, LAN/WAN, voice, video conferencing, virtual desktop environment, and clinical applications.
Monitor the measurement of network resource availability, performance, and capacity on a scheduled basis.
Create schedules for network testing and maintenance; track changes to the network environment.
Act as third level escalation point for the timely resolution of network-related problems and performance deficiencies.
Create and maintain detailed physical and logical network designs or drawings.
Oversee the development of disaster recovery plans; maintain and update documentation as required.
Act as a project engineer and lead for the definition of customer technical requirements, preparation of specifications, statements of work, contracts, proposals, studies, reports, conceptual and detailed designs, construction drawings, and documentation packages.
Oversee the preparation of engineering instructions for installation or modification of new or replaced equipment; determine most cost effective method of installation or modification.
Provider oversight to the installation or modification of projects; coordinate with field technicians and contractors until projects are complete and operational as required.
Establish technical hardware and software standards based on analysis of system performance, integration needs, and current and emerging technology, unit goals, and/or cost analysis.
Collaborate with vendors to remain current on industry trends and standards.
Develop strategic plans for maximum optimization and growth of LAN/WAN.
Conduct technology evaluations and selections, including the development of evaluation criteria and procedures.
Research and analyze common vendor products, request for information, request for quote, and request for proposal development.
Oversee the development of RFI/RFQ/RFP's.
Develop and maintain data network security requirements based on County Information Security Office (CISO) standards.
Define and implement network security best practices; audit security compliance.
Check and validate calculated mathematical requirements for the design and planning of telecommunications networks, systems, and equipment.
Oversee the preparation of specification for equipment and systems implementation for adequate design and compliance of operational requirements.
Recommend to management infrastructure enhancements for efficiency and technological advantage; consult with users in planning for future needs; maintain awareness of best practices and emerging technology.
Research, evaluate, test, and recommend products; recommend product versions and services for business needs.
Research and prepare white papers for management on emerging technologies.
Assist County departments and agencies in developing medium and long range telecommunication plans; develop cost estimates for budgetary purposes; research and recommend alternatives that will best meet operational requirements and budgetary constraints.
Ensure and maintain budget development and compliance.
Compile and evaluate data to provide justification of requests for equipment and materials to be included in the budget.
Identify all end of life (EOL) issues within the system(s) and provide management with recommendations for new purchases, budgetary estimates, and interim solutions if needed.
Engage with appropriate organizations and resources; communicate project requirements; ensure and monitor that required activates are completed within the budget and in a timely manner.
OPTION I
Education: Graduation from an accredited college or university with an Associate's degree, preferably with a major in computer science, computer information systems, telecommunications, information management, or a closely related field to the assignment. (Additional qualifying experience may be substituted for the required education on the basis of one year of experience for one year of education).
Experience: A minimum of six years of professional experience in which four years were in a journey level capacity in one or more of the following areas: planning, designing, or implementing enterprise-wide data networks encompassing data, voice, and video with security as a major component.
OPTION II
Education: Possession of two (2) valid Cisco certificates.
Experience: A minimum of six years of professional experience in which four years were in a journey level capacity in one or more of the following areas: planning, designing, or implementing enterprise-wide data networks encompassing data, voice, and video with security as a major component.
Th most competitive candidates will be those with; extensive experience with Data Network Centers, Cisco Certified Network Profession (CCNP) certification; Palo Alto Fire firewalls; and experience with Python, Java, PHP, Javascript, C++ and other scripting languages.
ALL OPTIONS
Knowledge of: Conceptual design, customer needs assessment, report writing, installation, maintenance, specifications, and current technology expertise related to LAN, WAN, and network-connected devices; Cisco switches, routers, and firewalls; LAN/WAN architecture and the configuration of the devices; preparation of system diagrams, system levels, assembly drawings, physical layout drawings, circuit and interconnected diagrams, and organization and systems integration; carrier-provided services; TCP/IP fundamentals (including all 7 layers of the OSI model); network security management; access and authentication; data integrity; business recovery; operation environment requirements; physical security; engineering tools involving design, installation, operation, and maintenance of wired and/or wireless communication systems using computer aided design and drafting, program management, and traffic analysis; network monitoring and administration tools (SolarWinds); Cisco wireless controllers, Cisco Prime, Cisco ISE (WLAN, 802.11x) management and technologies; planning, designing, implementing, and maintaining Quality of Services (QOS) in a large enterprise WAN; INFOBLOX DNS service.
Ability to: Design, implement, and maintain large TCP/IP based Wide Area Networks (minimum 400 routers and over 50,000 connected devices); utilize various routing protocols including EIGRP, OSPF, BGP and multicast; GETVPN; plan, design, implement, and support data networks utilizing services (e.g., Ethernet, MPLS, DWDM, CWDM T1/T3, OC-3/12); analyze and resolve multi-dimensional system problems spanning network hardware and software layers; utilize Visio software tools; demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills; work in a fast paced environment; demonstrate strong customer management and service skills; interpret and follow written and oral instructions; establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff, customers, employees, and the public; communicate effectively with people at all organizational levels.
License/Certificate: Possession of a valid California Driver's License is required.
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) - Required
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP), and Network security certification(s) such as CISSP, SANS, or GIAC is preferred.
Knowledge of communication standards and limitations.
Working knowledge of TCP/IP addressing and routing, IP Multicast, VLAN's, SSL, FTP, SMTP, and other OSI protocols is required.
Afterhours, weekends, and holiday work are required. (Standby duty rotation of one week per month.)
A successful Security Clearance conducted by the Sheriffs' Department is required for positions within the Riverside County Information Technology Department.

text:
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network
Canberra
To provide technical support by resolving incidents, installation, project delivery, maintenance for the Datacentre Communications Network and ensure end to end operational availability of network systems within service levels and / or service expectations.
General Attributes:
Network level: WAN and LAN connectivity, routers, firewalls, and security.
Internal systems, and Data centre network infrastructure.
Act as point of contact between customer and engineers.

Complete project activities as required on behalf of the customer.
Define and document requirements and provide design documentation as appropriate
Assist with and generate Design's, Solutions & execute new installations and upgrades as necessary complying with the change management process.

Experience with UCSD.
ITIL Foundations Certificate

MPLS, VPLS, VPN);,Proficiency in management and troubleshooting of the network infrastructure devices (access points, firewall, routers, switches, controllers);,Proficiency in switching (Capacity Planning & VLAN’s), routing (OSPF, RIPv2, BGP) and IP addressing;,Quality of Service (QoS) and rate shaping;,Checkpoint: CSSA/CSSP;,Understanding of VPNs, POTS, VOIP, SIP Trunking, BGP, VLAN, Large Scale Wi-Fi Deployments;,Understanding of OSI or related models;,Proficiency with fiber-based PON LAN networks;,Understanding of public cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure and AWS);,Experience in network security, encryption and security concepts (DDoS protection, intrusion prevention and detection systems (IPS/IDS) and proxy servers);,Security software (anti-virus, anti-SPAM, anti-Spyware and other);,Virtual Private Network (VPN) and encryption/tunneling protocols;,Ability to prepare documentation for design and planning network communication systems;,Ability to learn quickly using trainings, documentation and internet resources;,Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to perform well under pressure;,Ability to work on call outside of regular working hours;,Working well both independently and in team;,Excellent communication skills.,Desirable Qualifications,Understanding of other networks such as MANs, GANs, SAN, CAN, PAN, DAN;,Additional certifications such as Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) or Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP), Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) or Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA), CompTIA Network+, etc.;,Proficiency managing and configuring network monitoring tools;,Networking certification (JNCIE/CCNA/CCNP/CCIE);,Firewall certification (CCSA/CCSM/CSSA);,Cloud certification (CSSP);,Ability to multitask;,Desire to learn, apply learnings and willingness to teach others.

tasks:
Ready for Business trips
JOB DESCRIPTION
Scope of Work
The Network Engineer is responsible for the implementation, maintenance, development and support to Senior Network Engineer in design of communication networks and connectivity components within the organization and/or project facilities. The goal of the Network Engineer is to ensure maximum performance of a high traffic network infrastructure while maintaining the system integrity. (S)he should deeply understand the logical and physical, private and public network components including WAPs, firewalls, routers, switches, controllers, transit, peering, transport, cloud and security protocols and techniques. Primary duties include establishment and maintenance of networks by building net configurations and connections, maintenance and protection of data, hardware and software from different attacks, troubleshooting network problems and equipment, carrying out disaster recovery operations and replacing faulty network hardware components when necessary.
Duties and Responsibilities,Assist in design and development of the network infrastructure including networking software, computer hardware and other;,Establish network environment through defined, documented and enforced system standards;,Perform modelling, analysis and installation of integrated network;,Program and configure routers, switches and other equipment;,Configure DNS servers;,Configure hosted IP voice services;,Monitor network availability, performance and utilization;,Troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve problems and outages;,Maintain and troubleshoot:,LAN, WLAN, WAN;,Firewall landscape;,Core and next generation network services (DNS, DHCP, access control; IDS, IPS, proxies, ATP, DLP, SD-WAN, etc.);,VMware, Checkpoint and Microsoft virtualization technologies;,VPN remote access solution;,Maintain, configure and monitor virus protection software;,Perform disaster recovery operations and data backups when required;,Replace faulty network hardware components when required;,Coordinate, evolve and implement network security techniques and monitor access;,Configure and maintain firewall and manage security related to hacking;,Design and implement new solutions to improve the resilience of current network environment;,Assess live traffic patterns to optimize network capacity planning;,Schedule and perform updates and upgrades to the latest releases;,Report network operational status by managing projects and prioritizing information;,Manage owned domain names and coordinate network access and use;,Manage and audit IP addressing and hosted devices within data centres;,Perform network operations across multiple on-prem and cloud sites;,Remotely monitor and manage system alerts, troubleshoot and find faults;,Provide technical support;,Assist in preparation of all related network documentation.,Essential Requirements and Qualifications

summary:
As a Network Engineer
You would be working across multiple client sites within the ACT and need to ...
tasks: CCNA level skills/experience. Qualification ideal.
text:
As a Network Engineer
You would be working across multiple client sites within the ACT and need to be open to travelling to more than one location for work, however for this first 12 months of your employment you will be based at one client site.
Role requirements
CCNA level skills/experience. Qualification ideal.
Cisco R&S and Data Centre Networking experience (e.g. Nexus switches)
Understanding of firewalls ideal (ASA, Checkpoint, Fortigate)
What you need to now
For more information or if you wish to apply please contact Amy Simon on 02 6245 1705 email: Amy.Simon@peoplebank.com.au for more information
Due to security clearance requirements for this role, candidates must be Australian Citizens who currently hold or are able to gain an Australian Government security clearance
Please note: only candidates that meet the above criteria will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in the position.
How to Apply?
Click on the link below
Click here for more information about this job
Contact Details
Contact Name: Amy Simon
title: Network Engineer

name: Network Engineer
summary:
Job Description
Requirements: Qualifications
• Senior Level knowledge of Linux Systems and Networki...
text:
Job Description
Requirements: Qualifications
• Senior Level knowledge of Linux Systems and Networking
• Been in an Testing/ Operations environment before
• Possess a Software Engineering/JAVA knowledge, in a testing environment
• Thorough understanding & experiences in system software testing methodology, especially in cable TV/Telecom/IP video industry. Hands-on experience with white–box & black-box testing
• Deep technical expertise in digital video technology & high reliability video delivery in wired & wireless environment. Hands-on experiences with video content workflow & delivery. Familiar with Video on Demand (VOD) system
• Comfortable & experience with in fast paced Agile development process. Strong ability to successfully drive and execute work in a dynamic environment. Experience with successfully working with offshore resources
• Strong knowledge of QA test processes including test planning, development, execution, and results reporting. Strong technical written and verbal communication. Server experience is critical/set top is not so much
• Hands-on experiences with video streaming solutions, such as Silverlight and Flash. Thorough understand of video compression (mpeg) & transportation stream protocols & analysis tools.
• Capable of configuration network gears for high reliability video delivery. Understand various network standards. Familiar with high speed optical networking technology
• Extensive experience in testing consumer client devices such as home gateway, WiFi, cable modem, Set Top Box, etc. • Deep knowledge of IP video end to end delivery system and components. Hands-on experience in integration and QA of IP video on various client platforms
• Familiar with various types of local & global load balancing. Familiar with high reliability network and server fault tolerance testing
• Hands-on experience with Cable technology, such as Conditional Access system DAC/DNCS, QAM video, CMTS/DSG, etc.
Powered by JazzHR

Responsibilities/Duties • Contribute to the...
text:
Our client is looking for a full-time Network Engineer.
Responsibilities/Duties • Contribute to the design, implementation and ongoing management of the corporate Data Center
• Design, implement and maintain new and existing systems, such as monitoring and analysis, management and alerting, for a complex enterprise network environment that is growing
• Capacity planning and changes to network architecture
• Develop automated methods to mitigate and remediate network events and minimize operational complexity.
• Willingness to work an on-call rotation for outside of office hours support
Qualifications:
The ideal candidate for this role is a Network Engineer. They will ensure that industry best practices and methodologies are applied for the design, deployment, and operations of core route/switch and data center networks. The engineer will be proficient in configuring and troubleshooting Cisco technologies. They will have worked in data centers and understand how to translate business requirements into engineering solutions. They need to have strong communication skills and be able to effectively present to business partners
• 10 years of experience working Cisco, including Cisco Adapt Security appliance, Cisco Blades Servers, and etc.
• Network infrastructure to include converged IP networks, WLAN, WAN/MAN, LAN, VPN/Firewall.
• TCP/IP and OSI model.
• Routing protocol EiGRP, OSPF, BGP.
• CCNA certification required, prefer CCNP
Must be authorized to work in the US now and in the future, no sponsorships available at this time.

text:
Job Description
Net2Source Inc. is one of the fastest growing Global Workforce Solutions company with a growth of 100% YoY for last consecutive 3 years with over 2200+ employees globally and 30 locations in US and operations in 20 countries.
Net2Source is headquartered at NJ, USA. We offer a wide gamut of consulting solutions customized to our 450+ clients ranging from Fortune 500/1000 to Start-ups across various verticals like Technology, Banking, Financial Services, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Oil & Gas, Energy, Retail, Telecom, Utilities, Manufacturing, Aerospace & Defense and Engineering. We are one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S. and this may be your opportunity to join us! Want to read more about Net2Source? Visit us at www.net2source.com
Position: Sr. Network Engineer
Location: Denver, CO
Duration: Full Time Employment
Sr. Network Engineer Job Description
This is a hands-on engineer position
Conduct cross-training of all team duties amongst all team members
Prepare and coordinate project/task plans for network changes and document progress
Assist Network Manager with prioritization of work across the network team (including self). This would include break/fix, project initiatives, and strategic planning.
The candidate will be responsible leading and guiding Sr level Network Engineers in the following:
Management of VLAN connectivity documentation
Ensure that all switches are patched and standard approved configuration files are maintained.
As the environment changes, he/she will contribute strategically to re-configuration and design.
Coordinates with Server Administration and WAN operations teams to avoid unintended interruptions of service
Function within a team of several network engineers while leading the overall effort (this role is both hands on and a leader)
Support Cisco VLAN environment
Work with the TSO technology staff to ensure the network environment meets business strategy/direction, is secure and supports business critical applications on a highly available basis
Analyze and resolve network hardware, software, and communications problems using diagnostic software and/or technical troubleshooting processes
Provide Tier 1 through Tier 4 (Architecture) engineering support, advice, and consultation
Maintain system documentation
Consult with users and program management conducting information assessments to determine user needs and to define network solutions to meet user requirements
Conduct research concerning the development of network systems and related technologies
Coordinate and ensure the standard implementation of policies, procedures, and systems operations with support personnel
Write and/or maintain documentation for network software and operational procedures
Monitor hardware to ensure it is sufficiently updated to current standards and security requirements
Conduct on-going network system audits to evaluate the utility and efficiency of the system's hardware, software, and communications components and its effectiveness in meeting management information needs
Develop and maintain disaster recovery procedures for the network and network resources
Perform related work as required
Requirements and Qualifications:
Experience:
7+ years' experience within network engineering
7+ years progressive Cisco device/appliance support
Hands-on experience with Cisco router switch security configurations
Must have excellent customer-focused problem solving and communication skills
Education:
Bachelor's degree preferred
7+ years of experience in Cisco WAN, LAN, VLAN, network management and design (in-lieu of college education)
Preferred Technical Certification(s): CCNA, CCNP, CompTIA Security+, CCNA-Security, CISSP, etc...
Other Desired Skills:
Experience with the following:
Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS)
Cisco Wireless
Cisco Client/TACACS/RADIUS
Cisco ASA firewalls
Checkpoint firewalls
Cisco wireless technologies/controllers
F5 Load Balancer technologies
Various security appliance working knowledge. (Imperva, SourceFire, FirePower, IDS/IPS)
If you are interested, please forward your resume to Amir@Net2Source.com. You can also reach me at (201-354-1049).
Equal Employment Opportunity Commission:
Net2Source, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Net2Source, Inc. is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all candidates and employees. Hiring decisions are solely based upon job related criteria regardless of race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), marital status, disability, age, national origin, political affiliation, retaliation, parental status, military service, other non-merit factor or any other status protected by U.S. law.
Regards,
Amir Ahmad
Account Manager
Net2Source Inc.
Global HQ Address 7250 Dallas Pkwy, Suite 825 Plano, Texas 75024
Office: (201) 340-8700 x 428 (EXT )| Cell: 201-354-1049 | Fax: (201) 221-8131| Email: amir@net2source.com
Web: www.net2source.com | Social: Facebook | Twitter | LinkedIn
Fast Facts about Net2Source:
" Inception in 2007, privately held, Debt free
" 2200+ employees globally
" 375+ In- house Team of Sales, Account Management and Recruitment with coast to coast COE.
" 30 offices in US and 50+ Offices globally
" Operations in 20 countries (US, Canada, Mexico, APAC, UK, UAE, Europe, Latin America, Japan, Australia)
Awards and Accolades:
2018 Fastest Growing IT Staffing Firm in North America by Staffing Industry Analysts
2018 Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America as a 5 times consecutive honoree Inc. 5000
2018 - Spirit of Alliance Award by Agile1
2018 - 40 Under 40 Leadership Awards by Triangle Business Journal
2018 Fastest 50 by NJBIZ
2018 TechServe Excellence Award (IT and Engineering Staffing)
2018 Best of the Best Platinum Award by Agile1
2018 40 Under 40 Award Winner by Staffing Industry Analysts
2018 CEO World Gold Award by SVUS
2017 Best of the Best Gold Award by Agile1

summary:
Functieomschrijving

equensWorldline is one of the leading and most innovat...
