name: Network Engineer II
summary: Job Summary: The Network Engineer II is responsible for planning, designing, implementing and maint...
text:
Job Summary: The Network Engineer II is responsible for planning, designing, implementing and maintaining a network architecture within the customer environment. The Network Engineer II will also implement, maintain, and support network systems on a day-to-day operational level. In addition, day-to-day duties will include establishing standards within the network infrastructure, documentation and resolving break-fixes or design issues. The successful candidate would work closely with other Vision Technologies and customer personnel within the Networking Services department to ensure that the customer WAN hand-off is functioning as designed.
At Vision each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. Five business units in pursuit of 100% customer satisfaction – expert audio-visual, professional services, security, wireless and structured cabling capabilities. Corporate certifications plus the support of everything IP uniquely distinguishes Vision among top technology integrator s. Our committed team, entrenched in a culture of support, works to ensure an unforgettable customer experience. Vision is committed to the community and we promote a healthy environment for our teammates – caring people focused on great outcomes. 100% customer satisfaction is more than words at Vision…it’s our culture. We strive to provide the best solutions and services to meet our customer’s needs, while providing a positive work environment that allows our Customer, Company and Employees to grow and succeed.
Responsibilities and Duties: Principal responsibilities and duties, but not all-inclusive, include the following. Individuals may perform other duties as assigned, including working in other functional areas to cover absences or relief to balance workloads.
Operational Duties
• Serve as Point of Contact for the customer Data Center network which includes the accountability for the availability, security and performance of the network
• Manage and administrate Local Area Network (LAN), Data Center, Wide Area Network (WAN) installation, configuration and ongoing field service
• Manage and administrate the application of firmware upgrades, network system monitoring and uplinks to ISP and customer WAN within a High Availability Network
• Ability to configure and manage dynamic routing protocols with a strong understanding of Policy Routing
• Manage Cisco based Firewalls in an HA (High Availability) Environment
• Configure Site-to-Site IPSEC VPN(s) and manage comms/routing across Wide Area Transports
• Manage and administrate on-premise and cloud Palo Alto firewalls, load balancers and customer application controllers
• Serve as customer point of contact with vendor provided network managed services
• Operate within customer departmental Incident, Change and Work Management systems
• Manage and administrate an Azure Cloud Network within an Express Route circuit interconnect
Planning and Development Duties
• Performs complex network management design and integration
• Plans, forecasts, implements, and identifies resource and bandwidth requirements for network devices and connections
• Participates in design reviews with customer application systems leadership on supported customer systems
• Participates in Quality of Service (QOS) reviews of IT systems install by junior technicians
• Provides mentoring on projects for voice, video, and data systems, including but not limited to LANs, and WLANs; Video over IP and converged networks
• Participates in the selection of hardware, software, and services to meet customer departmental specifications and requirements
• Participates and provides consultation on scope and specification requirements for bids and contracts
• Conducts site surveys and on-site assessments and prepares schematic diagrams for recommended and efficient installations
• Develop and maintains network documentation
• Assists in developing architectures and planning for enterprise-wide tactical and strategic requirements, systems definition, and feasibility determination within a complex system environment
• Assists in developing and implementing a multi-system capacity plan
• Plans and oversees the implementation of system installations and ensures network connectivity
• Serve as customer point of contact with networking professional services engagements
• Occasional travel throughout the local Las Vegas area
Qualifications and Skills:
Education:
• Graduation from a recognized college or university with a bachelor’s degree in math, computer science, information systems, electrical engineering, or a related field.
• Qualifying experience in addition to that listed above may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis.
Years of Experience:
• At least 8 years of journey level experience installing, designing, configuring and/or maintaining computer data, telecommunications, or converged systems
• Experience or knowledge of VMWare, MS Azure, Wireshark/ Packet Analysis, Alien Vault are desirable
• A strong knowledge of Spanning Tree
• Knowledge and experience with BGP and OSPF routing protocols is required
• Experience with Ruckus/Commscope and legacy Brocade routers is required
• Experience with a major enterprise network switching vendor product line is required. Ruckus/CommScope or Cisco are preferred
• Experience with PaaS mainframe hosting provider to manage MPLS circuits connecting remote mainframe and interconnected VPN backup connection considered a plus
• Experience with Linux Servers and Perl Scripting are desirable
Security Clearance:
• A valid Nevada Driver License
• Must pass a criminal background investigation
Certifications:
• Cisco Certified Design Professional (CCDP) - preferred
• Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) – required
• Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Wireless, CCNA (Voice)
• •Microsoft MCSE, Linux+, RHCE, or LPI certifications – preferred
Skills:
• Design principles for local area networks
• Design and implementation principles for cloud hosted environments
• Ethernet Fabrics
• Switching and routing protocols
• Wi-Fi Technology
• IPSEC VPN(s)
• Dynamic Routing
• Policy Routing
• RADIUS/TACACS Protocols
• Network testing tools
• IP addressing and subnet schemes
• Voice over IP routing
• Industry standard network engineering specifications
• Cisco and Ruckus/CommScope, and legacy Brocade networking devices
• Experience in on-premise and cloud Palo Alto firewalls, load balancers and application controllers
• Experience in design and deployment of Azure cloud network interfacing with Microsoft Professional Services
• TCP/IP Protocol
• Copper and fiber cable topologies and installation
• Microsoft Visio for Network Documentation
• Principles of supervision, mentoring, and training
• Methods, materials, tools, equipment and procedures used in the installation, maintenance, testing and repair of networks, communication links, microcomputers and peripheral equipment
• Interpersonal skills using tact, patience, and courtesy
• Professional presentation skills
• Install and troubleshoot local area networks, including wireless systems
• Review and evaluate IT system designs for compliance organizational and industry standards
• Configure servers, computers, and a variety of networking equipment
• Create and modify project plans utilizing Microsoft Project and Visio
• Prepare clear and concise reports and technical documentation
• Analyze and solve complex networking problems
• Formulate and express ideas clearly and effectively in writing and orally
• Set priorities and successfully complete tasks in a timely manner
• Analyze and interpret materials and problems involving rules, procedures, documentation, and related matters
• Maintain effective relationships with coworkers, enterprise team members, and representatives of manufacturers and other organizations
• Plan, organize, coordinate and direct complex network systems development projects
• Supervise and train junior networking technical staff
• Provide technical expertise and information regarding enterprise network technology, and
• industry best practices and policies
• Read, interpret, apply and explain rules, regulations, policies and procedures
• Work confidentially with discretion
• Analyze complex situations accurately and adopt an effective course of action
• Work independently with little direction to meet schedules and timelines
• Establish and maintain cooperative relationships with customer staff and vendors
• Effectively communicate networking operations/issues/initiatives/projects to customer management/team-leads/staff
• Maintain a calm and tactful manner
Work Conditions
• Typically, 40-45-hour work week, that could spike during critical changes or outages
• Daily work schedule is determined by customer but is primarily based around normal business hours
• Must be able to lift devices weighing roughly 20-50 lbs
• Vision Technologies will provide a laptop to fulfill daily work duties
Vision Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local law.

text:
Altran is the world leader in engineering and R&D services. We offer our clients a unique value proposition to meet their transformation and innovation challenges. We support our clients, from concept through industrialization, to develop the products and services of tomorrow and have been working for more than 35 years with major players in many sectors: automotive, aeronautics, space, defense & naval, rail, infrastructure & transportation, industrial & consumer products, life sciences, communications, semiconductor & electronics, software & internet, finance & public sector. Altran has more than 50,000 employees operating in over 30 countries. In April 2020, we became part of Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. Visit us at www.altran.com.
Title - OTN Migration Engineer
Location - Remote (Canada / USA)
Job description
Experience in Ciena 6500 series
Implements upgrades on Customer’s In-Service networks without impacting the services provided to the end user. This includes, but is not limited to, Channel Adds, Node Insertions, Traffic Migrations, and HW/SW Upgrades.
Plan, develop and execute on Customer modernization plans for evolving customer networks via the EMOP process. Create and own Engineering Method of Procedures (EMOP), supports field execution remotely of these modernization projects. Including, but not limited to:
Perform remote audit of network elements using GUI and/or TL1 commands.
Create traffic migration “cut sheets” and network diagrams showing before and after configurations.
Plan migration and create TL1 scripts to be executed during the MW.
Write eMOP and review internally and externally.
Execute eMOP and scripts during MW
Ensure proposed solutions are
technically viable, i.e. meet all product and software capabilities and guidelines.
meet customer requirements and provide maximum benefit to us.
Deliver and own Network Engineering documentation for Customers via the Detailed Network Design service offering.
Validates that the actions taken by the Assigned Project Team are executed properly as per the steps detailed in the Engineering Method of Procedure (EMOP). Ensures the Customer’s network is operating in a stable state as designed during Maintenance Window activities.
Working with engineering consultants and the customer, generates quality detailed low-level design documentation that reflects the subsea network design requirements.
This is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.
Job Type: Full-time
Schedule:
8 Hour Shift
Experience:
Ciena 6500: 4 years (Required)
Migration: 3 years (Required)
Work remotely:
Yes

Title: Cisco Network Engineer
Location: Chester, VA 23836

text:
Job Description
Title: Cisco Network Engineer
Location: Chester, VA 23836
Contract Duration: 12 – 14 months
Job Description:
The Network Engineer is responsible for analyzing, designing, installing, configuring, maintaining and repairing of network infrastructure and application components.
Performs a wide variety of evaluation, maintenance, installation and training tasks to ensure the computer network performance meet company and user satisfaction.
The Network Engineer also provides direction, information, and recommendations regarding network configurations and installations.
• Looking for a motivated, self-starter with experience using established processes and tools to support a mid-size to large IT environment.
• The candidate should be well versed in Cisco, as well as other manufacturer, networking technologies and have experience supporting a large, Enterprise environment with multiple
locations.
• 5+ years of LAN/WAN Network Engineering experience installing, maintaining, configuring, and troubleshooting network equipment including Cisco routers and switches
• 5+ years of Network Engineering experience with network protocols including TCP/IP, EIGRP, UDP, DHCP, SMTP, and FTP
• 5+ years’ experience in operational support and troubleshooting in a large scale corporate network, Telecom provider or ISP environment.
• Wireless configurations, installations and controller experience desired
• Engineers with experience implementing and managing network load balancing, especially F5, is preferred. Juniper and Aruba Wireless is highly desired.

text:
Job Description:
Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies is hiring for a senior-level Network Engineer in San Francisco to design, implement, maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot enterprise networks in a Cisco, VMWare, and Microsoft environment. The person in this position will function as our Cisco Networking SME on the team. They will install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain networking equipment, servers and data management systems.
The ideal candidate should be familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within field. Performs a variety of tasks autonomously and with proficiency. Works under general supervision. Some degree of creativity and latitude is required.
Responsibilities
Designs, implements, and administers internal and external networks
Troubleshoots issues and upgrades networks when necessary
Secures network from external attacks and viruses
Provides assistance with researching appropriate technology for internal use
Provides assistance with Network and Systems Architectural design, development, and implementation. Design and implement solutions based on Microsoft server 200X OS, HP and Cisco network switches, routers and firewalls, and other technologies in compliance with client standards.
Administers virtual environment in VMWare 6.0
Collaborates heavily with server and system administrators on design and implementation projects
Functions as team SME on networking technologies
Accurately estimates system and network infrastructure activities; can manage tasks and work independently to meet timelines and expectations
Able to support business critical systems and maintain composure during crisis situations
Creates roadmap, architectural, process and standards documents and governance documents
Provides recommendations for solutions based on research, background, and current direction
Decomposes large systems into subsystems, components, and service threads
Effectively communicates and disseminates knowledge to personnel at various skill levels
Competencies:
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Problem Solving - Gathers and analyzes information skillfully and provide solutions in complex situations. Identify items requiring additional information or action.
Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others
Customer Service - Provide for quality customer service; appropriately respond and resolve complex situations/problems; Responds promptly to customer needs, requests for service and assistance; Solicits customer feedback to improve service and enhance existing procedures; Responds in a timely manner; Meets commitments.
Design - Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles; Demonstrates attention to detail.
Cost Consciousness -- Works within approved budget; Develops orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals.
Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; Understands organization's strength & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies external threats and opportunities; Adapts strategy to changing conditions.
Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
Qualifications:
Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year College or technical school; or equivalent work experience
10-15 years experience with network design, implementation, administration, upgrades, troubleshooting, and security
Strong experience with troubleshooting and debugging Cisco routers and switches (Nexus Core)
Strong experience of administration and automation with VMWare or other virtualization tool
Understanding of network protocols (TCP/IP, UDP, SNMP, SMTP, DHCP, and DNS), hardware & software network security best practices
Extensive knowledge of Windows Server 2012 and higher, Exchange, and Active Directory
Experienced in designing and implementing highly-available, high-performance solutions across multiple infrastructure technology stacks
Demonstrated capability to integrate multiple systems, processes, and data; including commercial package applications and cloud-based services: PaaS/SaaS/IaaS
An understanding of IPV4 concepts and troubleshooting is a plus. Ping, tracert, nslookup, etc.
Experience with management and monitoring tools.
Experience with NAS, and SANs devices.
Experience automating repetitive tasks with scripting with one or more of the following technologies and/or equivalent: (batch files, PowerShell, VBScript, WMI, etc.)
CCNP certification required; CCIE or working towards CCIE preferred
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Health and wellness -- low premiums for medical, dental and vision coverage; FSA and EAP benefits
Company paid Life, Disability and AD&D benefits
Employee Retirement Savings Plan with employer match up to 5% of compensation
Generous Paid Time Off and Holidays
Education Assistance Reimbursement
Recognition and Rewards Programs
Company Store
Discounts across Berkshire Hathaway Inc. companies such as GEICO, See's Candies, etc.
About Us:
The Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies (BHHC) is a group of six insurance companies that are part of the Berkshire Hathaway Insurance Group. Our Workers Compensation Division provides premier workers compensation insurance coverage to employers across the country, with offices in San Francisco, San Diego, Pasadena, Omaha, St. Louis, Atlanta, and Dallas.
As a member of the Berkshire Hathaway Insurance Group, BHHC has earned an enviable record of success in the insurance industry that is supported by an A++ A.M. Best rating for the last 10 consecutive years. Our corporate size enables our organization to react swiftly and effectively to opportunities in the insurance marketplace. At the same time, our financial strength provides our agents and insureds security and makes us one of the best brands in the marketplace.
We value each individual and recognize that attracting and retaining high quality talent is essential to the success of our company. Our structure minimizes bureaucracy and creates an environment that encourages our employees to see the direct effects of their hard work throughout the company. Each division provides hands on training and maintains a small company feel, creating an atmosphere in which 'team players' thrive.
Within the last six years BHHC Workers Compensation has seen significant growth, and we're continuing to grow as we build one of the largest Workers Compensation companies in the country -- join us!
If you feel you would be a good fit for this position, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your application here and one of our recruiters will be in touch!

name: Network Engineer
summary:
Job Description
Title: Cisco Network Engineer
Location: Chester, VA 23836
Contract Duration: 12 – 1...
text:
Job Description
Title: Cisco Network Engineer
Location: Chester, VA 23836
Contract Duration: 12 – 14 months
Job Description:
The Network Engineer is responsible for analyzing, designing, installing, configuring, maintaining and repairing of network infrastructure and application components.
Performs a wide variety of evaluation, maintenance, installation and training tasks to ensure the computer network performance meet company and user satisfaction.
The Network Engineer also provides direction, information, and recommendations regarding network configurations and installations.
• Looking for a motivated, self-starter with experience using established processes and tools to support a mid-size to large IT environment.
• The candidate should be well versed in Cisco, as well as other manufacturer, networking technologies and have experience supporting a large, Enterprise environment with multiple
locations.
• 5+ years of LAN/WAN Network Engineering experience installing, maintaining, configuring, and troubleshooting network equipment including Cisco routers and switches
• 5+ years of Network Engineering experience with network protocols including TCP/IP, EIGRP, UDP, DHCP, SMTP, and FTP
• 5+ years’ experience in operational support and troubleshooting in a large scale corporate network, Telecom provider or ISP environment.
• Wireless configurations, installations and controller experience desired
• Engineers with experience implementing and managing network load balancing, especially F5, is preferred. Juniper and Aruba Wireless is highly desired.
title: Network Engineer

name: Sr. Network Engineer (Virtualization/Storage)
summary:
JOB SUMMARY:
Provide virtualization engineering, analysis, and management in support of the Departm...
text:
JOB SUMMARY:
Provide virtualization engineering, analysis, and management in support of the Department of Commerce applications, storage, disaster recovery, networks, and systems. Support of LAN, WAN, and IP storage systems; including planning, designing, evaluating, selecting operating systems and countermeasures. Configure and maintain complex virtualization environment including IP/Storage network systems.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Lead and oversee virtualization activities (i.e., build, deploy, configure, etc.)
• Perform the operations daily health check to ensure that the network storage is operational.
• Provide node management, maintenance, and troubleshooting efforts for projects critical to the business.
• Provide Tier3 support in troubleshooting of the storage & virtualization network related issues and problems.
• Ensure that the storage and its components are patched with the latest software version, security updates, and hotfixes.
• Conduct research to improve performance and enable storage/virtualization environment stability and availability.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
• 10+ years of experience managing different storage technologies: EMC, Compellent, and NetApps.
• 10+ years of experience designing and deploying storage networks (FCoE, FC, iSCSI).
• 10+ years of experience in Cisco L2 switching and L3 routing (Nexus Technologies).
• 10+ years of experience in designing, troubleshooting distributed Data Centers.
• 10+ years of experience virtual infrastructure design, deploy, and maintain.
• 10+ years of experience in enterprise disaster recovery solutions.
• 5-10 years of experience in working with Dell blade servers, brocade FC switches.
• Possess CCNP certification, at minimum
• Possess VMWare VCP certification

name: Field Network Engineer
summary: Impact Networking is seeking customer service focused individuals with a wide knowledge base for co...
text:
Impact Networking is seeking customer service focused individuals with a wide knowledge base for computers and networks to provide remote and on-site technical support and customer service. Impact Managed IT Services division is a network management solution for clients that range in size from 10-200 nodes and provides 100% maintenance and management of client's networks. The role of the Field Network Engineer is challenging and rewarding and requires a strong and vast technical skill set along with business acumen and interpersonal skills.
There are many hats to be worn and all require different skills. The focus of the job at Impact is always excellent customer service. We strive to make sure our clients are happy and that their networks are secure and running optimally.
The primary job focus is on specifying and implementing a full range of Network solutions for clients. The Field Network Engineer will perform these following roles: + Pre Sales: + Working with the Account Mangers and VCIO roles you will act as the technical subject matter expert in prospective client engagements. This is a supporting role to help explain and define the proper technologies that might fit in with each prospective client.
+ Manage the System Assessment process. This includes the onsite interviews, RMM tool configuration and deployment on the client network, physical review and documentation of the IT assets. Once the field work is done the Engineer then must analyze the data collected and produce a detailed technical document that outlines the client network with our technical recommendations.
+ Conduct the in person System Assessment review meeting. This includes walking the client through the technical aspects of the System Assessment documentation and explaining our recommendations. This requires the ability to take the technical details and explain them to C level prospects in a non-technical way.
The emphasis is always on showing the client the value we bring and getting them excited about our Managed IT Services. The end goal is getting the client to sign up for our Complete Care full managed IT program. + IT Project implementation: + Plan and lead the installation and configuration of all recommendations made during the System Assessment process.
This requires the technical skills to implement the core networking technologies. These include Windows Server, Hyper-V or VMWare, Exchange, SharePoint, Firewalls (SonicWall, Meraki and others), BDR Solutions (StorageCraft), Switching, Active Directory and Group Policy configuration, Cloud Services such as Office 365 and Azure and many others. This also includes the configuration of our RMM tool to monitor and alert on all critical client network components.
+ Manage: + Work with the Level 1 and Level 2 Help Desk teams to plan and implement the client management and maintenance plans that include Windows and 3rd party software patching, Line of Business application updates, A/V profiles and scan schedules, Workstation clean up, Active Directory management and all network documentation. + Act as the top tier technical support expert and work to resolve complex technical issues that are escalated from the level 1 and 2 Help Desk technicians. + On Board: + Work with the account managers and VCIO roles to conduct end user On-Boarding meetings to explain the Complete Care program and show clients how to interact with our Help Desk.
Walk users through the Complete Care end user guide and ensure the client understands the process while emphasizing our commitment to Customer Service. + Maintain: + Work with the Account Managers and VCIO roles to prepare monthly and quarterly reports about the clients network health and performance, end user tickets and all client communications. Continuously working to align the clients IT needs with their business goals.
Qualifications + Windows Server and Workstation Operating Systems + Active Directory design, management and maintenance + Microsoft Exchange, SQL and SharePoint + DNS, DHCP, Remote Desktop Services + VMWare, Hyper-V and other virtualization technologies + Storage solutions: SAN, NAS, Shared storage, ISCSI, Fiber Channel + Firewalls, switches and other networking technologies + Disaster Recovery solutions and backup technologies + Office365, Azure and other "cloud" solutions + Mobile operating systems (IOS, Android, Windows) + RMM tools such as N-Able, Kasaya or LabTech Education/Certifications + College Graduates with focus on IT, MIS, or Networking + Computer Related Degree or Industry Certifications + Valid drivers license and clean driving record + Must be able to do some light lifting External Company Name: Impact Networking LLC External Company URL: http://impactnetworking.com Street: 8888 Keystone Crossing
title: Field Network Engineer

Capable of managing a Wireless Infrastructure with more than 100 Access Points.
Understands and adheres to the principles of Change Management.
Well refined documentation and communication skills.
Exposure to VoIP, IP Telephony, and Call Management a plus.
Understands and plans for Disaster Recovery scenarios.
Capable and willing to be on-call at a minimum of one week per month.

5 years of Infrastructure experience (Network, Server, and Desktop).
3-5 years experience with maintaining the day-to-day operations of mid-sized LAN/WAN.
CCNP, CCDP or Demonstrated Equivalent Experience required, MCSE, CCSA, NOKIA preferred.

text:
Needed - Network Engineer with strong IT and Cyber Security background. Strong background in layer two technologies and remote access technologies
Melbourne
I am looking for a Network Engineer to provide services and support of Infrastructure Systems for a leading provider of integrated facilities services with clients spanning across Australia and New Zealand.
The role requires you to plan, organise, and prioritise your work in order to meet targets and strict deadlines. You will have excellent communication skills to provide timely and accurate information to all stakeholders. You will be in charge of developing effective working relationships with internal customers and external partners.
EXPERIENCE
6+ years relevant IT experience in a large corporate environment
Worked with 1000+ user base, with different business units and unique requirements
Experience in design, installation and support of small, medium and large networks
Proven network troubleshooting skills
Established skills in supporting Cisco hybrid environments (HP, IBM, DELL, Juniper, Checkpoint, Meraki)
Good project management/co-ordination skills
Experience working in Skype for Business or other VoiP environment
Network Monitoring and Management tools such as Solarwinds (or Manage Engine, etc)
Worked in a team environment
Network Design Documentation skills
Follow documented Change, Release, Incident and Problem management processes
Knowledge Required
Strong understanding of Cyber Security, including but not limited to Antivirus, Mail protection, firewalls, etc.
Excellent understanding of networking technologies, hardware and security
Network routing protocols: EIGRP, OSPF and BGP
Layer two technologies: VLANs, FHRP (HSRP/VRRP), 802.1Q, 802.1X, Etherchannel / Port-Channel, VPC, LACP/PAgP, STP, VTP, SPAN
Excellent understanding of remote access technologies, VPN, SSL and IPsec, (including site to site VPN in a hybrid environment (Cisco / Check Point, etc))
Excellent understanding of TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, AAA, QoS, and Certifcates
Strong configuration and management of network hardware (Switches, Routers, Access Points, Firewalls)
Good understanding of virtualization and cloud environments
Cisco Routers, Switches, Wireless and Firewalls
Check Point Security Appliances
Cisco Meraki Security, Switching, and Wireless Appliances
Load Balancers and Proxies
3G/4G Provisioning
QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS
Tertiary qualifications in Information Services or related course
Industry certifications with Cisco
Microsoft, Citrix, VMWare, and ITIL certifications
Shows initiative and is proactive
Proven ability to learn quickly and take ownership of jobs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent customer service skills
Understanding of ITIL principles
Participation in after hours on-call roster

Be responsible for the management and day to day support of the clients network along with the delivery and configuration on integration technologies.
Sydney
Fantastic opportunity now available for a skilled Network Engineer to be responsible for the build, support and support of the clients network.
Provide a second level escalation point for other members of the team and take an active role in providing technical leadership and mentoring junior staff.
Responsibilities
Perform research, analysis and design of technical solutions to meet business requirements
Work as part of a support team and provide 24x7 after hours support on a rotating roster
Provide technical leadership on different projects
Ensure that existing technology investments are optimized if applicable

Knowledge of and experience in documenting business requirements & developing technical solutions to meet those requirements.
Immediate availability is preferable

Position Title: Network Engineer
Position Description: Protingent Staffing has an exciting direct h...
text:
Position Title: Network Engineer
Position Description: Protingent Staffing has an exciting direct hire opportunity with our client in Portland, Oregon.
Job Requirements:
Integration, test and troubleshooting of hardware, software and networking for our products
Develop and implement procedures for configuration and testing of systems
Produce and support integrated systems for Marketing, Sales, and End Customers
Ability to write and create documents and procedures for internal and external users
Responsible for quality levels maintained in our products
Performance requires physical attendance
Other duties as assigned
Job Qualifications:
US Citizenship Required
3+ years in network or systems engineering in a production environment
Ability to present complex technology to technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with Microsoft Windows
Experience with PC hardware and troubleshooting
Hands-On experience with IP networking and networking devices (Switches, Routers, Firewalls, etc.)
Cisco CCNA or ability to attain CCNA required
Experience with multiple network equipment vendors (Cisco, Juniper, Palo Alto, Riverbed, Aruba, Ruckus, etc.) strongly desired
Experience with VMware vSphere (ESXi) strongly desired
Experience with Linux strongly desired
Experience with network management applications such as SolarWinds, SNMPc, Nagios, etc. is a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Independent professional that can perform job assignment with limited supervision
Ability to lift and carry 35 pounds of test equipment at least 40 feet
Must be able to self-organize workloads and manage all deadlines
Accuracy and attention to detail and quality orientation a must
About Protingent: Protingent is a niche provider of top Engineering and IT talent to Software, Electronics, Medical Device, Telecom, and Aerospace companies nationwide. Protingent exists to make a positive impact and contribution to the lives of others as well as our community by providing relevant, rewarding, and exciting work opportunities for our candidates.

text:
Apply Now I'm Interested
Airport Network Engineer job at Munich Aiport US Holding LLC in Newark NJ
Description, duties, responsibilities
EWR Terminal One LLC is an US-based subsidiary of the German Airport Operator Munich Airport. EWR Terminal One LLC is responsible for the maintenance and concession management at the existing Terminal A at Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR), and will be responsible for the operations, maintenance, and concession management of the New Terminal A at EWR which is currently under development and is scheduled to open in spring of 2022. We are looking for an experienced;
Airport Network Engineer
to join our team as soon as possible. You will be part of a quickly growing team, helping not only to create an attractive passenger terminal, but also to develop the Terminal Operator company with your expertise and personality.
Your Future Responsibilities
Design communication networks and implement, maintain, and support network infrastructure.
Plan, design, implement and maintain laboratory IP networks consisting of multiple VLANs, subnets, domains (i.e. management plane, data plane), domain protection mechanisms (e.g. access control list enforcement), and constructed with enterprise grade network switches and routers.
Directs and manages all aspects of data communications and technologies.
Review, monitor and correct (when needed) the EWR New Terminal A network, data security, firewalls (coordination with Security), IP addresses, domain name servers, load balancers, network monitoring (coordination with Security), Wi-Fi, remote access, SSL, Internet access and more.
Establish and implement IT Security measures and controls including monitoring network activity to identify vulnerable points.
Research, evaluate and develop implementation plans to upgrade data systems.
Oversee and/or assist in the installation of equipment, system troubleshooting and ensures highest level of system availability.
Manage budgetary requirements for equipment and infrastructure replacement, determines backup components to be maintained in stock.
Maintain the company Telephony system and work closely with the Telecom service provider to keep the lines active.
Respond to network connectivity issues and resolve any wireless communication issues within the confines of the office.
Update the network maintenance manual and submit a summary of changes to the manual each week to management.
Your Education & Training
University degree in Degree in Information Technology or related field.
Certification: Cisco, Windows, Citrix, Linux, Microsoft Azure Cloud Computing preferred.
Experience in managing sophisticated computer networks.
Strong troubleshooting skills.
Knowledge of Microsoft technologies including Office 365, DNS (Domain Name System), DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol), Active Directory, Exchange, IIS (Internet Information Service).
Experience in supporting Closed Circuit Television (CCTV), Access Control Server (ACS) , Voice Over Internet Protocol (VOIP) system is preferred.
Very good knowledge and practical experience of the MS Office products (MS Word, MS Excel, MS, PowerPoint, MS Visio, and MS Project).
Experience in managing and supporting network in airport experience is an added advantage.
Your Skills & Experience
Excellent writing skills
Extremely proficient PowerPoint Skills
Extremely proficient Excel Skills
Stellar organizational skills
Ability to prioritize tasks
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality
Has a positive and energetic attitude with a hands-on mentality
Ability to work without direct supervision, taking responsibility, and ownership of assigned tasks
Ability to work in a team-driven environment
Good reasons why you should become part of the airport family
Be part of the team who embraces diversity, fosters collaboration, practices mentorship, and believes in a positive, healthy work climate.
Help Munich Airport, Europe’s only 5-star Airport, to build on its reputation in the US.
International working environment.
Attractive benefit package; Health, Vision, Dental, 401(k) Matching, LTD/STD, PTO.
Munich Airport International US Holding and it's subdivisions EWR Terminal One LLC and Reach Airports are equal opportunity employers.
Munich Aiport US Holding LLC Company Overview
EWR Terminal One LLC is an US-based subsidiary of the German Airport Operator Munich Airport. EWR Terminal One LLC is responsible for the maintenance and concession management at the existing Terminal A at Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR), and will be responsible for the operations, maintenance, and concession management of the New Terminal A at EWR which is currently under development and is scheduled to open in spring of 2022.

tasks: The ability to administrate Symantec Proxy ASG/SG appliances and virtual machines,The ability to edit proxy rules (blocks, additions) using PERL scripting,Strong knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, FTP, cookies, authentication, web filtering, virus scanning, web servers, SSL/encryption and reporting packages,The ability to use scripting languages,The ability to manage *NIX type systems,The ability to troubleshoot proxy issues,PAC file experience is required,Assist in monitoring, configuration changes, and software updates,Analyze and evaluate anomalous network and system activity,Strong understanding of enterprise and global strategies and technical challenge,Assist in troubleshooting and problem solving a variety of security-related network issues,Coordinate requirements with users and suppliers,Assist to optimize proxy solutions,Assists with training other employees on a periodic basis,Must be able to interface with individuals at all levels of the organization both verbally and in writing
text:
Job Description
Position: Information Technology Specialist/Network Engineer
Location:Raleigh, NC
Duration: 6+ Months
Required Skills:
The ability to administrate Symantec Proxy ASG/SG appliances and virtual machines
The ability to edit proxy rules (blocks, additions) using PERL scripting
Strong knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, FTP, cookies, authentication, web filtering, virus scanning, web servers, SSL/encryption and reporting packages
The ability to use scripting languages
The ability to manage *NIX type systems
The ability to troubleshoot proxy issues
PAC file experience is required
Assist in monitoring, configuration changes, and software updates
Analyze and evaluate anomalous network and system activity
Strong understanding of enterprise and global strategies and technical challenge
Assist in troubleshooting and problem solving a variety of security-related network issues
Coordinate requirements with users and suppliers
Assist to optimize proxy solutions
Assists with training other employees on a periodic basis
Must be able to interface with individuals at all levels of the organization both verbally and in writing
BCCP, BCCPP, BCWAA, BCWAP, BCPSA, BCPSP certifications preferred not required
Preferred Qualifications:
8+ years of professional experience and a Bachelor of Arts/Science or equivalent degree in computer science or related area of study; without a degree, three additional years of relevant professional experience.
Demonstrate strong knowledge in at least three major technology areas.
Technical expertise is sought after and provided to several projects/accounts.
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of assigned technology and discipline area.
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of corporate organization and policies.
Advanced level business, technical, or functional knowledge..
I must inform you that during the hiring process, we may ask for you to disclose and provide us with various categories of your personal information, including identifiers such as your name and address, professional information, commercial information, education information, and other related information. Please note that we will only use this information to facilitate and complete the recruiting process.
Company Description
About BCforward
BCforward began as an IT business solutions and staffing firm. Founded in 1998, BCforward has grown with our customers’ needs into a full-service personnel solutions organization. BCforward’s headquarters are in Indianapolis, Indiana and also operates delivery centers in 17 locations in North America as well as Hyderabad, India and Puerto Rico. We are currently the largest consulting firm and largest MBE certified firm headquartered in Indiana. With 14+ years of uninterrupted growth, the addition of two brands (Stafforward and PMforward) and a team of more than 1400 resources our teams deliver services for multiple industries from both public and private sectors. BCforward’s team of dedicated staffing professionals has placed thousands of talented people over the past decade, with retention rates that are consistently higher than the industry average.
www.bcforward.com

summary:
Description
**
About Frontier Communications
Frontier Communications provides communications servic...
tasks: Frontline project management for T1, DS3 and Ethernet orders,Engineering design for outside plant,Proactive review of outside plant facilities to determine necessary upgrades and enhancements,Communicate with Sales and Capital Management on budgetary project resolution,Coordinate with peer Engineers for project design and construction to resolve roadblocks,Communicate with all peers and departments to insure proper project planning,Maintain accurate cable records and updates,Maintain and investigate ROW's and easements for releases,Attend construction meetings,Prepare project justifications for approvals,Prepare loop studies as needed,Prepare cost estimates for BDT's,Update records according to As-Builts,Digitize land base into GIS system,Code and approve contractor invoices,Assist in annual budget design
text:
Description
**
About Frontier Communications
Frontier Communications provides communications services to urban, suburban, and rural communities in 29 states. Frontier offers a variety of services to residential customers over its FiOS and Vantage fiber-optic and copper networks, including video, high-speed internet, advanced voice, and Frontier Secure digital protection solutions. Frontier Business offers communications solutions to small, medium, and enterprise businesses.
**Network Engineer - Outside Plant - Job Description
**This position is responsible for the application engineering of telecommunications outside plant in a local serving exchange environment. The responsibilities include planning and providing strategic guidance for OSP facility reinforcement for a geographical territory. Position is customer facing, and typically provides customer network solutions. Requires extensive OSP knowledge. Depended on to provide accurate budgetary OSP project estimates. Knowledge of approved Frontier Network Engineering systems/equipment is also required. First engineering contact for all high-bandwidth customer requests requiring facility augments or new builds. This position works as a team member with National Planning, Sales, Broadband/Transport, Construction and Operations to support the growth and upgrades of telecommunications plant facilities. This person provides frontline project management for all Ethernet activity associated with outside plant customer orders.
Frontline project management for T1, DS3 and Ethernet orders
Engineering design for outside plant
Proactive review of outside plant facilities to determine necessary upgrades and enhancements
Communicate with Sales and Capital Management on budgetary project resolution
Coordinate with peer Engineers for project design and construction to resolve roadblocks
Communicate with all peers and departments to insure proper project planning
Maintain accurate cable records and updates
Maintain and investigate ROW's and easements for releases
Attend construction meetings
Prepare project justifications for approvals
Prepare loop studies as needed
Prepare cost estimates for BDT's
Update records according to As-Builts
Digitize land base into GIS system
Code and approve contractor invoices
Assist in annual budget design
Research and respond the Ethernet order activity for outside plant
Prepare and monitor the capital budget plan.
Engineer, design and prepare project narrative and routing for Ethernet orders.
Maintain inter-company relations to provide information needed by sales, project management, construction and operations for special projects.(pre-quals, BDT, boundary information, easement and ROW recording and service orders)
Project management oversight of all OSP capital construction activities to insure conformance to requirements.
Required Skills:
Knowledge of outside plant activity and engineering tools to include CAD, Ethernet order systems, circuit design.. Organizational skills, communication skills (written and verbal) and customer relations will be utilized in achieving desired results. Outside plant construction project management experience and inventory management experience. Experience in Ethernet circuit designs and order processing.
Education/Experience: B.S Engineering or equivalent preferred, or a minimum of 3 to 5 years experience in an outside plant position. Must be able to demonstrate knowledge with heavy emphasis on outside plant design, cable count design and capacities. Strong interpersonal skills are very important in discussions and meetings with Engineering team, regional managers, vendors, local supervisors and technicians.
Frontier Communications is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
title: Network Engineer - Outside Plant

name: Senior Network Engineer
summary:
Meet our professionals
CGI: A place to build an IT career
Position Description
CGI Federal is seeki...
text:
Meet our professionals
CGI: A place to build an IT career
Position Description
CGI Federal is seeking an experienced Network Engineer to provide technical expertise for federal agency network and security requirements for WAN and security services. In this role, you will work closely with other team members to set the strategy direction across the enterprise, and ensuring that project and program architecture aligns to this vision by working with stakeholders to build a holistic view of the organization's strategy, processes, information, and information technology assets with a focus on telecommunications. You will develop a detailed knowledge of the underlying data and data products and become the subject matter expert on content, current and potential future uses of data, and the quality and interrelationship between core elements of various government networks.
Your future duties and responsibilities
• Responsible for understanding the technical configuration of agencies network and leading the Agency integration into a cloud-based shared services platform.
• Implement and configure security products for each agency, including vulnerability scanners, endpoint protection tools, firewall, VPN and network access control.
• Support and enhance the agency’s integration goals by deploying and maintaining security tools and capabilities.
• Assist in the maintenance of technical documentation of the agency’s architecture and configurations.
• Assist the agencies in understanding and implementing continuous monitoring.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role
• Lead efforts for network technology evaluations, which involves identifying a weighted feature matrix for a specific need and evaluating and scoring products against the desired features.
• 10+ years of experience with architecting and designing IP networks
• Experience with routing, switching, and security technologies
• Experience with DoD and Civilian LAN networks
• Knowledge of multi-domain architectures, including data center, WAN, and LAN, and cloud
• Experience with US-CERT (Computer Emergency Readiness Team) as well as TIC architecture and design
• Lead research focused on identifying emerging technology solutions that reduce costs, increase efficiencies, provide more value, provide more capabilities, reduce risks, and increase security.
• Familiarity with Software defined networking (SDN) Network Disaggregation technologies and methodologies along with open source solutions.
• 10+ years of experience with enterprise/telecom packet capture and analysis along with the ability to use tools and techniques to identify anomalous traffic that indicates potential malicious activity from advanced persistent threats.
• Ability to brief complex information to senior leadership.
Desired qualifications
Experience managing complex WAN communication environments for Federal agencies
Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE) and Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) professional certifications.
Demonstrated experience operating and designing a network using routing protocols MPLS and MTIPS, IPSEC VPN.
Demonstrated experience performing compliance and vulnerability testing. Demonstrated experience making recommendations for leveraging network installations and reducing operation costs.
5+ years of experience in working with IPv6 and associated technologies
Minimum Years of directly related experience Required: 12
Minimum Education Required: Bachelors Degree
#CgiFederalJobs
What you can expect from us
Build your career with us.
It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.
At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.
Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.
Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.
No unsolicited agency referrals please.
CGI is an equal opportunity employer.
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.
CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.
We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.
All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.
CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

summary: Invitae is a healthcare technology company that leverages genetic information to empower doctors an...
tasks: Contribute to the design, build, and support for all facets of our office networks including offices and locations outside of our San Francisco base operations,Embrace cross-team collaboration, debate and presentation. You will work closely with other network engineers and people from other engineering teams.,Design, engineer, build and support AWS VPC networks, gateways, IPsec tunnels, etc., across multiple regions,Occasional overnight travel.,Support employees across the organization and diagnose network problems.,Evaluate and purchase hardware.
text:
Invitae is a healthcare technology company that leverages genetic information to empower doctors and patients to make informed medical decisions. Our software engineers work on a variety of projects ranging from innovations in healthcare systems to taming the chaos of biology. We're constantly improving our tools and technologies to deliver the highest quality actionable information for patient health.
About our team:
The networking team's responsibilities range from WAN to LAN, wired to wireless, and they work very closely with the information security team to build a robust network that supports our rapid growth trajectory. It is part of the larger Computing Group -- everything IT -- at Invitae, so there's plenty of opportunity to work with people across disciplines.
Invitae is seeking a network engineer to work at our offices in the San Francisco Bay Area and travel to our other locations, including international, from time to time. The network engineer will support all aspects of the office network ranging from ISP provisioning to wireless to wired.
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the design, build, and support for all facets of our office networks including offices and locations outside of our San Francisco base operations
Embrace cross-team collaboration, debate and presentation. You will work closely with other network engineers and people from other engineering teams.
Design, engineer, build and support AWS VPC networks, gateways, IPsec tunnels, etc., across multiple regions
Occasional overnight travel.
Support employees across the organization and diagnose network problems.
Evaluate and purchase hardware.
Technical Requirements :
Support a range of technologies including Juniper, Palo Alto Networks and Cisco Meraki.
Use monitoring tools such as Nagios, DataDog, Juniper Space and Palo Alto Networks Panorama.
Configure and troubleshoot routing protocols such as OSPF and BGP.
Build and deploy IPsec tunnels between AWS and offices.
Work in a hybrid cloud/on-premises environment.
Configure and troubleshoot wireless networks.
What you bring:
4+ years of experience in IP networking.
Expertise in TCP, IPv4/6, QoS/CoS, routing protocols.
Working knowledge of Junos and Panos.
Knowledge of Linux and experience troubleshooting the life of a packet from client to server and back.
Experience setting up and testing circuit connections with ISPs, both Internet and P2P.
Experience with many network hardware platforms and the implications and tradeoffs of different types.
A desire to build each network better than the last. Treat networking, operational efficiency, and automation as sciences with room for breakthrough.
In depth knowledge of Palo Alto Networks Global Protect and Duo, a plus.
Experience with SDN, SD-WAN a plus
At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
title: Network Engineer

name: Sr Network Engineer
summary: We are currently looking for a highly motivated and experienced Network Engineer. Reporting to the ...
text:
We are currently looking for a highly motivated and experienced Network Engineer. Reporting to the Network Engineering Manager, the Network Engineer will be primarily responsible for developing and expanding the infrastructure supporting the Webex Calling Unified Communication service portfolio, within the Cisco Collaboration group. The role will also act as escalation for in-life issues and work to maximize the quality and reliability of the Webex Calling service and minimize support cases.
With access to the latest Cisco Networking technologies you'll help the infrastructure team drive improvement and expansion in our global network to support the constantly evolving service profile in collaboration with the wider Webex Calling Engineering group. Essential_Duties_And_Responsibilities Development, Deployment, Integration and Testing of new Webex Calling products and services. Maintenance and in-life changes to existing Webex Calling Cloud infrastructure Debugging of service/system issues to identify causes and solutions in a timely manner Element and system dimensioning and capacity forecasting Maintain accurate documentation for both internal and customer use Work closely with Engineering and customer Project Management teams whilst on- boarding new customers or making changes, in-line with your responsibilities.
Responsible to perform all the duties of the role on an as needed ba to ensure SLA s and customer expectations are met. To act as an escalation point for the internal teams Organize and prioritize workload Communicate with suppliers Encourage best practice Keep abreast of relevant vendor developments and establish strategies and plans to proactively evolve the network and remain technologically current Keep abreast of relevant industry standards and be able to apply these standards as necessary Who_You'll_Work_With The Webex Calling Infrastructure Engineering team is a globally distributed group working collaboratively to improve and develop the Webex Calling offer. Making use of the best Cisco has to offer by integrating these products with the wider spectrum of 3rd Party services to provide a best in class Cloud service.
With a depth of Service Provider experience in the UC space the team leverages this to drive innovation whilst maintaining core service. Who_You_Are You are a highly inquisitive, motivated and driven person who takes time to research and understand the detail individually. Self-disciplined to manage multiple tasks in parallel with minimal oversight, yet capable of working collaboratively in a team possibly in a leading role with a proven record of delivering large scale projects.
At a minimum we expect you to have a BA/BS, or equivalent, ideally an MS, 5 years experience delivering network services in a service provider setting You should have an expert knowledge of Cisco router/switches and ideally Juniper equivalent as well as underlying network protocols and principles. You will need to have a demonstrated record of participation in large scale infrastructure deployment projects. Due to contractual obligations, you must be a US citizen Experience At least 5 years of Telecommunications experience Experience with engineering and operating networks and associated components Experience with IP networking includes routers, ethernet switches, and firewalls Skills,_Knowledge_&_Attributes Knowledge of TCP/IP networking and routing protocols are essential Significant experience and working knowledge of Network Routing and Switching infrastructure Experience operating Cisco ACI, Cisco Firepower and F5 Big IP software Understanding of Ansible, python and automating tools Must have excellent verbal communication and writing skills Candidate must show the ability to collaborate in a team environment Knowledge of troubleshooting tools and interpreting protocol traces within Wireshark is mandatory Knowledge of voice network architecture design and implementation principles Ability to create and maintain clear and easily understandable documentation within the scope of the position Willingness to work non-standard hours as needed for system changes and deployments Why Cisco At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference.
Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people. * We connect everything people, process, data and things and w those connections to change our world for the better. * We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results.
Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more from Smart Cities to your everyday devices. * We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.
title: Sr Network Engineer

name: Network Engineer
summary:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
The Wine Group is one of the top leaders in the wine industry. As a privately h...
text:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
The Wine Group is one of the top leaders in the wine industry. As a privately held management-owned company with 12 wineries in California, New York, and Australia, we strive to win with exceptional people who share our values. We produce many well-known brands including Franzia, Cupcake, Chloe, Flip Flop, Save Me San Francisco, Insurrection, Concannon, Benziger, and Imagery. We are a successful company looking to employ talented individuals on our team who are self-motivated, positive and energetic. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply!
JOB SUMMARY
An ideal candidate will be a competent individual with a passion for technology. This position will require an individual with an analytical mindset for effective troubleshooting. The ideal candidate should be comfortable working with internal and external customers via IM, phone, email and in person. This position is contract with the opportunity to convert to full time.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
* Configuration and Support of LAN, WAN and wireless infrastructure with a focus on high uptime for all users.
* Configure/install/troubleshoot networking devices including but not limited to switches, routers, SDWAN devices, firewalls, etc.
* Performing audits of IT infrastructure and creating solutions to be implemented, which support the long term and short-term goals of the company.
* Follow specified data security, confidentiality, and backup procedures as required.
* Developing rapport and trust with clients as their primary technical point of contact.
* Work with the desktop support team to help resolve trouble tickets in a timely manner.
* Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside normal working hours. Local travel to California facilities required.
QUALIFICATIONS
* 3-5 years of experience building, administering, deploying and supporting network infrastructure for a multi-site organization.
* Firewall experience with NAT and VPN required. Palo Alto experience is a strong plus.
* Complete knowledge of network protocols, TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS.
* Hands-on experience with Cisco IOS.
* Outstanding diagnostic and problem-solving skills.
* Understanding of Windows and Linux operating system environments.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.
* CCNA strongly preferred.
* Experience with Aruba or Silver Peak strongly preferred.
* Curiosity and the desire to learn new technologies.
* Effective communicator, both verbal and written.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
* Ability to lift 30-50 lbs.
* Ability to sit for long periods of time.
* Ability to stand for long periods of time.
The Wine Group is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
